loans.name: Mahfirat

texts.ru:
Mahfirat Ergashevna M. lives in the city of Tursun-Zoda. She is 24 years old, married and has 2 children. Mahfirat sells fertilizer at the local market in Tursun-Zoda. This business is the sole source of income for her family since her husband is currently out of work. Right now Mahfirat needs to buy more fertilizer from wholesalers, and so she wants to take out this loan, which she will pay back in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Махмудова Махфират Эргашевна жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 24 года, замужем , имеет 2 детей. Клиентка занимается куплей продажей минеральных удобрений на местном рынке в городе Турсунзаде. Эта деятельность является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. Так как муж клиентки временно не работает. В данный момент клиентка хочет закупить у оптовых поставщиков товар.Для чего ей нужны деньги,поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Resuscitate her business.

loans.name: Haldina

texts.en: Haldina is a 26 years old married woman from Gornja Lukavica, a small village near the town Živinice. Her husband is self-employed. Haldina does the cattle breeding, and she sells milk to the dairy.  She has two small daughters who are not attending school yet. This is her first loan at MCO .  Haldina will use this loan to buy a cow in order to increase her monthly income by selling the milk and milk products.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Woevi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Woévi G. was born in 1976. She runs a little general store. Married and the mother of two children, she contributes to household expenses thanks to the income from her business. In order to stock her shop according to her customers' tastes, she is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase foodstuffs wholesale to stock her shop appropriately. This will allow her to better satisfy her clientele and will increase her income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame G. Woévi est née en 1976. Elle tient une boutique d’alimentation générale. Mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants, elle contribue aux charges ménagères grâce aux revenus de son commerce. Afin de bien équiper sa boutique aux goûts de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un financement qui lui servira d’acheter en gros les produits alimentaires et bien équiper sa boutique. Ceci lui permettra de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et augmentera ses revenus.

loans.use:
Purchase of foodstuffs and stocking of her little store

Achat de produits alimentaires et équipement de boutique

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Bebey

texts.fr:
Mrs. Bebey A. was born in 1983 in Gamé séva (Zio County). Lacking financial means, she left school and went into the preparation and sale of palm oil. The income from this business allows her to contribute to household expenses. Married and the mother of one child, she is dynamic and well versed in her business. In order to increase her income, she is requesting a loan that she will use to buy larger quantities of palm nuts to prepare oil so that she can better satisfy her clientele. This will allow her to increase her income and better contribute to the improvement of living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Bebey est née en 1983 à Gamé séva (P/Zio). Par manque de moyens, elle a abandonné ses études et s’est lancée dans la préparation et la vente de l’huile de palm. Les revenus de cette activité lui permettent de contribuer aux charges du foyer. Mariée et mère d’un (1) enfant, elle est dynamique et maîtrise bien son activité. Pour accroître son revenu, elle sollicite un financement qui lui servira d’acheter en grande quantité les noix de palme pour la préparation de l’huile afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus et mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of palm nuts for the preparation of palm oil

Achat de noix de palme pour préparation d'huile rouge

loans.name: Sehran

texts.en: Sehran has been in this business for 10 years. He was born in 1962, is married and has three children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. Now he would like to buy 10 sheep for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Bakh Yaye 2 Group

texts.fr:
The Saloum River delta in central Senegal is renowned for its oysters and shrimp.  Preserving seafood by drying over a fire is primarily a women's activity, and it is also the main source of revenue for the Bakh Yaye 2 group.  This loan will allow us to purchase canoes, build ovens and drying racks, pay young people to transport the oysters to the processing site, and to purchase firewood to smoke and dry the oysters and shrimp.  In this way, we will create a source of income in our village.



Le delta du Saloum est zone de production d'huîtres  et de crevettes par excellence. La cueillette des huîtres est une activité essentiellement faite par les femmes. C'est pour cela le GIE bakh yaye 2 en a fait son activité principale. Le prêt va nous permettre d'acheter la matière première (pirogues, et construction de fours et sèchoires, achat des ustensiles qui vont servir à la conservation des produits transformés) et nous aider pour payer les services des jeunes qui vont porter les huîtres jusqu'au lieu de transformation; à l'achat du bois de chauffe qui va servir à la cuisson des huîtres et des crevettes). Avec ce fond, nous pourrons acheter des crevettes chez les pêcheurs et les transformer. C'est de cette façon que nous comptons promouvoir des activités génératrices de revenu dans notre zone.

loans.use: Preparation and sale of dried seafood

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil has been in the dairy business for five years. He was born in 1976. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Armenian-occupied Fuzuli town in Azerbaijan and is settled in the Fuzuli region, Zargar village. He is married and has two children. Now he would like a loan of $975 to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Maya

texts.en: Maya (her husband is pictured) was born in 1959. She is the mother of three children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Armenian-occupied Fuzuli town in Azerbaijan and is settled in the Fuzuli region in Karabulag village. Ten years ago her family started their sheep-breeding business. Now they would like a loan of $975 to buy 10 sheep to improve their business.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.en:
“Virgen del Rosario” is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari-project which provides its credit with education services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and, as a very mountainous area ranging 2,000 – 5,000 meters above sea level, has many limitations such as the cold, the difficulty to grow crops, and the lack of an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems.

BCR “Virgen del Rosario” is located at approximately 2,500 meters above sea level in the community of Huanchuy, in the district of Chincho, province of Angaraes. The small town of Huanchuy is located at the border of the Cachi River and used to be an old colonial hacienda. Although the village politically belongs to the region of Huancavelica, all business is done with Ayacucho, the biggest city nearby. Most members of the group have never even been to the capital of their region!

The main activities of the population are related to agriculture. The valley of Huanchuy has an excellent climate because of the relatively low altituD. and the availability of water throughout the year. The climate makes it possible to grow a great variety of products like tara and black corn and many fruits and vegetables like avocado, pacay, tuna (prickly pear cactus fruit), sugarcane, carrots, and lettuce. In higher altitudes, the population also grows potatoes. From the tuna cactus comes another product: cochinilla, a small parasite (insect) that is used for its powerful coloring for cosmetics (locals used it to paint their faces or lips in traditional festivals). Besides cultivating all of the mentioned products, most people dedicate their time to raising small animals like guinea pigs, chicken, ducks and rabbits; and bigger animals as cows and bulls.

Currently the bank is starting its first loan cycle with 12 female borrowers and a total loan of 3,400 soles (about 1,225 US$). The loans range from 200 up to 600 soles. As the group is just starting its first cycle, the group was not able to save. But all agree to save in the future for reinvestment in their businesses or maybe to buy a community sewing machine. The expectations of the members of the new village bank incluD. receiving trainings on “marketing” (how to improve their business) and learning how to weave and stitch cloths. Besides that, they think the village bank will be an excellent way to share ideas and experiences.

One of the members of the community bank is Nancy. Nancy will receive a loan of 600 soles and runs a small grocery store in the community. With her loan, she will increase her merchandise, buying more soft drinks, beers, sweets, fruits and other groceries. Nancy´s dream for the future is to have her own sewing business. With FINCA Peru, she wants to learn to save so that she can improve her business and help her father.

Maura tells another story. She sells vegetables at local weekly markets, going from one to the other. But her main market is the one in Secclla. With her 600 soles loan, she will buy more vegetables like carrots, black potato, celery and onions. Part of what she sells comes from her own small terrain, but she also buys vegetables from other members of the community. Now that she will be working with FINCA Peru, she hopes to save more and to work more responsibly to be able to pay for her loan. She will use her savings to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Buy new supplies

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Mr. Komla G., aged 45, did not get a lot of schooling before entering the business world. Married and the father of two children, he manages a workshop sharpening blades for mills and other cutting tools. Very dynamic and honest, he was able to manage his first loan and repay it without problem. He is again requesting a loan of US$ 900 which he plans to use to purchase a new dynamo for his workshop. In this way, he believes he will be able to increase his turnover and hence his income. He will thus be able to contribute more to the improvement of living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agé de 45 ans, Monsieur G. Komla n’a pas fait de grandes études avant de se lancer dans la vie active. Marié et père de deux (2) enfants, il gère un atelier d’aiguisement de meule à moulin et des objets tranchants. Très dynamique et honnête, il a su bien gérer le premier crédit obtenu et l’a remboursé sans incident. De nouveau, il sollicite un crédit de $900 qui servira à l’achat de dynamo neuf pour le nouvel atelier. Par ceci, il pense augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et de facto ses revenus. Il pourra ainsi, contribuer d’avantage à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of a dynamo and opening of a workshop

Achat de dynamo et ouverture d'un atelier

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Socorro

texts.es:
Socorro is a member of the Wiracocha Communal Bank.

Socorro is a 66-year old widow with six children; one child, a daughter, still lives with her. She has a store where she sells automotive lubricants located on a main street of the city of Ayacucho. Her products are acquired in the city of Lima at better prices.

Socorro needs a loan of 3000 soles, money that she would invest in purchasing lubricants of various brands.

She will use her savings to improve her home. Socorro’s dreams are to have another house, and that her children get ahead and have prosperous businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Socorro es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha.

Socorro es viuda, tiene 66 años y 6 hijos D. los cuales solo 1 hija vive con ella, Socorro tiene una tienda donD. venD. lubricantes D. carro, que esta ubicado en una avenida principal D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad D. Lima a un precio más cómodo.

Socorro necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. lubricantes D. distintas marcas.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará en la mejora D. su casa. Los sueños D. Socorro son tener otra casa, sus hijos progrese y tengan negocios prósperos.

loans.use: Socorro needs a loan of 3000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of automotive lubricants of various brands.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena is a member of the Wiracocha Communal Bank.

Maria Elena is single and 28 years old. She works as a midwife at the hospital in Huanta. She also sells surgical clothing in hospitals and medical centers. In addition, she has a mototaxi that she rents out.

Maria Elena needs a loan of 1500 soles, money that she would invest in a new enterprise selling quilts/duvets that she would purchase in the city of Lima.

Maria Elena’s dreams include having a clinic, a restaurant and of providing all the best for her mother.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha.

Maria Elena es soltera y tiene 28 años, de profesión Obstetriz trabaja en el hospital de Huanta , Maria Elena vende ropa quirúrgica en los hospitales y centros médicos, actividad que realiza eventualmente, además Maria Elena tiene una mototaxi que alquila.

Maria Elena necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en un nuevo negocio de venta de edredones que serán adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima.

Los sueños de Maria Elena son tener una clínica, un restaurante y brindarle todo lo mejor a su mamá.

loans.use: Maria Elena needs a loan of 1500 soles, money that would be invested into a new business selling quilts/duvets that would be purchased in the city of Lima.

loans.name: Sania

texts.es:
Sania is a member of the Wiracocha Communal Bank.

Sania is 38 years old, married, and has two children. She sells a variety of clothing for adults and children. She makes her sales on credit, distributing her goods among friends, relatives and acquaintances. She purchases her merchandise in the city of Lima.

Sania needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that she would invest in buying pants and tops.

Sania’s dreams are that her children become professionals, to have her own store selling lubricants, and to expand her enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Sania es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha.

Sania es casada, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Sania vende ropa variada para adultos y niños, sus ventas los realiza al crédito y reparte a amigos, familiares y conocidos, sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima.

Sania necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones y polos.

Los sueños de Sania son que sus hijas sean profesionales, tener una tienda de lubricantes y ampliar su negocio.

loans.use: Sania needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that would be invested in the purchase of pants and tops.

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr:
Miss Kafui A. was born on September 6, 1990 in Davié in Zio County. A trained hairdresser, she manages to contribute to her parents' living expenses thanks to the income from her trade. Single with no children, she was able to manage the previous loan she obtained appropriately.

At present, she is requesting a loan which she plans to use to purchase a hair dryer and other beauty salon supplies so as to increase her income and participate more in improving living conditions for her parents.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mademoiselle A. Kafui est née le 06 septembre 1990 à Davié dans la préfecture de Zio. Coiffeuse de profession, elle arrive à se prendre en charge contribuer aux charges de ses parents grâce aux revenus de son métier. Célibataire sans enfants, elle a su gérer le précédent crédit obtenu.

A présent, elle sollicite un crédit qui servira à l’achat de séchoir et d’autres matériels de coiffure afin d’augmenter ses revenus et participer plus à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de ses parents.

loans.use:
Dryer and beauty salon supplies

Séchoir et matériels de coiffure

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr:
Born in 1980 in Aného (Lacs prefecture), Akouavi B. attended school through the 9th grade. After earning her middle school diploma, and due to a lack of financial support, she couldn't continue. After finishing her training in sewing, she became an excellent seamstress. Single and without children, she has a nephew in her care. The meager income from her poorly-equipped dressmaking shop is not enough to cover expenses.

To meet the demands of her customers and to hold onto them, Ms. B. need to get better equipment. This is why she is requesting a loan for buying other sewing machines and cloth to make ready-to-wear clothing to sell. Then her income will increase in order to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1980 à Aného dans la préfecture des Lacs, Mlle B. Akouavi a fait ses études jusqu’en classe de troisième. Après son BEPC, par manque de support financier elle n’a pas pu continuer. Après sa formation en couture, elle est devenue une excellente couturière. Célibataire sans enfant, elle a en charge un neveu. Les maigres revenus de son atelier de couture très peu équipé ne suffisent pas à couvrir les charges.

Pour répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle et la maintenir, Mlle B. Akouavi a besoin de mieux s’équiper. C’est ainsi qu’elle sollicite un crédit qui servira à acheter d’autres machines à coudre et des tissus pour confectionner des habits prêt-à-porter pour la commercialisation. Ce qui augmentera ses revenus afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and cloth

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Born in 1975 in Gavi Kopé (Zio prefecture), Komla A. is married and has six persons in his care, including his children. A farmer by profession for ten years, he noticed that the land produces very little. So he decided to be a motorbike taxi driver and thus manages to support his family. His wife, a farmer also, contributes very little to cover family expenses. An honest man, he has demonstrated good management of his business to-date.

To get a new motorbike, he is requesting a loan. He will then be able to effectively contribute to improving his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Né en 1975 à Gavi Kopé dans la préfecture du Zio, Monsieur A. Komla est marié et a en charge six (6) personnes dont ses enfants. Cultivateur de profession depuis dix (10) ans, il constate que la terre rapporte très peu. Alors il décida de faire taxi moto et, avec celui-ci, il arrive subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Sa femme, cultivatrice aussi contribue très peu dans les dépenses de la famille. Honnête, il fait preuve d’une bonne gestion de ses activités jusqu’à ce jour.

Pour avoir une nouvelle moto, il sollicite un crédit. Il pourra ainsi efficacement contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike taxi

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abla S. was born in 1958 in Batonou (Lacs prefecture). Currently, she lives in Adétikopé, a village located 15 km from Tsévié, with her two children and two others in her care. Her husband is a merchant and lives in the same place. With his meager income, he has a hard time covering all family expenses, which means that some household expenses are covered by Ms. Abla S.. An energetic and enterprising woman, she supports her family thanks to the income from her grocery shop. She found out how to manager well the previously obtained loans and to repay them appropriately.

Presently, she is requesting a loan for buying sacks of rice and drums of oil, boxes of canned food, and other items in order to bolster her business. And so she will be able participate more in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame S. Abla est née 1958 à Batonou dans la préfecture des Lacs. Actuellement, elle vit à Adétikopé, un village situé à 15 km de Tsévié avec ses deux (02) enfants et deux (2) autres à charge. Son mari est un commerçant et vit dans la même localité. Avec son maigre revenu, il arrive difficilement à couvrir toutes les charges de la famille, ce qui fait qu’une partie des charges du foyer est prise par Madame S. Abla. Dynamique et entreprenante, elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille grâce aux revenus de sa boutique d’alimentation générale. Elle a su bien gérer les précédents crédits obtenus et les a remboursé convenablement.

A présent, elle sollicite un crédit qui servira à l’achat des sacs de riz et des bidons d’huile, des cartons des boites de conserves et autres pour renforcer son commerce. Ainsi pourra-t-elle participer davantage à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To stock up on food items

loans.name: Maria Petronila

texts.es:
The small-business owner María Petronila Ramírez Z. is 41 years old, and a single mother of two small children still in primary school. For the past eight years, Mrs. Ramírez has dedicated herself to selling products such as meneitos, frozen drinks, cookies, gum, sodas, and juices, among other products, at wholesale. She conducts her activities in the corridor of a public municipal building. She uses a table and a thermos with ice to offer her products to the people who frequent the public areas and who come to visit the city’s municipal offices. However, the returns that the business provides are small given that she must pay her suppliers who give her only a week to meet her obligations to them. For this reason, Mrs. Ramírez seeks a loan to purchase the following products: 3 cases of Pepsi at $12USD each, 3 cases of Coca-Cola at $11USD each, 3 cases of bottled water at $8USD each, 3 cases of canned juices at $9USD each, 60 packs of bagged water at $0.25USD each, 3 packs of Ritz crackers at $3USD each, 6 packs of Chiky cookies at $1.50USD each, 4 bags of cliclin sweets at $2USD each, 4 bags of meneitos at $5USD each, and 4 packages of chocolates at $3USD each.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La microempresaria Maria Petronila Ramírez Z. tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera con dos hijos ambos menores quienes estudian en nivel primario. La señora Ramírez desde hace 8 años se dedica a vender productos al por menor tales como meneitos, agua helada, galletas, chiclets, gaseosas, jugos entre otros productos. Esta actividad la realiza en el corredor de un edificio público propiedad de la alcaldía en donde utiliza una mesa y un termo con hielo para poder ofertar sus productos a las personas que transitan la via publica y que visitan las oficinas de la alcaldía de esta ciudad. Sin embargo las utilidades que le genera este negocio son muy pocas ya que tiene que pagar a sus proveedores quienes le dan solamente una semana para cancelar su préstamo. Por tal razón la señora Ramírez esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar los siguientes productos: Comprar 3 cajillas de pepsi cola a US$ 12 dolares cada una, 3 cajillas de coca cola US$ 11 dolares cada una, 3 cajas de agua de botella US$ 8 dolares cada una, 3 cajas de jugos de lata US$ 9 dolares cada una, 60 pacas de agua en bolsa US$ 0.25 dolares cada una, 3 paquetes de galletas Ritz US$ 3 dolares cada una, 6 paquetes de galletas Chiky US$ 1,50 dolares cada una, 6 paquetes de galletas oreo US$ 1.50 dolares cada una, 4 cajas de chiclets adams US$ 3 dolares cada una, 4 bolsas de confites cliclin US$ 2 dolares cada una, 4 bolsones de meneitos US$ 5 dolares cada una y 4 paquetes de chocolates vaquita US$ 3 dolares cada una.

loans.use: To purchase 3 cases of Pepsi, 3 cases of Coca-Cola, 3 cases of bottled water, 3 cases of canned juices, 60 packs of water in bags, 3 packs of Ritz crackers, 6 packs of Chiky cookies, 6 packs of Oreo cookies, 4 cases of Adams gum, 4 bags of cliclin sweets, 4 bags of meneitos and 4 packs of chocolates.

payments.comment: la cuota real de pago es de $ 17.58 dólares

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Akou V. was born in 1960 in Tsévié. The mother of three, she is married to a person who has for some time met with difficulty in his work. In this situation, Ms. V. is alone in dealing with family needs. An honest, energetic, and enterprising woman, she manages with surprising rigor her little business selling food items and has figured out how to repay her previous loan without a problem.

She is applying for a loan that will enable her to buy in bulk (soap, tomatoes, milk, etc.) and to open a food shop. She will then be able to meet household expenses and to improve her family's living conditions while waiting for her husband to return to work.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame V. Akou est née en 1960 à Tsévié. Mère de trois (03) enfants, elle est mariée à un particulier qui depuis un certain temps rencontre de difficultés dans l’exercice de ses fonctions. Dans cette situation Madame V. Akou est seule à faire face aux besoins de la famille. Honnête, dynamique et entreprenante, elle gère avec une étonnante rigueur son petit commerce de produits alimentaires et a su rembourser un précédent crédit obtenus, sans incidence.

Elle sollicite un crédit qui va lui permettre d’acheter en gros (savons, tomates, laits etc.) et ouvrir une boutique de vente des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle pourra alors faire face aux charges du foyer et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille en attendant la reprise des activités de son mari.

loans.use: To open a shop and sell food items

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Agbelenko

texts.fr:
Born on March 23, 1954 in Ahépé (Yoto prefecture), Agbélénko A. is married and has six people in his care, including his children. He makes and sells medicinal ointments. Despite his efforts, his income does not allow him to cover all expenses. Nevertheless, he has the trust and the esteem of his customers because of the quality of his products. He manages his business correctly and is always honest in repaying the loans he has gotten.

For the purposes of growing his business, he is requesting a loan to bolster his ointment production and also to start raising pigs. With this loan, his sales figures can increase, and he will be able to invest more in the education and health of his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Né le 23 mars 1954 à Ahépé (P/Yoto), Monsieur A. Agbélénko est marié et à six (06) personnes à charge dont ses enfants. Il fait la fabrication et la vente des pommades salicilées. Malgré les efforts, son revenu ne lui permet pas de couvrir toutes les charges. Toutefois, il a la confiance et l’estime des clients à cause de la qualité de ses produits. Il gère de façon correcte son activité et est toujours honnête dans le remboursement des crédits obtenus.

En vue d’accroître ses activités, il sollicite un crédit pour renforcer la fabrication des pommades et aussi, initier l’élevage de porcs. Avec ce crédit, son chiffre d’affaire pourra augmenter et il pourra investir plus dans l’éducation et la santé de la famille.

loans.use: To make medicinal ointments

loans.name: Komla Samuel

texts.fr:
Born June 16th, 1980 in Bolou Agbadomé in the Zio Prefecture, Mr. Komla Samuel A. wasn’t lucky enough to move on in his studies. Very early on he launched himself in the poultry farming business. He has been very successful at this. He is seeking a loan which will serve to construct a chicken coop and to buy one day-old chicks. With this loan he believes he will become self sufficient, will increase his sales and thus his income in order to take responsibility for his brothers and sisters still living with his parents, and to contribute to improving his family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 16 juin 1980 à Bolou Agbadomé (P/Zio), Monsieur A. Komla Samuel n'a pas eu la chance d'avancer dans les etudes.Mais tres tot il s'est lance dans l'elevage des poulets.Ce qui lui reussit tres bien. il sollicite un crédit qui servira à construire le poulailler et à acheter les poussins d’un jour d’âge. Avec ce crédit il pense s’auto suffir, augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et de facto ses revenus pour prendre en charge ses fières et sœurs toujours à la charge de leurs parents et contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Construction of a chicken coop and purchase of chicks for breeding

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi H. was born February 7th, 1988 in Tabligbo in the Yoto Prefecture. After some years of study, he learned welding for three years. Currently he is working in this trade. Single and without children, he is responsible for his younger brother. Energetic and very good at his job, he is a successful entrepreneur and knew how to manage the previous loan he sought and repaid without incident. To be able to accomplish his work efficiently and make it profitable, he is seeking a loan which will allow him to set up his own electrical wiring and purchase other work equipment. He will then be able to increase his income in order to better take care of his brother.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

H. Koffi est né le 07 février 1988 à Tabligbo dans le Préfecture de Yoto. Après quelques années d’étude, il appris la soudure pendant trois (3) ans. Actuellement il exerce ce métier. Célibataire sans enfant, il a en charge son petit frère. Dynamique et maîtrisant son métier, il est un bon entrepreneur et a su gérer le précédent crédit obtenu et l’a remboursé sans aucun incident. Pour pouvoir accomplir efficacement son travail et rentabiliser celui-ci, il sollicite un crédit qui servira à avoir pour son propre compte une installation électrique et à l’achat d’autres matériels de travail. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus afin de mieux entretenir son frère.

loans.use: Electrical wiring and purchase of work equipment

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Patzutzun Ii Group

texts.es:
The women of Patzutzun Group II come from a remote village named Concepción in the departament of Sololá. Within this group, few of the members know how to speak Spanish. This, however, is not an impediment to them in getting ahead with their businesses given that they know the local idiom of Maya Kachikel very well. At the onset of the interview many of the women were intimidated by my presence and became very shy, since in their village they had never had a visit from a “gringo”. Over time, however, and thanks to the support of the credit agent Marta Julia, they were able to gain confidence and share with me some of their experiences.

The majority of the clients are in sales. They will invest their loan into their small stores that stock basic need or convenience products. One of them, Maria Teresa S., will invest her loan in the sale of wood. Thanks to the loan, she will be able to purchase twice as much that which she bought before and she hopes that this will help her business to grow.

The other part of the group works in textiles, weaving traditional fabrics. Two of the four craftswomen contract other weavers for labor. Marcela S. currently has three employees under contract to meet the demand from her customers. Meanwhile, Lucia L., one of the older members, has six weavers under contract.

Currently, Friendship Bridge offers all the members savings products. The women commented that they are very grateful to the institution because they will finally be able to put their earnings in safekeeping. They want to reinvest their entire savings into their businesses. Another reason why they are happy with the institution is that it is one of the few that has offered financial products to their communities. When the women were asked why they chose to work with Friendship Bridge, they said simply that it was because they hadn’t heard of any other such institution in their community.

The dream of these women is to grow their businesses and, in this way, have a stable a enterprise that will help support them and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Las mujeres del grupo Patzuntzun II vienen de una aldea remota llamada Concepción en el departamento de Sololá. Dentro de este grupo de mujeres pocas saben hablar el español, sin embargo eso no es ningún impedimento para que puedan salir adelante con sus negocios, ya que el idioma local Maya Kachikel lo dominan muy bien. Al principio de la entrevista muchas de las señoras se intimidaron con mi presencia y se pusieron un poco tímidas, debido a que en su aldea ellas nunca habían visto a un “gringo”, pero con el transcurso del tiempo y gracias al apoyo de la agente de crédito Marta Julia ellas pudieron entrar en confianza y compartir un poco de sus experiencias.

La mayoría de las clientas son comerciantes. Ellas van a invertir su crédito en sus pequeñas tiendas de consumo diario o de conveniencia. Una de ellas, Maria Tereza S. va a invertir su crédito en el comercio de leña. Gracias a su crédito ella va a poder comprar dos veces el monto que ella compraba anteriormente y espera que de esa manera su negocio crezca.

La otra parte del grupo trabaja en el sector textil. Ellas son tejedoras de telas tradicionales. De las cuatro artesanas dos de ellas contratan a tejedoras como mano de obra. Marcela S. actualmente está contratando a tres empleadas para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Mientras que Lucia L., una de las clientas más ancianitas, está contratando a seis tejedoras.

Actualmente Friendship Bridge les ofrece a todas las clientes un producto de ahorros. Las señoras me comentaron que ellas estaban agradecidas con la institución porque ellas finalmente van a tener un lugar donde guardar su dinero. Ellas, van a utilizar su dinero en su mismo negocio. Ellas quieren reinvertir enteramente su dinero en el negocio. Otra razón por que las clientas están contentas con la institución es porque es la única o una de las muy pocas que ha llegado a ofrecer productos financieros a sus comunidades. Cuando se les preguntó a las señoras porque escogieron trabajar con Friendship Bridge simplemente dijeron porque no habían escuchado de otra institución en su comunidad.

El sueño de estas señoras es que sus negocios puedan crecer y de esta manera tener un negocio estable para poder mantener a ellas y a sus respectivas familias.

loans.use: Purchase basic necessities for daily use, purchase of raw materials to weave traditional fabrics.

loans.name: Inoussa

texts.fr:
Born October 22nd, 1968 in Tsévié, Mr. Inoussa B. is married and the father of three children. After his secondary studies he decided to go into business. He thus began traveling to Nigeria and Ghana to buy household appliances which he resells in Tsévié. The business he has been running for many years doesn’t bring in enough income to completely take charge of the needs of his family because he is lacking sufficient working capital. After having successfully managed and repaid a previous loan without incident, which greatly helped him, he is seeking a new loan to begin selling bicycle spare parts in addition to his household appliance business. This project will increase his income and help him to better contribute to improving his family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 22 octobre 1968 à Tsévié, Monsieur B. Inoussa est marié et père de trois (03) enfants. Après les études secondaires il décida de se lancer dans le commerce. Ainsi donc, il fait le voyage de Nigeria et/ou du Ghana pour acheter des appareils électro ménagers qu’il revend à Tsévié. Ce commerce qu’il exerce depuis des années, ne lui procure pas assez de revenus pour prendre totalement en charge tous les besoins de sa famille, car il lui manque suffisamment de fonds de roulement. Mais après avoir bien géré et remboursé sans incidence, le crédit antérieur qui l’a beaucoup aidé, il sollicite à nouveau un crédit pour initier la vente des pièces détachées pour vélo en plus de son commerce des appareils électro ménagers. Ce projet augmentera ses revenus et lui permettra de mieux contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Retail of bicycle spare parts

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Atsou

texts.fr:
Born September 13th, 1978 in Bolou-Kpéta in the Zio prefecture, Mr. Atsou W. is married and the father of two children. Very early on he left his studies to enter the workforce. Employed as a maintenance man in a company near where he lives in Tsévié, his salary barely covers his family expenses. This led him to begin selling cell phone credit recharge cards. His wife, a retailer of fresh fish, earns very little money which means all of the household expenses are the responsibility of Mr. W.. He is very energetic and is seeking a loan to strengthen his credit recharge card business and to set up a private telephone booth. This project will allow him to increase his income to improve his family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 13 septembre 1978 à Bolou-Kpéta dans la Préfecture du Zio, Monsieur W. Atsou est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Très tôt, il a abandonné ses études pour se lancer dans la vie active. Employé comme agent d’entretient dans une société de la place à Tsévié où il vit actuellement, son salaire suffit à peine à couvrir les dépenses de la famille. Ceci l’a amené à initier la vente des cartes de recharges. Sa femme, revendeuse de poissons frais gagne très peu, ce qui fait que toutes les dépenses du ménage sont prises en charges par monsieur W.. Dynamique, il sollicite un crédit pour renforcer le commerce des cartes de recharge et installer une cabine téléphonique. Ce projet lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus pour une amélioration de ses conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To set up a private telephone booth and sell phone credit recharge cards

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
Jesula is a 32-year-old woman who lives with her husband and five children in the community of L. Alcarrizzos, located on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo in the Dominican Republic. She has run a small fantasia for several years now (a fantasia is a small store that sells women’s fashion items ranging from sandals to shirts to hair accessories).

She has asked for this loan so that she can improve the variety of merchandise she is able to offer her customers. Specifically, she says she would like to start offering more hair accessories and a selection of bracelets and earrings that are popular with teenagers in the area. Her loan officer has worked with her to teach her that offering products that nobody else offers in her community will give her a competitive edge, and consequently help increase her sales and profits.

Jesula says her goal is to open and own her own store in the next five years—that way she can make it as big as she wants and not have to worry about paying rent anymore. She hopes that she can help her children attend one of the local universities in the capital so that they will have more opportunities than she has had, and she hopes to help her husband improve their home.

On behalf of Jesula and everyone here at Esperanza International, we thank you for supporting her dreams and goals!

loans.use: Invest money into expanding the variety of merchandise she is able to offer.

loans.name: La Resurrecion (The Resurection) Group

texts.en:
Luciana is a 31-year-old woman who lives in the suburb of Los Alcarrizzos on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo.

She has a small business selling used and new shoes to her community members and is asking for this loan so that she can have the money available to buy a larger quantity of shoes and, as a result, both sell more shoes and make more money. In her community people are very poor, and so the demand for used shoes is high; but when people can, they always prefer to have new shoes so she likes to be able to offer both.

With the money she is able to generate from this loan, she hopes that her little business will continue to grow, attracting and retaining new customers. She hopes that the extra income will also help her go back to school and finish her high school education. One day she dreams of having her own home and her own vehicle so that she can travel around more easily and be able to visit her family and friends more often.

On behalf of Luciana and everyone here at Esperanza International, we thank you for supporting her dreams and goals!

loans.use: To increase the quantity of shoes she is able to buy and sell to her community members.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
Las Margaritas Communal Bank is a young bank that begins its third cycle with 22 partners. The partners look forward to receiving a new loan that will help their businesses to proviD. more products.

The partners engage in different businesses such as the sale of vegetables, snacks, cheeses, groceries, food, crafts, cosmetics by catalogue, fish, fruits, and transport services.

Each partner has a different story to tell, as in the case of Haydee. Haydee is a weaver, a skill she learned from her father. Upon establishing her homestead, she taught her husband, too. Together they have a shop with three looms and sell their products to middlemen, but hope one day to engage in direct sales.

Maria is married and has been selling vegetables in the Magdalena market for many years. She supports her children with the income her business generates since her husband holds only temporary jobs.

The partners require varying loan amounts, including loans from 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, to 1000 soles, and amounting to a total loan of 11,100 soles in the Communal Bank.

The loans will be applied toward the purchase of sugar, rice, pasta, squash, tomato, onions, cookies, sweets, cheeses, various cosmetics and fish.

The partners dream of having equity capital and a stable business, of expanding their businesses and offering a better life to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Las Margaritas es un Banco joven que inicia su tercer ciclo con 22 socias. Ellas están alegres D. recibir un nuevo préstamo, que ayudará a surtir con más productos sus negocios.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. verduras, golosinas, quesos, abarrotes, comida, artesanía, cosméticos por catálogos, pescado, frutas y servicios D. transporte.

Cada socia tiene una historia diferente que contar como es el caso D. Haydee que realiza trabajos en telar, actividad que aprendió D. su padre y al formar su hogar enseñó a su esposo y actualmente tienen un taller con tres telares, sus productos lo venD. a intermediarios, pero espera algún día tener un puesto D. venta directa.

Mientras que Maria es casada, venD. verduras en el mercado Magdalena hace muchos años y con los ingresos que genera su negocio mantiene a sus hijos, pues su esposo solo tiene trabajos eventuales.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 11,100 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, fideo, zapallo, tomate, cebolla galletas, caramelos, quesos, cosméticos variados y pescado.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener capital propio, un negocio estable, ampliar sus negocios y brindarle lo mejor a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, pasta, squash, tomato, onions, cookies, sweets, cheeses, various cosmetics and fish.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Định is 55 years old. She is a TYM member since 2001. She has 3 children, 2 of them are still in school. Her main occupation is to raise pigs and poultry. In the beginning, she only applied for small loans. After a while she became accustomed to the process so she started applying for bigger loans. She has success with her investment: her pig & poultry business brings her income to 900 USD a year. Her total loan is about a few grands to date. She wishes to remain a TYM member for a long time to come. She is seeking 1125 USD for this round.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Định, 55 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2001. 2 trong số 3 người con của chị vẫn đang đi học. Công việc chính của chị hiện nay là chăn nuôi lợn gà. Vòng đầu tiên chị chỉ dám vay mức vốn thấp từ Quỹ để đầu tư. Sau khi quen dần với cách thức hoàn trả chị Định nâng dần mức vốn vay lên. Sử dụng đồng vốn có hiệu quả, thu nhập bình quân hàng năm của chị khoảng 900USD. Tính cho đến nay chị đã vay từ Quỹ số tiền vài nghìn USD. Mong muốn của chị Định là tiếp tục được tham gia vay vốn lâu dài từ Quỹ. Mức đề nghị của chị vòng này là 1125USD.

loans.use: Buy pigs, chickens and feed

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Hiền, 42, joined TYM fund in 2002. She has 3 children, 2 are attending higher education. Like many other women in the region, she uses her loans to invest in raising livestock. At first she raised pigs. The money was decent but it was difficult to make the weekly payment because there was no cash flow. So she switched to raising ducks and fish farming. She has successes, her income has increased to 1200 USD a year. Today she has a paddle of 400 egg laying ducks. She is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to buy more ducks to breed and feed.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hiền, 42 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2002. 2 trong số 3 người con của chị đang học phổ thông và cao đẳng. Cũng như nhiều người dân trong vùng chị Hiền sử dụng đồng vốn chủ yếu vào dự án chăn nuôi. Ban đầu chị đầu tư nuôi lợn. Thu nhập cũng khá nhưng vì không có nghề phụ nên việc hoàn trả tuần hơi khó khăn. Sang vòng vốn sau chị chuyển sang nuôi vịt đẻ và thả cá. Công việc thuận lợi, một năm bình quân chị thu khoảng 1200USD. Hiện tại chị Hiền đang có một đàn vịt đẻ 400 con. Chị vừa đề nghị xin vay 1000USD để mua thêm vịt giống và thức ăn tổng hợp.

loans.use: Buy ducks

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị L. is 38, she joined TYM fund in 2002. Her 3 children are attending school. At first she invested in raising livestock. The money was decent. After a few years, with all their savings she and her husband opened a wood supply shop. There are a lot of constructions going on so their business is growing strong. On average, they make 200 USD a month. Because the economy is going strong so it is very favorable to her business. She is requesting a new loan of 1125 USD to buy timber

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị L., 38 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2002. 3 con của chị hiện đều đang học phổ thông. Thời gian đầu chị vay vốn chăn nuôi và cũng thu được một khoản lợi nhuận kha khá. Sau vài năm, chị cũng tích cóp được một số tiền và muốn tận dụng tay nghề mộc của chồng nên chị đã mở một xưởng mộc tại nhà. Hiện nay các công trình xây dựng mọc lên nhiều nên hàng đồ gỗ nhà chị bán rất chạy. Bình quân mỗi tháng chị L. cũng thu khoảng 200USD. Việc kinh doanh tiến triển thuận lợi, vòng vốn tới chị L. xin vay 1125USD để mua thêm gỗ làm hàng.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Đặng Thị Liên is 48 years old, a TYM fund member since 2002. She and her husband have 4 children, 3 of them are still attending school. She sells bánh cuốn
. This enables her to have a constant cash flow so it is easy for her to make the weekly payment. The "bánh cuốn" that she makes is very good so she has a lot of customers. Her monthly income, after expenses, is 100 USD. She is requesting a loan of 950 to stock up on rice.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đặng Thị Liên, 48 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2002. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 4 người con, trong đó 3 còn đang học phổ thông. Công việc hàng ngày của chị Liên là bán bánh cuốn. Đây là một công việc tạo ra thu nhập thường xuyên rất thuận lợi cho việc hoàn trả tuần. Bánh chị làm vừa mềm vừa dẻo nên rất đông khách đến ăn. Hàng tháng trừ chi phí chị Liên cũng lãi được 100USD. Với mong muốn tăng thêm thu nhập, vòng vốn tới chị Liên làm đơn xin vay 950USD để mua gạo làm bánh.

loans.use: Buy rice to make "bánh cuốn"

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To start a small business selling precooked beans

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Bé, 30 years old, is a TYM member since 2004. She is married and has 2 young children. Her main occupation is fish farming and raising ducks. Every year, she sells 2 batches of fish worth 500-700 USD each. Her paddle of a few hundreds ducks bring in 6-7 USD a day for the eggs. Since joining TYM enables her to invest in her business, this in turn improves her family financial status. She always makes her weekly payment on time. This time she is seeking 625 USD to buy ducks and feed for the animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Bé, 30 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2004. Chị Bé sống cùng chồng và 2 con nhỏ. Công việc của chị là thả cá và chăn nuôi vịt. Mỗi năm chị thu hoạch 2 vụ cá vào khoảng 500-700USD. Đàn vịt vài trăm con mỗi ngày cũng cho thu nhập 6-7USD tiền trứng. Từ khi tham gia Quỹ có thêm vốn làm ăn nên kinh tế gia đình ngày càng phát triển. Việc hoàn trả tuần cũng được chị Bé thực hiện đầy đủ. Vòng vốn sắp tới, chị làm đơn xin vay 625USD mua vịt và thức ăn chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy ducks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in bedspreads for her small business

loans.name: Dinh Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đinh Thị Tự, 40 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2003. She has 3 children, two are still in school age. She farms and tends livestock. From a single pig at the beginning, she now frequently has 7-8 pigs. She releases pigs 3 or 4 times a year. Each earns her 500-600USD. With better income, she’s been filling her house with furniture and appliances. She is applying for a loan of 1000USD to buy more breeding pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Đinh Thị Tự, 40 T.ổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. 2 trong số 3 con của chị đang trong độ T.ổi đến trường. Công việc chính của chị hiện nay là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Từ một con lợn ban đầu số lợn hiện nay của chị đã lên 7-8 con. Mỗi năm chị xuất chuồng 3, 4 lứa lợn, mỗi lứa cho thu nhập 500-600USD. Thu nhập tăng, kinh tế phát triển, chị Tự đã sắm sửa thêm được nhiều vật dụng có giá trị trong gia đình. Vòng vốn này chị làm đơn xin vay 1000USD để mua thêm lợn giống.

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a collection of bedspreads and tablecloths for her business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Phương, 26 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2005. She is single and lives with her parents. She owns a grocery stand. With funds from the loans her stand caries more variety of goods, the income therefore increases The stand earns her 130USD monthly in average that she spends for herself and also reinvests into the stand. She wishes to expand her stand more and quicker that she is applying for a loan of 625USD to stock her stand.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Phương, 26 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2005. Chưa lập gia đình, chị hiện vẫn sống cùng bố mẹ. Công việc chính của chị là bán hàng tạp hóa. Từ khi có thêm vốn vay của Quỹ, số lượng hàng hóa của quầy hàng đa dạng hơn, thu nhập tăng lên đáng kể. Bình quân một tháng chị Phương thu khoảng 130USD. Số tiền này được chị dùng chi phí cho sinh hoạt cá nhân và tái đầu tư. Với mong muốn mở rộng quy mô cửa hàng, vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 625USD mua hàng bán.

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Cường, 40 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2003. She lives with her husband and their 4 children, 3 are still in school age. She uses funds from the loans to buy exotic seafood like eels and frogs then resells to the restaurants in the area. Her merchandises are popular. A good percentage of the monthly income of 300-400USD is reinvested. With a good economy she has been filling her house with furniture and appliances. She is applying for a loan of 950USD to invest in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Cường, 40 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Chị đang sống cùng chồng và 4 người con, 3 trong số đó đang học phổ thông. Vốn vay từ Quỹ được chị Cường sử dụng thu mua thực phẩm như lươn, ếch sau đó đem bán cho các nhà hàng. Hàng bán chạy, đồng vốn được quay vòng liên tục nên tạo hiệu quả kinh tế cao. Bình quân một tháng chị Cường thu 300-400USD. Kinh tế phát triển mạnh nên đồ đạc tiện nghi trong nhà được sắm sửa đầy đủ. Vòng vốn tới chị Cường xin vay thêm 950USD để mua thêm hàng bán.

loans.use: Invest in seafood business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Nghĩa, 45 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2004. She lives with her husband and their 3 school aged children. After her first loan that she invested in her livestock, she switched her business to rice processing. It is a good business. She processes for a lot of farmers in her area. The service earns her 200USD monthly. The monthly payments are easy for her. She is applying for a loan of 950USD to invest in the business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nguyễn Thị Nghĩa, 45 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2004. Chị đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con trong độ tuổi đi học. Sau vòng đầu vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, chị Nghĩa chuyển sang đầu tư xay xát lúa gạo. Công việc ngày càng phát triển, rất nhiều bà con trong thôn đến xay xát gạo tại cửa hàng nhà chị Nghĩa. Thu nhập một tháng của dịch vụ xay xát khoảng 200USD. Nhờ có thu nhập thường xuyên nên việc hoàn trả tuần của chị Nghĩa rất thuận lợi. Vòng vốn tiếp theo chị xin vay 950USD mua gạo về xay xát.

loans.use: Rice processing

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đỗ Thị Hoài, 25 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2005. She is single and lives with her parents. She is the owner of a popular tailor shop in the area. The business is good. She earns 130USD monthly in average. She spends a part of her income on personal need and reinvests the rest back to her tailor shop. She is applying for a loan of 650USD to buy fabric.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Đỗ Thị Hoài, 25 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2005. Chưa lập gia đình, chị sống cùng với bố mẹ. Chị có một cửa hiệu may phục vụ cho bà con trong thôn. Nhờ khéo ăn nói và có tay nghề nên ngày càng có nhiều khách hàng đến cửa hàng của chị. Công việc kinh doanh tiến triển thuận lợi, mỗi tháng chị Hoài thu 130USD. Số tiền lãi thu được chị dùng vào chi phí cho cá nhân và mua thêm vải may. Chị mong muốn được vay những mức vốn lớn từ Quỹ để mở rộng cửa hàng. Số vốn chị xin vay lần này là 625USD để mua vải.

loans.use: Buy clothes

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đào Thị Sáu, 47 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2001. In the last 7 years she has been through many business avenues. Sometimes, she has more than one at the time but her main activity still remains livestock. The income is 200USD monthly in average. Her husband, a construction worker, helps her to pay the weekly repayments. The total amount of loans, up to today, is 2000USD. All is paid off. She raises her two children well. They both attend college now. This time she is applying for a loan of 625USD to buy some cattle.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Đào Thị Sáu, 47 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2001. Trong 7 năm qua chị đã làm rất nhiều việc như chăn nuôi, trồng trọt và làm một số nghề phụ khác để có thêm nguồn thu nhập cho gia đình. Tuy nhiên công việc chính của chị vẫn là chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng từ hoạt động này khoảng 200USD. Chồng chị lại đi xây hỗ trợ cho vợ trong việc hoàn trả tuần nên việc tham gia Quỹ của chị rất thuận lợi. Tính đến nay chị Sáu đã vay từ Quỹ số vốn là 2000USD. Nhờ đồng vốn vay và sự chịu khó của mình, chị Sáu đã có tiền cho con ăn học chu đáo. Hiện nay 2 con chị đều đang học đại học và cao đẳng. Vòng vốn này chị Sáu xin vay 625USD mua trâu bò về chăn nuôi.

loans.use: Buy cattle

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Dao Thi T., 49 years old, joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) in 1997. She has two grown-up children. When she first joined TYM Fund, she just borrowed 50USD to raise chicken. After that first loan, she earned 20USD in profit. Although the profit was small, it helped her understand the benefits of being a member of TYM Fund. In 11 years, she has continuously taken loans and used it to breed animals; her income increases significantly. In total, she has borrowed up to 3000USD. Mrs. T. is a fishman, and what he earns is also used towards the repayments. With the average monthly income of 200USD, Mrs. T. wants to borrow 950USD to buy buffaloes, cows, and fertilizers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đào Thị Tám, 49 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 1997. Chị có 2 con đã trưởng thành. Khi mới vào chị chỉ vay 50USD để chăn nuôi gà. Cuối vòng vốn chị lãi được 20USD. Số lãi tuy nhỏ nhưng chị Tám đã thấy được tiện ích khi tham gia Quỹ. Trong 11 năm chị liên tục vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi mang lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao. Tổng số vốn vay của Quỹ lên đến 3000USD. Nguồn hoàn trả tuần được lấy từ việc đánh bắt cá của chồng nên công việc diễn ra rất thuận lợi. Với thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng là 200USD, chị Tám đề nghị xin vay 950USD để mua trâu bò nuôi và dành một phần tiền mua phân bón.

loans.use: Buy cattle

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi V., 41 years old, live primarily based on farming. After borrowed 100 USD to invest into breeding cattle and gain success, she borrowed more and more each time around. Now, the total loan she had borrowed from TYM is closed to 3000 USD. Most of these loans have been used on breeding cattle and buying fertilizers. With good calculation and strong work ethic, her family has been able to gain huge success. She has been able to buy furniture for the house and afford her children to go to school. With monthly income of 250 USD, Mrs. V. just made a request for a loan of 950 USD to help invest more into her project.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Vân, 41 tuổi, là một gia đình thuần nông. Chồng chị ngoài việc đồng áng luôn giúp vợ trong mọi công việc. Sau khi vay mức vốn 100USD đầu tư vào chăn nuôi mang lại lợi nhuận chị Vân tiếp tục vay những mức vốn cao hơn. Cho đến nay tổng số tiền chị vay từ Tym lên đến 3000USD. Số vốn này được dùng cho việc mua con giống hoặc phân bón. Nhờ khéo tính toán và chăm chỉ, kinh tế gia đình rất phát triển. Chị Vân đã mua sắm thêm được nhiều vật dụng có giá trị trong gia đình và cho các con ăn học tử tế. Với thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng 250USD, chị Vân vừa làm đơn xin vay 950USD để đầu tư cho dự án.

loans.use: Buy pigs and fertilizer

loans.name: Pham Thi Ngoc

texts.vi:
Mrs. Pham Thi Ngoc A., 22 years old, joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) in 2006. Her husband is a truck-driver. Their 2 children are still very small. The first loan of 200USD, which was used towards Mrs. A.'s store, was a success. Thus, Mrs. A. is more confident and continue to take loans and invest in her store. Now each month she earns about 250USD from the store. With the increasing income, Mrs. A. has more ability to take care of her children. Her husband also helps her with the repayments whenever she encounters difficulty in business. This time she wants to borrow 575USD to buy candy and other goods to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Ngọc A., 22 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2006. Chồng chị làm nghề lái xe, 2 con trai của A. chị đều còn nhỏ. Sau năm đầu vay vốn 200USD đầu tư vào bán hàng tạp hóa có hiệu quả, chị A. tiếp tục vay vốn đầu tư cho dự án này. Đến nay thu nhập hàng tháng của chị từ việc bán hàng khoảng 250USD. Kinh tế phát triển, chị A. có điều kiện chăm sóc cho các con của mình hơn. Chồng chị cũng luôn hỗ trợ vợ mỗi khi chị gặp khó khăn nên việc vay vốn của chị A. rất thuận lợi. Vòng vốn này chị làm đơn xin vay 575USD để mua bánh kẹo bán.

loans.use: Buy confectionary

loans.name: Quach Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Quach Thi D., 44 years old, joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) in 1999. Her husband died early, leaving her the sole bread-winner of the family. She has to take care of her two children who are still going to school. Her first loan of 100USD was used to breeding cows. After the first loan, she earned 50USD in profit. Up to now, she has borrowed 3000USD from TYM Fund in total. Each month she earns 150USD from poultry breeding. This time she wants to use the loan to pay for the living expenses and her children's school fees. Ms. D. wants to continue to be a member of TYM Fund. This time she proposes for a loan of 450 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Quách Thị Điền, 44 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 1999. Chồng chị mất sớm một mình chị phải lam lũ nuôi 2 con ăn học. Số vốn vay 100USD lần đầu được chị đầu tư cho chăn nuôi bò. Sau khi kết thúc vòng vốn chị lãi được 50USD. Tính cho đến nay chị đã vay của Quỹ 3000USD. Mỗi tháng chị thu được 150USD tiền lãi bình quân từ chăn nuôi gà, vịt. Số tiền này được chị sử dụng cho sinh hoạt gia đình và các con ăn học. Chị luôn mong muốn được tham gia Quỹ lâu dài để vay vốn. Mức đề nghị của chị Điền vòng này là 450USD.

loans.use: Buy poultry

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi M., 44 years old, joined TYM since 1997. After her husband passed away, she have to raise her two children all alone (one is still going to school). The first 100 USD loan was used for breeding cattle and give her a profit of 30 USD. During the 11 years with TYM, Mrs. M. has borrowed a total of 3500 USD and has been able to make enough profit from them to increase her family standard of living and provide education for her children. In this cycle, she would like to borrow 625 USD to buy breeding chickens and foodstuff as well as fertilizers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị M., 44 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 1997. Chồng mất, gia đình chị chỉ có 3 mẹ con, trong đó 1 cháu còn đang đi học. Số vốn vay 100USD lần đầu được chị vay đầu tư cho chăn nuôi và lãi 30USD. Trong 11 năm tham gia chị Mỹ vay tổng số 3500USD từ Quỹ. Tiền lãi bình quân hàng tháng từ chăn nuôi gà lợn và trồng trọt khoảng 150USD. Số tiền này được chị M. dùng cải thiện cuộc sống, mua thêm đồ đạc, cho các con ăn học. Vòng vốn tới chị M. làm đơn xin vay 625USD mua gà giống, thức ăn tổng hợp cùng phân bón.

loans.use: Buy chickens, food and fertilizer

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vu Thi H., 29 years , is the 12th member of TYM. Her husband currently working in Hanoi so she has to take care of her two small children by herself back home. Her primary income is from the internet cafe which give her about 200 to 220 USD per month. This earning has enable her to increase her family standard of living include buying furniture and buying books for her children. Up to now, she has taken out a total of 2000 USD through loan. During this cycle she would like to borrow 575 USD to buy more computer and increase the profit.

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Hiền, 29 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 12 của Quỹ Tình thương. Chồng chị hiện đang làm thuê cho 1 công ty tại Hà Nội, một mình chị ở nhà trông 2 con nhỏ. Công việc hiện nay của chị Hiền là kinh doanh dịch vụ Internet. Nhu cầu tìm hiểu thông tin ngày càng nhiều nên cửa hàng chị Hiền luôn đông khách. Mỗi tháng chị thu khoảng 200-220USD. Số tiền này được chị Hiền dùng trang trải cho cuộc sống, mua sắm đồ đạc và chăm lo cho các con. Tính cho đến nay chị đã vay của Quỹ khoảng 2000USD. Với mong muốn được tham gia Quỹ lâu dài để vay vốn. Vòng này chị Hiền đề nghị xin vay 575USD để mua thêm máy mới về kinh doanh.

loans.use: Buy computer

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Phượng, 55 years old, joins the TYM Fund in 2003. She is married and they have three grown up children. She used funds from early loans to invest in her livestock. Small at first, the business gradually expanded. The family’s economy was better that she could furnish their house with many furniture and appliances and raise her kids comfortably. Last year, she steered her business to selling steel. The market for steel and stainless is booming so her business. Her monthly income is 250USD. She is applying for a loan of 950USD to invest in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Phạm Thị Phượng, 55 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 3 người con đều đã trưởng thành. Trước đây, vốn vay được chị Phượng đầu tư chủ yếu cho việc chăn nuôi lợn. Từ việc chăn nuôi nhỏ lẻ chị nâng dần quy mô việc chăn nuôi, chăn nuôi lợn thịt được chuyển thành chăn nuôi lợn sinh sản cho thu nhập cao hơn. Kinh tế phát triển, chị Phượng đã mua sắm được nhiều tài sản có giá trị, nuôi được các con khôn lớn. Năm ngoái, chị chuyển sang mở cửa hàng kinh doanh sắt và Inox. Nhu cầu về mặt hàng này trên thị trường đang cao nên hàng bán rất chạy. Một tháng bình quân chị Phượng thu 250USD. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 950USD để mua thêm sắt.

loans.use: Buy steel

loans.name: Dong Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Dong Thi N., 51 years old, joined the Fund in 2003. Her family includes the couple and four grown children, one of which has already started a family. In the first round of funding, she borrowed 100USD to invest in keeping pigs and chickens with the goal of becoming familiar with how the Fund works. After the success of the first year’s loan Ms. N. borrowed larger amounts to do business selling chickens and ducks. After subtracting the costs of running the business, Ms. N. earns 200USD per month. In addition to her husband’s pension, the monthly income brings the couple a comfortable life. With the business growing smoothly, in the coming round of funding Ms. N. requests a loan of 950USD to buy more chickens and ducks.

translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer

Chị Nguyễn Thị Đông, 51 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 4 người con đã trưởng thành, trong đó người con đầu đã lập gia đình riêng. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị xin vay 100USD đầu tư cho chăn nuôi lợn gà với mục đích làm quen với cơ chế của Quỹ. Sau khi năm đầu vay vốn mang lại hiệu quả, chị Đông vay những mức vốn lớn buôn bán gà vịt. Trừ chi phí một tháng chị Đông lãi được 200USD. Cộng với lương hưu của chồng thì thu nhập hàng tháng giúp cho hai vợ chồng có một cuộc sống khá giả. Công việc tiến triển thuận lợi, vòng tới chị Đông xin vay 950USD để mua gà, vịt bán.

loans.use: Buy poultry

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Mrs. Natividad A. is 42 years old and lives in the Rinconada neighborhood of Trujillo, Peru.

She was only able to study up to her third year of high school; she has three dependent children. Mrs. Natividad has a shoe-making workshop on the third floor of their home where she makes leather shoes for children. She opened the workshop five years ago and has been able to open and operate the shop with the help of loans from Manuela Ramos. She and her husband are always united in their business as they understand that the progress of their family depends on their efforts in their workshop. Their shop currently has two outliners/profilers, three shoe assembly machines, and one cutting machine.

Mrs. Natividad has become a member of the “Gaspers” community bank through the referral of a friend. She used her first loan of ~$115 to purchase shoe forms, leather, glue, and other materials necessary to make the shoes.

With this $275 loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase additional materials to make and sell shoes during the winter.

Mrs. Natividad dreams of having a shoe factory and become a bigger businesswoman and is working hard to achieve her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Natividad A. tiene 42 años de edad, vive en la Urbanización la Rinconada el Provincia de Trujillo La Libertad – Perú. Estudió sólo hasta tercero de secundaria; tiene 3 hijos los cuales aun dependen de ella. La señora Natividad tiene en el tercer piso de su casa, un taller de confección de calzado para niños en cuero; se inicio hace 05 años, y viene trabajando cuatro años conjuntamente con los préstamos otorgados por Manuela Ramos. Su esposo y ella están siempre unidos en este negocio porque saben que de su esfuerzo dependerá el progreso de su familia. Actualmente cuenta con dos perfiladoras, tres armadores de calzado y un cortador. La señora Natividad ingresa al Banco Comunal “ Las Jadeitas” por medio de una amiga. Obtuvo su primer crédito de S/300.00 con los cuales compró hormas, cuero, pegamento, y otros insumos para confeccionar. Con el préstamo de S/.700.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses comprará material para su campaña de invierno. La señora Natividad sueña con tener una fabrica de calzado, ser una empresaria grande para lo cual esta trabajando mucho para poder lograr sus sueños.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to make shoes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Hanh Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Hanh Thi N., 50 years old, joined the Fund in 2003. Two of her four children are still living with their parents. Her current business is selling straw brooms. With more than 10 years of experience in selling these goods, Ms. N. is boldly taking a big loan to invest in growing her business. Presently the value of her business is around a few thousand dollars. Her monthly income is around 200 USD. She uses this money to buy things for the house and make other investments. In this round of funding Ms. N. requests 950 USD to buy more stock for her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hạnh, 50 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. 2 trong số 4 người con của chị Hạnh vẫn đang sống cùng bố mẹ. Công việc hiện nay của chị là kinh doanh chổi chít. Với kinh nghiệm hơn 10 năm trong việc buôn bán mặt hàng này, chị Hạnh mạnh dạn vay vốn lớn đầu tư cho dự án. Hiện nay tổng số vốn buôn bán của chị lên đến một vài nghìn USD. Thu nhập mỗi tháng của chị khoảng 200USD. Số tiền này chị dùng để sắm sửa vật dụng trong gia đình và tái đầu tư. Vòng vốn tới chị Hạnh đề nghị xin vay 950USD để mua thêm hàng buôn bán.

loans.use: Buy straw broom

loans.name: Sinh Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Sinh Thi N., 53 years old, joined the Fund in 2002. She has four adult children. In the first round of funding, Ms. N. borrowed 200USD to raise pigs and chicken, by the year’s end she had made 100USD. After a while, she used large loans in combination with money she had saved up to raise cattle and farm lemon trees. Each year her annual income from raising cattle and lemon sales surpasses 2000USD. In addition, her husband and children also go to the city to do odd jobs so the family can have extra income. The amount she is requesting in this funding round is 625USD, to invest in buying more lemon trees and fertilizer to expand the lemon tree operation.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer

Chị Nguyễn Thị Sinh, 53 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2002. 4 người con của chị Sinh đều đã trưởng thành. Vòng vốn đầu chị Sinh vay 200USD chăn nuôi lợn gà, cuối năm chị lãi 100USD. Sau một thời gian, chị vay mức vốn lớn cộng với số tiền tích lũy được chăn nuôi trâu bò và trồng chanh bán. Mỗi năm thu nhập bình quân từ chăn nuôi và trồng trọt khoảng hơn 2000USD. Ngoài ra chồng và các con chị cũng ra thành phố làm thuê để gia đình có thêm thu nhập. Số vốn đề nghị của chị Sinh vòng tới là 625USD đầu tư cho việc mua chanh, phân bón mở rộng diện tích đất trồng.

loans.use: Buy lemon tree, fertilizer

loans.name: Bertha Azucena

texts.es:
Mrs. Bertha A. is 41 years old and married with three school-aged children. She studied nursing but has not been able to complete her degree. She lives on Tornillos Street in La Rinconada in Trujillo, Peru.

Three years ago, she opened a small general store which has grown thanks to loans she has received through the Manuela Ramos Movement. Today, it is a large store selling such things as meats and vegetables.

She belongs to the credit group “Stars of Jesus.” She received her first loan from Manuela Ramos of ~$115 and invested it all in purchasing cleaning and other consumer products to sell in her store.

With this $375 loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she plans to buy various products to supply her store.

Mrs. Bertha wishes to continue working in order to provide an education for her children and see them become professionals. She would like them to follow the example of their older sister who is currently studying Microbiology and Parasitology at the National University of Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Bertha A., tiene 41 años, casada con 03 hijos en edad escolar, tiene estudios superiores incompletos de enfermería, y vive en la calle los Tornillos -La Rinconada, Trujillo – Perú. Hace 03 años se inició con una pequeña bodega la cual ha ido creciendo gracias a los préstamos obtenidos por el Movimiento. Manuela Ramos hoy es una bodega amplia en la cual vende carnes y verduras, Pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “Estrellas De Jesus”, recibió un primer préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos, de S/.300, invirtiendolo completamente en la compra de artículos de limpieza, de consumo, etc. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000. el cual cancelará en 4 meses; con este dinero comprará diversos artículos para surtir la bodega. La señora Bertha, desea seguir trabajando para educar a sus hijos hasta verlos profesionales y sigan el ejemplo de su hija mayor la cual estudia Microbiología y Parasitología en la Universidad Nacional de Trujillo.

loans.use: Purchase of additional merchandise to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Lai Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Lai Thi N., 41 years old, joined the fund in 2005. She lives with her husband and 6 children in Hung Trung, Hung N.. Five out of six of her children are still in school. In the first round of funding she borrowed 200USD to raise pigs, by the year’s end she took in 120 USD. Although she was able to put the loan to good use, Ms. N. realized that raising pigs does not make enough money to pay for her children’s schooling; her husband still has to work as a bricklayer to bring more income. In addition to 2000 USD of capital that she raised herself, Ms. N. plans to borrow 950USD to buy decoration equipment and flower gates to serve weddings. She makes the weekly payments from investments in a wedding hall and her husband’s sidejob. According to today’s market prices, Ms. N. expects to make in the range of 10-30 USD per wedding.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Lài, 41 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2005. Chị sống cùng chồng và 6 người con tại Hưng Trung, Hưng Nguyên. 5 trong số 6 con của chị còn đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay 200USD để chăn nuôi lợn, kết thúc năm chị lãi 120USD. Tuy vốn vay sử dụng có hiệu quả nhưng chị Lài thấy chỉ nuôi lợn thì không đủ tiền đóng học phí cho con, chồng chị vẫn phải đi làm thợ nê để có thêm thu nhập. Cộng với 2000USD vốn tự có, chị Lài dự định vay 950USD để sắm trang thiết bị và rạp cưới phục vụ đám cưới. Nguồn trả tuần chị lấy từ đầu tư rạp và nghề phụ của chồng. Theo như giá cả hiện nay thì cứ mỗi đám cưới chị Lài thu lãi vài chục USD.

loans.use: Buy wedding equipment, decorations, flower gates

loans.name: Nhung Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nhung Thi P., 55 years old, joined the Fund in 1998.  Her family includes the couple and their 2 children, one of which is still in school.  In the first round of funding she used the loan to raise pigs and collected 50 USD.  In the subsequent funding rounds, Ms. P. invested in raising cattle.  She also runs a convenience store to make enough income for the weekly payments.  After 10 years of participation in the Fund, Ms. P. has been able to build a new house.  Her monthly income is about 150USD.  Her wish is to receive the new loan in time to buy beverages to serve her customers in the coming summer, to improve her family’s income.  She is requesting a loan of 625USD.
Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.
Chị P. Thị Nhung, 55 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 1998. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con, trong đó 1 còn đi học. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay vốn chăn nuôi lợn và thu lãi 50USD. Các vòng tiếp theo chị Nhung đầu tư chăn nuôi trâu bò. Bên cạnh đó chị cũng bán hàng tạp hóa để có tiền hoàn trả tuần. Sau gần 10 năm tham gia Quỹ đến nay chị Nhung đã xây dựng được nhà mới. Thu nhập hàng tháng của chị Nhung khoảng 150USD. Mong muốn của chị hiện nay là có vốn kịp thời để mua hàng giải khát phục vụ người dân trong mùa hè sắp tới, tăng thu nhập gia đình. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị là 625USD.

loans.use: Buy machine to make ice-cream, beverages

loans.name: Martha Sabina

texts.es:
Martha B. is 23 years old, lives with her partner and has a child who attends primary school. She lives at c/ Tornillos - La Rinconada, Trujillo, Perú. 5 years ago she started working mornings and afternoons, selling ointment in front of the Lazarte Hospital. Her husband, Ermitaño also sells ointment with her.

She has been a member of Grupo Mientras Tanto "Estrellas De Jesus" (which is part of the Movimiento Manuela Ramos) since 2007. She invested her first loan of $100 in the purchase of pollen, honey, bees, aloe vera etc.

With this next loan of $300, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy tyres for her tricycle and goods for preparing the ointment.

Martha wants to continue working so that she can buy her own house. She currently lives in her parents' home and feels the need to stand on her own two feet for the sake of her young child.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the preparation of her products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Aenid Selessy

texts.es:
