Aenid C. was born on June 1975. She is 32 years old, married and has 3 children, who have all attended primary school. She currently lives at Asentamiento Humano, Alberto Fujimori, Salaverry, Perú.

She is a member of the Banco Comunal Las Empesarias al Éxito II. Three years ago she opened a small shop, selling porcelein, glass and plastic, made possible by her ordering and delivery system.

With this loan of $625, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy plates, jars, pots etc.

Aenid has high expectations from her business, expecting it to grow daily from the hard work of her and her husband. Thus they hope to be able to support their children and hope to see them grow healthy and successful in their working lives.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Maria Eulalia

texts.es:
Mará is 30 years old and lives together with her husband and two children at Urbanización La Rinconada in the Trujillo La Libertad province of Perú. María has had a small store at home for about 5 years, during which time she has also worked with Manuela Ramos. She is one of the most active women in her group, eagerly taking part in activities which are organised for the benefit of her community.

María is a member of Banco Comunal "Las Jadeitas". With her first loan of $100 she was able to expand her business.

With this loan of $550, she will buy snacks, rice, sugar, fizzy drinks, grocieries and reading material. The loan will be repaid in 4 months.

María wants to continue working on the growth of her business so that she can improve her economic situation.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Luz Rosmery

texts.es:
Luz is 32 years old, and was born on May 15, 1976. She studied until the third year at high school and lives at Urbanización La Libertad-Trujillo, Perú. She is married and has three young children who are dependent on her and her husband. She is known as a friendly and hard-working woman.

Five years ago, she started work selling cosmetics. She stopped that when she fell pregnant with her second child but later returned to work. Her clients are her close friends and family, her neighbours and also some mothers of her youngest child's schoolfriends.

She is a member of Banco Comunal "Unidas Para El Progresso II", which is part of the Movimiento Manuela Ramos. She invested her first loan of $100 completely in cosmetics.

She will also invest this next loan of $300 in her business, and will repay it in 4 months.

Luz dreams of becoming a large provider of cosmetics, and would also like to increase her income by opening a restaurant together with her husband.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop.

loans.name: Luz Amparo

texts.es:
Luz Chávez is 32 years old, has completed her secondary school education and has two young children, who she takes care of very well. She lives in the new part of Cesar Vallejo in the Urbanización La Rinconada in the city of Trujillo, La Libertad, Perú.

Luz has moulding premises, where she sells bolts, lights, oils, lubricants etc. She runs her business from a room in her house, which is suitable for selling these products. She started doing this two and a half years ago, thanks to a $100 loan from Manuela Ramos. She invested this money in her small business and thanks to her constant hard work, this is now growing, leading to an improvement in her quality of life. She is a member of Banco Comunal "Las Jadeitas"

With this next loan of $400, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy more goods for her business.

Her biggest dream is to expand her business so that she can provide her children with a good education.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
Dionisia is requesting a fourth loan to invest it on improving her house, in this case to build a bathroom in her house. She has been working as a nurse assistant for the last 16 years.

Dionisia has two daughters, the oldest studies 1st year of high school and the baby girl is 5 months old, she also has the help of her husband who is also a nurse assistant.

Dionisia got a scholarship for her specialty, and she is currently studying, she works very responsibly, she is a humble woman with high spirits of personal improvement, is a woman who has fought for her family so her daughters do not lack the basic things in her house, her dream is to be healthy, have work stability and that her daughters one day would be able to go to college and be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Dionicia esta solicitando su cuarto refinanciamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, como es terminar de construir los servicios higienicos de su casa. Trabaja como Auxiliar de Enfermería desde hace 16 años.

Dionisia es madre de dos niñas, la mayor estudia 1 er año de educación secundaria y una bebita de 5 meses, además cuenta con la ayuda de su marido quien se desempeña tambien como auxiliar de enfermeria.

Dionicia logró obtener una beca para una especialidad, la cual está estudiando actualmente, desempeña su labor con mucha responsabilidad, es una mujer humilde y con alto espiritu de superación personal, es una mujer que ha luchado por su familia para que a sus hijas no les falte lo básico en el hogar, su sueño es tener salud, estabilidad laboral y que su hijas logren llegar a ser profesionales.

loans.use: To build a bathroom in her one room house

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es:
Dulce has always liked cooking, which is why she established a food preparation and sales business in her house 6 years ago. She started selling food to her acquaintances and neighbors. With the income generated from the business, she helps her husband cover the household expenses, as well as pay for her 4 children’s schooling.

She currently needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, so that she can buy an industrial stove because it is difficult to use big pots on the stove she currently has. Furthermore, the new stove will have a greater capacity, which means that she will be able to prepare more meals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Dulce, siempre le ha gustado la cocina, por loq ue haqce 6 años emprendio en su casa un negocio, preparar comidas para vender, inicio entre sus vecinos de la colonia y conocidos, con los ingresos ayuda con los gastos de su casa a su esposo, y pagan los estudios de sus 4 hijos

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $ 250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar una estufa industrial por que la que tiene es normal, y se le dificulta subir y bajar las ollas grandes, ademas de que la nueva estuvo tendra mas capacidad, por o que podra preparar mas platillos.

loans.use: Purchase industrial stove

loans.name: Oved

texts.es:
Mr. Oved is requesting a second loan with AFODENIC to invest it to improve his house to build a room, he has been working as a school teacher in the University of URACCAN located in the department of Nueva Guinea for the past 4 years; Oved since he was very little has supported his family, because they are very close and religious, he works very responsibly, as a teacher on computer science, he is also studying for a masters degree, we should point out that this young man is known for his simplicity and humility, but has a high desire of improvement, he wishes to have a house in good conditions, have work stability and health to keep on helping his family.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Oved está solicitando su segundo refinanciamiento con AFODENIC para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es construir una habitación, trabaja como docente en la Universidad URACCAN ubicada en el departamento de Nueva Guinea desde hace 4 años; Oved desde muy pequeño ha apoyado a su familia, ya que son muy unidos y profesan la religión cristiana, desempeña su labor con mucha responsabilidad, es maestro de informatica, a la vez está estudiando una maestria, vale la pena recalcar que este joven se caracteriza por su sencillez y humildad, pero posee un alto espiritu de superación personal, el aspira tener una vivienda con todas las condiciones, tener estabilidad laboral, salud para asi seguir ayudando a su familia.

loans.use: To build a room / Construcción de una habitación

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
The group “Unidas” has been working together with Pro-Mujer for about a year and a half. They are part of the Villa Exaltacion Group located in EL Alto City. In the morning they head to the bakery to get bread to sell on their stores, in which they also offer a variety of products. They buy these products by the dozen and sell them individually. They need a loan to be able to purchase these products by boxes; if they buy at bulk they will get higher earnings when they sell them individually. By getting higher margins they are able to get greater economically sustainability in their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Jimenez, Kiva Volunteer.

La asociación “Unidas” trabaja junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer hace un año y medio aproximadamente. Pertenece al centro focal de Villa Exaltación ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto. Por la madrugada van a los hornos y se abastecen de pan para ofrecerlos en sus tiendas, donde también ofrecen una variedad de productos, dichos productos los compran por docena para luego venderlos por unidad. Necesitan de mayores créditos parea adquirir estos productos por cajas, es decir por mayor así la ganancia de cada producto seria mayor, de esta forma generar mas ingresos para lograr sostenibilidad económica en sus hogares.

loans.use:
Need loan to buy their prodcuts at bulk.

Necesitan mayores creditos para comprar comestibles por mayor.

loans.name: Grisel Del Carmen

texts.es:
Grisel del Carmen has been selling apparel for a living for 10 years. She started this business upon taking custody of her 2 children because she needed to help them get ahead. Her family supported her and introduced her to the world of business. Even though she currently lives with her common-law husband and her financial situation has changed, she continues with her business because it has helped her cover her children’s education; one of them will soon be attending the university. She would like to purchase more merchandise in order to increase her sales and pay for her son’s degree.

She needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which will be repaid in 3 months, so that she can purchase merchandise and boost her sales. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Grisel del Carmen, hace 10 años que se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa, lo inicio al quedar sola con sus dos hijos, ya que tenia que sacarlos adelante, sus familiares la apoyaron y le enseñaron el negocio de venta en mercados, ahora aunque vive en unión libre y la situación económica ha cambiado, continua con el negocio por que le ha ayudado con los costos de la educación de sus hijos, ahora uno de ellos va a entrar a la universidad, y ella desea comprar mas mercancía para mejorar sus ingresos, y poder solventar la carrera de su hijo.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y continuar sus ventas. Con tu ayuda esto será posible.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es:
Rosalio is requesting a loan to invest it on improving his house by pealing out the walls and re-painting it, he lives in Nueva Guinea, has been working in the hospital Jacinto Hernandez as an Rx technician for the last 21 years, he is a hard working man and responsible who has worked for the good of the community, currently he is studying to be a nurse, although this client has no kids, he is responsible for taking care of his parents. Rosalio is an example of a good son, his dream is to have an honorable house and work stability to help his family, because they have very few economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

El Cliente Rosalio está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es repellar y pintar su vivienda, habita en Nueva Guinea, trabaja para el hospital Jacinto Hernández como Tecnico de Radiologia desde hace 21 años, es un hombre trabajador y responsable que ha trabajado para el bien de la comunidad, actualmente está estudiando una Licenciatura en enfermeria, a pesar que este cliente no tiene hijos, el asume la responsabilidad del cuido de sus padres. Rosalio es un ejemplo de hijo, su sueño es tener una vivienda digna y estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia, ya que son de escasos recursos económicos.

loans.use: Peal out the walls and paint his one room house / Repellar paredes y pintar su casa de habitación

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Blanca Petra

texts.es:
Blanca opened her general store, which she operated from home, 11 years ago because she did not have a job at that time. She wanted to make sure that her family had enough money. She started out with only a few products, but her business is currently more stable.

She is requesting a loan of $775.00 USD, which she will repay in 5 months, in order to restock her store and boost sales, thus expanding her business. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca inició el negocio debido a que en aquel entonces no tenia trabajo, su principal necesidad en aquel entonces fue que como no tenia trabajo, decidio iniciar su propio negocio para que no faltara dinero en su casa. Comenzó hace 11 años su tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio, con poca mercancia de cada producto hasta la actualidad que es un negocio mas estable.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $775 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancia y surtir su tienda para poder vender mas y asi ampliar su negocio. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rayito De Luz Group

texts.es:
The “Beam of Light” group of borrowers are members of the Villa Exaltacion focal center and live in the city of El Alto. This is a very joyful, friendly and unified group; perhaps part of their solidarity is due to the fact that one of the members, Mrs. Blanquita, suffers from a blood disease and the other group members work hard to proviD. her economic and moral support.

The Beam of Light group generally works in making and selling food, some in restaurants and some by special order, offering exquisite traditional meals, such as: fricassee, fried pork, grilled meats and others. They need additional capital in order to supply themselves with better products to expand their production and rent larger, more comfortable spaces which will help them earn more money for each of their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad D. El Alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal D. villa Exaltación, a éste pertenece la asociación Rayito D. Luz, grupo muy alegre, simpático y unido sobre todo, quizá dicha unión se deba a que una D. las socias doña Blanquita padece una enfermedad hemática por lo que sus compañeras mostraron mucha solidaridad ayudándola moral y económicamente. La asociación Rayito D. luz por lo general se dedica a elaboración y venta D. comida en algunos casos en restaurantes y otros a pedidos, ofreciendo exquisitos platillos por lo general tradicionales, como ser: Fricase, chairo, chicharrón, platos a la parrilla y otros. Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para abastecerse D. mayores productos con el fin D. ampliar su producción y para el alquiler D. ambientes apropiados y cómodos, D. esta manera podrán generar mayores ingresos que apoyen a la economía D. sus hogares

loans.use: Need additional capital to expand production and rent more adequate space

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor started a business since he is a baker by trade. The trade was passed down from his father who was also a baker and he has always being in this trade since he finished high school, which was the highest grade of schooling that he achieved. He started his own bakery in 1982 to sustain his family. He started with a drawer oven and slowly he has expanded his business with tables, stands, and displays. Later, he built a dome oven where he actually cooks the bread. Due to his dedication and effort, he has been able to prosper on his business.

He needs a US $400 loan which he will pay back in 6 months to buy raw materials to fulfill various pending orders. With your support, Victor will be able to increase his business

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Victor inició el negocio ya que su oficio de panadero, viene de herencia, su padre fue panadero, y el siempre se ha dedicado a ese oficio desde que termino la secundaria, que es la escolaridad que termino. Inicio su propia panaderia para mantener a su familia en 1982, comenzo con un horno de gabeta, y poco a poco fue ampliado su negocio con mesas, estanteria y exhibidores, despues, construyo un horno de boveda, que es donde actualmente coce el pan. Debido a su dedicacion y esfuerzo ha logrado hacer prosperar su negocio.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima para la elaboracion de varios pedidos que tiene pendientes. Con tu apoyo Victor seguira haciendo crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Buying raw materials.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia started selling snacks and beverages at a small wood and metal shop to help her family financially. In time, she started getting customers who insisted that she expand her selection of goods and open a general store. Little by little, she started offering dairy products, soft drinks, cold cuts, and other goods. Her business grew when she invested in it and also because of her faithful customers, who know that Sofía needs their support.

Sofía currently needs a loan of $200.00 USD, which she will repay in 5 months, so that she can purchase merchandise and paint her store. She hopes that this will be possible with Kiva’s support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Sofia, inicio el negocio en la venta de refrescos y frituras en un local pequeño de madera y laminas, para ayudar económicamente en su hogar. Con el tiempo se fue haciendo de clientes, que le insistían que surtiera mercancía para que tuviera una tienda de abarrotes, entonces poco a poco fue surtiendo lácteos, refrescos, carnes frías y todo para tener bien surtida la tienda. Su negocio fue creciendo con la inversión de créditos y gracias a sus clientes que no la han abandonado y que saben que Sofía necesita de su apoyo.

Ahora Sofía necesita de un prestamo por US $200 que pagara en 5 meses, para comprar mercancía y para pintar el local de su tienda, tiene la esperanza en el apoyo de Kiva esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Hermandad Group

texts.es:
The “Brotherhood” group of 13 borrowers are members of the Villa Exaltacion focal center and live in the city of El Alto. This group has worked with ProMujer for over two years and has proven to be very well-organized and very responsible in all their group activities.

Almost all the group members spend around ~$70 per month on family expenses and rent, a very difficult amount for each to earn. The group participates in diverse businesses, from baking and selling bread to making quilts and sheets, but cosmetic sales is the primary group business. They generally sell such products on credit, which leaves them in need of working capital that allows them to purchase such products to sell. This loan will help them to improve their income while providing economic stability for their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra el centro focal de Villa Exaltación, a éste pertenece la asociación “Hermandad”, grupo formado por 13 miembros activos, que trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer hace mas dos años, demostrando ser muy organizados y responsables en sus actividades de grupo. Casi todos con sus familias por lo general entre gastos domésticos y de alquiler de vivienda, mensualmente gastan 500 Bs. mínimos, monto que lo consiguen con mucha dificultad. Existen diversos negocios dentro la asociación, por ejemplo la elaboración y venta de pan, confección de Edredones y sabanas, pero la venta de cosméticos viene a ser la actividad principal. Productos que generalmente los dejan a crédito, teniendo así que tener un capital de trabajo que respalde la adquisición de éstos productos. De este modo mejorar sus ingresos para conseguir estabilidad económica en sus hogares.

loans.use: Need loans to back their capital since their products are sold on credit

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José started selling produce from his vehicle to people in different residential zones, using his home as both a warehouse and a business space. He later started gaining customers. After that, he started selling his produce wholesale to other stores and continued doing so until he established a favorable client-base. With those profits, he was able to build a business space so that he could keep selling from home, as well as at a local market.

He currently needs a loan of $975.00 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, so that he can purchase seasonal produce and fulfill his new dream, which is build another business space in another residential area. He trusts that with Kiva’s support, he will be able to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

José inicio el negocio vendiendo frutas y verduras por colonias en su vehículo, utilizando su hogar como bodega, y a la vez también vendía frutas y verduras ahi mismo. Después se empezó a hacer de clientes, posteriormente comenzó a surtirle a tiendas al mayoreo, así lo estuvo haciendo hasta que ya tuvo una cartera de clientes favorable. Con las ganancias que esto le dejo, empezó a construir un local, para seguir la venta en su domicilio, al igual en un mercado también tiene la venta de frutas y verduras.

Ahora necesita de un crédito de $975 a 6 meses, para comprar mercancía de temporada y también cumplir su nuevo sueño que es construir otro local en otra colonia de esta ciudad, el confía en el apoyo de Kiva, podra hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and build new business space

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
Maria de Lourdes started her business because she wished to have an extra household income and to support her husband and children when they needed. She started the business also because she needed to be active and wanted to be feel useful. She has always liked to be busy with some productive activity and likes to be an independent person. This way, she will also help her husband with the household expenses. She started approximately 30 years ago selling shoes, but after a while this activity was not given her good profits since the shoe stores started to accept credit. She decided to change and started selling clothes and novelties in front of her house where she furnished a small lot. Afterwards, she bought a lot next to her house which she as well furnished to sell her merchandise. This was 8 years ago and since then, she has being doing well.

She wants a US $775 loan which she will pay back in 6 months. She will be able to buy seasonal clothes and also ceramic decorations, flower vases, backpacks and a display which will allow her to have more variety for this summer season and serve her customers better. With your support, it will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Maria de Lourdes, inició el negocio por los deseos de tener un ingreso extra para el hogar y apoyar a su esposo y sus hijos cuando lo necesitaran. Inicio el negocio porque necesitaba estar activa y sentirse una persona útil ya que siempre le ha gustado ocupar su tiempo en alguna actividad productiva y también ser una persona independiente, y de esta manera también ayudaba a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Comenzó hace como 30 años vendiendo zapatos, pero después esta actividad dejó de darle buenas ganancias ya que las zapaterías comenzaron a dar crédito, por lo que decidío cambiar de giro y empezó a vender ropa y novedades en la parte de enfrente de su casa, en donde acondiciono un pequeño local, hasta que después compro un local al lado de su casa, el cual acondicioné para poder vender su mercancía, esto fue hace como 8 años y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien.

Ella requiere un prestamo por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses, para poder comprar ropa de temporada así como adornos de cerámica, floreros, mochilas y una vitrina, lo cual le permitirá tener mas surtido para esta temporada de verano y darles mejor atención a sus clientes. Con tu apoyo esto sera posible.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Isela

texts.es:
Rosa Isela started her own business because she wanted to help out her husband. Furthermore, she likes retail because it gives her the opportunity to meet new people, and because she likes to be an independent woman. She started the business because she needed the extra income to help with both the household expenses and her 2 children’s education, which is vital for obtaining better opportunities in life. She started selling novelty items and ceramics thanks to her mother-in-law, who supported her. She has now been selling seafood to her friends, family, and neighbors for 8 years, and has been prosperous.

She needs a loan of $775.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can purchase more fish and other seafood because there is currently a high demand for it. She would like to offer a wider selection of seafood in order to satisfy her customers’ needs and increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Isela inició el negocio por el deseo de ayudar a su esposo, además de que le gustan mucho las ventas ya que de esta manera puede conocer personas y también porque le gusta ser una persona independiente. Inicio el negocio porque necesitaba contar con un ingreso extra para el hogar y así ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y los estudios de sus 2 hijos, ya que querie que tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida. Comenzó hace 11 años vendiendo novedades y cerámica gracias a su suegra que la apoyó para hacerlo y tiene 8 años que se dedica a la venta de mariscos entre familiares, vecinos y amistades y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien en esta actividad.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para poder adquirir mas pescado y mariscos ya que en esta época del año existe mucha demanda y quiere tener mayor variedad y surtido para quedar bien con sus clientes y asi obtener mayores ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase fish and other seafood

loans.name: Jorge Ricardo

texts.es:
Jorge is married and works as a plumber and electrician. He currently works for a company, but he also provides these same services during his spare time. These two jobs have allowed him to help his family get ahead in life.

He currently needs a loan of $400.00 USD, which he will repay in 6 months, in order to upgrade his equipment, as well as purchase a bigger oxygen tank so that he can carry out his tasks.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge esta casado, pero por su tipo de trabajo solamente lo realiza el personalmente, ya que ofrece servicio de plomeria y electricidad, actualmente labora en una empresa, pero en sus tiempos libres hace este tipo de trabajos. Combinando estas actividades ha podido sacar adelante a su familia.

Actualmente, requiere un prestamo por US $ 400 que pagara en 6 meses para modernizar el equipo de corte con el que contaba, ademas de comprar un tanque de oxigeno mas grande, para realizar sus trabajos.

loans.use: Purchase work tools

loans.name: Bung

texts.en:
Bung T., age 51, is a widow and resided in Phnom Penh for many years where one of her children, who is married, work as garment factory worker with a salary $80 a month. Another child is a student. After Bung T.’s husband passed, she work very hard to supplement the household. She harvests crops and does farming for one of the villagers. On average, she makes about $4 per day.

Because of the difficulty of meeting daily expenses, Mrs. Bung T. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for her son-in-law so he can start a motor-taxi so he can better contribute to the family's support. She will  use the remainder of the loan to purchase wood to repair house. Her house in leaks in the rainy season. She hopes to save enough money so her child can attend the university.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son-in-law to operate motor-taxi.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim S., age 45, is a mother of four children and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She and her husband, Chea Chup, work together collecting fruit crops and faming whenever somebody hires them. Normally they earn a combined $4 per day. One of their children is married and lives away from home, one child is a garment-factory worker with a salary $90 a month, another child is a motorbike mechanic, and the last one is a student

The motorbike mechanic makes more money to help with the family's daily expenses, so Mrs. Kim S. is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase more mechanic's tools and to rent a small shop for that business. She will also use some of the money to purchase cane from the farmland and resell it in the market. She believes that the loan will help her family out of the poverty, and she would like to express deeply thank to all lenders from her heart.

loans.use: To purchase more mechanic tools for her child.

loans.name: Ly Kim

texts.en:
Heng Sovy, 37-years-old, has resided in Phnom Penh for many years with her family. She has two children, one a student and another too young to attend school. She has a small business selling snow cones on the street near the school. Snow cones are one of the favorite foods among young children, because it tastes sweet and cool. Normally she makes about $5 per day. Her husband, Ly Kim L., age 38, has a business renting musical instrument to other people in the village. He earns most from Jan to May, the dry season. Most people get married during the dry season. He earns less during the rainy season. On average, he earns $7 a day.

He is requesting a loan to purchase more musical instruments. This will allow him to arrange big parties and weddings for people and earn more from his business. (Heng Sovy is pictured because her husband is not available.)

loans.use: To purchase more musical instruments.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng N., age 56, is a widow and works as a weaver in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. People in Cambodia, especially women, like wearing silk dresses made by hand. A silk dress is very expensive, and people wear these dresses when they attend weddings or big ceremonies related to Khmer traditions. Depending on how good the decoration and silk is, a dress can cost more than $50 . Some weavers spend up to 10 days completing one dress. Heng has has one younger sister who is also a widow, and one daughter who is married and works as a garment worker earning $80 a month.

To make more money to support the family, Heng is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase a wooden boat so she can fish in the rainy season. She will also purchase piglets to raise for sell. This extra income will be very beneficial to her family well-being.

loans.use: To purchase a wooden boat for fishing and piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan S., a 48-years-old, has four children and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. One of her children is a garment worker, another is a chef in a small nearby restaurant, and the other two are students. She works as a weaver and normally earns around $3 per day. Her husband is a rice and corn farmer growing. He also raises animals. Normally he earns a combined $5 a day from selling crops and animals. 

This couple would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for their child to ride to school.
This will  reduce the cost they spend every on motor-taxis, so the family can have more money for other necessities.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Ngoc Thanh

texts.vi:
Ms. D. Ngoc Thanh is twenty six year old. Her family has a computer repair store and an internet business. Her husband does the repair works while she takes care of the accounting and administration. Her group already participated once in the 6 month loan program and they all repaid very well. This time she requests a loan of $VN2.242.000 to buy more equipments for her store.

Ms. D. thi Nga requests a loan of $VN 2.242.000 to start a business in cutlery.

Ms. Nguyen thi Tam requests a loan of $VN 2.242.000 to start a snack food business.

Ms. Le thi Quy requests a loan of $VN 2.242.000 to buy rice to make rice pastry for sales.

Ms Nguyen thi Ngoan requests a loan of $VN 2.242.000 to have capital for a breakfast food business..

Ms. Nguyen thi Hoa requests a loan of $VN 2.006.000 to start a retail store. .

Translated from Vietnamese by Hien, a Kiva volunteer

Chị Đăng Ngọc Thanh (MS:030005), năm nay 26 tuổi. Gia đinh chị có có cửa hàng kinh doanh Internet và sửa chữa máy tính. Chị trực tiếp đứng ra trông quán và thu tiền, chồng chị phụ trách việc sửa chữa máy tính. Nhóm chị đều đã trải qua một chu kỳ vay 6 tháng và đã hoàn trả rất tốt. Lần này chị vay 2.242.000 VND để mua linh kiện thay thế cho máy tính ở của hàng Internet. Chị Đặng Thị Nga (MS: 030001), vay 2.242.000 VND để mua hàng dao kéo về bán. Chị Nguyễn Thị Tâm (MS: 030002), vay 2.242.000 VND để mua đỗ nấu chè bán. Chị Lê Thị Quý (MS: 030003), vay 2.242.000 VND mua gạo làm bánh cuốn bán. Chị Nguyễn Thị Ngoan (MS: 030004), vay 2.242.000 VND để thêm vốn bán hàng ăn sáng. Chị Nguyễn Thi Hòa (MS: 030035), vay 2.006.000 VND để mua hàng tạp hóa về bán.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Pong

texts.en:
Pong T. is 45-year olds and has resided in Phnom Penh where her two children are employed by garment factories and earn $85 each a month. She has two other children who are students, and two that are married and live away from home. Mrs. Pong T. owns a plot of farmland for growing rice, and normally she makes about $2.50. Her husband, Mr. Kut Kan, 57, is a construction worker and he goes from village to village building houses. He also averages $2.50 a day.
 
Because the price of rice is going up, Mrs Pong T. would like to purchase more land for growing rice. She will also need fertilizer. She hopes to save enough money to send her children to university.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and more land for growing rice

loans.name: Mubaro

texts.en:
H. Mubaro is 34 years old. She is married with three children. Her husband and daughter help her with the business. Mubaro is a market vendor. She is selling different kinds of foodstuff such as peas, wheat, buckwheat and pods in the central local market. Mubaro is very friendly and polite, which allows her to have many clientele. In 5 years the business has turned into a successful one, generating stable income for this family.

This year is very important for Mubaro, as her daughter shall graduate from school and is going to enter the University. Being a loving mother, Mubaro wants to support her daughter. In order to be able to do so, she is planning to expand her business and wants to increase the working capital for purchasing the foodstuffs for selling. With the generated income, Mubaro plans to spend for paying the fee for education of her daughter. With this purpose Mubaro requests $600 for the term of 12 months. Mubaro is counting on your help and thanks everyone for supporting her. Your support will really help her. Be an important part of the growth of Mubaro’s business!

loans.use: Purchasing foods in order to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Azam

texts.en: I. Azam is 53 years old. He is married with two children. Azam provides taxi services with his car. He has been in this business for about 2 years. The current business is the main source of income for his family as his wife is a housekeeper and his children are studying at the university. Azam is working hard, and he gets up early and goes to bed late at night. The business is successful and generates stable income for the family but not enough for making the completely overhaul  of his car. Now Azam is planning to completely overhaul  his car in order it to be in working and to serve his clients in time. Today Azam requests $600 for the term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase spare parts for his car. He thanks all for supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy, on time.

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for the car

loans.name: Manzurat

texts.en:
M. Manzurat is 39 years old. She is married with two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. In order to help her husband in supporting the family, Manzurat has been running her own business. Manzurat is a market vendor. She sells different kinds of macaroni in the central local market. Her daughter helps her with the business. As a rule, she purchases the goods for selling from the local factories.

Manzurat is very friendly and polite, which allows her to have good clientele. In 8 years the business has become a successful one, generating stable income for this family. Considering the constant competition in the market, Manzurat is trying to diversify the range of goods. With this purpose she requests $600.00 for the term of 9 months. Manzurat thanks all supporting her and promises to be accurate in loan management.

loans.use: Purchasing macaroni in order to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Khayala

texts.en:
Khayala H. is single. She is a 26-year-old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town who has settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on the front line in the Fuzuli region. 
Khayala has raised sheep and has been in this business for 5 years. Now she needs a loan of $975 to buy 15 lambs to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy 15 lambs

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en:
M. Farogat is 40 years old. She is married. She is the loving mother of four children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. In order to help her husband in supporting the family, Farogat has been running her own business for five years. She has her own tailoring shop. Currently there are four sewers working in the shop. Farogat’s tailoring shop is specialized in sewing clothing for women of European style as well as of the national style. As any mother does, she works hard to make her children happy and to give them a good education.

Today Farogat is planning to expand her business and to hire two more sewers. So she requests $600 for the term of 6 months. She shall spend it on a new sewing machine produced in Japan. This is the first loan for Farogat ,and she promises to pay it in a timely manner. She would like to thank everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: Purchasing of a new sewing machine for expanding the business

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida (her husband is pictured) is a 41-year-old woman and the mother of 3 children. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan and has settled in the Fuzuli region in Kurdmahmudlu village. She works very hard with her husband for the success of their children.

They have run their dairy business for 10 years. By improving their business, they will be able to provide their family with better living conditions. Now they need a loan of $975 to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Mabira Development Group

texts.en:
Muwanga N. is the chairperson of Mabira Development Group, a group that has been together for 10 years. She has a retail shop business selling soda, juice and mineral water in Najjembe, located in the middle of Mabira forest on the Kampala - Jinja road. It is also a common place for selling roasted meat, chicken, yellow bananas and gonja to passengers in moving vehicles. She employs a total of five boys and girls to do the running around with cold water and juice to passengers in the stopping vehicles. The profits they make are shared with her as their daily wage; meaning the more they sell, the more they earn. Muwanga is a married woman with eight children of whom four are still in school. She takes care of one of her sick sister’s children, paying for school fees in a boarding section, plus one grandchild not yet in school.

Muwanga needs a loan to buy more soda, mineral water and juice for her shop. Her dream is to own a much bigger shop with more soda, mineral water and juice plus other goods like sugar, tea leaves and other foodstuffs to accompany her drinks.

Muwanga will share this loan with the members of her group. The group is really thankful to Kiva for giving them this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy more soda, mineral water and juice for her shop.

loans.name: Seak

texts.en:
Mrs. Seak L. is the mother of six school-aged children and lives with her husband in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, where she works growing rice, vegetables and some kinds of fruits on her plot of land. She picks her produce in the morning and sells it in the market in the afternoon. She has been doing this for over ten years. 

Her husband, 53, is employed as a high school teacher making about $4/day. Their combined salaries barely cover her family’s expenses (food, and her children’s education).
Mrs. Seak L. is requesting a loan form CREDIT MFI to purchase more seeds, fertilizer so she can grow more produce, and to purchase gasoline for her family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds, fertilizer and gasoline for her family’s supplies.

loans.name: Masitula

texts.en:
Masitula N. owns a small boutique in Najjembe trading centre that sells new clothes for men, women and children. She has had her shop for one year and she has been a member of the Mabira development group for 10 years. In the shop, she is helped by her sister especially during the holidays and she pays her school fees as a reward. She is proud of her business and would like to keep it and restock it to the brim. She is a married woman with three children, all in school, and she takes care of three of her in-laws. Her husband works as a manager in a company.

Masitula needs a loan to help with buying more clothes for her boutique.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for men, women and children for her boutique.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
N. Sofia has a retail shop in Najjembe trading centre that sells new clothes for men, women and children. She has had her shop for one-and-a-half years now. She is also a proud member of Mabira development group taking loans of various amounts and repaying them on time. She is married with four children between the ages of 4 to 14 years with no-one else to cater for except her parents in the village.

She would like a loan to help her buy more clothes for her shop. Her dream is to see the shop grow to selling other goods like shoes, handbags and many clothes of different makes.

loans.use: To buy clothing for men, women and children for her shop.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Pearl Microfinance Limited - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nail

texts.en: Nail A. has run his General Store  for 5 years. This 26-year-old man is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory Fuzuli town, settled in the Fuzuli region, Alkhanli village. Nail is single. Now he needs a loan of $975 to buy goods to improve his business and get more income.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey SaR., 28-yeas old, has already repaid her first loan. She is requesting a second loan so she can continue improving her standard of living. She has two small children and is a garment factory worker. She is very impressed and amazed at how her first loan impacted her family. She used the loan to purchase a concrete mixer for her husband, a construction foreman. This increase her husbands productivity and increased their income. This second loan will be used to buy more construction equipment that will further increase her husband's productivity and profits.

loans.use: To purchase more construction's tools for her husband to reduce his work load

loans.name: Varziyar

texts.en:
Varziyar I. has been in the livestock  business for ten years. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region in Kurdmahmudlu village. 
Varziyar is 45 years old and married with three children. Now she needs a loan of $975 to buy six sheep.

loans.use: to buy 6 sheep

loans.name: Obida

texts.ru:
Obida B. lives in the city of Yavan with her large and supportive family. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is earning money in Russia. Obida herself makes her living in farming and raising livestock. She would like to take out a credit to purchase a milk cow. Obida is planning to sell the milk at the market and use the income for other purposes. She will pay back the loan in the next 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Бобошева Обида жительница города Яван. Живет со своей семьей. Замужем и имеет 6 детей. Очень большая , но дружная семья . Муж уехал на заработки в Россию. Сама занимается растениеводством и животноводством. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы купить корову.Получаемое молоко сможет продавать , а полученную прибыль использовать на другие цели. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 6 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Armiyawou

texts.fr:
Born March 16, 1973 in Cotonou, the economic capital and largest city in Benin, Mr. Armiyawou G. is a married father of three children, whose needs he must meet with his income alone. He is a tailor by trade but also sells traditional African Bazin cloth and various sewing supplies. He is currently facing difficulties related to a lack of financial means. To overcome this, he is requesting a loan in order to meet his customers’ needs both in providing tailoring services and in selling cloth.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 16 mars 1973 à COTONOU dans la capitale économique et première ville du BENIN, monsieur G. Armiyawou est marié et père de 3 enfants dont il a exclusivement la charge. Il est couturier de profession mais mène parallèlement à celle-ci la vente de tissu bazin et de différentes fournitures de couture. Actuellement il éprouve quelques difficultés liées au manque de moyens financiers. Pour cela, il sollicite ce crédit afin de répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle tant dans le domaine de ses prestations de services que dans la distribution de tissu.

loans.use: Purchase of eight pieces of traditional African Bazin cloth and various sewing supplies

loans.name: Ashurbi

texts.ru:
Ashurbi A. lives in the city of Yavan. She is 35 years old and has two children. Ashurbi's husband passed away and the entire burden of supporting her family lies on her shoulders now. But she is in high spirits and makes sure that her children grow up in a close and happy family. Ashurbi has a professional degree and works as a nurse in the local hospital in Yavan. To supplement her income she also sells milk. She purchases milk from her neighbors and takes it to the center of the city for sale. Ashurbi would like to purchase a milk cow herself so that she can sell her own milk as well. This will result in a substantial increases in her family's income. To purchase the milk cow Ashurbi needs to take out this loan. She is planning to pay back the loan in the next 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Асоева Ашурби проживает в городе Яван.Имеет средне-специальное образование . Работает медсестрой в поликлинике города Яван. Кроме того она занимается торговлей молока . Скупает у соседей и вывозит в центр города для реализации. Хочет купить дойнукю корову , чтобы получать свое домашнее молоко. Это будет приносить больший доход для ее семьи. Для того , чтобы купить корову ей нужен кредит. Получив его она сможет погашать его в течении 6 месяцев. Ашурби 35 лет , у нее 2 детей . Муж умер и поэтому вся ответственность за обеспечение семьи лежит на ней. Но она не унывает и живет с детьми дружно и весело.

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Hayrinisso

texts.ru:
Hayrinisso Huseinova T. lives in the Fayzabad region. She is married and has three children. She has a high school education. She works in the central market. She sells cottonseed oil brought in from the city of Dushanbe. She has been working in this business for 6 years. She wants to increase her inventory. She wants to import more goods at once in order to cut down on transportation costs. Additionally, the oil is in demand among residents, so her goods are sold quickly. In order to increase her inventory, she needs a loan which she will be able to repay in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Табарова Хайриниссо Хусейнова жительница района Файзабад. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Работает на центральном рынке . Продает хлопковым маслом , которое привозит из города Душанбе.Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 6 лет. Хочет увеличить товарооборот . Привезти больше товара , чтобы сократить расходы на перевозку продукции. Кроме того масло пользуется спросом у населения и товар быстро реализуется . А для того , чтобы увеличить товарооборот она должна получить кредит, который сможет погасить в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mahmadullo

texts.ru:
Mahmadullo U. lives in Fayzabad. He works as a high school history teacher. Besides his work in the high school, he works in animal husbandry. He raises steers to sell for meat. He has been doing this for 4 years. He wants to increase the number of his cattle by taking out a loan. It will help increase his income. Mahmadullo lives with his family. He is married and has 2 children.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Умаров Махмадулло проживает в районе Файзабад.Работает учителем истории в средней школе . Кроме работы в средней школе он занимается животноводством. Разводит бычков для продажи на мясо. Занимается этим видом деятельности уже 4 года. Хочет увеличить поголовье скота , путем получения кредита. Это поможет увеличить доход. Махмадулло живет со своей семьей . Он женат и имеет 2 детей.

loans.use: Purchasing steers

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru:
Karomat N. lives in the Fayzabad region. He graduated from the Agricultural institute. He has received a diploma in agronomy. He works raising cattle. He has a farm where he raises animals. He has been doing this work for about 6 years. His business is profitable, and therefore he has decided to purchase more cattle. To do this, he must receive a loan for 750 US dollars. He will be able to pay off his debt in 12 months. Karomat is married and has 6 children. He has a very large family, but they live cheerfully and amicably, despite all their difficulties.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Нуров Каромат житель района Файзабад. Закончил Сельскохозяйственный институт. Получил высшее образование по профессии агроном. Занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Имеет хозяйство , где разводит животных. Занимается этим видом деятельности около 6 лет. Его бизнес приносит доход , поэтому он решил увеличить поголовье скота путем покупки . Но для этого он сначала должен получить кредит в размере 750 долларов США. Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 12 месяцев. Каромат женат и имеет 6 детей. У него очень большая семья , но живут они весело и дружно , не смотря на все трудности .

loans.use: Purchasing steers

loans.name: Honoré

texts.fr:
Born around 1963 in Cannan, a small village in the Abomey commune (the historic capital of Benin), Mr. Honoré S. is a married father of 12 children, who all still live at home. He is a baker in Cotonou and makes different types of artisan bread. He also sells Hitarget brand traditional African cloth. He is an earnest man who is requesting his third loan to be able to meet his customers’ needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né vers les années 1963 à CANNAN dans un petit village de la commune d'ABOMEY (Capitale historique du BENIN) monsieur S. Honoré est marié et père de 12 enfants dont la charge lui incombe. Il est boulanger dans la ville de COTONOU et fabrique de façon artisanale du pain sous diverses formes. Il est également revendeur de pagne de la gamme HITARGET. De bonne moralité, il est à son troisième crédit afin de répondre favorablement aux attentes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 10 bags of wheat flour, sugar, yeast and other products used to make bread

loans.name: Nematullo

texts.ru:
Nematullo R. is the director of a high school in Fayzabad. He is 41 years old, is married, and has 6 children. His salary is small, and therefore he works in animal husbandry. He has a small farm at home where he raises steers. Now, while there is fresh grass and the cost of feed is minimal, Nematullo wants to buy another pair of steers. Therefore, he has come to us for a loan. He has decided take out a loan for 750 US dollars. He will be able to pay off his debt in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Раджабов Неъматулло директор средней школы района Файзабад. Возраст 41 год , женат и имеет 6 детей. Зарплата маленькая , поэтому он занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшое хозяйство у себя дома , где разводит бычков. Сейчас пока есть свежая трава и расходы на корм минимальные , Неъматулло хочет купить еще пару бычков. Для этого он обратился к нам за кредитом . Решил получить кредит в размере 750 долларов США. Погасить кредит он сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchasing steers

loans.name: Asif

texts.en: Asif  A. was born in 1955. He started his business ten years ago. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region in the village of Kurdmahmudlu.  He is married and has 3 children. Now he needs a loan of $975 to buy goods to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Kin

texts.en:
Mrs. Kin C. is a grocer and a farmer in the Prey Rongeang Village of Kampong Speu Province. Mrs. Kin C. is a 37-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. Her husband, Mr. Thy Kong (pictured on the left), is a farmer and a construction worker in the village. Previously, Mrs. Kin C. obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizers for her field and pigs for breeding purposes. Last year, her youngest child contracted typhoid, so Mrs. Kin C. incurred $75 of expenses to cure that disease. Recently, the same child fell ill again, and Mrs. Kin C. will surely need to spend additional money on unforeseen expenses.

Despite her two business activities, she is unable to support her family in a meaningful way. Thus, she is seeking to start another husbandry business. Unfortunately, Mrs. Kin C. does not have enough money to attain this goal, so she is seeking a loan to buy cows and pigs for breeding.

loans.use: To better support her family by starting yet another business and, more specifically, by purchasing cows and pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru:
Akbar Nazarov has approached us for a loan to repair the car he uses as a taxi. He has been using it for work for 10 years, and now it requires a major overhaul. Akbar is married and has 6 children. The family is very large, and while the car does not run Akbar cannot work and earn money, though he is the sole supporter of his family. He plans to pay off the debt in12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer.

Назаров Акбар обратился к нам за кредитом , чтобы отремонтировать автомобиль , который использует в качестве такси. Работает на ней уже 10 лет и машина требует капитального ремонта. Акбар женат и имеет 6 детей.Семья очень большая и пока машина не работает Акбар не может заниматся своим делом и зарабатывать деньги, ведь основным кормильцем семьи является он сам. Погасить кредит собирается в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Automobile repair

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom C. lives in the Srey Praseur Village of Kampong Speu Province, where she works as a farmer. She is the mother of four children, one of whom is studying at state school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband (pictured on the left) is a farmer and laborer who can generate a small amount of income to support their family.

Although her family members are engaged in different business activities, they still do not generate enough money to allow them to live in good conditions. In particular, the family would like to build a new house to replace their old house. Thus, Mrs. Mom C. is requesting a loan to supplement her income in order to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: To improve her family's standard of living by building a new house for her family.

loans.name: Alassane

texts.fr:
This young stockbreeder has invested in the pasteurisation of milk in order to participate in the development of his country. He wants to buy a large quantity of milk regularly in response to the demand of his clientele for buttermilk or fresh milk packaged in bags of 1/4 liter each. This loan will permit him to reinforce his position in the burgeoning milk industry which contributes to the struggle against malnutrition in this part of Senegal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Ce jeune éleveur s'est investi dans la pasteurisation du lait pour participer au développement de son pays. Il veut acheter réguliérement de grande quantité de lait pour répondre à la demande de sa clientéle en lait caillé ou lait frais mis en sachet dans des emballages de 1/4l. Ce crédit lui permettra donc de conforter sa position de PME émergente dans la filiére lait qui contribue à la lutte contre la malnutrition dans cette partie du Sénégal.

loans.use: purchase of milk for processing

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akou A. was born in 1971 in Tsévié. After secondary school, she began doing business selling soap, batteries, and other things. Mother of three children, she is unmarried. This is why all of the needs of her family fall to her. Very dynamic and entrepreneurial, she is very good at her business and manages it with surprising strictness. She successfully repaid her previous loan without difficulty. Currently, she is seeking a loan which will allow her to buy merchandise in bulk (soap, batteries, tissues, medicines, and other things) in order to stock her shelves with various products sought in her area. She will then be able to improve the conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Akou est née en 1971 à Tsévié. Après les études secondaires, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de savons, piles et autres. Mère de trois (03) enfants, elle est sans mari. Ce qui fait que tous les besoins et charges de la famille reposent sur elle. Très dynamique et entreprenante, elle maîtrise bien son commerce et gère avec une étonnante rigueur ses affaires. Elle a bien remboursé le précédent crédit obtenu sans aucune difficulté. A présent, elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter les marchandises en gros (savons, piles, papiers mouchoirs, médicaments et autres) afin d’approvisionner son étalage de divers produits recherchés dans le milieu. Elle pourra donc améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise in bulk (soap, batteries, tissues, medicines, and other things) in order to stock her shelves with products sought in the area

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal K. is a farmer in the Beng Village of Kampong Speu Province. She is a 39-year-old mother of four children: one child attends state school, another child stays at home to assist her in the field, and the other two children are too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Von Yon (pictured on the left), is a farmer and a teacher.

As a result, the family lives in poor conditions because all of the family members have small business activities and, on the whole, they are not able to generate much income. Additionally, they live in an old house, and they do not even have enough money to build a toilet. Therefore, Mrs. Sophal K. is seeking a loan to enable them to build a toilet for her family.

loans.use: To improve her family's standard of living by building a toilet in their house.

loans.name: Bahrigul

texts.ru:
Bahrigul S. has been working in sales for 7 years. She sells cottonseed oil which she buys wholesale. She has a shop in the central market in Fayzabad. She has a big family. She is married and has 4 children. She wants to increase her sales volume since the goods she sells are in great demand. She has decided to take out a loan to deliver more goods. It will help Bahrigul to increase her income, which is very necessary for her family. She plans to pay off the debt in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer

Саидова Бахригул занимается торговлей уже 7 лет. Продает хлопковое масло , которое покупает у оптовых реализаторов. Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке Файзабада. У нее большая семья. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Хочет увеличить товарооборот, так как продаваемая ею продукция пользуется большим спросом у населения. Она решила получить кредит и завозить болше товара . Это поможет Бахригуль увеличить доход , который очень необходим для ее семьи. Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr:
Born on December 31, 1969 in Dalavé in the Zio Prefecture, Mr. Komi A. is married and the father of five children, plus takes care of a nephew. After primary school, he learned motorcycle mechanics. After three years' training, he opened a workshop in Tsévié, which he manages well. His wife, who sells miscellaneous items, contributes very little to the family expenses. Dynamic and honest, Mr A. is exceptionally skilled at his trade. To be able to satisfy his customers, he is asking for a loan that he can use to buy more materials for his work, sell motor oil and buy a motorcycle for transport. This will enable him to increase his income so he can better look after his family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 31 décembre 1969 à Dalavé dans la Préfecture du Zio, Monsieur A. Komi est marié et père de cinq (5) enfants et a en charge un neveu. Après les études primaires, il apprit la mécanique à deux roues. Après trois ans de formation, il a ouvert son atelier à Tsévié, qu’il gère bien. Sa femme, revendeuse de divers produits et contribue très peu aux charges de la famille. Dynamique et honnête, Monsieur A. Komi a une parfaite maîtrise de son métier. Pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle, il sollicite un crédit qui servira à l’achat d’autres matériels de travail, la vente d’huile à moteur et l’achat d’une moto pour le transport. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus afin de mieux entretenir sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a motocycle taxi and sell motor lubricant

loans.name: Soro

texts.ru:
Soro Faizalievna S. lives in Fayzabad. She is 26. She lives with her family. She is married and has 2 children. She has been selling vegetables and fruit for two years. She has a shop in the area’s central market. She wants to increase her sales volume by taking out a loan. It will help her make her business more profitable as well as help provide the population with fresh vegetables. She plans to pay off the debt in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer

Сатторова Соро Файзалиевна жительница района Файзабад. Возраст 26 лет. Живет со своей семьей. Она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Два года занимается торговлей овощей и фруктов. Имеет торговую точку на центральном рынке района. Хочет увеличить товарооборот , путем получения кредита. Он поможет ей увеличить прибыльность бизнеса , а так же поможет обеспечить население свежими овощами. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales volume

loans.name: Farkhad

texts.en: Farkhad K. is  married and has 3 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan,Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region, in  Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs . He has repaired vehicles and cars for four years. Now  he needs a loan of $975 to buy necessary materials for repairing  vehicles and cars  to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for repairing vehicles and cars

loans.name: Asha's Serena Group

texts.en:
Asha M., is 52 years old and is a widow. She has seven children between the ages of 38 and 12. Asha provides for her home by running a small butcher shop, where she works from 7am to 6pm daily. She started this business three years ago and now makes a monthly profit of about $135 from her sales.

Asha hopes for a loan to open another small butcher shop. She will share this loan with her loan group called Serena, which has 23 members. In the picture, Asha is in the second row, second from the right in the pink scarf.

loans.use: To open another butchery

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A., a married woman with 3 children, travels to a distant town to buy food supplies like maize in large quantities to sell to her customers in smaller quantities. Business is going very well, but the cost of transportation is a major problem. Mary is asking for a loan to reduce the burden of transportation cost on her limited capital. This would allow her to buy more food per trip.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of transportation cost on her limited capital

loans.name: Urbatullo

texts.ru:
Urbatullo S. lives in Fayzabad. He is 30 years old, is married, and has no children. He works in sales. He sells petroleum products (gasoline). He has a place where he sells gas on the Dushanbe-Faizabad highway. He has been working in this business for about six years. This is the only source of income for his family. He stores his gasoline in a Gaz-53 truck. However, his truck recently broke down. He needs money to repair the truck, and therefore he decided to take out a loan. He will pay off the loan in 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva volunteer

Салимов Урбатулло проживает в районе Файзабад.Возраст 30 лет , женат детей не имеет. Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Торгует Горючесмазочным материалом ( бензин). Имеет торговую точку на трассе Душанбе- Файзабад. Занимается этим видом бизнеса около шести лет. Эта деятельность единственный источник дохода его семьи. Бензин хранит в машине Газ-53. Но в ближайшее время произошла поломка автомобиля . На ремонт требуются деньги , поэтому он решил получить кредит и отремонтировать машину. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Repair automobile

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: A 26-year-old woman, Lay S., is married with one small child. She works as a garment factory worker. Her husband is self-employed as a carpenter making wooden tables, chairs which he sells. She and her husband can collectively make about $6 each day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tools for her husband's carpentry business. This will increase his productivity and their income.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and other tools for her husband carpentry business

loans.name: Keun

texts.en:
Mrs. Keun P. is a grocer and a farmer in the Trapaing Lompeak Village of Kampong Speu Province. Mrs. Keun P. is a 31-year-old mother of two children, one of whom is attending school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Soeur Sok (pictured on the right), is a farmer and a bed-maker in the local village, and he makes barely enough income to support their family.

Recently, her grocery business activity has improved, and thus Mrs. Keun P. is seeking to expand her business. Accordingly, she is requesting a loan to buy more grocery goods to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store business by purchasing more products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Born in 1977 in Tsévié, Miss Adjo A. spent a few years in primary school before undertaking an apprenticeship as a seamstress because of financial difficulties. Married with no children, she nevertheless has a heavy responsibility in the care of her parents and one of her sisters. The meager income from her poorly-equipped sewing workroom is not sufficient to cover the household expenses. Yet through her dynamism and impeccable work, she has been able to manage and reimburse the previous loan without any problem. To meet the demands of her customers, Miss A. needs to be better equipped. She is therefore requesting a loan that will help her buy more sewing machines and work materials, as she is training four apprentices.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1977 à Tsévié, Mlle A. Adjo a fait quelques années d’étude au cours primaire avant de se lancer dans l’apprentissage de la couture, faute de moyens financiers. Mariée, sans enfant, elle a tout de même une lourde responsabilité qui est la charge de ses parents et une de ses sœurs. Les maigres revenus de son atelier de couture très peu équipé ne suffisent pas à couvrir les charges du foyer. Mais par son dynamisme et son travail impeccable, elle a su gérer et rembourser le précédent crédit sans incident. Pour répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Mlle A. Adjo a besoin de mieux s’équiper. Ainsi donc elle sollicite un crédit qui servira à acheter d’autres machines à coudre et autres matériels de travail, car elle a quatre (4) apprenties en formation.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines and work materials

loans.name: Peurn

texts.en:
Mr. Peurn P. lives in the Trapaing Lompeak Village of Cambodia, where he works as a farmer. Mr. Peurn P. is a 53-year-old married man, and he is the father of two children. One of his children is employed in a garment factory, while the other one assists with his father’s business. His wife, Mrs. Kong Khim (pictured on the left), is a rice farmer.

In addition to his farming operation, he is also a bed-maker in the local village. Unfortunately, in this bed-making business, Mr. Peurn P. has encountered numerous difficulties as of late because he has insufficient money to buy wood to make beds to re-sell for a profit, so he is requsting a loan for that purpose.

loans.use: To improve his bed-making operation by purchasing additional wood in order to make beds for resale.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.fr:
Bernadette D. is 51 years old, a widow, and the mother of three. She is therefore responsible for all household expenses for her family. Given this difficult situation, Bernadette has found hope and strength. She runs a boutique in Kpalimé, where she sells plastic goods, but there is more. Three times a week, she travels with her merchandise to neighboring villages to make sales in marketplaces. This motivation has earned her a lot of profit, which she uses to improve her family's living conditions. With this loan, Bernadette hopes to bolster her boutique by purchasing new plastic items for retail sale.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Bernadette D. est âgée de 51 ans, veuve et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est donc responsable de toutes les charges du foyer pour sa famille. Avec cette difficulté, Bernadette a trouvé l’espoir et la puissance. Elle opère une boutique à Kpalimé ou elle vend les plastiques, mais elle n’arrête pas là. Trois fois par semaine Bernadette voyage avec ses marchandises dans les villages environnants pour vendre aux marchés. Cette motivation l’a fait gagner beaucoup de profits qu’elle utilise pour améliorer les conditions de la vie de sa famille. Avec ce crédit, Bernadette espère renforcer sa boutique dans un l’achat des nouveaux plastiques pour revendre.

loans.use: Bolster her boutique by buying new plastic items

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Mrs. Lim T. is a farmer in the Kraing Metrey Village of Kampong Speu Province. She is married with five children: one child works as a laborer, two children work in a garment factory, and the other two children study at state school and help their parents on the rice field. Last year, two of their children got in a traffic accident, so Mrs. Lim T. incurred $1,500 of expenses in order to cure them. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Mrs. Lim T. would like to start a cow breeding business, but she does not have enough money to buy cows. Thus, Mrs. Lim T. is seeking a loan for this purpose. Previously, Mrs. Lim T. obtained a loan to buy fertilizers and pigs for breeding purposes.

loans.use: To embark upon a cow breeding business by purchasing cows.

payments.comment: Mrs. Lim Tress has paid off her loan 8 months in advance! AMK and Kiva would like to thank you for lending to her and we hope you lend again soon! We\'ll do a journal on her very soon!

loans.name: Atsou Koffi

texts.fr:
Born on August 30, 1963 in Tsévié in the Zio Prefecture, Mr. Atsou Koffi H. trained as a welder, a trade he learned after leaving high school. He is married and the father of two children. His wife, who sells toothpicks and the like, is barely able to help him with the family expenses as she makes very little money from her business. In addition to his children, he also has apprentices to take care of. Honest, dynamic and skilled at his work, he is an excellent entrepreneur and manages his workshop well. To carry out his work proficiently and make it profitable, he is requesting a loan so that he can acquire a buff wheel and buy other equipment for his work. This will enable him to better satisfy his customers and develop their loyalty.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 30 août 1963 à Tsévié dans la Préfecture du Zio, monsieur H. Atsou Koffi est soudeur de formation, métier qu’il a appris après avoir abandonné ses études secondaires. Marié, il est père de deux (2) enfants. Sa femme, revendeuse de cure dent et autres, l’aide à peine dans les dépenses de la famille, car elle tire très peu de revenu de son commerce. En plus de ses enfants, il a en charge des apprentis. Honnête, dynamique et maîtrisant bien son métier, il est un excellent entrepreneur et gère bien son atelier. Pour accomplir efficacement son travail et rentabiliser ce dernier, il sollicite un crédit qui servira à acquérir une meule et à acheter d’autres matériels de travail. Ceci lui permettra de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et de la fidéliser.

loans.use: To buy a buff wheel and new work equipment

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Mr. Koffi A. is 26 years old and single with no children. He has an entrepreneurial spirit and opened a bar in Lavie, a small village near Kpalimé in Togo. He would like to use the Kiva funds to buy a motorcycle (like the one in the photo of his brother) to make it easier to carry goods for the bar. This will enable him to expand his business. He hopes to make a greater contribution to the expenses of his maternal family.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Koffi A. est âgé de 26 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Il a l’esprit d’entrepreneur et il a ouvert un bar à Lavie, un petit village proche de Kpalimé, Togo. Il souhaite avec les fonds de Kiva acheter une moto (comme la moto dans la photo de son frère) pour plus facilement transporter ses marchandises pour le bar. Ca va lui permettre d’augmenter la capacité de son entreprise. Il espère mieux participer à la prise en charges des besoins de la famille maternelle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Mrs. Yun Y., 32, is a mother of three children and works with her husband growing rice on their piece of farmland. They have been doing this for over ten years. In order to generate more income for her entire family, Mrs. Yun Y. is requesting a loan to purchase a motor-taxi for her husband. Transport people to their destinations is a good business and will generate more income for her household.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-taxi for her husband

loans.name: Djabine Kansami

texts.fr:
Mr. Djabine Kansami K. is 31 years old, married and the father of one child. To earn money he drives a taxi between the Togolese capital Lomé and Kpalimé, the city in which he lives. At the moment his car has broken down and he is having trouble meeting the needs of his family. He wants to use this loan to repair his car, which will enable him to continue carrying passengers in order to make money. He appreciates the opportunity this loan will give him to resume his work.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Djabine Kansami K. est âgé de 31 ans marié et un père d’un enfant. Pour gagner de l’argent, il conduit un taxi entre Lomé, la capitale Togolaise, et Kpalimé, la ville ou il habite. A ce moment, sa voiture est gâtée et il essaie avec difficulté de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Avec ce crédit, il veut réparer sa voiture, ce qui lui permettra de continuer à transporter les passagers pour gagner de l’argent. Il apprécie l’opportunité que ce crédit va lui donner pour recommencer son boulot.

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Eunice's Mwanza Group

texts.en:
Eunice M., age 45, is married with three children (ages 26, 18, and 12). She started a business of raising and selling chickens in 2006. She works from 8am to 6pm at this business and makes a monthly profit of about $230 from her sales.

Eunice hopes for a loan to start a new business of selling charcoal. Charcoal is needed in many homes in Dar es Salaam to cook food and purify water because the majority of Tanzanians do no own electric stoves. In the picture, Eunice is standing third from the right.

Eunice will share this loan with her loan group, Mwanza.

loans.use: To start a charcoal business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Koffi Lanyo

texts.fr:
Koffi Lanyo A. was born on May 13, 1969, in Gblainviém in Zio prefecture. For lack of financial means, he quit secondary school and went into agriculture. Married, he is the father of seven and has a nephew in his care. His wife, thanks to her commerce in charcoal, also contributes to meeting family expenses. Having become a renowned agriculturalist by successfully incorporating animal husbandry in his farm, he figured out how to manage the initial loan, which he repaid without incident. In addition, he has an orange tree plantation in his native village.
