Dynamic in his work, he is requesting a new loan to buy a motorbike, which will make it easy for him to get about, because he intends to extend his cultivated area and to improve his poultry production. He is thinking he will make his business more profitable to increase his bottom line in order to better his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Koffi Lanyo est né le 13 mai 1969 Gblainvié, dans la préfecture du Zio. Par manque de moyens financiers, il abandonna ses études secondaires et s’est lancé dans l’agriculture. Marié, il est père de sept (7) enfants, il a à sa charge un neveu. Sa femme, grâce à son commerce de charbon de bois, contribue aussi aux dépenses familiales. Devenu un grand exploitant agricole de renommer par sa bonne association d’élevage à la culture végétale, il a su bien gérer le premier crédit qu’il a remboursé sans incident. En plus, il a une plantation d’oranger dans son village natal. Dynamique dans ses activités, il sollicite un nouveau crédit qui servira à acheter une moto qui lui facilitera ses déplacements, car son intention est d’étendre sa surface cultivée et améliorer son élevage de volailles. Il pense rentabiliser plus ses activités afin d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires pour le mieux être de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Azizi

texts.fr:
Mr. Azizi A. is 32 years old, married and has one child. He runs a hardware store in Kpalimé, one of Togo’s largest cities. He sells building materials to meet the needs of the growing population. Azizi hopes to use this loan to increase the size of his hardware store and, with the profits he will make from sales, improve his family’s situation.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Azizi A. est âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de un enfant. Il opère dans une boutique de quincaillerie à Kpalimé, l’une des plus grandes villes du Togo. Il vend les produits de construction pour satisfaire les besoins des populations en train d’agrandir. Avec ce crédit, Azizi espère élargir la capacité de sa quincaillerie et, avec les profits qu’il va dégager dans ses ventes, améliorer les conditions de sa famille.

loans.use: To increase the size of his store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FECECAV - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra A. was born in 1956 in Ghana. She currently reside in Havé, a village located a dozen kilometers from Tsévié, where she is a farmer and sells tubers and grains. Married, she is the mother of five children who are in their care. In addition, she takes care of three other young children. A courageous woman full of confidence, she continued her business thanks to an initial loan of $500 that she obtained. It enabled her to have a significant income for meeting the essential needs of the children. Although illiterate, she manages her business in an extraordinary fashion and always makes her loan payments correctly.

This loan that she is requesting will enable her to stock up on corn and black-eyed peas in order to better meet customer expectations during lean times. Thus, her bottom line can increase, and she will be able to invest more in the education, health, and schooling of the children.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Abra est née en 1956 à Ghana. Actuellement elle réside à Havé, un village situé à une dizaine de kilomètre de Tsévié où elle fait l’agriculture et la vente de tubercules et de céréales. Mariée, elle est mère de cinq (5) enfants qui sont leur charge. En plus, elle a en charge trois (3) petits enfants. Courageuse et pleine de confiance, elle a continué son activité grâce à un premier crédit de $500 qu’elle a obtenu. Ce qui lui a permis de dégager un revenu substantiel aux besoins élémentaires des enfants. Bien qu’analphabète, elle gère de façon extraordinaire son activité et est toujours très correct dans le remboursement de ses crédits.

Ce crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de faire du stock de maïs et de niébé afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle en période de soudure. Ainsi, son chiffre d’affaire pourra augmenter et elle pourra investir plus dans l’éducation, la santé et la scolarisation des enfants.

loans.use: To stock corn and beans

loans.name: Edem

texts.fr:
Mr. Edem T. is 32 years old and a married father. To earn a living and provide for his family’s needs he drives a motorcycle taxi in Kpalimé, one of Togo’s largest cities. He picks up passengers by the side of the road and drops them off at their destination. Mr. T. hopes to use this loan to buy a new, more comfortable motorcycle. With this improvement, he hopes to gain more customers, earn more money and change his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Edem T. est âgé de 32 ans et un père marié. Pour gagner de l’argent et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il conduit un taxi moto à Kpalimé, une des plus grandes villes du Togo. Il prend les passagers au bord de la route et les dépose à leurs destinations. Avec ce crédit, Monsieur T. espère acheter une nouvelle moto qui est plus confortable. Avec cette amélioration, il espère attraper plus des clients, gagner plus d’argent et changer les conditions de la vie de sa famille. 390000 12 mois

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Nouglozé

texts.fr:
Born on July 14, 1977 in Kpové, in Haho prefecture, Nouglozé T. did not have the chance to go to school. Very early on, he started working in the milling business. An owner of a milling machine in his town, he is married and the father of four. In addition, he has his mother to care for. A very energetic and honest man, he figured out how to manage his initial loan and to repay it without incident. Once again, he is requesting a loan for setting up another mill. Thus, he is thinking he will increase his bottom line and therefore his income. He will then be able to help more in improving his family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Né le 14 juillet 1977 à Kpové dans la Préfecture de Haho, Monsieur T. Nouglozé n’a pas eu la chance de faire des études. Très tôt, il s’est lancé dans les activités de moulin. Propriétaire d’un (1) moulin, dans sa localité, il est marié et père de quatre (4) enfants. En plus il a la charge sa mère. Très dynamique et honnête, il a su bien gérer le premier crédit obtenu et l’a remboursé sans incident. De nouveau, il sollicite un crédit qui lui servira à installer un second moulin. Par ceci, il pense augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et de facto ses revenus. Il pourra ainsi, contribuer d’avantage à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and install a milling machine

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace D. owns a provision store. She is not yet married but has been focused on developing herself. Business is going very well so she wishes to increase sales to improve her income. However, Grace is running out of stock. So she is asking for a loan to buy more goods to sell in her store.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase his stock of clothing.

loans.name: Kodzo Essianyo

texts.fr:
Mr. Kodzo Essianyo D. is 39 years old, married and has 4 children. He works as a photographer to earn money to provide for his family’s needs. He takes photos of weddings and other events in Kpalimé, which is one of Togo’s largest cities. His main business is taking photos for school ID cards (as seen in the photo). He hopes to use this loan to expand his business by buying another camera and some film. With the profits he will make from selling his photos, he will improve his family’s situation enormously.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Kodzo Essianyo D. est âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il est photographe. Il prend les photos des marriages et autres ceremonies à Kpalimé, une des plus grandes villes du Togo. Son activité la plus grand est de prendre les photos pour les cartes scolaires (on voit les cartes dans la photo.) Avec ce crédit il espere elargir ses activites de en achetant un autre camera et du filme. Avec les profits qu’il va dégager dans la vente de ses photos, il va énormément améliorer les conditions de sa famille.

loans.use: To expand his photographic services

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Jewelry is a precious substance to all. Ghanaians have beads carved from stones, very precious stones that every woman would want to adorn herself with. Faustina A. has been selling jewelry such as beads, necklaces, bangles and earrings for 20 years now. She has seven children, three of whom are in school.

Faustina wants to use her loan to buy more beads and other jewelry to expand her operation and to increase her income. She is a member of the group called Stewards. Members agree to guarantee loans for each other.

loans.use: To buy more jewelry including beads, necklaces, bangles and rings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase the stock of his dressmaking materials and his shop.

loans.name: Alimatou

texts.fr:
Alimatou C. was born in Lomé in 1986, in Golfe prefecture. She is single and lives with her mother. She did not have the chance to continue in her studies after earning her primary school diploma. She learned how to sew and today is well-off having her certificate of completion. After her apprenticeship, she began a small 'pagne' cloth business, which enabled her to buy a sewing machine, adding dressmaking to her commerce in pagne cloth.

A determined, energetic, and very self-assured woman, she provides quality service to her customers. To provide this service more effectively where her customers are found, she is requesting a loan to buy another sewing machine and to bolster her pagne cloth business. This strategy of adding pagne cloth commerce to her dressmaking will enable her to reach other customers and to make her business profitable. This will allow her to care for and meet the needs of her mother.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Mlle C. Alimatou est née à Lomé en 1986 dans la préfecture du Golfe. Elle est célibataire et vit avec sa mère. Elle n’a pas eu la chance de continuer ses études après son certificat d’études primaires. Elle a appris la couture et est aujourd’hui nantie d’un certificat de fin de formation. Après son apprentissage, elle a commencé un petit commerce de pagne, ce qui lui a permis d’acheter une machine pour associer le commerce de pagne à la couture. Déterminée, dynamique et très sûre d’elle-même, elle offre un service de qualité à ses clients. Pour rendre ce service plus efficace à l’endroit des clients, elle sollicite un crédit pour s’acheter une autre machine et renforcer son commerce de pagne. Cette stratégie d’associer le commerce de pagne à la couture lui permettra d’atteindre d’autres clientes et de rentabiliser son commerce. Ceci lui permettra de se prendre en charge et assumer les besoins de mère

loans.use: To buy another sewing machine and to bolster her pagne fabrics business

loans.name: Djabborova

texts.ru:
K. Djabborova is 46 years old, married and is a mother of two children. She has secondary education. Her husband is currently working in Russia. Before applying for a loan with MicroInvest she took out a loan from local illegal sources at high interest rates. K. has been selling food and groceries for the past three years. After receiving a loan and using it to meet her goals she has increased her commodity circulation. In the future she plans to have another vendor location and increase the variety of the merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Джабборова Кумри – 46 лет. Замужем, мать двоих детей. Образование среднее. Муж в Российской Федерации на заработках. До получения кредита в МЗФ «Микроинвест» брала кредит у местных нелегальных кредиторов под большие проценты. Занимается торговлей продуктами питания вот уже 3 года. После получения займа и целевого использования она увеличила товарооборот. В будущем планирует приобрести еще одну торговую точку и увеличить ассортимент товара.

loans.use: To expand location and increase variety of merchandise

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 32 years old and the mother of two children. She treks to the northern part of Ghana to buy products like beans, millet and peanuts and then retails them in her town. Frequent travel reduces her income and therefore she wants to use her loan to buy bags of gari, beans, millet and peanuts to avoid price hikes and also to reduce her travels. She is a member of the group called “Kamfo Yehowa” meaning Praise Jehovah. Members agree to support each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of gari (milled cassava), beans, millet and peanuts.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica F. operates a restaurant where all kinds of local dishes are sold. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a driver and his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family, so Veronica is working very hard to help with the family’s expenses.

Business is good and customers are increasing rapidly. Veronica wishes to improve her services to attract more customers, so she is asking for a loan to buy more food items and other ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy food items and ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Kayi S. is 38 years old and married. She lives and works in Kpalimé, one of the largest cities in Togo. To provide for her family’s needs, she buys and sells napkins and other kitchen products. There are many such products and they are in constant demand. As the photo shows, she currently lacks the resources to operate her business, so is selling tomatoes (which are seasonal) at the market. Kayi hopes to use this loan to restart her business of buying large plates and different sized saucepans. With the profit she will make from her business, she will improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Kayi S. est âgée de 38 ans et mariée. Elle habite et travaille à Kpalimé, une des plus grandes villes du Togo. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille elle achète et revend les serviettes et autres produits pour la cuisine. Ces produits sont beaucoup et la demande ne cesse pas. Comme on la voit dans la photo, présentement elle n’a pas de ressources pour faire son travail donc elle vend des tomates (qui sont saisonnières) au marché. Avec ce crédit, Kayi espère recommencer son commerce d’achat des grandes assiettes et casseroles des tailles variées. Avec les profits qu’elle va dégager dans son commerce, elle va améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy plates to sell at retail

loans.name: Kossivi

texts.fr:
Kossivi A. was born in Lomé on January 21, 1979. Quitting school due to a lack of money, he turned towards an apprenticeship in maintaining and repairing electronic equipment. Since finishing his training, he has not been practicing his trade very effectively because he lacked the money to open a shop. He worked with his friends who were able to open a shop, but he didn't appropriately benefit from it. Despite all his talent with electronics, Mr. A. continues to lead a difficult life.

To solve the situation, he is requesting a loan to open his shop. The loan will enable him to rent a place and to acquire work supplies. Realizing this project will launch this energetic and dedicated young man's business. This will enable him to improve his living conditions and to support himself better.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Kossivi est né à Lomé le 21 Janvier 1979. Abandonnant ses études faute de moyens, il s’oriente vers l’apprentissage où il se forme en entretien et réparation des appareils électroniques. Depuis la fin de sa formation, il n’exerce pas efficacement son métier car il n’a pas de moyens pour ouvrir un atelier. Il travaille avec ses amis qui ont pu ouvrir un atelier mais il n’en profite pas convenablement. Malgré tous ses talents en matière d’électronique, Monsieur A. continue de vivre dans des conditions très difficiles.

Pour sortir de cette situation, il sollicite un crédit pour ouvrir son atelier. Le crédit va lui permettre de louer un local et acquérir du matériel de travail. La réalisation de ce projet lancera les activités de ce jeune dynamique et dévoué. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et de mieux se prendre en charge.

loans.use: To open a shop and to buy work supplies

loans.name: Mavchuda

texts.ru:
Mavchuda K. is 46 years old, married and has secondary education. Her children are already grown up and have their own families and businesses. After the collapse of the Soviet Union Mavchuda lost her job and went into entrepreneurship to sustain the same quality of life. She has more than five years of experience in her field of work. She began taking out loans at MicroInvest last year and has proven to be a well disciplined and responsible client. In the future she plans to go into wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Камолова Мавчуда – 46 лет. Замужем, образование среднее. Дети уже взрослые и заняты своими делами и семьей. После распада Советского Союза Мавчуда осталась без работы и начала заниматься предпринимательством для поддержания уровня жизни. Имеет опыт в этой сфере более 5 лет. Начала кредитоваться в МЗФ «Микроинвест» в прошлом году и за это время показала себя ответственной и дисциплинированной клиенткой. В будущем планирует перейти на оптовую продажу.

loans.use: To start selling wholesale

loans.name: Mewumodzi

texts.fr:
Mr. Mewumodzi T. is 50 years old, married and has 3 children. He lives and works in a small village in the mountains that surround Kpalimé, one of Togo’s largest cities. To earn money, Mewumodzi takes advantage of the area's agriculture to make flour from the corn and root vegetables grown in the fields. He has a successful business and currently has several machines and 4 apprentices. Mewumodzi hopes to use this loan to buy a new engine for the generator that powers the machines. With the profits he will make from expanding his business, he will be able to improve his family’s quality of life.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Mewumodzi T. est âgé de 50 ans marié et père de 3 enfants. Il habite et travaille dans un petit village dans les montages qui entourent Kpalimé, une des plus grandes villes du Togo. Pour gagner de l’argent, Mewumodzi profite de l’agriculture dans les montages pour fabriquer la farine à partir du mais et des tubercules qui sont cultivés dans les champs. Son entreprise a réussi et présentement il a plusieurs machines et 4 apprentis. Avec ce crédit, Mewumodzi espère acheter un nouveau moteur pour le groupe électrogène qui donne de l’énergie aux machines. Avec les profits qu’il va gagner de cet agrandissement, il peut augmenter la qualité de la vie pour sa famille.

loans.use: To buy a new engine

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua D. is a fishmonger. She is married and has 4 children. She buys fresh fish from the fishermen, brings it home for processing, and then later sells the fish to her customers. She wants to increase sales to meet customer demand. Therefore she is asking for a loan to buy more fish for processing and sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and sale

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
Rano M. is 45 years old, married and has four children. She has secondary education and has her own business selling rice. Her husband is helping her with the business. She became a client of MicroInvest in the early 2007 with US$375 in assets. In the beginning, Rano has been selling in different parts of town and buying rice in credit. Right now she has a permanent vendor space in the central market and her merchandise variety has increased. In the future she plans to go into wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мирбобоева Рано –45 лет. Замужем, имеет 4-х детей. Образование среднее и занимается она продажей риса. Муж помогает ей в торговле. Стала клиенткой МЗФ Микроинвест в начале 2007-го с активами на 375 долларов. Раньше торговала в разных местах города и покупала рис в кредит. Сейчас у нее постоянное место торговли в центральном рынке и увеличился ассортимент. В будущем планирует перейти на оптовую продажу.

loans.use: Plans to travel to purchase merchandise and start selling wholesale

loans.name: Kodzoshi

texts.fr:
Born in 1963 in Lomé, in Golfe prefecture, Kodzoshi A. is married and the mother of three. Aside from her own children, she is responsible for another child. Her main business is selling fruit at the N'kafu marketplace. Her husband, a mechanic, no longer works because of his advanced age. All household expenses fall onto Ms. A.'s shoulders. Thanks to the rigorous management of her business, she discovered how to repay her first two loans without a problem.

Today, she is requesting financial support to bolster her business by acquiring supplies wholesale from the villages where fruit is abundant, to resell in Lomé. The profits from her sales will help improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1964 à Lomé dans la préfecture du Golfe, Madame A. Kodzoshi est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. En dehors de ses propres enfants, elle a en charge un autre enfant. Son activité principale est la vente des fruits dans le marché de N’kafu. Son mari, un mécanicien, n’est plus en activité à cause de son âge avancé. Toutes les charges du ménage sont revenues à Madame A.. Grâce à la gestion rigoureuse de son activité, elle a su rembourser ses deux premiers crédits sans difficulté.

Aujourd’hui, Madame A. sollicite un appui financier pour renforcer son activité en s’approvisionnant en gros dans les villages où les fruits abondent et revendre à Lomé. Les bénéfices de la vente contribueront à l’amélioration des conditions de vie dans sa famille.

loans.use: To acquire supplies wholesale for retail sale

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame K. is a widow with 11 children. Trekking the northern part of Ghana to buy maize and gari (milled cassava) has been her principal business for the past 26 years. She wants to use her loan to buy more bags of maize and gari to increase her inventory and also to avoid price hikes. She hopes to reduce her frequent travels to enable her to save some money to support her children’s education.

Maame is a member of the group called “Kamfo Yehowa” meaning Praise Jehovah. Members agree to guarantee one another's loans.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and gari.

loans.name: Pihenewe Yawa

texts.fr:
Pihenewe Yawa P. is 42 years old, married, and a mom. To provide for her family's needs, she buys and resells poultry -- hens, roosters, and other birds for consumption. With this loan , Ms. P. hopes to strengthen her commerce by buying poultry and also to expand her enterprise by buying pigs for retail sale. With the profits she is going to make, she can improve her family's living conditions in Kpalimé, Togo.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Pihenewe Yawa P. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille elle achète et revend les volailles – les poules, les coqs et les autres oiseaux pour la consommation. Avec ce crédit, Madame P. espère renforcer son commerce de l’achat des volailles et aussi agrandir son entreprise avec l’achat des cochons pour les revendre. Avec les profits qu’elle va dégager, elle peut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille à Kpalimé, Togo.

loans.use: To buy poultry and pigs

loans.name: Hairullohon

texts.ru:
Hairullohon M. is 28 years old, married. He has been in the business of selling cigarettes and miscellaneous items for the past eleven years. His wife is helping him with the business after she gets off work. In the beginning, he has been selling in small quantities at random temporary locations. The necessity to increase commodity circulation has pushed him to become a client of MicroInvest. At this time Hairullohon has US$2,000 in assets and his own permanent trading location. In the future he plans to open another location.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Муродов Хайруллохон- 28 лет. Женат, занимается торговлей сигаретами и разными мелочами вот уже 11 лет. Жена после работы помогает ему в торговле. Раньше торговал в малом количестве в непостоянных местах. Необходимость увеличить товарооборот подтолкнула его стать клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест». Сейчас его активы достигают 2000 $ и у него свое постоянное место деятельности. В будущем планирует приобрести еще одну точку.

loans.use: To expand trading location

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua Y., a married woman with 2 children, travels to a distant town to buy food supplies like maize in large quantities to sell to her customers in smaller quantities. Business is going very well but the cost of transportation is a big problem.

So Ekua is asking for a loan to reduce the burden of transportation cost on her limited capital. This would allow her to purchase more food supplies per trip.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of transportation cost on her limited capital

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa W. is 40 years old and the mother of three children. All her children are currently in school. She has been selling used clothing for the past 10 years in the local market. Adwoa wants to use her loan to buy more used clothes to expand her operation. She is a member of the group “Kamfo Yehowa” meaning Praise Jehovah. Members agree to guarantee one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: H. Zagou

texts.fr:
H. Zagou B. was born in 1985; he is married and is responsible for two people. A very courageous and determined man, he has owned a shop selling paint for three years. Business is booming because he is the only one in his district and he sells good quality paint. He has a large and steady customer base. Not having enough funds, he is often short of stock, and his customers complain all the time. Faced with this situation, he might lose his customer base.

To bolster his business and to prevent his loyal customers from going elsewhere, he is requesting a loan to enable him to increase his capital and to buy paint in bulk in order to make a profit. This will improve his household's standard of living.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur B. H. Zagou est né en 1985 ; il est marié et a à sa charge deux (2) personnes. Très courageux et déterminé, il tient une boutique de vente de peinture depuis 3 ans. C’est un commerce florissant car il est le seul dans son quartier et vend des peintures et de bonne qualité. La clientèle est abondante et régulière. N’ayant pas assez de moyens, il est souvent en pénurie de stock et ses clients se plaignent tout le temps. Devant cette situation, Monsieur B. risque de perdre sa clientèle.

Pour renforcer son commerce et éviter que ses fidèles clients n’aillent s’approvisionner ailleurs, Il sollicite un crédit qui va lui permettre d’augmenter son capital et d’acheter en gros les peintures pour en tirer plus de profit. Ceci améliorera le niveau de vie dans son ménage.

loans.use: To increase his capital and to buy paint wholesale

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia A. is 34 years old and the mother of two children. Her children are currently in school. Rukia has been selling jewelry like necklaces, earrings, bangles, rings, etc. in the local market for two years now. She wants a loan to buy more jewels to increase her inventory and also to increase her income.

Rukia is a member of the group called “Kamfo Yehowa” meaning Praise Jehovah. Members agree to guarantee loans for one another.

loans.use: To buy more jewelry.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi M. supplies food items to her customers in the neighboring town. She travels to a distant town to buy food supplies like maize in large quantities, which she sells to her customers in smaller quantities. She is a single parent with 1 child. Business is going very well but the cost of transportation is a big problem.

She is asking for a loan to reduce the burden of transportation cost on her limited capital, allowing her to purchase more food items per trip.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of transportation cost on her limited capital

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr:
Adzo A. is 37 years old, married, and a mom. To earn money in order to provide for her children's needs, she makes and sells mocha coffee in a small village in the mountains surrounding Kpalimé, one of the biggest cities in Togo. As you can see in the photo, she does not have the basic ingredients to do her work. So, she sells charcoal on the roadside. With this FECECAV loan, she wants to buy the basic ingredients for restarting her mocha business. Through the profits she is going to make from her sales, Adzo hopes to expand her enterprise in the coming years. She appreciates the opportunity that this loan will give her to improve the quality of life for her and her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Adzo A. est âgée de 37 ans, marié et est mère d’enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent afin de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, elle prépare et vend du café cacao, dans un petit village dans les montages qui entourent Kpalimé, une des plus grandes villes du Togo. Comme on la voit dans la photo, présentement elle n’a pas les matières premières pour faire son travail donc elle vend du charbon au bord de la route. Avec ce crédit de FECECAV, elle veut acheter ces matières premières pour recommencer son travail de café cacao. Par les profits qu’il va dégager dans la vente de ses marchandises, Adzo espère agrandir son entreprise dans les années prochaines. Elle apprécie l’opportunité que ce crédit va lui donner pour améliorer la qualité de sa vie et la vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy basic ingredients

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience A. is 38 years old and a divorced mother with two children. Her children are currently in school. She sells used clothes in the local market to make some income to take of the children. Prices of goods are going up and therefore she wants to use her loan to buy more bales of used clothes to increase both her inventory and her income to support the children’s education.

Patience is a member of the group called “Kamfo Yehowa” meaning Praise Jehovah. Members agree to guarantee one another to help with loan repayment.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Crobéshi

texts.fr:
Born in 1957 in Ekpui, in Vo prefecture, Crobéshi A. is married, the mother of four children, and is responsible for another child. She sells fruit in her district. Since her husband was admitted into retirement, the small pension is no longer enough to cover family needs. You see, Ms. A. sees herself needing to strengthen her business to increase family income. This is why she struggles each day to feed her children. But the burden of household expenses is decimating to all the effort she puts forth.

She therefore wants to improve her business by delivering fruit wholesale to retailers in Lomé. To do so, she is requesting a loan to be able to stock up in the villages where fruit abounds, for reselling. This will increase her bottom line and help her to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1957 à Ekpui dans la préfecture de Vo, Madame A. Crobéshi est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants et un autre enfant à sa charge. Elle est revendeuse de fruits dans son quartier. Depuis que son mari est admis à la retraite, la petite pension ne suffit plus pour assumer les besoins de la famille. Du coup, Madame A. se voit dans l’obligation de renforcer son activité pour augmenter le revenu familial. C’est ainsi qu’elle se bat au quotidien pour pouvoir nourrir ses enfants. Mais le poids des charges du ménage annihile tous ces efforts qu’elle fournit.

Elle veut alors améliorer son commerce en livrant des fruits en gros aux détaillants de Lomé. Pour cela, elle sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir s’approvisionner dans les villages où les fruits abondent et revendre. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaire et l’aidera à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Commerce in fruit

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret D. prepares a native food called ‘kenkey’, which is made with maize. It is very popular with the natives of her area. Margaret is divorced, with 2 children. Business is going very well, so she wishes to increase production and sales.

Margaret is running out of ingredients for her food production business, so she is asking for additional capital to buy more ingredients.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Najmitdinova

texts.ru:
K. Hajmitdinova is 40 years old, married, has secondary education. Since 2004 she has has been selling children's clothing. She started the business with $100 in assets. She heard of MicroInvest from her business partners and decided to apply for a loan to increase her merchandise circulation. After receiving the loan she used it to improve her business by expanding her location and improved her quality of life. In the future she plans to travel for merchandise to other countries.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Нажмитдинова Хикматой –40 лет. Замужем имеет среднее образование. Занимается продажей детской одежды с 2004 –го года. Начала свою деятельность с товарооборотом в сумме 100$. Услышав о программе МЗФ «Микроинвест» у партнеров по бизнесу она решила взять кредит и тем самым увеличить товарооборот. После получения займа и целевого использования она расширила место деятельности и улучшила уровень жизни. В будущем планирует ездить за товаром сама в дальние страны.

loans.use: Plans to increase commodity circulation and travel for merchandise

loans.name: Bassiratou

texts.fr:
Bassiratou C. was born in 1977 in Lomé (Golfe prefecture). She is married and the mother of two children with another child in her care. She sells various goods in her district in Lomé. The income from her husband does not allow him to entirely support the family. And so, most expenses are taken over by Ms. C.. This is possible thanks to the income from her commerce.

But to be effective in this role, she needs more substantial funds for bolstering her commerce. This is why she is requesting a loan as working capital to buy and sell her various goods. Strengthening this business is going to enable the family to rise above daily difficulties.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame C. Bassiratou est née en 1977 à Lomé (Préfecture du Golfe). Elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants avec un enfant à sa charge. Elle est revendeuse de divers produits dans son quartier à Lomé. Le revenu financier de son mari ne permet pas de supporter toutes les charges de la famille. Ce qui fait que la majorité de ces charges sont prises en compte par Madame C.. Ceci est possible grâce aux revenus de son commerce.

Mais pour jouer efficacement ce rôle, elle a besoin des moyens financiers plus consistants pour renforcer son commerce. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente de ses divers produits. Le renforcement de cette activité va permettre à la famille de sortir des difficultés quotidiennes.

loans.use: To buy and sell goods

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina A. sells sandals, cloth and clothing. She is married and has 6 dependants. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family, so Christina is working very hard to help with the family’s expenses.

She wishes to increase sales, so she is asking for a loan to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Fatouma

texts.fr:
Fatouma A. was born in 1970 in Lomé. She is married and the mother of two children. Born into a large family, she did not have the chance to continue her schooling due to a lack of funds. Very early on, she started selling boutique items and, given her mastery of her business, she succeeded in repaying her first loan without any problem at all.

Today, she is requesting a loan to enlarge her boutique and to bolster her business by buying ribbons, lace, and snaps. Realizing this project will enable her to have different items to offer at market and to meet the demands of her customers. This will enable her to raise her standard of living, leave her family home, and be on her own.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Fatouma est née en 1970 à Lomé, elle est mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Issue d’une famille nombreuse, elle n’a pas eu la chance de continuer ses études faute de moyens financiers. Elle s’est lancée très tôt dans le commerce de mercerie et avec la maîtrise de ses activités, elle a réussit à rembourser son premier crédit sans aucun incident.

Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un crédit pour agrandir sa boutique et renforcer ses activités en achetant des rubans, dentelles, presse bouton. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’avoir les différents produits à offrir sur le marché et de satisfaire les exigences de sa clientèle. Ce qui lui permettra de relever son niveau de vie, quitter la maison familiale et se prendre en charge.

loans.use: To enlarge her boutique and to bolster her business

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia O. is 28 years old. She is a single parent of one child. She is really dedicated to her work and supportive to her child. She owns and operates a clothing and cosmetic shop in the local market.

Cynthia is a proactive businesswoman who grabs opportunities when they appear. For example, she also sells mangoes, a seasonal fruit, to make additional income for her family upkeep, and right now is the mango season.

Cynthia believes she can make her business grow bigger and brighter with loan support and wants to use the loan to buy more clothing materials and assorted cosmetics to increase her stock of goods. She belongs to the community group called Nso Nyame ye (All is possible with God) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials and assorted cosmetics.

loans.name: Akua

texts.fr:
Akua A. is 28 years old, married, and a mom. All her children attend school. She manages a shop with her husband in order to provide for her children's needs and their school fees. Ms. Akou wishes to use this loan to make a large purchase of beans and corn to resell in the shop, which is located next to the marketplace in Kpalimé, one of the biggest cities in Togo. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more, and to meet the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Akua A. est âgée de 28 ans, mariée et mère. Tous ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle gère une boutique avec son mari pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et de leurs frais scolaires. Madame Akou désire avec ce crédit, faire un grand achat des haricots et du maïs pour revendre dans la boutique, qui est située à côte du marché à Kpalimé, une des plus grandes villes du Togo. Cet achat lui permettra d’augmenter ses ventes, gagner plus et répondre aux besoins de ses enfants.

loans.use: To make a big purchase of beans and corn

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena M. is a 60-year-old widow mother of seven children. She is a trader who trades in tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish and other goods from a tabletop in the local market. Abena says her husband died several years ago and through this business she has managed to support her seven children to finish school and enter the workforce. She is, however, convinced that her business can grow better with increased capital and therefore wants the loan to buy more tubers, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize and beans to increase her stock and make bigger income to put up a decent shelter.

Abena belongs to the community group called Okamafo (Deliverer) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans.

loans.use: To buy more yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize and beans.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa P., a married woman with 4 children, sells food at the market. She travels to a distant town to buy food supplies like maize in large quantities to resell to her customers in smaller quantities. Business is going very well but the cost of transportation is a big problem.

She is asking for a loan to reduce the burden of transportation cost on her limited capital, allowing her to buy more food per trip.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of transportation cost on her limited capital

loans.name: David

texts.en: David S. is sixty-two years old. He is married and has four children who are currently in school. David earns money selling various kinds of chemicals like weed killers, fertilizers, pesticides, as well as spraying machines to the local farmers. Many local farmers buy his products during the currently ongoing farming season when many crops are being planted. Therefore, David wants to take out a loan to buy increased supplies of chemicals and spraying machines to better serve the needs of his customers. He also hopes to thereby increase his income and be able to send two of his children to university this year. David is a member of the community called Nananom (Elders) Trust Group, whose members provide a form of guarantee (social collateral) to one another to enable overall higher rates of loan repayment.

loans.use: Purchase of weed killers, fertilizers, pesticides, and spraying machines

loans.name: Mouniratou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Mouniratou C. was born in 1956 in Lagos, Nigeria; she is married and the mother of five (05) children. Her husband has been unemployed for 4 years and her dry goods store is the only source of income for the family. She has been practicing this trade for over 20 years but her insufficient means do not allow her to develop and increase the number of her customers. Nowadays, she is anxious to revive her activity, to better outfit her store in order to attract more customers; Mrs. C. Mouniratou is requesting a loan. This will increase her profit and improve her family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1956 à Lagos au Nigeria Madame C. Mouniratou est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Son mari est sans emploi depuis 4 ans et son commerce de mercerie constitue la seule source de revenu pour la famille. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis plus de 20 ans mais ses maigres moyens ne lui permettent pas d’évoluer et d’avoir plus de clientèles. Aujourd’hui, soucieuse de relancer ses activités et mieux équiper sa boutique pour attirer plus de clientèle ; Madame C. Mouniratou sollicite un crédit Ceci augmentera son chiffre d’affaires et améliorera son niveau de vie et celui de sa famille.

loans.use:
To outfit her dry goods store

Equiper sa boutique de mercerie

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi Antwiwaa is twenty-six years old and single. For the past five years, she has been earning income running her own seamstress shop. Esi is a specialist in various types of female clothing, including kabas, slits, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc. Esi currently needs a loan of US$500, which she will use to increase her supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. The purchase will allow her to increase the total output and efficiency of the shop. Esi is a member of the community group called Nananom Trust Group, whose members provide a guarantee for one another.

loans.use: Purchase of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia D. sells sandals and other footwear. She is married and has 3 dependants. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family, so Cecilia is working very hard to help with the family’s expenses. She wishes to increase sales, therefore she is asking for a loan to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba K., a married woman with 4 children, sells maize, yam and other food items. She travels to a distant town to buy food supplies in large quantities that she then resells to her customers. Business is going very well but the cost of transportation is a big problem.

She is asking for a loan to reduce the burden of transportation cost on her limited capital, freeing up more capital per trip to purchase food items.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of transportation cost on her limited capital

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa G. is a thirty-nine year old widow and has four children who are all currently in school. Theresa hopes to be able to provide her children with good education despite being a single parent. She owns and operates and grocery shop in one of the busy local markets. In the shop, Theresa sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. Currently, she would like to take out a loan to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, and other goods to increase her stock. Theresa belongs to the community group called Decency Trust Group, whose members provide a guarantee for one another as social collateral to help access and repay loans.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, evaporated milk, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Abiola

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abiola A. was born on April 10, 1963; she is married and the mother of three (03) children. After she left her studies, fifteen years ago, she launched herself in the sale of jewelry and cosmetics. This business is booming but she lacks the financial means to meet her customers’ demand.

She is requesting a financial support of $1,000 to enhance her display and to acquire a wider variety of jewelry. This loan will allow her to satisfy the market’s demand, to provide for her needs, and to take care of her family.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née le 10 Avril 1963 à Lomé, Madame A. Abiola est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Après avoir abandonné ses études, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce des bijoux et des produits de beauté il y a 15 ans. Ce commerce est très florissant mais elle manque de moyens pour satisfaire sa clientèle.

Elle sollicite un appui financier de $1000 pour augmenter son étalage et acquérir d’autres variétés de bijoux. Ce crédit lui permettra de satisfaire la demande sur le marché, de subvenir à ses besoins et prendre soin de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase and sale of jewelry

Achat et vente de bijoux

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Microfund Togo - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua Menu is forty-three years old. She is married and has ten children, seven of whom are currently in school. Akosu owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, etc. She also sells frozen beef, chicken, fish and palm oil as a subsidiary. Akosua currently needs a loan to be able to buy more rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, etc. and thus expand her business. Akosua believes that with increased income she would be more capable of financing her children’s education and providing them with better opportunities than what she had. Akosua belongs to the community group called Decency Trust Group, whose members provide a guarantee for one another as social collateral to help access and repay loans.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, milk, canned foods and drinks, etc.

loans.name: Fata

texts.en: Fata is 43 years old woman from Donje Dubrave, a small village near the town Živinice. She is married and her husband has his own car wash.  Fata has one daughter who attends secondary school. Fata will use this loan in the amount to buy a car polishing machine. Her wish is to improve work and family income.

loans.use: To buy a car polishing machine.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr:
Mrs. Ayawa A. was born in 1984 in Tabligbo (P/Yoto). Being a girl in a family of 11 children, she lacked financial means and did not have a chance to pursue any schooling. She used her first loan of $75 to retail poplin to provide for her needs. She is very courageous and determined, and she easily paid back that loan. She is currently requesting a second loan to strengthen her business, and to buy poplin wholesale that she will retail. This will enable her to make a much more significant profit and fulfill her socio-economic needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Mlle A. Ayawa est née en 1984 à Tabligbo (P/Yoto). Fille d’une famille de 11 enfants, elle n’a pas eu la chance de continuer ses études scolaires par faute de moyens financiers. Avec son premier prêt de $75 elle se lança dans le commerce des popelines pour subvenir à ses besoins. Très courageuse et déterminée, elle à remboursé sans peine ce crédit et sollicite actuellement un second crédit pour renforcer son commerce, acheter en gros les popelines et les revendre en détail. Ce qui lui permettra de gagner une marge bénéficiaire beaucoup plus considérable et satisfaire à ses besoins socio économiques.

loans.use:
To strengthen her retail business, to buy poplin wholesale and resell it

Pour renforcer son commerce, acheter en gros les popelines et les revendre en détail.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina T. is thirty-seven years old. She is divorced and has a child who is currently in senior high school. Sabina operates a clothing store in the community market. She sells male and female clothes, including jeans, shirts, skirts and tops. Sabina currently needs a loan to be able to increase her supplies of male and female clothes and thereby expand her business. With increased income, Sabina hopes to be able to finance her child’s education at a university. She is a member of a loan group called Decency Trust Group, whose members provide a guarantee for one another as social collateral to help access and repay loans.

loans.use: Purchase of male and female clothes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sinapi Aba Trust (SAT) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Fahreta

texts.en: Fahreta was born in 1986. She is from Donje Dubrave where she lives with her husband. Her husband only works occasionally . This is her first loan at the MCO. Fahreta intends to use this loan to buy goods for her small grocery store. Her wish is to increase monthly income for her family.

loans.use: To buy goods for the shop.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokou A. was born in 1968; he is married and the father of three (03) children. He trained to be a cook, but was out of work for several years before he decided to drive a motorcycle taxi. He is a courageous and dynamic man. He does not have the means to buy a motorcycle, so he has to borrow his friend’s on their days off. This does not help him much. Nowadays, he really wants to have his own motorcycle to be able to fully enjoy it. He is requesting a loan. The execution of this project will allow him to gain a steady income. This activity is profitable when you have your own motorcycle.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur A. Kokou est né en 1968, il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Cuisinier de formation, il a chômé pendant plusieurs années avant de se décider à conduire du taxi moto malgré lui. C’est un homme courageux et dynamique. N’ayant pas de moyens pour s’acheter une moto, il est obligé de prendre celui de ses amis quand ceux-ci sont au repos. Ce qui ne l’avantage guère. Aujourd’hui, il veut vivement avoir sa propre moto pour pouvoir en jouir pleinement. Il sollicite un crédit. La réalisation de ce projet, lui permettra d’avoir une source de revenu plus sûr. Cette activité est rentable lorsque vous avez votre propre moto.

loans.use:
Purchase of a motorcycle for taxi

Achat de taxi moto

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama H. is 36. She is married and had four children but unfortunately, she lost all of them through tragic disease. However, she is consoled by the fact that there is still hope for her to make new babies. She owns and operates a little grocery shop selling items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed milk powder, etc. She deems this an opportunity to expand her business and wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to increase her stock of goods available for sale.

Ama belongs to the community group called Anyidado (Hope) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, vegetable oil, body and hair creams, etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Aiša

texts.en: Aiša was born in 1961. She is a widow. She sells curtains and material for sewing at the market. She has two children, a son who works and one daughter who attends secondary school. This is her first loan at the MCO . Aiša intends to invest this loan in purchasing additional textiles for selling in order to increase her monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase additional textiles.

loans.name: Sikujua's Uhai Group

texts.en:
Sikujua H., age 45, is a widow with a 22-year-old son. She sells food and cosmetics, a business she started five years ago. From selling cosmetics, she makes about $90 a month, and from her food sales, she makes about $9 a day. She works from 6:30am to 5pm each day.

In the past, Sikujua has taken three loans from Tujijenge Tanzania in order to increase her inventory, buy land, and pay school fees for her son. She now hopes for a new loan to start selling soft drinks with her food. In the picture, Sikujua is squatting third from the left and is wearing the black scarf.

loans.use: To start selling soft drinks

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua M. is 60, married, and has four children who have all completed school and are working. She is a food vendor selling banku. Banku is prepared from milled maize, cooked and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish or soup. Afua has a lot of customers because banku is enjoyed by many Ghanaians as breakfast, lunch, and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials such as maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and also firewood. She hopes to increase her income to support her children’s education.

Afua belongs to a community group called Anyidado Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for food preparation: maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and also firewood

loans.name: Kossi Michel

texts.fr:
Kossi Michel K. is 31 years old, married, and a dad. He is a farmer in Kuma, a small village in the mountains near Kpalimé, one of the biggest cities in Togo. Since he is a farmer, he has trouble providing for his family's needs because arable lands are becoming more and more rare and less fertile. He grows yams and corn in his field, which is found about 10 km from his house. To do his work better, Kossi Michel hopes to use this loan to buy a motorbike to transport himself to the field more easily. He appreciates the opportunity that this loan will give him to improve the quality of his life.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Kossi Michel K. est âgé de 31 ans, marié et père. Il est un cultivateur à Kuma, un petit village dans les montagnes environnantes de Kpalimé, une des plus grandes villes du Togo. Comme il est un cultivateur, il subvient difficilement aux besoins de la famille puisque les terres cultivables deviennent de plus en plus rares et moins fertiles. Il cultive les ignames et du mais dans son champ, qui se trouve environ 10 kilomètres de sa maison. Pour mieux faire son travail, Kossi Michel espère avec ce crédit acheter une moto pour lui transporter au champ plus facilement. Il apprécie l’opportunité que ce crédit va lui donner pour améliorer la qualité de sa vie.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transportation to his field

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes N. is forty-five years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in senior high school, while the other one is in primary school. Agnes is hard-working and dedicated, and therefore successful in her business. For the past twelve years, she has been working as a retail seller of eggs and onions, financially supporting her family. Agnes is now in need of a loan to be able to increase her supply of onions and eggs and to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. Agnes is a member of the trust group called Anyidado (Hope) Trust Group, whose members provide a guarantee for one another as social collateral to help access and repay loans.

loans.use: Purchase of maize and eggs for sale

loans.name: Kokoli Afiwa

texts.fr:
Y. Kokoli Afiwa, age 62, is a jovial woman, married, and the mother of four. All by herself, she provides for her three children's needs and those of her husband, since he is retired. She operates a shop, "Chez Maman" in Kuma, a small village in the mountains near Kpalimé, one of the largest cities in Togo. She sell various goods, and she uses solar energy to illuminate her merchandise at night. She wishes to use these Kiva funds to increase the capacity of her enterprise by buying flip-flop sandals, canned foods, soap, and other items for retail sale. She hopes to continue to improve her family's quality of life with the profits she is going to make selling her goods

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Y. Kokoli Afiwa est une femme joviale âgée de 62 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle subvient toute seule aux besoins de ses 3 enfants et ceux de son mari étant donné que ce dernier est en retraite. Elle opère une boutique, « Chez Maman», à Kuma, un petit village dans les montagnes environnantes de Kpalimé, une des plus grandes villes du Togo. Elle vend les produits variés et elle utilise l’énergie solaire pour éclairer ses marchandises pendant la nuit. Maman souhaite avec les fonds de Kiva augmenter la capacité de son entreprise en achetant les sandalettes, les boites de conserves, du savon et les autres produits pour revendre. Elle espère continuer améliorer la qualité de vie de sa famille par les profits qu’elle va dégager dans la vente de ses marchandises.

loans.use: To increase the capacity of her enterprise

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en: Alberta O. is thirty years old, married, and has two children, 1 and 4 years old. Alberta earns income running her own grocery store, where she sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She would like to expand her business further to be able to offer other items frequently demanded by her customers. Alberta is therefore asking for a loan, which she will use to buy more rice, sugar, vegetable oil, body and hair creams, and other items to increase the stock of goods in her store. Alberta belongs to the community group called Nyame kye (God’s Gift) Trust Group, whose members provide a guarantee for one another as social collateral to help access and repay loans.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, vegetable oil, body and hair creams, and other goods for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. Mary works very hard and with passion to be able to provide better opportunities for her children and send the eldest of them to a medical school. Mary earns income running her own grocery store in one of the busy local markets. She sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. Currently, Mary is asking for a loan, which she will use to buy more rice, sugar, evaporated milk, vegetable oil, and other goods to increase the stock in her store. Mary belongs to the community group called Nyame Kye (God’s Gift) Trust Group, whose members provide a guarantee for one another as social collateral to help access and repay loans.

loans.use: Purchase of rice and sugar, evaporated milk, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa A. is forty-five years old, married, and has six children. She is very resourceful and supportive of her husband, helping him finance their children’s education and provide them with opportunities in the future. Three of Yaa's children have already completed senior high school and could start studies at a university. Yaa earns a living selling cooked food - rice with stew - as well as ground nuts, beans, and yams in the community market. She currently needs a loan to buy more rice, beans, and yams to increase the stock of goods in her store. She belongs to the community group called Nyame kye Trust Group, whose members provide a guarantee for one another as social collateral to help access and repay loans.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, beans, and yams

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy K. is thirty-four years old. She is married and has three children - twin boys and a girl - who are all in school and doing very well. Mercy is a responsible mother and cares a lot about her children's needs and welfare. She earns a living selling used clothes to a large number of customers. However, with insufficient capital, Mercy can barely buy enough used clothing to make profit from selling it. She is therefore asking for a loan, which she will use to buy a variety of used clothes to meet the customers' needs and thus be able to increase her income to pay for her children’s education. Mercy is a member of the community group called Anyidado Nyame (God of hope) Trust Group, whose members provide a guarantee for one another as social collateral to help access and repay loans.

loans.use: Purchase of used clothing for sale

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa Nyaneba is forty-five years old. She is married and has a child who has completed senior high school. Adwoa sells ground nuts, beans, yams and waakye - cooked rice and beans typically eaten as breakfast in the mornings with stew, macaroni and fish. Waakye is very tasty and filling, and almost all tribes in Ghana enjoy it. Adwoa currently needs a loan to buy more bags of rice, beans, and yams to increase her stock of goods. She belongs to the community group called Nyame kye Trust Group, whose members provide a guarantee for one another as social collateral to help access and repay loans.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, beans, and yams

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en: Anastasia E. is forty-two years old. She is married and has two sons and three daughters who are currently in school. Anastasia owns and operates a grocery store, where she sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk, etc. She enjoys running her own business and is motivated to work hard, because she dreams of a better future for her children. However, Anastasia is constrained by insufficient capital. She is therefore requesting a loan to be able to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, and other items to increase her sales and income. Anastasia is a member of a community group called Nyame kye Trust Group, whose members provide a guarantee for one another as social collateral to help access and repay loans.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, vegetable oil, body and hair creams, etc.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina M. is twenty four years old. She is not married. She sells porridge and groundnuts in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast. It is prepared from boiled milled maize or millet grains eaten with sugar, milk and bread. Because of her large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, and milk to increase production. She hopes to earn a good income to support her younger brother in school. She is a member of a group called Nyame Kye Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Geronima Esperanza

texts.es:
Geronima Esperanza B. has partnered with Fundación Leon for ten years, obtaining 27 loans in all.  In the beginning, her business was exclusively tortilla sales.  Since then she has succeeded in establishing a small grocery store and has made improvements to her home.  Her dream is to improve her house, where she lives with some of her children even though they are all married.  Her husband is elderly.  She runs her business together with one of her daughters.  She sells tortillas, and she also sells soft drinks, bread, refreshments, treats and more.  With the loan, she will invest 70% in her tortilla business and the rest in a new business.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Geronima Esperanza B. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace diez años obteniendo veitisiete prestamos, cabe destacar que al inicio su negocio era unicamente venta de tortillas actualmente a logrado poner una pequeña pulperia a realizado mejoras a su vivienda, su sueño es mejorar su casa ya que ella vive con varios de sus hijos aunque cada uno ya esta casado, ella es casada sus hijos todos mayores de edad su esposo es un señor muy mayor, el negocio lo administra en conjunto con una hija, en su negocio vende tortillas y en la pequeña pulperia vende gaseosas, pan, frescos ,golosinas y otros. Con el credito ella le invierte un 70% al negocio de tortillas y el restante al nuevo negocio.

loans.use: To buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Evgeniya

texts.en:
Evgeniya is a business owner from the city of Melitopol in southern Ukraine. She has a small kiosk at the central market in Melitopol where she sells a selection of women’s clothing. Evgeniya is very experienced as an entrepreneur, having been in business for over eleven years. Married with two daughters, her business has been a good source of income for her family. One of her daughters is in college and Evgeniya has been able to help with some of her educational expenses.

Evgeniya has requested a loan of 4000 Ukrainian Griven to help purchase new clothing inventory. She has a good credit history with HOPE Intl-Nadiya Ukraine and we are happy to be able to continue helping her run a successful business.

loans.use: Purchase new clothing inventory

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is a careful, hard-working entrepreneur who has a small business selling women’s clothing at an outdoor market in Melitopol, Ukraine. Before starting her own business Lubov had worked in a manufacturing plant. When the plant was shut down, she decided to start her own business and began selling in the market. She has been self-employed now for about ten years. Her business has done well and she currently makes about $1000 per month – a good middle wage income in Ukraine. Lubov is divorced and has two grown children.

Lubov has requested a short term loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to buy an assortment of new inventory for her business. She has proven to be a very responsible client with Nadiya Ukraine, repaying all previous loans on-time. We are happy to have this opportunity to assist her as she works to continue operating a successful business.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is an entrepreneur from the southern Ukrainian city of Melitopol. She sells a variety of small clothing items including socks, hosiery and hats at an outdoor market in Melitopol. Tatyana has a good place to sell in the market with lots of passing traffic and a visible location. She has had her own business for the past twelve years. Divorced, her business is a very important source of income. She has two children – a son who is married and has a family and a daughter who was just recently married. Tatyana is able to help both of her children with the income she makes.

Tatyana has requested a loan of 5000 Ukrainian Griven to increase her working capital. This will allow her to purchase new inventory and continue developing her business.

loans.use: Increase working business capital

loans.name: Evdokiya

texts.en:
Evdokiya is a small business owner from Melitopol, Ukraine. A widow, she lives with her daughter and granddaughter. Evdokiya sells women’s clothing from a little kiosk at the busy central market in Melitopol. She is an experienced entrepreneur, having been in business for about 15 years. Her typical monthly income is around $400.

Evdokiya has requested a loan of 4000 Ukrainian Griven to purchase a supply of summer clothing to sell in her kiosk. She has been a client with HOPE Intl-Nadiya Ukraine since 2002 and has developed a reputation as a responsible borrower. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her with operating a successful business.

loans.use: Purchase summer clothing inventory

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina has a small business in Melitopol, Ukraine. She sells a variety of children’s clothing from a little outdoor kiosk at the central market in Melitopol. Galina has had her business for over ten years. When she was first starting out she chose to sell a product that was a good fit for her. Divorced and living by herself, Galina would like to continue developing her business so she can improve her standard of living. She currently makes about $320 per month.

Galina has requested a loan to purchase new summer clothing inventory. She should have good sales and resulting good income during the warm summer months.

loans.use: Purchase summer clothing inventory

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana loves children. Her children’s clothing business, which she has had for the last ten years, is a great fit for her. She sells clothing from a little kiosk at the central market in Melitopol, Ukraine. Tatyana has gained extensive experience as an entrepreneur. She respects her customers and they respect her in return. Tatyana is married and has two children who are grown. She typically makes over $500 in a given month.

With the change in seasons, Tatyana has requested a short term loan to help purchase some summer clothing inventory. She hopes to expand her business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: Purchase inventory of summer clothing

loans.name: Uliya

texts.en:
Uliya has a business creating beautiful synthetic flower arrangements used in funerals and as gravesite decorations. These arrangements are very common in the Ukraine as a way to memorialize and honor loved ones who have passed away. Uliya has extensive experience in this business. She has been working for herself for over seven years. She is married and has two young sons. Uliya makes about $400 per month from her business.

Uliya has requested a loan of 5000 Ukrainian Griven to buy materials used in making her flower arrangements. She has been a client with HOPE Intl-Nadiya Ukraine since 2004. We are happy to have another opportunity to help this hard-working entrepreneur as she works to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: Purchase materials to make synthetic flower arrangements

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria Guadalupe B. has been a client of Fundación Leon for six years, during which time she has been the recipient of 17 loans. She is married with five grown children who are themselves married, and she has one child still living with her. Her husband helps her to oversee her business. She relies on two local service taxis as well as a grocery store set up in her home. The loan proceeds have been directed toward both of the businesses. In fact, one of the taxis was financed by the Fundación Leon institution. The current loan is to be used to repair one of the taxis that was in an accident.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Guadalupe B. es cliente de nuetra institución desde hace unos seis años donde ha manejado diesisiete prestamos, Casada con cinco hijos todos casados solamente uno vive con ella, su esposo le ayuda a ver el negocio, Ella cuenta con dos taxis locales ademas de una pulperia en su casa nuestros creditos han sido destinados a los dos negocios, cabe destacar que uno de los taxis fue financiado por nuestra institución, sus condiciones de vida han mejorado asi como sus negocios, este financiamiento lo utiliza para reparar una de las unidades de taxi que le chocaron.

loans.use: Repair of a taxi.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación Leon 2000 - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Francisca Juana

texts.es:
Francisca is 35 years old and has a stand in the street of Sempertegui by “la calle 4”, in Villa Dolores where she sells fruits, vegetables and other goods. Francisca has been living in her own house for the past seven years, her main activity is to sell fruits and at other times she gets supplies of different merchandise. Her husband is a construction work contractor. Francisca has been a saleswoman for the last eight years. The market is very competitive but her experience has made her successful with her clients as she is providing excellent attention to the customers. The present request will be spent on buying a variety of fruits such as grey pear, “peramota”, peach, apricot, pear, and plum. Prices vary depending on the assortment and quantity. Francisca’s credit report is good.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Francisca tiene 35 años de edad, tiene un puesto en la calle Sempertegui entre la calle 4, en Villa Dolores donde vende variedad de frutas, verduras y otras mercaderías. Francisca vive en su casa que es propia desde hace siete años atrás, su principal actividad es vender frutas y en otras épocas se surte de otra mercadería. Su esposo es contratista de obras de construcción. Francisca tiene una experiencia en el rubro de ocho años. Existe competencia en el mercado, pero con el tiempo de experiencia logró consolidar a su propia clientela ya que da una excelente atención a sus clientes. La presente solicitud sirve para adquirir variedad de frutas como son la pera gris, peramota, durazno, damasco, pera y ciruelo. Los precios de las mismas varían dependiendo de la variedad y la cantidad. Francisca tiene buenos antecedentes crediticios.

loans.use: Purchase assortment of fruits and other merchandise to increase sales.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase products for a small convenience store, firewood, and raw materials to make fabrics

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro is 39 years old and has a minibus with which he works as part of the 10th of February Union in his community. His family is made up of his three children, his two parents and his wife, who is a homemaker. His family lives in a two room wooden house with no fence around it. Pedro's minibus has the capacity to transport 12 people. As he is a member of the union his routes are defined by them. He takes passengers to distant communities in the region. While he has years of experience in this field, competition is quite elevated because of the increase of public transport vehicles and unions that offer the same service. At the same time, demand has increased due to the growing migration of people from the interior. The following application is to repair his minibus, which does not have an exact price as he fix it and he will use the loan to buy parts. Previously he has obtained loans from the institution and demonstrated that he is a responsible person who is punctual with his loans.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Pedro tiene 39 años de edad, tiene un minibus con el que trabaja en el Sindicato 10 de febrero de su localidad. Su familia esta conformada por sus tres hijos, sus dos padres y su esposa que realiza labores de casa. La familia vive en una casa de madera de 2 ambientes que no tiene barda. Pedro trabaja con su minibus que tiene capacidad de trasnporte para 12 personas, es socio del sindicato por lo que tiene rutas definidas por el mismo. Lleva pasajeros a las distintas comunidades de la zona. Su experiencia e este rubro es bastante larga, es por esta razón que si bien la competencia es elevada y sobre todo ahora por el incremento de vehiculos de transporte público y sindicatos que ofrecen el mismo servicio, paralelamente también creció la demanda por la creciente migración de personas del interior. La presente solicitud es para arreglar su minibus, no tiene el precio exacto ya que es él quien arreglará su minibus y el préstamo lo utilizará para comprar repuestos. Anteriormente ya obtuvo otros créditos en la institución y demostró ser una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos.

loans.use: Repair of Mini Bus

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca F. D. M.'s main business is selling sweaters in a stall in Correos. She has been working with this Microfinance Institution since May 2007 and is a woman who helps her family pay for her nieces and nephews' education. She does not have loans with any other institution. She is an excellent client. Since beginning to work with Emprender she has not maD. any delayed payments.

She lives in a very humble rented house in the el Alto region of San Antonio. She works with this agency because she used to belong to a borrowing group in the area.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

LA SEÑORA FRANCISCA F. D. M. TIENE COMO ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL LA VENTA D. CHOMPAS EN UN PUESTO SITUADO EN CORREOS LA SEÑORA TRABAJA CON LA INSTITUCIÓN DESD. MAYO D. 2007 Y ES UNA PERSONA QUE AYUDA A SU FAMILIA CON LA COLEGIATURA D. SUS SOBRINOS Y NO PRESENTA NINGUAN OTRO CRÉDITO EN OTRA INSTITUCION, ES EXCELENTE CLIENTE, DESD. QUE COMENZÓ A TRABAJAR CON EMPRENDER NO TUVO DÍAS D. ATRASO.

VIVE EN ALQUILER EN UNA CASA MUY HUMILD. D. LA ZONA D. ALTO SAN ANTONIO, TRABAJA CON ESTA AGENCIA PORQUE ANTES PERTENECÍA A UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO SITUADO POR LA ZONA

loans.use: To purchase clothing

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco is 59 years of age and his family is composed of his four children, his two parents and his wife who has a small business selling food. Currently his children are in school, all of whom are his dependents. Francisco has a stand in the 2nd of February Market where he sells car parts. He has 20 years of experience in this field and he also acts as a wholesale distributor bringing his car parts to the Chapare region to sell them. His success is based on the effort that he puts into his work and also the location of his business in a highly frequented location. At the same time he receives help from his children who collaborate in an unconditional way. With the following application he will acquire wheel bearings that cost USD$400 per box and other lower quality wheel bearings with a value of USD$250 a box. His credit history is acceptable and all of his previous loans have been paid off.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.
