Francisco tiene 59 años de edad, su familia está conformada por sus cuatro hijos, sus dos padres y su esposa que atiende una pequeña venta de comidas. Actualmente sus hijos siguen estudiando, todos depende de él. Francisco tiene una caseta comercial en el mercado 2 de febrero donde tiene su venta de repuestos, tiene una experiencia en el rubro de aproximadamente 20 años, además también actua como mayorista ya que lleva sus repuestos hasta el Chapare para poder venderlos. Su exito se basa en el empeño que pone en su trabajo y también de la ubicación de su negocio que es un lugar muy frecuentado por la gente. Paralelamente recibe mucha ayuda de sus hijos quienes colaboran de manera incondicional. Con la presente solcitud adquirirá rodamientos que cuestan $us. 400.- la caja y otros rodamientos de menor calidad que tiene un valor de $us. 250.- la caja. El historial crediticio es aceptable si bien tuvieron algnos problemas con créditos anteriores siempre cancelaron los mismos.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise

loans.name: Yurina De Los Angele

texts.es:
Yurina S. U. has worked with the Fundación Leon Institution for three years, obtaining five loans total. She is the single mother of a little girl who lives with her relatives. She sells general merchandise and also works in conjunction with her father, a tailor, in the clothing business. She provides materials to her father, who creates the pieces that Yurina then sells. Additionally, she sells products such as cosmetics, underwear, gold-plated items, children's clothing, etc. With this financing, she intends to buy fabric and general supplies with the goal of offering a better selection now that a favorable time for commerce is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Yurina S. U. trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace tres años obteniendo cinco creditos, Ella es madre soltera tiene una niña tierna ella vive con familiares, ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general ademas trabaja en conjunto con su padre en la confección de ropa ya que su padre es sastre por tanto ella le provee de los materiales el papa elabora las piezas y ella las vende, ademas ella vende productos como: cosmeticos, ropa interior, oro laminado, ropa de niños etc. Con este financiamiento pretende comprar telas y productos en general esto con el fin de tener una mayor oferta ya viene una buena temporada para el comercio.

loans.use: Working capital, fabric and clothing, cosmetics, gold-plated items, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in beauty products to resell in her community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase shoes and pants to supply her small business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is 31 years old, she is single and supports only herself. She sells clothes, especially for ladies, she buys at the market and sells on credit with weekly payments. She has been carrying out this activity for 5 years. In spite of the competition Hilda has established a business with many customers who buy from her on a regular basis. With the present request she will buy merchandise to increase her sales. This is her third loan from Agrocapital y during the commercial relationship with the institution she has proven to be a very responsible person, and punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Hilda tiene 31 años de edad, se dedica al comercio de prendas de vestir especialmente ropa para damas, compra en la feria y entrega al crédito con pagos semanales. Hilda es una persona soltera y no tiene dependientes. Tiene una experiencia de 5 años en esta actividad. Si existe bastante competencia, Hilda ha logrado establecer una buena clientela que demanda sus productos de manera constante. Con la presente solicitud adquirirá mercadería para incrementar sus operaciones. Esta es su tercera actividad en Agrocapital y durante el tiempo de relación comercial con la institución demostró ser una persona muy responsable y puntual en sus pagos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase sales.

loans.name: Luz Maximiliana

texts.es:
Luz is 53 years old, presently she has three income sources: a general store, a phone booth, and rent from rooms at her home. Luz has one daughter who is economically independent. Luz has a 15-year experience and in spite of competition, the general store she runs is one of the oldest and best-known by the neighbors which allows her to count on a stable group of costumers. The present request will be used to purchase supplies for the store. This is the fourth time Luz is working with our institution and she keeps a very good record of accomplishment.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Luz tiene 53 años de edad, actualmente tiene tres fuentes de ingresos que son su tienda de barrio, su cabina de teléfonos y los alquileres de habitaciones en su domicilio. Luz tiene una hija pero la misma es independiente económicamente. Luz tiene una experiencia de más de 15 años en los diferentes rubros que realiza. Si bien existe competencia en sus rubros, la tienda de barrio es una de las más antiguas y conocidas por las personas que habitan el lugar, lo que le permite contar con clientela frecuentemente. La presente solicitud es para surtir su tienda de mercadería. Esta es la cuarta secuencia de Luz con nuestra institución y tiene un muy buen record de cumplimiento.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase sales at a general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in women's clothing and silver jewelry for a small business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase meat to keep her business running

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina is 34 years old and has four children: Ana María, 12; Julieta, 10; Sergio, 8; and young Sebastian who is 5 years old. Cristina has a business set up at home where she manufactures shoes, sandals, and boots. Once she has manufactured the footwear, it is delivered to the stores and they finish the details. There is little competition in this field as the work requires qualified and specialized labor. With the present loan Cristina will buy three machines that will allow her to become more independent and to increase her income. She will buy two straight stitch sewing machines and a serger (overlock machine). This is Cristina’s third credit with this institution and she has proven to be a responsible person, punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Cristina tiene 34 años de edad y tiene una familia que consta de sus cuatro hijos Ana María de 12 años, Julieta de 10 años, Sergio de 8 años y el pequeño Sebastian de 5 años de edad. Cristina tiene instalado en su domicilio su negocio que es donde se preparan calzados, sandalias y botas. Una vez se producen los mismos entonces se entrega a las zapaterías para que las mismas finalicen el trabajo. Existe una competencia media en este rubro, esto debido a que el tipo de trabajo requiere de mano de obra calificada y especializada. Con el presente crédito comprará tres máquinas las cuales le permitirán ser más independiente y a la vez a percibir mayores ingresos. Comprará dos máquinas de costura recta y una máquina sesgadora. Este es el tercer crédito de Cristina con la institución y demostró ser una persona responsable y puntual con sus pagos.

loans.use: Purchase sewing machines to increase manufacture of footwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in costume jewelry to move her business forward

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: urchase of clothing in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
Maria Rosario M. D. ValverD.'s main business is an internet and Entel Point (telephone calls). She is a single mother and is in charge of paying for her son's education. For this reason she continues working so that she can help him get ahead. She lives in a house with her parents.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

LA SEÑORA MARIA ROSARIO M. D. VALVERD. TIENE COMO PRINCIPAL ACTIVIDAD SERVICIO D. INTERNET Y PUNTO ENTEL (LLAMADAS TELEFÓNICAS), LA SEÑORA ES MADRE SOLTERA Y TIENE A SU CARGO LA EDUCACION D. SU HIJO POR EL CUAL ELLA SIGUE TRABAJANDO PARA PODERLE SACAR ADELANTE ELLA VIVE EN LA CASA D. SUS PADRES

loans.use: To purchase phone cards

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase silver jewelry to retail in her community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of candies and sweeties to sell in her community

loans.name: Corazon De Oro I Group

texts.es:
The women that make up the Corazon de Oro I group are from a town called El Jaibalito located on the shores of Atitlan Lake. El Jaibalito is a small town located on a very steep hill. Almost all homes are located on the mountain slope. This small town is not connected to other neighboring towns by any roads due to the mountainous terrain and the volcanoes, which make it difficult to build a road. You can only reach the town by boat.

Usually when a town is isolated the local culture remains intact and this is the case with El Jaibalito. The women mainly speak Maya-Tzutujil, and as you can see in the photo they wear their traditional garb. The lack of exposure to other cultures inhibits the townspeople when they encounter a “foreigner.” The meeting between the women and myself was very funny. They spend the entire interview laughing and it was a very entertaining moment.

All the women that belong to this group are weavers. They are going to invest their loan in the purchase of raw materials and different colored threads. With this thread they are gong to make beautiful traditional costumes using ancient waist loom techniques. The women in the region of Atitlan are taught how to weaved by their mothers at the age of nine years old.

The women believe the loan is useful because it will help them buy a large quantity of thread and with this they will be able to make more huipiles (embroidered blouses), whether their clients pay them on time or not.

This group of women is always smiling and they deserve an opportunity to succeed as entrepreneurs. Through this loan they can get this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Las señoras que conforman el grupo Corazón de Oro I vienen de un pueblo llamado “el Jaibalito” ubicado a las orillas del Lago Atitlán. El Jaibalito es un pueblo muy pequeño que está ubicado en una cuesta muy, pero muy, empinada. Casi todas las casas están ubicadas en las laderas de una montaña. Este pequeño pueblo no está conectado por carreteras con los otros pueblos vecinos ya que la complicada geografía de las montañas y volcanes no permite que una carretera sea construida. Solo se puede llegar al pueblo por medio de lanchas.

Usualmente cuando un pueblo esta aislado, la cultura del lugar permanece intacta, y el Jaibalito no es la excepción. Las mujeres hablan mayormente el Maya-Tzutujil y, como se ve en la foto, ellas visten sus bellos trajes tradicionales. La falta de exposición a otras culturas inhibe a la gente cuando ellas ven a un “extranjero”. El encuentro entre las señoras y mi persona fue muy gracioso. Las mujeres se pasaron toda la entrevista riéndose. Ese momento fue muy ameno.

Todas las señoras que pertenecen a este grupo son tejedoras. Ellas van a invertir su crédito en la compra de materia prima, hilos de distintos colores. Con estos hilos, ellas van a elaborar bellos trajes tradicionales utilizando la técnica antigua de telar de cintura. Las mujeres en la región de Atitlán aprenden, de sus madres, a tejer desde que tienen nueve años de edad.

Las mujeres piensan que el crédito si les sirve porque les ayuda a comprar mayor cantidad de hilo y con este poder elaborar más huipiles, independientemente si sus clientes le pagan o no a tiempo.

Este grupo de señoras que cargan una bella sonrisa todos lados merecen una oportunidad de salir adelante como empresarias. Por medio de este crédito esta oportunidad se les puede brindar.

loans.use: To purchase thread for making traditional costumes

loans.name: Ruth Hortencia

texts.es:
Ruth, who is 34 years old and single, works together with her mother who is a nurse in their own office located inside of their home. Ruth is a surgeon with specialization in pediatrics and chiropractics. She also has an office in the SAVI medical center and in a public medical center specialized in chiropractics. Competition is low for this type of specialty as this requires specialized training. Ruth has many private patients and also sees various children on a daily basis on the SAVI hospital in her community. The following request is to pay for the legal transactions required to open her new office in the community. This is Ruth’s third loan with the institution and the time of their business relationship demonstrates that she is a responsible person who is punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Ruth de 34 años de edad, es una persona soltera y trabaja junto a su madre que es enfermera en su consultorio personal que se encuentra instaldo en su domicilio. Ruth es médico cirujano con especialización en pediatría y quiropráctica. También tiene consultorios en el centro médico SAVI y en el centro médico de bienestar social especializado en quiropráctica. La competencia es baja en este tipo de especialidad, ya que se requiere de mano de obra especializada para este servicio. Ruth tiene muchos pacientes particulares y también atiende a varios niños en forma diaria en el centro SAVI de su localidad. La presente solicitud es para pagar los trámites legales que implican la instalación de su nuevo consultorio en la comunidad. Esta es la tercera secuencia de Ruth con la institución y en el tiempo de relación comercial demostró ser una persona esponsable y puntual con sus pagos.

loans.use: Conclusion of transactions to open a new doctor’s office

loans.name: Cao Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Cao Thi L., 51 years old, joined TYM Fund in 1997. Two of her children already got married. She lives with her husband and three other children. Their main jobs are farming and breeding animals. The types of animals she breeds are also varied: chickens, ducks, pigs, geese, and buffaloes, depending on each season, the condition of the economy, and the local weather. Since investing in the farm brings good profit, each year Ms. L. is able to borrow more money from TYM Fund. On average, her income from breeding animals is about 2000 USD per year. Her three children are working and helping her whenever she finds difficulty with the repayments. This coming loan cycle, Ms. L. applies for a loan of 625USD to buy more ducks, chickens, and their food.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Cao Thị Liên, 51 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 1997. 2 người con đã có gia đình riêng, chị Liên sống cùng chồng và 3 con. Công việc chủ yếu của gia đình là làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Loại hình chăn nuôi cũng rất đa dạng: gà, vịt, lợn, ngan, trâu tùy mùa vụ và tình hình kinh tế, thời tiết của địa phương. Đầu tư chăn nuôi có hiệu quả, số vốn vay từ Quỹ tăng dần lên qua các năm. Bình quân thu nhập từ chăn nuôi của chị Liên khoảng 2000USD/năm. 3 con của chị đều đi làm và hỗ trợ mẹ mỗi khi có khó khăn. Vòng vốn sắp tới chị Liên làm đơn xin vay 625USD để mua thêm vịt, gà và thức ăn gia súc.

loans.use: Buy ducks, chickens

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Pham Thi M., 54 years old, joined TYM Fund in 2006. Two out of her four children are still living in the house. All of them, however, get their jobs. Before, Mrs. M. and her husband worked at the village's engineering office. When the place disintegrated, Mrs. M. discussed with her husband to borrow money and open their own small shop and use their existing skills. Their business turned out very good. Each month Mrs. M. earned 150 USD from selling iron doors and the farming machines. Besides, she also breeds pigs and chickens, and sells coffins. In order to open the scope of her shop, Mrs. M. wants to borrow 625USD to buy more iron.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phan Thị M., 54 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình thương năm 2006. 2 trong số 4 người con của chị M. hiện vẫn sống cùng bố mẹ. Các cháu đều đã đi làm. Trước đây chị M. cùng chồng làm ở hợp tác xã cơ khí của địa phương. Khi hợp tác xã giải thể, chị M. bàn với chồng vay vốn mở xưởng phát huy tay nghề sẵn có. Công việc diễn ra rất thuận lợi, mỗi tháng chị thu nhập khoảng 150USD từ bán cửa sắt, máy tuốt lúa. Ngoài ra chị M. cũng chăn nuôi lợn gà và bán quan tài. Với mong muốn mở rộng thêm quy mô của xưởng, chị M. vừa làm đơn xin vay 625USD mua sắt làm hàng.

loans.use: Buy iron

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi N., 43 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2006. Her family has 4 members: 2 parents and 2 children. At first, she used the borrowed money to buy mussels and sold them to the restaurants. Because she lives near the river, her business went very well. Every month, she profitted 130 USD. During these recent years, she borrows more money to buy iron and alluminum to make metal goods. Her business is going well, and during busy times, she has to hire more workers. Her average annual income is 2500 USD. She hopes to borrow more money to expand her business. This time, she wants to borrow 625 USD to buy iron and alluminum to make general carriers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Ngọ, 43 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2006. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con. Thời gian đầu chị Ngọ vay vốn thu mua hến cung cấp cho các nhà hàng. Sống gần sông nên việc thu mua hến rất thuận lợi. Mỗi tháng chị cũng lãi được khoảng 130USD. Vài năm gần đây, chị vay những mức vốn lớn mua sắt nhôm làm cơ khí. Công việc thuận lợi, vào những thời điểm đông khách, chị Ngọ phải thuê từ 2 đến 3 nhân công cùng làm. Hàng năm tổng thu nhập của gia đình đạt 2500USD. Mong muốn của chị là được vay những mức vốn lớn để mở rộng kinh doanh. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 625USD mua sắt, nhôm chế tạo xe thô sơ dùng chở vật liệu.

loans.use: Buy iron, aluminium

loans.name: Abiba Essowodona

texts.fr:
Mrs. Abiba Essowodona K. was born in 1954 in Lome. She is the mother of six (06) children. She currently runs a small grocery store in the neighborhood of Tokoin-Forever in Lomé. She would like to build up a consequential stock of merchandise to be able to cope with the ever-increasing demand of her customers. Thus, she is requesting a loan. She is a very courageous woman and very determined but faces financial limitations.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Abiba Essowodona K. est née en 1954 à Lomé. Mère de six (06) enfants, elle tient actuellement une boutique d’alimentation générale dans le quartier Tokoin-Forever à Lomé. Pour constituer un stock important de marchandises en vue de faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante de ses clients, elle sollicite un financement. C’est une femme très courageuse et très volontaire, mais qui est financièrement très limitée.

loans.use:
To build up a consequential stock of merchandise.

Constituer un stock important de marchandises

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es:
Rosendo is 47 years old and his family is composed of his children and his wife who is a homemaker. Rosendo has two sources of income as he is a mason and he also receives rent from a motorcycle. He works in Portachuelo and in the surrounding areas of this community and, at the same time, receives a daily rent for renting his motorcycle in this same area. Little competition exists in this field as the majority of the masons left to work outside of the community, which is why he has never lacked work and has a high demand for his services. The price of his services varies depending on the job y if he is paid my project or a daily wage and simultaneously receives a daily rent of Bs. 25.-. He does not have any negative credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Rosendo de 47 años de edad cuenta con una familia conformada por sus hijos y esposa que se dedica a las labores de casa. Rosendo tiene dos fuentes de ingresos ya que es albañil y también recibe renta de una moto. Trabaja en Portachuelo y en los alrededores de esta localidad y paralelemente recibe una renta diaria por el alquiler de su moto en la misma población. Existe muy poca competencia en este rubro ya que la mayoría de los albañiles se fueron a trabajas al exterior y por esta razón nunca le falta trabajo tiene alta demanda por sus servicios. El precio de sus servicios varia dependiendo de la obra y si esta es vendida o por jornal diario y paralelamente recibe una renta diaria de Bs. 25.-. No tiene antecedentes crediticios negativos.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Duong Thi N., 38 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2006. Her family has 4 members: 2 parents and 2 children who are still going to school. Her husband is a motorbike-taxi driver and she sells fruits. Every day she sells fruits in 2 different markets, earning 4-5 USD/ day. Her activity takes lots of effort but it helps her covering her children’s school tuition. Her husband also helps her whenever she is in difficulties. Therefore, joining the Fund is very convenient for her. This time, Mrs. N. wants to borrow 575 USD to buy more fruits.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Dương Thị N., 38 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2006. Gia đình chị gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Chồng chạy xe ôm còn chị N. buôn bán hoa quả. Mỗi ngày chị bán hàng tại 2 chợ khác nhau, thu nhập bình quân 4-5USD/ngày. Công việc tuy vất vả nhưng giúp chị N. có điều kiện cho 2 con ăn học tử tế. Chồng chị cũng luôn hỗ trợ vợ mỗi khi có khó khăn nên việc tham gia Quỹ đối với chị rất thuận lợi. Vòng vốn tới chị N. xin vay 575USD mua thêm hoa quả bán.

loans.use: Buy fruits

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi D., 57 years old, is the fifth member of TYM Fund. Her children are all grown-up and building their own family. Only her youngest child is still attending university. Before, Mrs. D. used the borrowed money to buy material (sedge) to weave mats. This activity brought her a stable income and was also very convenient for repaying weekly. During these recent years, Mrs. D. sells sedge mats to improve her income. Now, she is owning a motorbike, and is free from worries about tuition for her youngest child. Her average income is 220 USD/month. This time, Mrs. D. wants to borrow 950 USD to buy sedge and mats.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị D., 57 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 5 của Quỹ Tình thương. Con cái chị đều đã trưởng thành và có gia đình, chỉ còn người con út học đại học. Các vòng vốn trước chị D. vay vốn về mua nguyên liệu (cói) để dệt chiếu. Công việc này mang lại cho chị một nguồn thu ổn định và rất thuận lợi cho việc hoàn trả tuần. Trong những năm gần đây, chị D. còn buôn bán chiếu để nâng cao thu nhập. Qua các vòng vốn chị D. đã mua được xe máy, con chị cũng không còn phải lo lắng khi xin tiền đóng học phí. Thu nhập hàng tháng hiện nay của chị khoảng 220USD. Vòng vốn tới chị D. xin vay 950USD mua cói và chiếu về bán.

loans.use: Buy sedge and mats

loans.name: Salamatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Salamatou A. was born in 1957; she is married to a carpenter and is the mother of seven (07) children. She sells wood coal. She alone provides financial support for the family and she fights day and night to see her trade flourish. Unfortunately, she is limited by financial constraints and needs financial support. This is why she is requesting a loan to strengthen her business.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1957, madame Salamatou A. est mariée à un menuisier et mère de sept (07) enfants. Elle est revendeuse de charbons de bois. Elle porte sur elle seule tout le poids des charges familiales et se bat nuit et jour pour faire prospérer son commerce. Malheureusement elle est financièrement limitée et nécessite un appui financier. C’est pourquoi elle demande un crédit pour renforcer son commerce.

loans.use:
Purchase and sell of wood coal

Achat et vente de charbons de bois

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Kiên is 49 years old. She is a participating member of TYM since 2003. She has had 5 rounds of loans already. She uses all her loans to buy sedge to weave mats. Her family living condition has considerably improved: she has been able to buy the goods for her household including a tv set. Since this type of business brings her cash flow, it makes it easy for her to make the weekly payment. Her income is around 250 USD a month. She also produces sedge herself on her own field. This is why she has to renew the soil once in a while. This time she is requesting 500 USD to buy sedge and fertilizer for her field.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Kiên, 49 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Qua 5 vòng vốn vay, hầu hết chị Kiên đều đầu tư mua cói dệt chiếu. Kinh tế gia đình phát triển rõ rệt, chị Kiên đã mua sắm được ti vi, tủ cùng nhiều đồ đạc trong gia đình. Việc hoàn trả của chị cũng rất thuận lợi nhờ có thu nhập thường xuyên. Trung bình một tháng chị Kiên thu được 250USD từ bán chiếu. Để có nguyên liệu tốt làm chiếu thì sau 1 vài vụ thu hoạch phải cải tạo lại đất, đầu tư chăm bón. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 500USD để cải tạo đồng cói và đầu tư chăm bón. Bên cạnh đó chị cũng mua cói làm nguyên liệu dệt.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, sedge

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery works selling meat in a neighborhood store and also offers a variety of other food products. Rosmery rents her home and has one son who totally depends on her as she is a single mother. She has worked in this activity for more than 4 years now and therefore has a lot of experience in this field. She has some competition, but the place where she works is well known and she takes orders from clients as well as travels to villages. The current request is to increase her merchandise. In the coming days, due to inflation, she will have to increase the price of her goods, which will vary between Bs. 0.30 and Bs. 19.-. Rosmery has a loan from another institution but she has demonstrated accountability in both.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr:
Mr. Daniel K. was born in 1974 in Lomé where he currently lives. He abandoned his schooling early on, and began an apprenticeship as an upholsterer. He is currently practicing this trade with great difficulty. He is married and the father of 1 child. He is applying for a loan to buy tools for his work and raw material that he will use to practice his trade.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Daniel K. est né en 1974 à Lomé où il réside actuellement. Ayant très tôt abandonné ses études, il entre en apprentissage comme tapissier ; métier qu’il exerce actuellement avec beaucoup de difficultés. Il est marié et père d’un (01) enfant. Il sollicite un prêt pour acheter ses outils de travail et les matières qu’il utilise dans l’exercice de son activité.

loans.use:
Purchase of tools for the trade

Achat de materiels de travail

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Trần Thị Cảnh is 55 years old. She is a 4th year member of TYM fund. She has a big family and they rely on the fishing as their source of income. Fishing is a good business, it can provide her family a steady income. Since she joins TYM, her family living condition has improved a lot. Her family income is at 180 USD a month. She also farm her rice paddy and raises livestock. Since the fishing equipment is old, it limits their ability to fish. She is requesting 750 USD to buy a new boat and a motor.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Cảnh, 55 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 4 của Quỹ Tình thương. Là một gia đình thuộc vùng giáo dân, lại đông con nhưng có nghề phụ là đánh cá sông nên cuộc sống cũng no đủ. Nghề cá vừa đảm bảo được nguồn thức ăn cho gia đình lại có thu nhập ổn định, thường xuyên, thuận tiện cho việc hoàn trả hàng tuần. Tham gia vào tham gia Quỹ, có thêm nguồn vốn và biết sử dụng hiệu quả nên kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển rõ rệt. Mỗi tháng thu nhập bình quân từ nghề cá khoảng 180USD. Ngoài ra chị Cảnh còn làm ruộng và chăn nuôi. Thời gian gần đây các đồ nghề đều cũ nên việc đánh bắt cũng bị hạn chế. Vòng vốn này chị Cảnh xin vay 750USD để mua 1 chiếc thuyền và máy mới.

loans.use: Buy fishing boat

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Trần Thị Cộng, 52, participates in TYM fund since 2003. Her husband passed away so she had to take care of her 4 children by herself. She was relying on her husband's salary but since his death, life has become very difficult for her financially. Her children attend higher education so the expenses are high. She was determined to provide a good education to her children no matter what so she has contracted a loan to open a small farm supply store selling fertilizer. Her life slowly becomes easier with time, 3 of her children have graduated from university and they all have a steady job. Today, Mrs Cộng is still getting loans from TYM to get her youngest child through university. Lately people start farming a lot so her business has picked up. She needs to replenish her inventory so she is requesting 825 USD. Her income is 180 USD a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Cộng, 52 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Chồng mất, gia đình chị Cộng chỉ còn 5 mẹ con. Trước đây việc nuôi con ăn học đều nhờ lương chồng nên cũng thuận lợi. Sau khi anh qua đời, cuộc sống trở nên vất vả đối với chị Cộng vì các con đều học cao, chi phí lớn. Với nỗ lực vượt qua mọi khó khăn vì tương lai các con, chị vay vốn mở một chiếc quán nhỏ bán đạm lân và thuốc sâu. Cuộc sống dần trở nên ổn định, đến nay 3 con của chị đã tốt nghiệp đại học, cao đẳng và có công ăn việc làm tử tế. Hiện nay chị Cộng vẫn tiếp tục vay vốn kinh doanh để lo cho người con út ăn học. Vào thời điểm này lúa đang làm đòng cần nhiều phân bón nên chị Cộng đề nghị xin vay 825USD lấy thêm hàng về phục vụ nhân dân. Thu nhập hiện nay của chị là 180USD.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Corazon De Oro Ii Group

texts.es:
The women that belong to the communal bank Corazon de Oro II are from a remote community called El Jaibalito, which is located on the shores of Atitlan Lake. This town is far from other villages. Access roads are limited and you can only get there by boat since the uneven terrain does not allow for the construction of a road.

The people of El Jaibalito are traditional, and as you can see in the photo all the women wear the native traditional garb. Except for one woman who speaks Spanish, the rest of the women only speak Maya Tzutujil. This language is only spoken on the shores of Atitlan Lake and part of the Guatemalan coast.

All the women in this group are weavers. They will use their loan to purchase thread, which they will weave into elaborate traditional textiles on a traditional waist loom. You can also find women that participate in this communal bank that invest their loan in raising game and many of them also work in construction. Women work as part of the work force involved in the construction of buildings in Jaibalito.

The women believe that the loan they are getting will help them expand their business. The lack of funds doesn’t allow them to buy the raw materials necessary to make the products that are asked of them. This problem could easily be solved with the loan that they will be given.

Members of Corazon de Oro II like working together because they know each other and where their partners live and they trust each other. The size of the loan is small. Many women are asking for similar loans and this similarity helps group consolidation because they are all at the same level.

These women deserve the opportunity to secure this loan and expand their business. Support them!

Translated from Spanish by Sandy Juárez, Kiva volunteer.

Las señoras que pertenecen al banco comunal Corazón de Oro II provienen de una retirada comunidad llamada el Jaibalito, que está ubicada a las orillas del lago Atitlán. Esta comunidad esta aislada del resto de pueblos aledaños. Sus vías de acceso son muy limitadas, solo se puede llegar por lancha ya que la accidentada geografía del lugar no permite que una buena carretera sea construida.

La gente del Jaibalito es muy tradicional. Como se puede ver en la foto todas las mujeres visten sus bellos trajes tradicionales oriundos del lugar. Ellas, excepto una señora que sabe el español, hablan exclusivamente el Maya Tzutujil. Este idioma solo se habla a las orillas del lago Atitlán y en una parte de la costa de Guatemala.

En este grupo todas las señoras son tejedoras. Ellas van a invertir su crédito en la compra de hilos para elaborar tejidos tradicionales en un telar de cintura. En este banco comunal se encuentran señoras que también invierten su crédito en la crianza de animales. Asimismo, muchas de ellas trabajan en construcción. Las mujeres trabajan como mano de obra en las construcciones que se llevan acabo en el Jaibalito.

Ellas piensan que el capital que están sacando las va ha ayudar a expandir su negocio. Esto se debe a que por falta de ingresos ellas no pueden comprar la materia prima que necesitan para elaborar los productos que a ellas les demandan. Este problema se resuelve fácilmente con el crédito que se les va a otorgar.

A las integrantes de Corazon de Oro II les gusta trabajar juntas porque se conocen bien, sabe donde viven sus compañeras y se tienen confianza. Además, el rango del préstamo es muy limitado. Muchas mujeres están solicitando préstamos similares, esta similitud ayuda a que el grupo se consolide porque todas las señoras están en el mismo nivel.

Estas señoras merecen la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito y de esa expandir su negocio. ¡Apóyenlas!

loans.use: To purchase threads for weaving and animals for raising game.

loans.name: Sylvana

texts.fr:
Mrs. Sylvana A. was born in 1966 in Lomé. She is married to a trader and the mother of three children. She is a seamstress by training and would like to have a loan to rent a workshop and buy another sewing machine. A very good designer and very honest, she is highly sought after by those living in her neighborhood to make their clothes.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Sylvana A. est née en 1966 à Lomé, elle s’est mariée à un commerçant, et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle est couturière de formation et désire avoir un prêt pour loyer un atelier et acheter une autre machine de couture. Bonne couturière et très honnête elle est très convoitée par les habitants de son quartier pour la confection de leurs vêtements.

loans.use: Rental of a workshop and purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
This group is maD. up of 12 people, all of whom are women. The group’s name comes from the members’ devotion to the Virgin of Guadalupe. All of the members with the exception of a few live in the Central Pampahasi zone and two people live in the San Antonio Bajo zone which is located 22 blocks from the aforementioned neighborhood. This group is well consolidated as they previously worked together in other groups, which is why they know each other very well. Their purpose is the growth of each one of their businesses and many of them work in food sales. A clear example is the secretary, Maria Roxana Fernández Avendaño, who is located in the middle of the photograph dressed in light blue. She has a restaurant where she sells around 30 lunches per day. All of these women are hopeful that this money lent will help them achieve their daily goals.

Name of business, type of business and experience in years: Carla Alexandra O. A., Crafts and jewelry sales, 12 years of experience; Patricia H. A., Food sales, 5 years; Melba Roxana C. V. D. A, Neighborhood Store, 5 years; Teresa Cacilda B. B., Employee at a Public Telephone Station, 5 years; Paola H. A. F., Sale of Electronic Products, 5 years; Lucia Yovana S. D. C., Small business employee, 2 years; Yaquelin Lisbeth B. M., Distribution of food staples, 5 years; Maria Roxana F. Avendaño, Hotel employee, 3 years; Evelin Fatima P. C., Hotel employee, 2 years; Elizabeth C. H., Book store employee, 2 years; Zulma S. M., Candy Sales, 4 years; Salome G. D. C., Sale of Compact Discs, 27 years.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Este grupo está conformado por 12 personas 100% del grupo mujeres. El nombre del grupo viene D. las mismas socias por devoción a la virgencita D. Guadalupe. Todas las socias a excepción D. algunas viven en la zona D. Pampahasi central y dos personas viven en las zona San Antonio Bajo, que se encuentra a unas 22 cuadras D. la zona mencionada. El Grupo esta bien consolidado ellas anteriormente trabajaron con otras entidades y por lo cual se conocen muy bien. Su propósito D. ellas es el crecimiento D. cada uno D. sus negocios, muchas D. ellas se dedican a la venta D. comida. Un claro ejemplo es la secretaria Dña. Maria Roxana Fernández Avendaño que se encuentra en la fotografía en la parte central vestida D. celeste, ella tiene una pensión donD. venD. alrededor D. 30 almuerzos al día. Todas señoras esperanzadas D. que este dinero prestado es para la meta establecida del día a día. Nombre del socio Actividad Experiencia en años O. A. CARLA ALEXANDRA ARTESANIA Y VENTA D. JOYAS 12 H. A. PATRICIA ATENCION D. PENSION 5 C. V. D. APAZA MELBA ROXANA TIENDA D. BARRIO 5 B. B. TERESA CACILDA ATENCION D. PUNTO VIVA 5 H. A. F. PAOLA VENTA D. PRODUCTOS ELECTRONICO 5 S. D. C. LUCIA YOVANA ATENCION D. COMERCIAL 2 B. M. YAQUELIN LISBETH REPARTO D. VIVERES 5 F. A. MARIA ROXANA ATENCION D. PENSIOS 3 P. C. EVELIN FATIMA ATENCION D. PENSION 2 C. H. ELIZABETH ATENCION D. LIBRERIA 2 S. M. ZULMA VENTA D. DULCES 4 G. D. C. SALOME VENTA D. CDS 27

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Adjoagan Lucienne

texts.fr:
Born in 1951 in Lomé, Mrs. Adjoagan Lucienne A. is separated from her husband who began taking additional wives twenty years ago. Since then she has been taking care of her children by herself with her small grocery and basic goods business. She is seeking financing to expand the size of her business and to stock food products in bulk to better satisfy her customer demand. This will allow her to increase her income in order to better take care of her children.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1951 à Lomé, madame Adjoagan Lucienne A. s’est séparé de son mari qui est devenu polygame il y a de cela 20 ans. Depuis lors elle a pris soin de ses enfants seuls avec son petit commerce produits alimentaires de premières nécessités. Elle sollicite un fonds de financement pour agrandir la taille de son commerce et s’approvisionner en grande quantité en produits alimentaires et mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître ses revenus afin de mieux s’occuper de ses enfants.

loans.use: Retail of grocery products

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria S. started the business when she stopped working. At that time, her son was 4 years old, and she did not have enough money because they could not cover all the expenses with her husband’s income. For this reason, she started to sell beauty products to her neighbors and acquaintances by catalogue 15 years ago.

She now needs a loan of $600 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can purchase more merchandise and host a beauty product party, which will help her increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria S. inicio el negocio cuando dejo de trabajar, el dinero no alcanzaba y en aquel tiempo su hijo tenia 4 años, con el sueldo de su esposo no completaban para solventar todos los gastos, por tal motivo se puso a vender productos de belleza por catalogos. Comenzo hace 15 años comprando los catalogos y asi empezo a vender entre sus vecinos y conocidos.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mas mercancia y realizar una demostracion, la cual le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Farah Janeth

texts.es:
Farah is a married mother of a 7-year-old son. She started the business when she stopped working and therefore did not have enough money. Furthermore, her husband was unemployed at that time, so she started to sell cosmetics by catalogue 5 years ago. Currently, in addition to selling beauty products, she also sells home products by catalogue, which yields her greater profits.

She is requesting a loan of $600.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can purchase merchandise and host a cosmetics party since this business strategy always boosts sales. With your support, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Farah esta casada y tiene un hijo de 7 años. Inicio el negocio cuando dejo de trabajar y el dinero no alcanzaba, ademas su esposo se habia quedado sin empleo, entonces ella empezo a vender cosmeticos por catalogo y desde entonces sigue vendiendo, su negocio lo emprendio hace 5 años, ahora ademas de los productos de belleza vende productos para el hogar tambien por catalogo, lo que le da mejores ganancias.

Ella solicita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia para realizar una demostracion, ya que esta estrategia siempre le da buenas ventas. Con tu apoyo esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr:
Married and the mother of one child, Mrs. Véronique V. was born in 1960. She currently lives in the N’kafu neighborhood and is a retailer of fruit and tapioca porridge, which is made from cassava. Her husband is a tire mechanic and doesn’t manage to fully meet the family’s needs. She would like to have a loan to supply her stock of fruits, tapioca, and milk. This will allow her to better satisfy her customers and increase her income to contribute more to household costs.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariée et mère d’un enfant, madame Véronique V. est née en 1960. Elle habite actuellement le quartier N’kafu et est revendeuse de fruits et de bouillie de « Tapioca », un produit à base de manioc. Son mari est vulcanisateur et n’arrive pas à faire face totalement aux besoins de la famille. Elle désire avoir un prêt pour faire le stock des fruits, de « Tapioca » et du lait. Ceci lui permettra de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et accroître ses revenus pour plus contribuer aux charges du foyer.

loans.use: Preparation and sale of porridge and fruit

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Mrs. Massan T. was born in 1969 and is married and the mother of three children. She is a retailer of general medicines, basic goods, and gas which she sells alongside the road under the sun. Conscious of the danger that sun exposure poses to drugs, she would like to have financing in order to open a kiosk to shelter her products from the sun and to fix up her gas business.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame Massan T. née en 1969, est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants. Elle est revendeuse de médicament et produits génériques et de pétrole qu’elle expose au bord de la route sous le soleil. Consciente du danger des rayons solaires sur les médicaments, elle désire avoir un financement pour ouvrir un kiosque pour mettre ses produits à l’abri du soleil et mieux installer son commerce de pétrole.

loans.use: Open a kiosk to sell medicine and basic goods

loans.name: Félicia

texts.fr:
Separated from her husband who has multiple wives, Mrs. Félicia A. lives with her five children in Lomé’s East Tokoin neighborhood. She was born in 1960 and has a small space to serve food and sell sandwiches. She would like a loan to build a kiosk from which to sell the sandwiches. She is energetic and a good manager of her business.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Séparé de son mari qui est polygamme, madame Félicia A. vit avec ses cinq (05) enfants à Lomé au quartier Tokoin Est. Elle est née en 1960 et détient une petite place de restauration et de vente de pain sandwich. Elle aimerait avoir un crédit pour construire un kiosque pour vendre des sandwichs. Elle est dynamique et a une bonne gestion de son activité.

loans.use: build a kiosk to sell sandwiches

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Mrs. Maritza R. D. comes from the city of Bluefields, she is married to Mr. Calixto Sanchez and they have 3 children who are minors. Since two years ago, Mrs. R. sells coal. Her clients are the people that live in her community who also prefer her because she offers delivery service. Mrs. R. has difficulty with buying coal during winter since it is scarce. At this time, she doesn't have the necessary capital which will enbale her to buy the product. For that reason, she needs to buy 70 sacks of coal now at a cost of $2.86 each, so she can supply and offer it to her customers during winter.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. Maritza R. Dávila es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, esta casada con el Sr. Calixto Sánchez ambos tienen 3 hijos menores de edad. La Sra. R. vende carbón desde hace dos años, teniendo como clientes a los habitantes de su barrio que la prefieren por brindar un servicio a domicilio. La Sra. R. tiene dificultades de comprar carbón en el invierno ya que se escasea el carbón y en estos momentos no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder comprar el producto por esta razón necesita en estos momentos comprar 70 sacos de carbón a $ 2.86 dólares cada saco, para poder ofertar su producto en el invierno.

loans.use: Buying 70 sacks of coal.

payments.comment: La cuota real es de $ 16.67 dolares
La cuota real de pago es de $ 16.67 dólares

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Khady lives in a suburb of the town of Mbour. She began her little business selling fried dough with an initial loan of 50000 f cfa (about US$ 120). Two further loans of about US$ 360 and $600 allowed her to purchase a refrigerator so as to sell ice and then to begin to sell breakfast (coffee and sandwiches).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Khady habite dans un quartier périphérique de la ville de Mbour .Elle débute ses activités par la vente de beignets avec un premier pret de 50000 f cfa.Deux autres prets successifs de 150000 f cfa et 250.000f cfa lui ont permis d'acheter un réfrigirateur pour vendre de la glace et de commencer aussi la vente petit déjeuner (café, sandwich).

loans.use:
business capital

Fonds de Roulement

loans.name: Mawo

texts.fr:
Mawo sells telephone accessories and other electronics products. He has set himself up in the central market of Mbour. With this loan, he is counting on being able to expand his business to meet the high demand for his goods.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

MAWO s' active dans la vente des produits éléctroniques accessoires de téléphone ,et autres matériels éléctroniques.il est établi au marché central de MBOUR. Avec ce pret il compte renforcer ses activités pour povoir faire face à la forte demende

loans.use:
business capital

Fonds de commerce

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for UIMCEC, a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Fabril Group

texts.es:
The Fabril community bank is maD. up of 13 women who have the same goal: to grow. As this is their first lending cycle, they have just begun to establish and improve their micro-enterprise. Ruth is the group’s president and lives near the May 18 neighborhood, where the rest of the women live.

The bank member's names, activities, and years of experience are listed here:

C. M. NEISA - Health Supplements Promotion, 4 years

F. M. ROSA - Bakery, 3 years

F. S. ANA KARINA- Herbalife Promotion, 1 year

J. A. ILARIA - Beauty salon, 15 years

K. D. V. RUTH - Seamstress, 17 years

M. V. ANALIA - Artisan, 2 years

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Juan's Group

texts.en:
Juan is the leader of this amazing group of entrepreneurs, and they are now applying for their second loan with Esperanza. Juan is 24 years old and lives with his wife, Rosa, and their newborn baby girl. He has owned a small grocery store in his community for about three years but has been able to improve and expand his business significantly since his first loan. Juan wants to work hard to provide a better future for his new daughter. On weekends he likes to take his family to the beach or just spend quiet time in their house.

Thank you for your support!

loans.use: To buy vegetables, rice, oil, and other inventory for a small grocery store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
Hilario is 61 years old and works as a fruit grower and vendor in the community of Tacobamba, where he maintains fields producing a wide variety of fruits. Just as soon as Hilario picks the fruits, he sells them in the city markets. Hilario owns his house and lives with his wife and children. He has lived in Sahapaqui for 60 years and has 35 years of experience in this sector. Competition in the sector is mitigated by Hilario’s experience and his care for his clients. Hilario needs capital to till his fields and to purchase fertilizer which will improve his harvest when yield is high. Hilario grows the following fruits: “peramota,” gray pear, peach, apricot, pear and plum. Hilario has a good credit history and has no other debts.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Hilario tiene 61 años de edad, se dedica a la producción y venta de frutas. Hilario radica en la comunidad de Tacobamba que es donde tiene su terreno donde produce una gran variedad de frutas las cuales una vez las cosecha las vende en los mercados de la ciudad. La casa de Hilario es propia y vive junto a su familia que esta conformada por su esposa e hijos, Hilario vive en la localidad de Sahapaqui desde hace 60 años. Hilario tiene una experiencia en este rubro de 35 años. Si bien existe competencia en el rubro la misma se minimiza con la experiencia y el buen trato que Hilario da a sus clientes. Requiere capital para la remosión de sus tierras y para la compra de abono que es lo que le ayuda a tener una mejor cosecha en la época de mejor producción. Las frutas que planta son peramota, pera gris, durazno, damasco, pera y ciruelo. Hilario tiene buenos antecedentes crediticios y no reporta otros créditos en la central de riesgos.

loans.use: Capital for growing fruit

loans.name: Mary Scorly

texts.es:
Mary is 27 years old and has a sales counter on a busy avenue between Figueroa and Murillo Streets -- a central area. At her counter she sells leather wallets and cases for mobile phones and cameras. Mary lives in her parents’ house. For 9 years she has focused on making and selling leather goods. Although there is some competition in this sales field, thanks to her experience Mary has a solid client base. In addition, her sales counter is in a strategic location because people in the neighborhood tend to be more affluent. Mary has no negative credit history.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Mary tiene 27 años de edad, tiene un puesto de venta en plena Avenida entre las calles Figueroa y Murillo, esta es una zona central, en su puesto vende billeteras de cuero y también fundas para celulares y cámaras fotográficas. Mary vive en la casa de sus padres y desde hace 9años su actividad principal es la producción y comercialización de articulos de cuero. Si bien existe competencia en su rubro, ella debido a su experiencia ya cuenta con clientela fija, además que el lugar es estrategico porque la afluencia de gente es elevada. Mary no tiene antecedentes negativos en el sistema financiero.

loans.use: Purchase of leather and retail zippers

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
Mariana owns her house, which is equipped with all the modern amenities. She lives with her 8-year-old daughter, who is studying at a business school. Mariana promotes cosmetics and jewelry and makes sales by special order. She has a solid client base and three years’ experience in the field. There is some competition in this sales field, but Mariana owes her success to her good relationships with her clients and the way she presents her products’ new features. This loan request is for the purchase of a line of products from Yanbal, Avon and Ebel, which Mariana will buy wholesale to be able to offer better prices. Mariana also has a good credit history.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Mariana tiene una casa propia que esta dotada de todos los servicios básicos, vive junto a su hija que tiene 8 años de edad que actualmente está estudiando en una escuela fiscal. Mariana trabaja como promotora de cosméticos y joyas realizando ventas a pedido, cuenta con clientela segura y experiencia de tres años en el rubro. Existe competencia en el rubro, sin embargo el éxito radica en su buen relacionamiento con su clientela y la presentación de novedades en sus articulos. La presente solicitud es para la adquisición de productos de la línea Yanbal, Avon, Ebel que los compra al por mayor con precios de oferta. Tiene buenos antecedentes crediticios.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetic products

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura is married and lives with her husband and her four children (ages 22, 18, 12 and 7) in the house they own. Her three youngest children are studying in business schools and her oldest daughter is studying in Spain. Maura has a food sales counter in El Carmen market and her husband operates a motor taxi throughout the area. Each has 5 years of experience doing this work. Although there is competition in food sales, Maura owes her success to her experience in the sector and more importantly the location of her business opposite the bus stop. She also sells food in the market and to retirees. A full lunch costs 8 Bolivares (just over $1) and extra or special dishes cost 15-20 Bolivares (approximately $2-$3). She will use the requested loan to purchase ingredients for her business, which she can get at wholesale prices in the Villa Verde market. Maura and her husband have an excellent credit history.

Translated by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva volunteer

Maura es una señora casada y vive en su casa propia junto a su espos y suscuatro hijos de 22, 18. 12 y 7 años respectivamente, de los cuales los tres menores estudian en escuelas fiscales y la mayor está trabajando en España. Maura cuenta con un puesto de comidas en el mercado El Carmen y su esposo cuenta con una moto que la trabaja como mototaxi en rutas locales, ambos cuentan con una experiencia de 5 años. Existe competencia el rubro, sin embargo el éxito de Maura se concentra en la experiencia que tiene en el rubro y sobre todo por su ubicación que es al frente de la parada de micros. También vende comidas en el mismo mercado y a pensionados, el almuerzo completo vale Bs. 8.- y los platos extras o especiales de Bs. 15.- a Bs. 20.-. Sus compras las realizará con el presente prestamo comprará insumos para su puesto los cuales los compra a diferente precios en el mercado de Villa Verde al por mayor. Tanto Maura como su esposo tienen excelentes antecedentes crediticios.

loans.use: Compra de moto

loans.name: Ester Jiret Group

texts.en:
Yesenia is a funny and bright-eyed woman who lives with her husband and sonin the community of Los Alcarrizzos. She runs a small business out of her home selling curtains, sheets and a cloth home accessory that is very popular in the Dominican Republic. She has requested this loan to buy a few new kinds of fabric which are new to the area, but which she knows will be a hit with existing and new customers. Because summer is beginning, when the heat is often unbearable, people want materials that are bright, beautiful, and which help block the sun from their homes, and Yesenia plans to use this loan to buy material that will fit this need perfectly.

She hopes that this money will help her and her husband improve their lives enough so they can afford three meals a day, and so that their son has the opportunity to grow up in health and happiness. She hopes that the boy grows up to become not only a man of God, but a man who does well for he community. She herself hopes to always continue improving her life and business, and when asked what challenges she faces in her life, replied with a simple "Yo puedo," brushing off the idea that something might keep her down, and saying matter-o- factly, “I can.”

loans.use: To invest money in her home accessories business

loans.name: Desarrollo Comunitario Group

texts.en: Teresa is a very intelligent and hard-working woman who lives in the town of Samana with her three children, ages five, 14, and 15. She sells fried and baked bread outsiD. of her house, and hopes to expand her business. With this loan she plans to buy flour, coconut, and sugar, which she uses to make sweet bread. In her free time she attends church and spends time with her friends. She looks forward to being able to create a better future for herself and her family, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase flour, coconut, and sugar to make bread

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs. Mercedes is 52 years old, she is single and lives in the community of San Jose Oriental in the city of Managua, she has 3 children of 15, 18 and 20 years of age. Mrs. Mercedes prepares and sells tortillas, her business is called El Mana and has 10 years working on this activity, which she started with her own effort.

She is requesting the loan to acquire supplies to prepare tortillas to improve her business and be able to grow and get more profit and therefore improve her life and her children’s life and to teach them to work and have an honest life.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Mercedes tiene 52 años de edad, es soltera y habita en el barrio San José Oriental de la ciudad de Managua, tiene 3 hijos de 15, 18 y 20 años de edad. Doña Mercedes se dedica a la venta de tortillas, su negocio se llama El Maná y tiene 10 años de estar con esta actividad, la cual empezó con esfuerzo propio.

Requiere del préstamo para adquirir materia prima para la elaboración de tortillas para así poder fortalecer más su negocio y en un futuro poder agrandarlo más y explotarlo lo suficiente para generar más ganacias y así poder darles una mejor vida a sus hijos al mismo tiempo que les quiere enseñar a trabajar y a ganarse la vida de una forma honesta.

loans.use: To buy supplies to prepare tortillas / Comprar materia prima para la elaboración de sus tortillas

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadores (Hard Working Women) Group

texts.en:
Leoni is a 29 year old man who lives with his wife and three children in the suburb of Los Alcarrizzos on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo.  

He has a small business selling a variety of items such as motor parts, oil, gasoline and diesel by the quart, and a variety of other motor and electrical related appliances.  He has asked for this loan so that  he will be able to buy some new parts to offer his customers, instead of only being able to offer them used and repaired parts.  He hopes that with the extra income he is able to earn with this loan he will be able to save enough money he will be able to allow his children to continue going to school with enough pencils and notebooks to learn properly, and he hopes that he can finish building a strong home out of concrete blocks that will survive the strong hurricanes and tropical storms that hit them every year.

On behalf of Leoni and everyone here at Esperanza International, we thank you for supporting his dreams and goals!

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of more motor parts, oils, etc. for his business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Eugenio Alejandro

texts.es:
Mr. Eugenio is 42 years old, he is married and lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Norte, with his wife who is a stay at home mom and has 3 children of 2, 10 and 15 years old.

Mr. Eugenio is a welder and with the loan he wants to build a wall in front of his house to have more security for his family. His goals as the head of the household is to finish his house, to create good conditions for his children’s future, and provide them good education so they will be people of good will.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Eugenio tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y habita en el barrio Laureles Norte , su esposa es ama de casa y tienen tres hijos de 2,10 y 15 años de edad.

El Sr. Eugenio es soldador, y con el préstamo que le otorguen va a construir un muro en la parte de enfrente para tener más seguridad para su familia. Sus metas como padre de familia son terminar de hacer su casa, crearles a sus hijos las condiciones para un porvenir próspero, darles buena educación para que sean personas de bien.

loans.use: To build a division wall in front of his one room house / Construir muro perimetral en su casa de habitación

loans.name: Efrén Ulises

texts.es:
Since Efrén Ulises V. was very young he has been an agriculturalist. He has obtained a lot of experience in this business as he has always helped out a lot with the cultivation of crops in his home community of Condega, in Esteli. Now he is father to one child who is of school age, and this is his main motivation for working in agriculture. Nowadays e has managed to improve his family’s economic situation thanks to the help brought to him by Ceprodel through the credits that he has used directly for his agricultural business.

On this occasion Efren is looking for Ceprodel’s help so that he can benefit from technical assistance in his farming so that when harvest time comes around he can improve his economic situation. He has had two credits with Ceprodel and he has paid them in full and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Efrén Ulises V. desde muy joven se ha dedicado al negocio agropecuario habiendo alcanzado mucha experiencia en el negocio por el hecho de que siempre se ha destacado por tener destrezas en el trato de los cultivos en su comunidad en Condega de la ciudad de Estelí. Actualmente es padre de un niño en edad escolar el cual es el motivo de sus esfuerzos en el negocio agropecuario. Hoy en día ha logrado mejorar su condición económica y la de su familia gracias al apoyo único brindado por Ceprodel por medio de créditos que los ha utilizado directamente en el negocio agropecuario.

En esta ocasión el señor Efrén busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con el crédito que le permita dar asistencia técnica a sus cultivos para cuando llegue el momento de la cosecha mejorar aun mas su condición económica. Actualmente su record con Ceprodel es de 2 créditos pagados en tiempo y forma según lo establecido.

loans.use: Techinical assistance for farming/Asistencia técnica para cultivo

loans.name: Máximo Andrés

texts.es:
Maximo P. has been in farming for 15 years in the county of Condega, in the city of Esteli. Through his business he has been able to maintain his family which consists of his partner and their 4 kids, three of whom are school age so need his unconditional support.

Now Maximo needs to buy some young bulls so that he can raise them. This is why he needs a loan from Ceprodel; so that he can buy these bulls and feed them so that he can get the best price for them when he offers them to clients. It is very important to add that the main beneficiaries of this credit will be his partner and kids as much as him.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El caballero Máximo P. se dedica al negocio de la agricultura desde hace más de 15 años habiéndolo desempeñado en el municipio de Condega en la ciudad de Estelí. Por medio de su negocio ha logrado mantener a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y cuatro hijos de los cuales tres de ellos están en edad escolar y por tanto necesitan de su apoyo incondicional.

Hoy en día la necesidad del caballero Máximo es la pronta adquisición de los novillos para su respectiva crianza es por este motivo que muy sabiamente busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para llevar a cabo la compra de estos novillos los cuales al adquirirlos los alimentará para luego sacarle el máximo provecho ofreciéndolos a sus clientes. Es de suma importancia destacar que por medio de este crédito son beneficiados tanto el como su cónyuge e hijos.

loans.use: To buy young bulls to raise/Compra de novillos para desarrollo

loans.name: Mujeres En Progreso (Women In Progress) Group

texts.en:
Lourdes, the leader of this group, is a 35 year old woman who lives with her husband Felix, and two teenage-aged children in the community of L. Guaricanos in the Dominican Republic. Things in L. Guaricanos are often very difficult; consistent and well paying work is hard to come by, but the people live on the outskirts of the capital and as a result are forced to pay somewhat inflated prices for everything from food to school supplies, prices that most people simply cant keep up with.

Lourdes runs a small business selling dried flowers, scented candles, natural medicines and a few different chemicals to help treat skin problems. She normally sells these items to people who know about her business from her home, and will also walk the streets a few times a week. She has asked for this loan so that she can buy a new selection of candles—candles are always sin demand since the power goes out an average of two to three time each day. She would also like to expand the types of herbal medicines she is able to offer her clients.

She hopes that with the extra income this loan will help her make, she will be able to improve the lives of her children and improve the manner in which they all live. She also says she hopes to raise them with good health, and teach them what it means to make an honest living in a world where many people resort to corruption and stealing to get by. She wants to see them all happy, and she hopes that she will able to see her family continue to move forward in their lives economically and happily.

On behalf of Lourdes and everyone here at Esperanza International, we thank you for supporting his dreams and goals!

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of more inventory for her business selling flowers, candles and medicines.

loans.name: Pedro Joaquín

texts.es:
Pedro Joaquin E. is originally from the county of Condega in the city of Esteli. For a long time he has dedicated himself to his farming business. He sows seeds and cultivates crops so that he can have good fruits to sell to different clients in the zone at harvest time.

Thanks to his agricultural business he has always been able to maintain his partner and their 3 kids who really do need him. Now Pedro would like credit from Ceprodel so that he can get technical help with his farming. It is necessary to add that he has had 5 credits with Ceprodel, all of which he has paid back in full and on time in accordance with the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El caballero Pedro Joaquin E. es originario del municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí. Se ha dedicado por mucho tiempo a su negocio de agricultura en la siembra de semilla y cultivos en general para luego al momento de la cosecha obtener sus frutos para comercializarlos a sus diferentes clientes de la zona.

Gracias al negocio de la agricultura ha mantenido hasta este momento a su cónyuge y sus tres hijos que tanto necesitan de su querido padre. Hoy en día el señor Pedro acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual brindar asistencia técnica a sus cultivos. Es de necesidad destacar que hoy en día tiene cinco créditos con Ceprodel habiéndolos cancelado todos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido por la institución.

loans.use: Technical help for farming/Asistencia técnica para cultivo

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Doña Rosalia lives in the municipality of Ciudad Arce, in the ‘Departamento’ of La Libertad., together with her husband and two children. For five years she has dedicated herself to the sale of food typical to her area and for three years she has also sold coconuts. She has had several loans with Integral, which she has paid off punctually and has invested in the business with the desire to strengthen it. Now her priority is to construct a wall around the house with the desire to protect it from the strong rains that come in the winter and enter the house, generating great insecurity. This is the reason for requesting for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Rosalia vive en El Municipio D. Ciudad Arce, Departamento D. La Libertad. Junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Tiene 5 años D. dedicarse a la comercialización D. comida tipica y desD. hace 3 años tambien a la venta D. cocos. Ella ha tenido varios créditos con Integral, los cuales ha pagado con puntualidad e invertido en el negocio, con el afán D. fortalecerlo, Hoy su prioridad es la D. construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda con el afan protegerse D. las lluvias que azotan fuertemente en el invierno y que llegan a ingresar a la vivienda generandole una gran inseguridad. Siendo esta la razón D. solicitud D. este nuevo préstamo.

loans.use: To construct a wall around the house

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy is a young woman who lives with her family in her relatives' house in a single room. She sells American clothing at various markets in the Southern region of el Alto. She supports two children her need her care and attention. They are both in school and it is clear that she very much hopes to help her children succeed and thus give them a better way of life. This is her second individual loan and she has an excellent loan history.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Es una persona joven, ella y su familia viven en la casa de sus familiares en un solo cuarto, la cliente se dedica a la venta de ropa americana en las diferentes ferias de la zona sur de el Alto, a su cargo tiene dos niños que requieren de su cuidado y atencion, los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar y en ella se observa que tiene muchos deseos de sacar adelante a estos dos niños y asi darles una mejor forma de vida Actualmente es el segundo credito que solicita de forma individual, teniendo un exelente historial crediticio

loans.use: Increase her capital

loans.name: Silvia Susana

texts.es:
Silvia is 45 years old and has 2 children that still depend on her support. She has some advanced education completed and lives in the neighborhood La Libertad in Trujillo, Peru.

Since several years ago she makes a living selling clothing for men, women and children, such as shoes and sandals. She accomplishes this by taking orders and delivering them to her friends and family. In order to increase her income, she also works as a domestic employee in the home of a friend.

She is a member of the community bank United for Progress II (Unidas Para el Progreso II) of the Manuela Ramos movement. This is where she received her first loan of about USD $100 (300 soles) and invested it in the purchase of clothing, shoes and other inventory.

The loan of USD $625, which she will repay in 4 months, will be invested in her business.

Silvia dreams of being able to travel to other countries and being able to buy merchandise abroad, thus evolving into a great entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Silvia tiene 45 años, con 02 hijos dependientes aun de ella, tiene estudios superiores de educación inconclusos, y vive en la Urb. La Libertad- Trujillo – Perú.

Desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños así como zapatos, sandalias, este trabajo lo realiza en la modalidad de entrega de pedidos a domicilio a familiares y amigos.

Además trabaja como empleada doméstica en casa de una amiga, esto con el objetivo de incrementar sus ingresos.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “ Unidas Para El Progreso II”, del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, donde recibió un primer préstamo de S/.300 decidió invertirlo en la compra de ropa, zapatos y demás.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1700. el cual será cancelado en 4 meses lo invertirá en su negocio.

Silvia sueña con poder viajar a otros países y poder comprar su mercadería en el extranjero y así convertirse en una gran empresaria.

loans.use: With the loan she will buy more merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Ursula Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Ursula is married, has a four year old child, and is 28 years old. She is a technical nurse but does not practice her profession because she has not found the opportunity to do so. She is dedicated to the raising of her son and helping her husband with her small store.

She lives in Pasaje Dos de Mayo, Salaverry in La Libertad, Perú.

Since 2008, she runs a small store in her home where sells candy and fruit. She is part of the Community Bank “Entrepreneurs to Success II” (“Las Empresarias al Exito II”) of the Manuela Ramos movement. Her first loan of USD $100 was invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, candies, fruit, etc.

The loan of USD $300, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in merchandise for her store.

Mrs. Ursula has great dreams, one of which is seeing her small son turn into a professional when he grows up. Another is to be able to move her store to the market area or another larger location and thus being able to advance.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ursula, esta casada, tiene 01 hijo de 04 años; tiene 28 años; es enfermera técnica pero no ejerce su carrera, porque no ha encontrado la oportunidad, dedicándose en la actualidad a la crianza de su hijo y a ayudar a su esposo con su pequeña tienda.

Vive en el Pasaje Dos de Mayo. Salaverry, La Libertad – Perú.

Ursula tiene una pequeña bodega en su domicilio desde el año 2008, vendiendo caramelos y fruta. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “ Las Empresarias Al Éxito II”, del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, recibiendo primer préstamo de S/.300, invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, caramelos, fruta etc.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800. el cual será pagado en 6 meses, este dinero será invertido en artículos para su tienda.

La señora Ursula tiene grandes sueños, uno de ellos es poder ver a su menor hijo convertido en un profesional, y poder tener una tienda comercial en el mercado o en un local mas grande y así poder progresar.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase more merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena Castillo is 50 years old. She is married and has 4 children who are all independent, but she has three grandchildren in her care. She lives in the Luis Alberto Fujimori neighborhood of Puerto Salaverry, in the department of La Libertad, Peru.

Elena did not go to school, but she has always liked to work hard and get ahead. Since she was very young she has worked in various jobs, and she is currently selling food from her house in the evenings. She also rents rooms to boarders who live in some rooms that she and her husband fixed up for this purpose.

She belongs to the “Las Empresarias Al Exito II” (Business Women Headed for Success II) communal bank. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00 and she invested it in the purchase of soft drinks and ingredients for the foods she makes. With this loan of S/. 1,500.00, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will invest it entirely in her food business.

Her greatest dream is to be able to improve her living conditions and thereby be able to make some improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elena Castillo, tiene 50 años de edad. Esta casada y tiene 04 hijos, los cuales son independientes, pero tiene 03 nietos pequeños a su cuidado. Ella vive en el P.J Luis Alberto Fujimori, en el Puerto Salaverry, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La señora Elena, no estudió pero siempre le gustó progresar, así es que desde muy joven se dedicó a diferentes actividades, actualmente vende comida en su casa por las noches, da pensión a algunos inquilinos que viven en algunos ambientes que ella y su esposo acondicionaron para alquilarlos. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Empresarias Al Éxito II ” Su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.oo y lo invirtió en la compra gaseosas y víveres para la elaboración de los menús. El préstamo de S/. 1500.00 que cancelará en 6 meses lo invertirá completamente en su pequeño negocio de comida Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y así poder darle algunos acabados a su casa.

loans.use: She will buy more ingredients for the preparation of the foods she makes for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa Gonzáles is 68 years old and lives in the La Libertad Urbanization in the province of Trujillo, La Libertad, Peru. She has five children who are all independent. One of her daughters and her children live with her.

Rosa sells the following foods from her home: chocos (a food from the Liberteña mountains), sweets, and tamales. With the proceeds, she helps out with her expenses and some of her daughter’s. Despite her age, she is not afraid of work—quite to the contrary, she considers herself strong enough and with plenty of energy to continue working and earning a living. This also relaxes her and keeps her from feeling depressed due to the aches and pains that are normal at her age.

Rosa is a member of the “Unidas Para El Progreso II” communal bank. With her first loan of S/. 300.00 she invested in her cooking pot and cooking utensils.

With this loan of S/. 800.00 from Manuela Ramos, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy ingredients for the foods she makes.

She aspires to continue to have the strength to work each day and help her daughter and also to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Rosa González tiene 68 años de edad, vive en la Urbanización La Libertad en la Provincia de Trujillo La Libertad – Perú, tiene cinco hijos, independientes todos, viviendo ella con una de sus hijas y sus nietos. La señora Rosa vende en la puerta de su casa, chocos (alimento oriundo de la sierra Liberteña), dulces, tamales, con lo cual se ayuda para su manutención y aporta en algunos gastos de su hija. A pesar de su edad no se amilana ante el trabajo todo lo contrario se considera con fuerzas y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando y poderse mantener, lo cual también la relaja y no le deja deprimirse por algunas dolencias propias de su edad. La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “ Unidad Para El Progreso II”. Obtuvo su primer crédito de S/300.00 con lo cual pudo invertirlo en la compra de su olla y su cocina entre otros. Con el préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.800.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de sus platillos. Aspira seguir con fuerzas para trabajar día a día y poder ayudar a su hija y para mejor su condición de vida.

loans.use: She will buy more ingredients for the foods that she makes for sale
