payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Yovanna Lizet

texts.es:
Yovanna G. is 28 years old, lives with her husband, and with one child who is still dependant on her. She went to high school, but has not yet finished. She lives in the La Libertad neighborhood of Trujillo, Peru.

She sells used clothing from a rented stall at the Santa Rosa market in the district of El Porvenir. She began her business a year and a half ago, thanks to the support of Movimiento Manuela Ramos. She buys clothing from wholesalers, washes them, and then sells them.

She belongs to the “Unidas Para El Progreso II” communal bank. Upon receiving her first loan of S/.300.00, she invested it entirely in buying clothing. With this loan of S/.800.00, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will invest it in buying her merchandise.

Yovanna dreams of having her own store where she can sell not only used clothing, but also new clothing, and thereby increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Yovanna G. tiene 28 años, es conviviente con 01 hijo dependiente aún de ella, tiene estudios superiores de educación inconclusos, y vive en la Urb. La Libertad- Trujillo – Perú. Se dedica a la venta de ropa usada en el mercado Santa Rosa del Distrito de El Porvenir, en un pequeño puesto alquilado. Se inicio hace un año y medio gracias al apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, ella compra la ropa a mayoristas luego la lava y la vente en su puesto. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “ Unidas Para El Progreso II”, recibiendo un primer préstamo de S/.300, lo invertio completamente en la compra de ropa. Con el préstamo de S/. 800. el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, será invertido en la compra de su mercadería. Silvia sueña con poder tener su local propio y poner su tienda comercial de ropa no sólo usada sino también de ropa nueva y así mejora sus ingresos.

loans.use: She will buy more merchandise to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena is married and has 2 children ages 11 and 8 years old respectively. She started her business in 2006 when she was able to get a stand at the open-air market and a husband's friend sold her a pack of American clothes. She needed the money for her family's expenses since with her husband's salary it was not enough. He works as clerk at a store where they sell paints. Presently, she is doing very well with her business

She needs a US $250 loan which she will pay back in 6 months. She will buy merchandise with it since right now is a good season to sell clothes and she wants to take advantage of it. With your help, Lorena will be able to increase her business

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Lorena estaa casada y tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 8 años. Inició su negocio en el 2006 cuando consiguio un puesto en el tianguis y un amigo de su esposo le vendio una paca de ropa americana. Ella necesitaba dinero para los gastos de su familia, ya que con el sueldo de su esposo no era suficiente, el trabaja como empleado en una tienda donde comercializan pinturas. Actualmente le hadio muy bien con su negocio.

Ella neecsita un credito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia ya que esta temporada es muy buena para la venta de ropa y desea aprovecharla. Con tu ayuda Lorena podra hcer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Buying merchandise.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina started her business out of financial necessity since she is a single mother who had to raise her son on her own. In 2005, she met some people from Guadalajara who were silver jewelry distributors. She then started to sell jewelry to her friends. Since she realized that it was profitable, she continued with her sales. Her business has so far been prosperous.

She needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can purchase merchandise and keep her business running. With your support, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcelina inició en las ventas por las necesidades economicas, ya que es madre soltera, y tuvo que sacar adelante a su hijo sola. En el año 2005, conocio a unas personas de Guadalajara que se dedican a distribuir bisuteria de plata y empezó a venderla entre sus amistades, como vio que era redituable siguio con las ventas de esto, y actualmente le ha ido muy bien.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y poder continuar con su negocio, con tu apoyo esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Carlota

texts.es:
María Carlota is 62 years old. She has one daughter, who is 20 years old and is still economically dependent on her because she is studying. María Carlota lives in Pueblo Jesus Luis Alberto Fujimori, in Puerto Salaverry, in the department of La Libertad, in Peru.

Maria Carlota has finished university studies and is a teacher. However, she no longer works in that career—she now makes crocheted purses, which she makes from a synthetic fiber known as “mouse tail”. The purses are of various sizes, colors, and models. During the last few months she has also been making earrings. She is taking a small class so that she can perfect the making of these articles.

María is very devout. She belongs to the choir of her church and this has helped her to make many friends who help her by buying the things she makes. She belongs to the “Las Empresarias Al Éxito II” (Business Women Headed for Success) communal bank, where she obtained her first loan of S/. 300.00. With that money she bought the materials to make her purses.

With this loan of S/. 800.00, which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in the materials to make purses, and also a small amount for materials to make earrings, rings, etc.

Her biggest dreams are to see her daughter become a professional and also to have her own stand where she can sell her purses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María Carlota, tiene 62 años de edad. Tiene 01 hija de 20 años, la cual aún depende económicamente de ella, debido a que esta cursando estudios superiores. Vive en el Pueblo Jesus Luis Alberto Fujimori, en el Puerto Salaverry, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La señora María Carlota tiene estudios superiores concluidos, es profesora, aunque ya no ejerce su carrera, ahora se dedica a la confección de carteras tejidas a crochet, las cuales están elaboradas en el material sintético llamado cola de rata, las carteras que ella confecciona son de diversos tamaños, colores, modelos y también en los últimos meses se esta dedicando a la confección de aretes en lencería. Para lo cual paralelamente estudia un pequeño curso y así poder perfeccionarse en la confección de estos artículos. La Señora María es muy creyente, pertenece al coro de la iglesia de su localidad y eso le a ayudado a tener muchas amigas que colaboran con ella en la compra de los artículos que confecciona. Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Empresarias Al Éxito II ” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró los materiales para la confección de sus carteras. Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 que cancelará en 6 meses lo invertirá en material para carteras y un pequeño porcentaje para la confección de aretes, sortijas, etc. Su mayor sueño es poder ver a su hija profesional y poder tener un stand donde poder vender sus carteras.

loans.use: She will buy more of the materials she needs to make her products

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mirtha Azucena

texts.es:
Mirtha Mendocilla is 37 years old. She lives in the La Rinconada Urbanization in the province of Trujillo, La Libertad, Peru. She nearly finished high school. She is currently separated and lives with her son.

She sells women’s, men’s, and children’s clothing and delivers clothing ordered by family members to their door in the mornings. In the afternoons she works at a stand owned by a family member at a shopping center so as to help out with household expenses. She believes that although it is not easy to help a child get ahead in life, with work and much dedication it is possible. She gives her all to be a good example to her son and hopes that he will be a man of means one day.

Mirtha is a member of the “Las Jadeitas” communal bank. With her first loan of S/. 300.00 she invested in coats, polo shirts, blouses and special orders that her customers make.

With this loan of S/. 900.00, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will buy clothing such as: coats, jackets, blouses and orders from her customers.

She aspires to have her own store where she can sell her merchandise. She also hopes to see her son grow up well and become a great professional who is responsible and has values and principles.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mirtha Mendocilla tiene 37 años de edad, vive en la Urbanización La Rinconada en la Provincia de Trujillo La Libertad – Perú, estudio hasta quinto año de secundaria actualmente esta separada y tiene un hijo varón. Vende ropa de damas caballeros y niños y reparte a domicilio pedidos de sus familiares por las mañanas, por las tardes trabaja en un centro comercial en un stand de un familiar para poder ayudarse con los gastos de su casa. Considera que aunque no es fácil sacar adelante a un hijo, con trabajo y mucha dedicación esto es posible, ella pone todo de su parte para darle un buen ejemplo a su hijo y espera sea un hombre de bien en un futuro. La señora Mirtha es socia del Banco Comunal “ Las Jadeitas”. Obtuvo su primer crédito de S/300.00 el cual lo pudo invertir en la compra de chompas, polos, blusas y pedidos que le hacen sus clientas. Con el préstamo de S/.900.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra ropa como: chompas, casacas, blusas y demás pedidos de sus clientas. Aspira tener un puesto propio donde poder vender su mercadería, desea también ver a su hijo crecer con bien y que pueda ser un gran profesional, responsable y con valores y principios.

loans.use: She will buy more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Rosa Lastenia

texts.es:
Rosa Lastenia P. is 71 years old. She is a native of the district of Mache in Otuzco province. She does not have an education, since her parents did not consider it a good investment to send their daughters away to school to learn. Rosa has 6 children, all of whom are independent of her and married. She lives at Calle Las Jadeitas Mz. 31, lot No. 38 in the La Rinconada neighborhood in the city of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru.

Rosa has a small grocery store, which she started 10 years ago when she decided to move from Mache to the city of Trujillo. She has been working with Kiva Partner Manuela Ramos for almost 5 years now. Her store is located in a room in her house; she and her husband attend to the store every day, and the income that it brings in allows them to support themselves financially.

The first loan Rosa received from Manuela Ramos was for 300 Peruvian Soles ($100), which she invested in her small business by purchasing fruits, vegetables, and rice, etc. She belongs to Las Jadeitas Communal Bank.

Rosa will use the loan of 600 Soles ($225) to purchase products to sell; the loan will be repaid in a period of 4 months.

Rosa wishes to live peacefully in her old age near her children and grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rosa Lastenia P. tiene 71 años de edad, es natural del Distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco, no tiene estudios, cuenta que sus padres no consideraban una buena inversión el hecho que las niñas vayan al colegio y puedan estudiar por lo cual ella no pudo ir al colegio. Tiene 06 hijos todos independientes y casados; vive en la calle las Jadeitas Mz. 31 lote Nº 38 en la Urb. La Rinconada en la ciudad de Trujillo del departamento La Libertad – Perú.

La señora Rosa tiene una pequeña tienda en la cual vende abarrotes, empezó hace 10 años cuando decidió irse de Mache a la cuidad de Trujillo y viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos casi 05 años. Su tienda esta ubicada en la sala de su casa y junto a su esposo la atiende todos los días con estos ingresos se ayudan para poder vivir y sostenerse económicamente.

Su primer prestamo fue S/.300 de Manuela Ramos, este dinero lo invirtió en su pequeño negocio, comprando verduras, frutas, y arroz, etc. Ella integra el Banco Comunal “Las Jadeitas”

Con el préstamo de S/. 600.00 el cual pagará en un periodo de cuatro meses. comprará productos para su venta

Ella desea vivir tranquila su vejes cerca de sus hijos y nietos.

loans.use: Purchasing more products to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is a dedicated tinsmith and painter. He decided to start his business because he is the main provider and his main need is to sustain his family. He began in 2004, by renting a small lot where he built his shop. He is the father of 4 children ages 15, 12, 10, and 8 years old. His wife doesn't work, she is a housekeeper.

He is applying for a $250 US loan which he will pay back in 6 months. He wants to buy a pressurized paint gun for a new application material. Your support will help him to continue growing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Antonio se dedica al oficio de hojalatero y pintor, decidio emprender su negocio ya que es padre de familia y su principal necesidad era mantener a su famila. Comenzó en el año 2004, rentando un pequeño terreno y puso ahí su taller. El es padre de 4 hijos de 15,12, 10 y 8 años, y su esposa no trabaja se dedica al hogar.

El solicita un credito por US $250 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar una pistola de presion para un nuevo material de aplicación. con tu apoyo su negocio seguira creciendo.

loans.use: Buying a pressurized spray paint gun for his shop

loans.name: Giovanna Jaqueline

texts.es:
Giovanna is 37 years old. She is married and has two sons who are still dependent on her and her husband. She studied accounting in university but no longer practices her profession because of a lack of opportunities. She lives with her in-laws in the Razuri neighborhood in Trujillo, Peru.

Giovanna has sold children’s and baby clothing since 1997, though she left for a time to care for her sons and also because she had insufficient resources. She was able to take up her business again thanks to an initial loan of 300 Peruvian Soles ($100) that was given to her by the Manuela Ramos organization, which she invested in purchasing merchandise. Giovanna belongs to Las Jadeitas Communal Bank.

Giovanna will use the present loan of 1900 Soles ($700) to purchase clothing for the Mother’s Day holiday and the winter season; the loan will be repaid in 4 months. She will deliver the clothing to the homes of relatives, friends, and other customers who have placed orders.

Giovanna dreams of having her own stand where she can sell her merchandise. That way she would be able to improve her income, which would in turn allow her to buy her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Giovanna, esta casada, tiene 37 años y 02 hijos varones dependientes aún de ella y de su esposo, tiene estudios superiores de contabilidad, pero no lo ejerce por falta de oportunidades, y vive junto a sus suegros en la Urb. Razuri - Trujillo – Perú.

Desde el año 1997, Giovanna se dedica a la venta de ropa de niños y de bebe, dejando por un tiempo el negocio por dedicarse al cuidado de sus hijos y por no contar con recursos suficientes; retomó el negocio gracias a un primer préstamo otorgado por el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, de S/.300, invirtió completamente en la compra de mercadería. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “ Las Jadeitas”,

Con el préstamo de S/. 1900. el cual cancelará en 4 meses comprará ropa por campaña del día de la madre y por temporada de frío, ella utiliza la modalidad de reparto a domicilio de los pedidos que le hacen sus familiares, amigas y demás clientes.

Giovanna sueña con tener un stand propio donde poder vender su mercadería y así mejorar sus ingresos lo cual le permita comprar su casa propia.

loans.use: Purchasing more clothing to sell

loans.name: Karen Viviana

texts.es:
Karen is 25 years old and has completed her secondary education. She lives in Pueblo Joven in the Aurora Díaz neighborhood of Puerto Salaverry. She is unmarried and has been working for several years. Karen sells underwear for men, women and children, along with blouses, polo shirts, and baby clothing, to her neighbors and coworkers.

Karen is a member of the Rumbo Al Éxito (“Heading for the exit”) interim group, part of the Manuela Ramos organization. The first loan she received was for 300 Peruvian Soles ($100), which she invested in purchasing a selection of clothing for men, women, children, and infants. She is very pleased with her business because it has helped her a great deal.

Karen will use this loan of 500 Soles ($200) to purchase more clothing for her business; the loan will be repaid in 4 months.

Karen dreams of becoming a great businesswoman in this field, for then she will be able to help her relatives and improve her own quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

Karen tiene 25 años estudió secundaria completa y vive en el Pueblo Joven Aurora Díaz P. Salaverry, es soltera, muy amigable y trabajadora desde hace varios años. Se dedica a la venta de ropa interior de damas, caballeros y niños, así como blusas, polos, ropa de bebe, a sus vecinos, compañeras y compañeros de trabajo.

Es socia del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Rumbo Al Éxito”, del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, recibiendo un primer préstamo de S/.300, el cual lo invertio en la compra de mercadería surtida tanto para damas, caballeros, niños, y bebé, ella esta muy contenta con este negocio porque le ha ayudado mucho personalmente.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500. el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio

Karen sueña con llegar a ser una gran empresaria en este rubro, y así poder ayudar a sus familiares y poder también ella mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

loans.use: Purchasing more clothing to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Celinda Dora

texts.es:
Celinda is 48 years old, and lives in the Aurora Diaz neighborhood in Puerto Salaverry, in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She went to university and became a teacher but no longer practices her profession. Celinda lives with her husband and their 3 year-old son; it is because of her son that she wants to improve their situation.

Celinda has a store set up in a room in their house, where she sells groceries, candies, and various bread products. She started out selling bread in a small shop eight years ago, and was able to increase her business thanks to the loans she received from Kiva Partner Manuela Ramos. Today she has a store that is larger and well stocked.

Celinda is a member of the Rumbo Al Éxito (“Heading for the exit”) communal group. The first loan she received was for 300 Peruvian Soles ($100), which she invested in her store by purchasing rice, sugar, oil, noodles, etc.

Celinda will use the present loan of 400 Soles ($150) to purchase various products for stocking her store; the loan will be repaid in 4 months.

Celinda hopes to have an even larger business so that she can guarantee her son a better future than what she herself has had, and so that she can resume her professional career.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Celinda tiene 48 años de edad, vive en la Urbanización Aurora Díaz Puerto Salaverry en la Provincia de Trujillo La Libertad – Perú, estudio superior, ella es profesora pero ya no ejerce su carrera; vive con su esposos y su único hijo de 03 años el cual se ha convertido en la razón de su esfuerzo por progresar.

Tiene una bodega en la sala de su casa donde vende abarrotes, caramelos, y demás artículos de pan llevar. Se inicio hace ocho años vendiendo pan en una pequeña bodeguita y gracias a los préstamos que ha logrado obtener de Manuela Ramos ha podido incrementar su negocio, hoy tiene una bodega más grande y muy bien surtida.

La señora Celinda es socia del Grupo comunal “Rumbo Al Exito”. Obtuvo su primer crédito de S/300.00 con lo que empezó a invertir en su bodega comprando arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos, etc.

Con el préstamo de S/.400.00, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de diversos productos para surtir su tienda.

Aspira tener un negocio más grande aún para garantizarle a su pequeño hijo un futuro mucho mejor que el que ella tuvo, y poder verlo relanzado profesionalmente.

loans.use: Purchasing more merchandise to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Villa Cotay Group

texts.en:
“VilL. Cotay” is a small rural community bank of FINCA Peru’s Wari-project which provides its credit with education services in the rural areas of Huancavelica. Huancavelica is considered one of the poorest regions of Peru and has many limitations as it is a very mountainous area (altituD. ranges from 2,000 – 5,000 meters above sea level). These limitations incluD. the cold, the difficulty of growing crops, and the lack of an adequate infrastructure of roads and communication systems.

BCR “VilL. Cotay” is located at approximately 3,500 meters above sea level in the community of Cotay, in the district of Anco, province of Churcampa. The small town of Cotay is located where there once used to be an old colonial hacienda, and the people lived there to work on the hacienda. Most business is done with the city of Huancayo, the biggest city nearby and a 4-5 hour drive away. The main activities of the population are related to agriculture and incluD. growing crops like barley, wheat, corn, potato, oca, peas and beans. Most of the population also raises sheep, cattle and small animals.

The bank is starting its first loan-cycle with 11 female borrowers and a total loan of 2,400 soles (about 875 US$). The loans range from 100, 200, 300, and up to 500 soles.

The group already is in its third loan-cycle in over one year of existence. In their time with FINCA Peru, the members have worked very hard to save and to be more responsible with money and in their businesses. They want to improve the quality of their lives; they are especially motivated because they want their children to have a good education, to be professionals, and to have better opportunities. When talking about the future, these items are the most important ones.

In FINCA Perú, what the members have learned and want to continue learning is how to know and understand each other better, how to share responsibilities amongst the members, how to be better entrepreneurs, how to calculate the gains of selling their products, and how to do family planning. When asked about their savings, most are equally-minded. Savings are for improving their businesses and for their children's education or their housing when studying.

One of the members of the community bank is Doris. Doris will receive a loan of 200 soles and has a small business of buying and selling small animals. Besides that, she also sells cereals and clothes. Her business depends a lot on the time of year. Doris works to support her family, especially the education of her children. Before she did not do a lot. She was not working and depended completely on her husband. Now she runs her own little small business! She is creating her own opportunities and savings as well. Now her husband is jealous sometimes because her business is going well and she is the one earning the money for the household. Her dream is for her children to leave the community, to study to become engineers and that way give something back to the community in future, applying what they studied. (She is very sure her children will help). She has the dream of going to a place where she can run a bigger business. With her savings, she wants to improve her business.

Viviana P. D. L. C. tells another story. She started her business making clothes for children. Together with her husband, they operate some machines for making the clothes and sell them at nearby weekly markets. Another business she runs is buying and selling cereals in Huancayo. When in Huancayo she uses her time to buy more materials for her clothing business. With her 500 soles loan, she will buy more materials in Huancayo. Now that she will be working with FINCA Peru, she hopes to save more and to work more responsibly to be able to pay for her loan. She will use her savings to reinvest in her business and in the education of her children. Besides that she is thinking about buying terrain in Huancayo in the future and a car to be able to move her product. Now that she is in FINCA Perú, she has learned to care for and value herself as she learned to save.

Cipriana L. Montanéz has a small grocery store and sells shoes and clothes in the time the kids go back to school. With her 200 soles loan, she will buy more supplies for her store. Her dream for the future is to improve her small store and for her grandchildren to study. (Unfortunately her children did not have the opportunity to study). As well the family is thinking about buying a house in Huancayo where the grandchildren can live when they are studying. In FINCA Perú, she has learned that women can work as well and that they, too, can change something in their lives to improve the quality. Besides that, she has learned to value herself. She wishes her late husband could be alive to see that she is ok!

loans.use: Buy more supplies

loans.name: Estefana

texts.es:
I have a store that I have had for five years; I devote myself full-time to attend to my customers, who look for the quality of my products. I have four children who help me to go and buy the products to supply the store. My proposal is to increase my business and to be able to supply it. It is also my desire to purchase two display counters and fill them with products so that my store can have all that is necessary for everyday needs.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo una tienda, donde llevo 5 años de tenerla; me dedico a tiempo completo a poderla atender donde mis clientes buscan la calidad de mis productos. Tengo 4 hijos de los cuales me ayudan para poder ir a comprar el producto y poder surtirlo. Mi propósito es agrandar mi negocio y así poder surtirlo. Además mi deseo es poder comprar dos mostradores y llenarlo de productos, para que mi tienda pueda tener todo lo necesario para los consumos del día.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to stock the store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
I am dedicated to the sale of ‘Elotes Locos’ (corn with mayonnaise, salsa and cheese) and have had my business for four years. The business is located in my house so I can give it greater attention. At night I also sell tortillas with pork rind. My desire is to hire another person who can help me sell the corn in the fields to generate employment and also to profit from the sale of my corn.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith , Kiva volunteer.

Yo me dedico a la venta de Elotes Locos (elotes con mayonesa, salsa, y queso), llevo 4 años y medio de tenerlo, el negocio lo tengo en mi casa para poder darle una mejor atención, además por las noches vendo lo que es tortillas con chicharrón. Mi deseo es poder contratar a una persona para que me ayude a vender los elotes en el campo, y así poder generar un empleo y además tener una ganancia en la venta de mis elotes.

loans.use: Purchase of various articles to sell

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
I make a living by cutting hair. I have done this for 3 years, and I have identified myself with my clients by giving them excellent service. I need this credit to buy two hair clippers. I also need to buy two revolving chairs: one for children, and one for adults.

This business has gone well for me, thank God. With it, I help my family with their education, health, and clothing. My vision is to have another barber shop and to be able to expand my business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Me dedíco al servicio de corte de cabello, llevo 3 años en el atendiendo; me he identificado con mis clientes en darles un excelente servicio; éste crédito lo necesito para comprar dos maquinas rasuradoras de cabello. Además necesito comprar dos sillas giratorias una para niño y otra para adulto.

En el negocio gracias a Dios me ha ido bien, con ésto ayudo a mi familia en lo que se refiere a estudios, salud, vestuario. Mi visión es poder tener otra barbería y poder así expandirme en mi negocio.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for his barber shop

loans.name: María Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Francisica has a business selling coffee and ayote (squash) seeds in small quantities in the market of San Martín Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango. She learned this business from her mother and has had it for 25 years. She buys seeds and coffee in bulk and sells them in small units.

Her older daughter helps her with her business, which has in turn helped her four children. Her husband does not live in Guatemala; it has been many years since he went to the United States and he sends her a little help.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Francisca tiene un negocio de venta por menor de café y de semillas de ayote o calabazas, en el mercado de San Martín Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango. Este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, y tiene 25 años de tenerlo. Ella compra la semilla y el café por mayor y lo vende en unidades pequeñas. Su hija mayor le ayuda con su negocio, de esta forma ha sacado adelante a sus 4 hijos. Su esposo no vive en Guatemala, hace muchos años viajo a los Estados Unidos, y le envía un poco de ayuda.

loans.use: Investment in seeds to harvest coffee and ayote (squash)

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en:
Mrs. Khiev K. R., 41, is a mother of four single children and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been working as teachers at Ta Koak High School since 1998, making collectively about $4 each day. Now the income she and her husband make is barely enough to supplement her entire family. Because of the inflation, the prices of goods like gasoline and other commodities in Cambodia are very expensive.

In order to generate more income to cover her daily expenses, Khiev K. R. would like to run a new business making and selling dessert near the school where there are a lot of students passing by. To do this, Khiev K. R. has requested a loan to help her get started. (Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Khiev K. R. was not available).

loans.use: To open a new business making and selling dessert

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her inventory for her housewares business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair an old sewing machine and to purchase cloth and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials and beauty products for her small beauty salon

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Thi Thanh

texts.vi:
Mrs Ngô Thị Thanh (group leader) is 43 years old. She sells basic goods and flowers in front of her house. She makes about 100000 VND a day. Her group has already paid back the first loan, this this their second. This time thay're requesting 2.714.000 VND each. Mrs Ngô Thị Thanh will use the money to replenish her inventory.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Duyên needs the money to buy hardware stock for her store.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Bảy runs a refreshment drink stand.
- Mrs Nguyễn Thị Lĩnh has a hair salon, she needs the money to buy shampoo & hair products.
- Mrs Đào Thị Bình sells basic goods.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Ngô Thị Thanh (MS:030030 ), năm nay 43 tuổi. Cô bán hàng tạp hóa và hoa quả tại nhà. Thu nhập cô là trên 100.000 VND/ngày. Nhóm cô đã vay được một chu kỳ và hoàn trả rất tốt. Cô vay 2.714.000 để thêm vốn mua hàng tạp hóa và hoa quả bán. Chị Nguyễn Thị Duyên (MS:030031 ), vay 2.714.000 VND để mua đồ sắt, hàng ốc vít về bán. Chị Nguyễn Thị Bảy (MS:030032), vay 2.714.000 VND để mua thêm nước giải khát về bán hàng nước. Chị Nguyễn Thị Lĩnh (MS: 030033), vay 2.714.000 VND để mua các phụ gia thuốc, dầu gội đầu để mở rộng của hàng cắt tóc gội đầu. Chị Đào Thị Bình (MS: 030034), vay 2.714.000 VND để mua hoa quả bán.

loans.use: sells basic goods

loans.name: Ruhullah

texts.en:
This is Ruhullah A., a 32-year-old man. He is marred and has four children. He lives in the district of Shewa in the Ningarhar province and works as a farmer there.

He wants to buy a lot of seed and improve his business, but he doesn’t have enough money for this purpose. He requested a loan of 40,000 Afghanis from AFSG, and he will repay the loan in 24 months.

loans.use: To buy seed for his land

loans.name: Zokirov

texts.ru:
K. Zokirov is 66 years old, he has a daughter who works in Khukumat in the town of Khujand. K. and his wife are retired, but K. is still able to work and at this time works as a security guard in a manufacturing plant in Layl. K. has three grandchildren, his oldest one has just recently married and K. wants to give the newlyweds a TV-set and an air conditioner. His small salary does not allow him to buy these kind of home appliances so he decided to apply for a loan with MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Зокиров Каюм мужчина в возросте 66 летимеет одну дочь , которая работает в Хукумате г.Худжанда.Сам Каюм и его жена пенсионеры , но Каюм еще в силах работать , и на сегодняшний день он работает охраником на заводе Лаъл. Каюм имеет 3 внуков, старшего внука недавно они женили , и поэтому Каюм для новобрачных хочет подарить телевизор и кондиционер, но за наличные он не может купить технику , т,к. его зарплата не велика.Поэтому он решил обратится за кредитом в Микроинвест.

loans.use: To buy home appliances

loans.name: Anwar's Group

texts.en:
Anwar, the wife of Mr. A. H., is a mother of two beautiful daughters. Anwar B. is a fruitseller. She lives with her big dreams in a big country called Pakistan. Anwar’s dream is to see her daughters educated and qualified in every field. Her husband is a driver and he drives three wheel vehicles called Auto-rickshaws. She successfully completed a loan from Asasah, a microfinance Institute in Pakitstan. Anwar B. applied a loan to expand her fruit business.

Anwar has been joined in her group by a few more members who are: Maqboola B. who wants a loan for her fruit business; Zahida B. who wants a loan to start her electric supplies (tube lights) business; Nasreen B. is applying for a loan to start her fruit business; and Parveen B. wants to start her cloth business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to expand their businesses and fulfill their dreams.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran bibi, wife of M. S., is the mother of six children. Their eldest son got his education till 9th standard, now he works in a workshop and repairs the engines of vehicles like cars, motorbikes. Their second son is doing lathe work. Their younger children help Sughran by taking care of her buffaloes. Her husband is a contractor. Sughran bibi has a clothing business which she started through her home and she sells them to neighbors. She successfully completed a loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution in Pakistan. She needs a loan for her clothing business. She hopes that if she makes some profit from the loan she’ll make something for her daughter’s marriage.

Yasmeen B. needs a loan to start a shuttering business. Naziran B. wants to start an ice business. Manzoran B. needs a loan to repair her rickshaw. Razia B. needs a loan to start a cassette business. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to expand their businesses on a large scale.

loans.name: Qubra's Group

texts.en:
Qubra, the wife of Mr. I. is the mother of four sons and three daughters. Her husband hasa business making wooden baskets. Due to adverse circumstances her sons couldn’t get education. Qubra's first daughter is married. Her first son drives a rickshaw, the second one works in a paint shop and the last two are learning skills about lathe work. Qubra is sweeper by profession. She successfully completed a loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution in Pakistan. She has now applied for a loan to buy three wheel vehicles called auto-rickshaws.

Shabana wants a loan to start a meat business. Anwar B. and Shamim B. want loans to buy rickshaws, and Rashida B. wants a loan to start her gas slender shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their financial conditions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy raw materials in bulk.

loans.name: Naheed's Group

texts.en:
Naheed, wife of Mr.E., is the mother of five beautiful children. The eldest son is in 9th standard. The third son is in 2nd standard. Her husband works in a workshop. She is a housewife and does household work. She successfully completed a loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution of Pakistan. She took a loan for her son and made a rickshaw. Her son drives a rickshaw and supports the family. Now she applies for a loan for her husband to start his welding workshop. She hopes to make a profit from this loan that she can use to better her sons' futures.

Razia B. wants a loan to buy a rickshaw. Safia B. wants a loan to start a grocery shop. Nazia B. wants a loan to buy a paint machine. Shazia B. wants a loan to buy a rickshaw.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their financial conditions.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida, wife of M. Sarwar has the business of trading wheat. She has one son and one daughter. Their son is in kindergarten. Sajida and her husband are willing to educate their children because they think that through education they will be able to face every situation very independently. She successfully completed a loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution. She needs a loan to invest in her wheat business, so that they get a lot of profit because this is the wheat season.

She has been joined in her group by a few more members. Haleema B. needs a loan to start a fruit cart business. Bashiran B. wants a loan to make iron boxes. Maqboola B. wants to expand her cigarette shop. Naseem B. needs a loan to start a workshop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to expand their businesses and improve their financial conditions.

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana Parveen, wife of M. H., is the mother of four sons. The eldest son is in 2nd standard. The next to him is in kindergarten. Her purpose is to give her sons education, to make them independent. Rehana’s husband is a driver by profession and drives a rickshaw. She makes embroidered clothes and sells them. She applied her loan to repair her three wheel vehicles called auto-rickshaws. She plans to buy land with the profits.

Sangeeta B. wants a loan to start a food business. Gulshan B. wants a loan to buy masonry tools. Parveen B. wants a loan to buy woods to expand her business. Sumera B. wants a loan for her lathe work.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Sophea Bun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-four members in the Rotaing Village will be bonded in a Village Bank, and Mrs. Sophea B. will serve as the Village Bank President. Mrs. Sophea B. is a 33-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She is a farmer, and her husband, Mr. Chantha Prum, is also a farmer in the local village.

Typically, Mrs. Sophea B. cultivates her crops twice a year. Her farming business has encountered numerous difficulties in recent months because the field on which she farms is infertile, not to mention the fact that many insects damage the vegetables she is able to grow. Moreover, just last year, Mrs. Sophea B.’s vegetables were ruined by floods during that year's rainy season, which was truly a crisis for her family from a financial standpoint. As such, and in order to solve these problems, Mrs. Sophea B. is requesting a loan to buy more fertilizers and pesticides (to kill insects) for her field.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizers and pesticides for the field in order to make her crops more productive.

loans.name: Huy Um Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Huy U. is the Village Bank President of twenty-six members in the Khsom Village of Kandal Province. He is a fisherman and a bicycle repairman in the village. In addition, he is married with seV. children: two of his children are employed in a garment factoR., two are fishermen, two are enrolled in state school, and the other child stays at home. His wife, Mrs. Lou Aok, is a fish-seller. Last year, Mrs. Lou Aok was diagnosed with high blood pressure, so Mr. Huy U. incurred $125 of expenses to cure her. During that time, Mr. Huy U.’s fishing business faced a severe storm, and he was unable to catch many fish to support his family.

His fishing business has encountered mounting problems in recent months because he does not have enough money to buy fishing equipment. Accordingly, Mr. Huy U. is seeking a loan to buy such equipment to fish in the lake. Previously, Mr. Huy U. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank, which he used to buy fishing equipment.

loans.use: To improve the business by purchasing fishing equipment in order to work in a lake.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra kosar, wife of Mr. A. G., is the mother of four children. Besides her first son, the rest of them are getting an education. Bushra B. and her husband are willing to give their children education till they want. She is a successful client of Asasah, a microfinance institution of Pakistan. She invested that loan amount in her husband’s vegetable business. Now she applies for a loan again for her husband so that he is able to expand his vegetable business and earn a lot more profit.

Anayat bibi wants a loan for his cold drinks business. Naik Parveen B. wants a loan for a meat business. Shamim B. wants a loan for a vegetable business. Rehana B. wants a loan for a fruit business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina B., wife of M. Aslam, is the mother of five children: The first three sons got their education until 8th standard and started working in a bakery. Sakina’s daughter is married. The last son is in 12th standard. Sakina is a cook by profession. She use to make bakery materials and is famous in the society where she lives. She applied for a loan to expand her bakery business. She trained her sons in this business.

Farzana B., who is Sakina B.’s daughter in law, wants a loan for her husband who is a salesman. Nasreen B. wants a loan for her husband’s meat business. Kishwar sultana and ramzana B. want loans to buy rickshaws.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their businesses to improve their lives.

loans.name: Ly Chan Village Bank Group

texts.en:
A Village Bank in Khsom Village consists of twenty-nine members. Mrs. Ly C. is the Village Bank President. She is a 38-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are studying in state school. Her husband, Mr. Sopha Mao, is a farmer in the local village.

She is a fish-seller, so she buys fish to re-sell in the village. Her business is doing well, but she would now like to expand the business. Unfortunately, Mrs. Ly C. has insufficient money to purchase more fish; thus, Mrs. Ly C. is requesting a loan for this purpose. Previously, Mrs. Ly C. obtained a loan from Amret Co., Ltd., which enabled her start her fish-selling business.

loans.use: To expand the business by purchasing more fish for resale purposes.

loans.name: Chanthu

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthu H. lives in the Khsom Village of Kandal Province, where she is subsistence farmer. She is a 37-year-old married woman with six children: three of her children sell clothes in the Banteay Meanchey Province (which is on the border with Thailand), one attends school, and the others stay at home. Her husband, Mr. Nhork Chhuon (pictured on the left), is a farmer and construction worker. Aside from her farming activities, Mrs. Chanthu H. also generates income from her pump, which she permits villagers to use for a fee.

Recently, Mrs. Chanthu H. has faced mounting financial problems because her field is simply infertile. Therefore, Mrs. Chanthu H. is requesting a loan to buy more fertilizer, fuel for her pump, and pesticides to kill insects.

loans.use: To improve her field by purchasing additional fertilizer and pesticides, as well as fuel for her pump.

payments.comment: Mrs. Chanthu Hong has paid off her loan 7 months in advance! AMK and Kiva would like to thank you for lending to her and we hope you lend again soon! We\'ll do a journal on her very soon!

loans.name: Zahida's Group

texts.en:
Zahida Parveen is the widow of A. S.. He was the breadwinner of his family. He left his family all alone without any financial support. Zahida B. hasn’t enough money to change her circumstances. She has two sons and three daughters. The eldest sons completed 10th standard and are willing to get more education. The next to them is not willing to get an education. She needs a loan for her tea business. She is out of stock now and is relying on this loan.

Zahida has been joined in her group by a few other women named: Safia B., who wants a loan to expand her juice business. Rashida B. wants a loan to invest in a clinic. Sabra B. wants a loan to expand her computer business. Abida B. wants a loan for her mobile business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their lives by improving their businesses.

loans.name: Phlang

texts.en:
Mrs. Phlang C. is a fish-seller in the Khsom Village of Kandal Province. Mrs. Phlang C. is married with six children: two children are employed at a garment factory, three are enrolled in school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Last year, Mrs. Phlang C. developed a heart disease, so her husband spent $500 to cure his wife. Her husband, Mr. Tha Poul (pictured on the right), is a fisherman.

Mr. Tha Poul’s business has struggled as of late because he does not have sufficient equipment in order to catch fish. Therefore, in order to make his business more successful, Mrs. Phlang C. is requesting a loan to buy more fish nets, and any remaining loan proceeds would be used to fix their fishing boat.

loans.use: To improve her husband's fishing business by purchasing additional fish nets, and to repair their boat with any remaining funds.

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um R., a 37-year-old, has four children and lives with her husband in Kampong Chnang, Cambodia. She is a true entrepreneur purchasing and wholesaling in a large quantity of chickens to the market vendors, making on average $23 per day in revenue. Her husband, Mr. Heng Sophon, age 39, is a motor-taxi driver and earns approximately $3 a day of profit.

To meet her customer’s demand and to earn more profits to support the family, now she is requesting for a loan from Kiva to purchase more chicken to make her end meet.

loans.use: To purchase more chicken and repair house.

loans.name: Bidhya

texts.en:
Bidhya T. lives with her husband, Tulshi Ram T., and two children in the town of Sainbu-Bhashapati in the Lalitpur region of Nepal. Tulshi works in construction, building houses for a living. They have a daughter who is in the first grade and a son in primary school.

Two years ago, Mrs. Bidhya opened a poultry farm as a way to improve her family's standard of living and so that she could send her children to good schools. Mrs. Bidhya sells her chickens in a local market, and her husband and daughter help her in this work.

Today, the demand for chickens is increasing rapidly in Nepal, and Bidhya would like to meet this demand by expanding her business. That is why she has applied for a $375 loan to buy baby chicks to raise and eventually sell.

loans.use: To buy baby chicks for her business

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta B., wife of M. Y., is a fruit seller. Shagufta’s husband worked in a mill but unfortunately he left the job because his elder son became ill and through treatment they came to learn that their son was suffering from cancer. He left his job and served the amount in the treatment of his son but in vain. Shagufta’s younger son started to work as a property dealer. The eldest son sells fruit. Shagufta applied for a loan for her fruit business. She plans to renovate her house from the benefit of loan.

Shagufta has been joined in her group by a few other women who are: Sarwar B., who wants a loan for her grocery shop; Azra B., who wants to start her embroidery business; and Parveen B., who wants to buy a rickshaw.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their present conditions.

loans.name: Samey

texts.en:
Mr. Samey R. repairs motorcycles for a living in the Khsom Village of Kandal Province. His wife, Mrs. Vanny Mao (pictured on the right), is a fortune-teller in the local village. Mr. Samey R. is the father of four children, one of whom is attending school while the others are too young to work or study.

In recent months, his business has faced mounting problems because he does not have enough money to afford equipment which enable him to make repairs on the motorcycles his clients bring to him for service. Thus, Mr. Samey R. is seeking a loan to buy such equipment.

loans.use: To purchase equipment in order to repair his customers' motorcycles.

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarswati R. lives in the town of Bagdol, in the Lalitpur region of Nepal. Most of her neighbors make a living running small businesses. Mrs. R. has a husband, Raju R., and two sons. Raju works in a restaurant, and her sons are in the 5th and 3rd grade.

Three years ago, Mrs. Sarswati R. opened a small clothing shop where she sells different types of garments. She has applied for a loan of $225 to buy more goods to sell in this shop.

Mrs. R. is determined to provide a good education to her sons, but in Nepal the cost of education is very high. That is why she is trying to save her additional income for the future education of her two sons.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell in her shop

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en:
Mr. Chhorn B. lives in the Rotaing Village of Kandal Province, where he works as a farmer. Mr. Chhorn B. is a 54-year-old married man with four children: two of his children are laborers, while the others are enrolled in school. His wife, Mrs. Lon Von (pictured on the left), is a subsistence farmer. Last year, Mr. Chhorn B.’s children contracted typhoid and, as a result, he had to spend $75 to cure their diseases.

Usually, he cultivates his crops twice a year. In the dry season, Mr. Chhorn B. grows vegetables; unfortunately, however, he does not have sufficient funds in order to buy nets to protect his crops from animals that come to eat his vegetables. Thus, Mr. Chhorn B. is requesting a loan to purchase such nets, and any remaining funds would be used to buy fertilizer for his field.

loans.use: To purchase nets in order to protect his crops from animals, and to stock up on fertilizer for his field with any remaining loan proceeds

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Mrs. Asha Rawot lives in the town of Bagdol, in the Lalitpur region of Nepal. Most people in this region run small businesses such as grocery stores, small hotels and stationery stores.

Mrs. Maharjan is a widow who lives with her two sons. Three years ago, her husband, Mr. Tilak Rawot died, giving her sole responsibility for her family . Both of her sons are in school, one in the 10th grade and the other in the 6th.

Mrs. Rawot opened a small hotel three years ago. She also runs a shop where she sells different types of Nepali food, along with tea and coffee. She has applied for a $225 loan to buy food supplies for this business.

loans.use: To  purchase food for her business.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Mrs. Ros H. is a farmer in the Popeal Khaer Village of Kandal Province. She is a 34-year-old widow with five children: one child is employed in a garment factory, another one is a fisherman, two are enrolled in school, and the youngest child is too young to work or study. Aside from her farming work, Mrs. Ros H. owns a lake where she grows lotus, which she sells for a profit.

In order to make her harvests more plentiful and profitable, Mrs. Ros H. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer to support her field and lake.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer in order to increase production on her field and lake.

loans.name: Pramila

texts.en:
Mrs. Pramila M. lives in Baghdol, Lalitpur, a town where many people run small businesses such as grocery stores, ready-made clothes shops and so on. Mrs. M. lives with her husband, Bijay M., and one daughter. Bijay is an army officer, and her daughter is in school in the 12th grade.

Two years ago, Mrs. M. opened a beauty parlor. Before doing this, she trained for six months at an institute in a nearby city.

She is seeking a loan of $150 to buy equipment for her salon. She wants to increase her income so she can provide a better education for daughter.

loans.use: to buy equipment for a beauty parlor.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Mrs. Rama M. lives in the town of Thecho with her husband and their two sons. Both sons are in school, one in grade seven and the other in grade five.

Mrs. Rama and her husband Mr. Surendra earn a living making statues of traditional gods and idols, and demand for their products is increasing. To meet this increased customer demand, they need to invest in their business. They have applied for a $225 loan, which they will use to buy raw materials like wax, silver and bronze.

loans.use: to buy wax, silver, bronze and other materials needed to make religious statues.

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr:
After spending a number of years teaching sewing to young women, Ramatoulaye has now decided to set herself up and work out of her home. With her sewing machine, she makes clothing that she sells to tourists. Her earnings permit her to contribute to household living expenses along with her husband who is a teacher.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Ramatoulaye apres plusieurs années passées pour former les jeunes filles en couture a aujourdhui decidé de s' installer chez elle .Avec sa machine à coudre,elle confectionne des habilles qu'elle vend aux touristes.ses revenus lui permettent de participer aux dépenses de la maison à coté de son mari enseignant.

loans.use:
business capital

fonds de Roulement

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Mrs. Rama K. is 38 years old and lives in the town of Sainbu-Bhaishapati. She owns two cows and makes a living selling milk door to door every morning and evening.

Mrs. K. lives in a single-family home with her husband, Mr. Madan K., who works in private office, and their two daughters. Her older daughter has left school and helps her mother with her business. Her younger daughter is sill in school, in grade seven.

Mrs. K. has applied for a loan of $450 to buy another cow because the demand for milk is increasing in her area.

loans.use: To buy another cow to produce more milk

loans.name: Goma

texts.en:
Goma K. is married and has two children -- a daughter who is in the eighth grade and a son in the seventh. Her husband, Mr. Manohari, works at a factory in a nearby industrial area.

Goma K. owns one cow and and makes a living selling milk in her area. In Nepal pure, fresh cow’s milk is highly valued as a beverage and for its contribution to health. She carries her milk around with her in containers and sells it door to door every morning and every evening.

Goma K. lives in a growing neighborhood in which demand for milk is constantly increasing. To help meet this demand, she would like to buy another cow to increase her production. She plans to purchase a jersey cow, which produces more milk than most cows, and has applied for a $300 loan to fund the purchase.

loans.use: To buy a second cow to produce milk to sell.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana B., wife of Mr. M., is the mother of two children. Their eldest son is in 2nd standard. The next to him is not in a school going age. Farzana’s husband is a teacher in a local school near her area. She makes embroidered clothes. She is running a stitching center and a few girls are working with her to fulfill the order of customers. She needs a loan to purchase all decorated embroidery material to fulfill the orders of customers.

Naseem B. wants a loan to start a meat business. Rukhsana B. wants a loan to start a decorated embroidery business. Naik B. wants a loan for a meat business. Abida B. wants a loan for trading cattle. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Dara Salam 2007-1 Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Asunta C.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Asunta is 29 years old and is married with a husband who is a business man. She has one child who is two years old. Each week, Asunta makes approximately 25 Sudanese Pounds in profits. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

Asunta is joined in her small group by Omijima M., Christhine K., Susan P., and Mary S.. Omijima M. has a business selling clothes and wants to construct a house. Christhine K. is currently operating a business selling breads and wants a loan to buy property for her work. Susan P. operates a business selling breads and wants to expand the business. Mary S. is currently in the business of brewing alcohol and is requesting a loan to carry out her business.

loans.use: Expand the business

loans.name: Chandra Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Chandra Laxmi S., 40 years old, is a seamstress who works in the town of Volakhel in Patan. She opened her shop four years ago and specializes in making custom-fitted dresses and other clothing items for women, and school uniforms for both boys and girls. Before starting her business, Mrs S. took a six-month training course.

She is married to Bidya Ratna S., who earns a living making brass religious statues. She has two daughters, ages 17 and 11 years. The youngest daughter is in the seventh grade. Her older daughter just graduated and helps her mother in her shop.

Mrs. S. has applied for a loan to buy the materials she needs to make more clothing for her customers.

loans.use: To buy fabric and other materials to make clothing

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Installée au marché central de mbour Fatou D. vend des tissus ,des pagnes et  des perles trés prisés par les femmes.elle en est à sa premiere demande de crédit et compte renforcer son fonds de commerce. Elle est une mere de famille tres courageuse et travailleuse, avec ce crédit, elle pourra améliorer ses revenus et son niveau de vie et celui de ses enfants. sa clientele est composée essentiellement de femmes mariés.

loans.use: Fonds de Roulement

loans.name: Rejena

texts.en:
Mrs. Rejena N. is 31 years old and works as a seamstress in the town of Kalanki. She opened a shop three years ago, and specializes in making custom-fitted dresses that are very popular with Nepali women. Before starting her business, Mrs Nalarmi took a six-month course in tailoring at a shop near where she lives.

She plans to use her loan to buy raw materials for making dresses, and wants to use her income for self improvement and for her daughter's education. In Nepal, the cost of providing a good education is rising, and Mrs. Narkami wants to begin saving her income now so she can provide for her daughter later.

Her husband, Sudip Singh N., is a high-school and college teacher. Their daughter is three years old and attends nursery school .

loans.use: To buy materials for her shop

loans.name: Fahriddin

texts.ru:
Fahriddin A. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 30 years old, is married and has 2 children. Fahriddin is in business of purchasing and reselling building materials. He has a medium sized store on the Vahdat market. This business is the only source of income for his family. Right now is summer and people begin to do repair work in their homes. This is why Fahriddin would like to increase the variety of goods he has for sale and is in need of a loan. He plays to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Абдулхамедов Фахриддин житель города Вахдат . Возраст 30 лет , женат , имеет 2 детей. Образование средне-техническое. Фахриддин занимается куплей продажей строительных материалов. Он имеет небольшой магазин на рынке города Вахдат .Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Сейчас лето и люди начинают делать в своих домах ремонт. Поэтому клиент хочет увеличить ассортимент товара своей точки ,для чего ему нужны деньги. Поэтому он решил взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев

loans.use: Increase the variety of goods for sale

loans.name: Tulsi Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Tulshi Maiya M. lives in Thecho, Lalitpur, a part of Nepal where most people are farmers. She is married and has two children. Her husband, Tulshi Ram M., is a laborer who builds houses for a living. They have two sons who are in high school.

The family lives in poverty because her husband's income is not enough to support four people. To overcome this problem, Mrs. M. opened up a poultry farm two years ago. She now makes a living selling chickens in the local market. Because of her success, her family's conditions are slowly improving. To continue this improvement, she has applied for a loan of $150 to buy 100 baby chicks to raise on her poultry farm.

loans.use: To buy baby chickens

loans.name: Kumri

texts.en:
O. Kumri is 45 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband is entrepreneur. In order to help her husband in supporting the family, Kumri has been running her own business for the last 7 years. She works in a tailoring shop. During these seven years she has gained rich work experience about tailoring. Kumri’s work is specialized, sewing clothing for women of European style as well as of the national style.

She always dreamed of owning a business and not having to depend on anyone else. Kumri believes that someday her dream will come true and she will open her own tailoring shop. Today she is requesting a loan of $600, which she will repay over 6 months, in order to purchase a new sewing machine. With your help, this will be possible. Kumri is counting on your help. Be an important part of the growth of Kumri’s business!

loans.use: Purchasing of the new sewing machine for expanding the business

loans.name: Sharifgul

texts.ru:
Sharifgul D. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 50 years old, is married and has 7 children. High School education. Sharifgul works as a kindergarten teacher. Her sallary is very small and is insufficient to take care of her large family. This is why Sharifgul and her husband raise cattle. They buy small calves on the market, raise them and sell them to local meat vendors. This business allows them to take care of their children. Currently Sharifgul would like to purchase two more calves. In order to do that she would like to obtain a loan. She plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Джалилова Шарифгул жительница города Вахдат. Возраст 50 лет, замужем , имеет 7 детей. Образование среднее. Шарифгул работает воспитательницей в детском садике. Заработная плата очень маленькая и ей не хватает на содержании большой семьи. Поэтому Шарифгуль с мужем занимается животноводством. Они покупают на рынке молодых телят ,откармливают их и сдают на мясо в мясные ларьки. Этот бизнес позволяет им покупать все необходимое для своих детей. В данный момент клиентка хочет купить двух бычков .Для чего она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase two calves

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en: Mrs. Sushila M. is 25 years old and lives in the undeveloped region of Thecho, Lalitpur with her husband and a son. Most of people in this region are farmers. Her husband, Mr. Nanda M., is 60 years old, and for the last 26 years has installed and repaired gas cookers for a living. Mrs. M. is seeking a loan to buy the goods and supples she and her husband need to continue running this business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a business that installs and repairs gas cookers.

loans.name: Vohidova

texts.ru:
M. Vohidova is 39 years old, married and has three children. Her husband used to work as a public transportation driver. He has become disabled after an accident and has problems with his right leg.

M. sells children's clothing on the market. To grow her business M. decided to apply for a small loan because the entire weight of her family's expenses has laid on her shoulders. The merchandise circulation is not increasing and this is why she needs a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Вохидова Манзура женщина в возросте 39 лет замужем имеет 3 детей муж раньше работа водителем общественого транспорта. Манзура торгует на рынке детской одеждой.

Для увеличения своего бизнеса Манзура решила взять небольшой кредит , т.к весь груз семейных расходов лежит у ее на плечах, товарооборот у нее не увеличивается.Для этого она хочет кредитоваться.Муж ее после большой аварии стал инвалидом 2группы -по болезни правой ноги.

loans.use: Sell children's clothing

loans.name: Lochin

texts.en: A. Lochin is 38 years old. He is married with four children. Lochin is a farmer. He is growing crops like tomatos, cucumbers, onions, potatos, wheat and others. He has been working the land for ten years. His wife, who is pictured in the photo, and elder son help him with the business. Each year Lochin is grows crops sufficient for family consumption and for selling. Generating stable income, Lochin is able to support his large family. Today he requests $350 for the term of 8 months. The loan shall be used for purchasing the seeds and mineral fertilizer. After gathering his yield he wants to sell it all to the locals with the lowest prices in the market. Lochin thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to be accurate with the loan payment.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Srijana

texts.en:
Mrs. Srijana P. is 32 years old and lives in Bijeswori, a town in the Kathmandu Valley, with her husband and three children. Mrs. P.'s oldest daughter is 13 years old and in the seventh grade. Her middle child, also a girl, is 12 and in the sixth grade. Her youngest child, a son, is six and in the first grade.

Like many people in this area, she and her husband make a living running a small shop that sells various items such as snacks, gum and jewelery that are in demand among local residents. She has applied for a loan of $225, which she will use to buy more goods to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To buy goods to sell from her shop

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.ru:
Shamigul S. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 48 years old, is married and has 5 children. She has a High School education. Shamigul has a piece of land where she grows vegetables. Once the vegetables are grown, she puts some away for her family's consumption and sells the rest on the market. In order to get good crops she needs to purchase mineral fertilizer. For this goal she wishes to obtain a loan. She plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Сафарбекова Шамигул жительница города Вахдат . Возраст 48 лет , замужем ,имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Шамигул занимается сельским хозяйством. Она имеет земельный участок, где выращивает овощи. Собрав урожай клиентка делает необходимые запасы для своей семьи ,а лишнее продает на рынке. Но что бы собрать качественный урожай ей необходимо купить минеральные удобрения . Для чего она и решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mirzosafar

texts.en: K. Mirzosafar is 51 years old. He is married with four children. Mirzosafar is a farmer. He is growing crops like onions, wheat, tomatos, cucumbers, potatos and others. He has been working the land for ten years. His wife, elder sons and a daughter help him with the business. Each year Mirzosafar grows crops sufficient for family consumption and for selling. Generating stable income, Mirzosafar is able to support his large family. Today he requests $600 for the term of 9 months. The loan shall be used for purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer. Mirzosafar thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to be accurate in the loan payment.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anorhol

texts.ru:
Anorhol A. lives in the city of Vahdat. she is 42 years old, is married and has 6 children. She has a High School education. She is in the business of raising cattle. She purchases young calves on the market, raises them and sells them at a better price. This business is the main source of income for her family because Anorhol's husband is temporarily unemployed. Currently Anorhol would like to purchase a milk cow because the price of milk products has drastically increased on the local markets. The children need milk and this is why Anorhol has decided to get a loan. She plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Абдуллаева Анорхол жительница города Вахдат . Возраст 42 года, замужем , имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Анорхол занимается животноводством . Она разводит крупный рогатый скот . Клиентка покупает на рынке молодых бычков, откармливает их и продает по более выгоднй ей цене. Эта деятельность является единственным источником дохода ее большой семьи .Так как муж Анорхол временно не работает. В данный момент клиентка хочет купить дойную корову. Так как рынке очень сильно подорожала кисло-молочная продукция. А детям необходимо покупать молоко. Поэтому Анорхол решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchasing a milk cow

loans.name: Salimа

texts.en:
M. Salim is 48 years old. She is widow. Salim is the loving mother of three children. Salim is a market vendor. For the last ten years she has been selling cottonseed oil in the local market. Her son helps Salim with the business. In the traditional Tajik cuisine, the majority of the meals are fried or cooked using cottonseed oil. Especially our national dish, Oshi palov, which needs much cottonseed oil in order for it to be delicious.

So the goods that Salim is selling are of popular demand among the population. Now Salim is planning to arrange the marriage of her son. For this reason she is planning to increase her business. Now she requests $100 for the term of 6 months. The loan shall be used for purchasing cottonseed oil in order to increase the goods. Salim is counting on your help and thanks everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: Purchasing cottonseed oil in order to increase the goods for selling

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Y. Karim is 40 years old. He is married. He has three children. Karim is a market vendor. He is selling the brooms in the local market. As a rule, he purchases the brooms from the neighboring country Uzbekistan, from the city of Kokand. Karim has been in this business for eleven years. His wife and elder son help him with painting the brooms. Usually they paint the brooms with the red color in order to give them a good look to attract clients. Therefore his goods are in great demand.

The business is stable and allows Karim to use the generated income for improving the living conditions of the family. He is trying to do all the best in order to make his children happy and to give them a good education. Now his elder son is going to enter the University, and that’s why he needs to expand his business and increase the working capital for purchasing the brooms. With this purpose, he requests $700 for the term of 9 months. Karim is counting on your help and thanks everyone for supporting him.

loans.use: Purchase of the brooms

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
U. Jamal is 49 years old. She and her husband have raised six children. Her husband is a businessman. In order to increase their family budget, for the last six years Jamal has been selling cottonseed oil in the local market. Her son helps Jamal with the business. In the traditional Tajik cuisine, the majority of the meals are fried or cooked using cottonseed oil. So the goods that Jamal is selling are in demand.

Six years ago, Jamal started this business with a rather small amount of money, and today the business has turned into a stable one. Now Jamal is planning to cover the higher education expenses of her daughter and to arrange the marriage of her son. For this reason she is planning to increase her business. Now she requests $300 for the term of 6 months. The loan shall be used for purchasing cottonseed oil in order to increase the goods. Having proved herself as reliable, Jamal promises to repay the loan on time and thanks all supporting her.

loans.use: Purchasing cottonseed oil in order to increase the goods for selling

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is married and has a daughter. He sells women’s footwear at the city market in Novaya Kahovka, Ukraine. Sergey purchases all of his inventory from national shoe factories which produce good quality and durable footwear. He started this venture 4 years ago. Today his business is well known in the city for having assorted merchandise.

Sergey’s venture is the only source of income for his family. He operates it as a family business based on Christian values. Sergey always sticks to principles of integrity and responsibility. We believe this loan will help him expand his business, having a positive impact on his trade profitability and helping to further improve the economic and social situation of his family.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Huseyn.

texts.ru:
Huseyn K. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 44 years old, is married and has 5 children. He has a secondary-technical education and is a driver by profession. In his free time Huseyn raises livestock and has 5 years of experience in this area. He purchases young calves from locals, fattens them and resells them at the market at a higher price. This business allows him to support his family. At this point, Huseyn would like to purchase a new calf, fatten it and then resell it. This is why he needs money. He has decided to take out a loan for a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Кодиров Хусейн Назирович житель района Рудаки . Возраст 44 года , женат , имеет 5 детей . Образование среднее- техническое. По специальности водитель. Хусейн в свободное от работы время занимается животноводством.Имеет овыт более 5 лет. Он скупает у местного населения молотых бычков , откармливает их и продает на рынке по более выгодной ему цене. Эта деятельность позволяет ему содержать свою семью. В данный момент Хусейн хочет купить очередного бычка ,откормить и продать .Для чего ему и нужны деньги. Клиент решил взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев

loans.use: Livestock

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is married with two daughters. He’s a businessman from Novaya Kahovka where he sells women’s footwear in the city market. Yuryi is very enterprising, has vast experience working as a vendor and is full of creative ideas. A reasonable pricing policy and client-friendly service has always been priorities in his work and have helped to ensure the success of his business. Yuryi has a perfect record as a client with HOPE Intl-Nadiya Ukraine, having promptly repaid each loan he has received.

Yuryi has been running his business for seven years. Currently, he has about $6000 invested in the business. His monthly income is about $300-400. Yuryi is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to increase his inventory. He believes that having this additional turnover capital will help him minimize his sales risk and provide stable financial support for his family. Moreover, it will help him get closer to his ultimate goal of purchasing a big store of his own one day.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.en:
