K. Muhayo is 42 years old. She is married with four children of school age. She has been running her business for more than three years. She rents a shop at the center of the town. She is selling clothing for kids and also baby carriages, and other baby things.

All the goods are delivered by Muhayo’s husband from a neighboring country. Muhayo and her husband are trying to purchase goods of good quality, with prices acceptable for the clients with average incomes. Being a very nice and friendly woman by her nature, Muhayo is working hard and trying to serve the clients so that they have a positive experience and want to come back.

The business is stable, allowing her to contribute considerably to the family budget. Now Muhayo is planning to purchase baby carriages and tricycles in order to increase the range of goods for selling. With this purpose she requests $1200 for the term of 12 months. Having positive credit history, Muhayo promises to repay the current loan promptly. She grateful for everyone supporting her.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for kids in order to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Ahror

texts.en: C. Ahror is 40. He’s married. He’s the father of 4 children. Her wife is Bibijamol, and she helps Ahror with farming. Ahror is working hard on the farm, and his business includes growing and selling of onions, garlic, potatoes and maize. Due to it being the beginning of the sowing season, he is planning to sow onion, garlic, potatoes and maize. That is why he wants to buy seed and mineral fertilizer. He needs a loan of $500 with the term of 8 months. After gathering his yield he wants to sell it to locals, with the low prices in the market. He is promising to be accurate with paying the loan. Ahror and his hopeful wife are counting on your help. Be an important part of Ahror’s business!

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Etiennette

texts.fr:
Mrs. Etiennette K. was born April 17, 1972 in Cotonou, in the Atlantique du Sud department in Benin. She is married to Mr. Julien Houinsou, a freight agent at the Autonomous Port of Cotonou, and has two children who still live at home. For five years, she has been selling firewood and coal used by most households in Cotonou who often do not have enough money to buy household gas. For firewood, she often buys tree trunks that are then chopped. With an excellent record in this line of business, she is requesting this loan to purchase wood. She holds the monopoly on firewood in her neighborhood, where households often use firewood for cooking.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame K. Etiennette est né le 17 avril 1972 à COTONOU dans le département de l’Atlantique au sud du BENIN. Mariée à monsieur HOUINSOU Julien, transitaire au Port Autonome de COTONOU, elle a deux enfants à sa charge. Depuis 5 ans, elle commercialise du bois de chauffage et du charbon utilisés par la grande majorité des ménages de Cotonou ne disposant pas très souvent de moyens financiers pour se procurer le gaz domestique. Pour le bois de chauffage, elle achète très souvent des troncs d’arbres qui sont par la suite fendus. Ayant fait ses preuves dans ce secteur d’activité, elle sollicite ce crédit afin de s’approvisionner en bois. Elle se trouve dans une situation de monopole dans son quartier où les ménages utilisent le bois de chauffage pour faire la cuisine.

loans.use: Purchase of one truckload of firewood

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is married with two children. She is from Novaya Kahovka where she sells footwear for children and teenagers in the city market. Alla is an experienced market vendor – she has been working in the trade for 12 years. Today she earns about $400-600 of net profit per month. She has about 70 different types of shoes for sale. 

Alla’s business is an important source of income for her family and she works hard to provide for the daily needs of her family. Alla is very energetic and cheerful. She dreams big and always tries to be optimistic in her endeavors. Alla is seeking a loan of 2500 Grivnas to expand her vending business. She is hoping to generate enough profit and savings to open a new vending facility in the near future.

loans.use: To increase her shoe inventory

loans.name: Gwladys

texts.fr:
Born around 1956 in Sahoue, in the Mono department in southwest Benin, Mrs. Gwladys N. is retired from the Postal and Telecommunications Service in Benin. A mother of six children, two of whom still live at home, she is a trained hairdresser and has a beauty salon in her home. She also sells beauty products and various brands and types of hair extensions. In addition, she sells cloth that she displays in her salon. Considering her increased client base, Mrs. Gwladys N. is requesting a third loan in order to purchase more supplies and meet her customers’ needs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers les années 1956 à SAHOUE dans le département du MONO au Sud-ouest du BENIN, dame N. Gwladys est retraitée de l’Office des Postes et Télécommunications du BENIN. Mère de 6 enfants dont 2 sont encore à sa charge, elle s’est formée en coiffure et a ouvert un salon de beauté à son domicile. Elle vend également des produits de beauté et différentes marques et qualités de mèches. Parallèlement, elle revend des tissus qu’elle expose dans son salon. Compte tenu de l’augmentation de sa clientèle, dame N. Gwladys introduit sa demande de renouvellement pour son troisième crédit afin d’augmenter son stock pour répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 15 dozen hair extensions, 15 cosmetic kits, 10 pieces of cloth and other beauty products

loans.name: Uldosh

texts.ru:
Uldosh Rashanov is a resident of the Rudaki region. He is 53 years old, is married and has 8 children. Uldosh raises livestock. He raises small horned animals. Uldosh purchases young goats at the local market and fattens them up. After the animals gain weight, Uldosh sells them to local meat sellers. This business allows Uldosh to support his family. Today, Uldosh would like to purchase a calf, which is why he needs money. He has decided to take out a loan for a 7 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Равшанов Юлдош житель района Рудаки . Возраст 53 года , женат , имеет 8 детей. Юлдош занимается животноводством. Он разводит мелкий рогатый скот . Он покупает на местном рынке молодых коз ,откармливает их. После того как животные набирают вес,клиент сдает их в мясные ларьки. Эта деятельность позволяет Юлдошу содержать его большую семью. В данный момент клиент хочет купить бычка для чего ему нужны деньги. Юлдош решил взять кредит сроком на 7 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a working mom. She runs a business selling women’s clothing at the Dneprovskyi market in Kherson, Ukraine. Tatyana started her own business 5 years ago. She is disciplined, accurate and thoughtful in planning and managing her business and is a businesswoman who can handle any challenge with natural enthusiasm and determination.

Tatyana has benefited from the lending services provided by HOPE Intl-Nadiya Ukraine and has established a reputation for honesty as she has worked with our organization. She has requested a loan of 2500 Grivnas to purchase some new clothing items to sell. This loan will provide further assistance to Tatyana as she seeks to develop her business and increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase new clothing items to sell

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.en:
Y. Ibrohim is 30 years old. He is married. He is the father of three wonderful children. Ibrohim’s children are small now, but already today he is working hard in order to ensure the best future for them. Ibrohim is a market vendor. He is selling brooms in the local market. As a rule he purchases the brooms from the neighboring country Uzbekistan and the city of Kokand.

Ibrohim has been in this business for 6 years. His wife and elder daughter, who is pictured in the photo, help him with painting the brooms. Usually they paint the brooms with a red color in order to give them a good look to attract clients. Therefore the goods that is he selling are in great demand. The business is stable and allows Ibrohim to use the generated income for improving the living conditions of the family. Today he requests $700 for the term of 9 months. The loan shall be used for increasing the stock of goods. Ibrohim thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to be accurate with the loan payment.

loans.use: Purchase of brooms to increase inventory

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr:
Born November 20, 1974 in Cotonou, in the Littoral department in the south of Benin, Mrs. Cécile F. is a married mother of three children, who all still live at home. She has a stand at the Dantokpa international market. In order to attract customers and increase her capital, she would like to use one part of the loan money she is requesting to buy spices, milk and sugar and the other part to buy subsistence products in order to diversify her business.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 20 novembre 1974 à COTONOU dans le département du Littoral au sud du BENIN, dame F. Cécile est mariée et mère de 3 enfants tous à sa charge. Elle s’est procuré un stand au marché international DANTOKPA. En vue d’attirer de la clientèle et pour renforcer son capital, elle désire injecter une partie du crédit sollicité dans l’achat des épices, du lait, du sucre et la seconde partie dans l’achat de produits vivriers afin de faire une diversification d’activités.

loans.use: Purchase of two bags of corn, three bags of yams, three bags of beans, five boxes of sugar and six boxes of sweetened condensed milk

loans.name: Naveeda's Group

texts.en:
Naveeda B., wife of Mr. M., is a mother of two sons. Both are not yet of school-going age. She needs a loan to buy a laundry shop because her husband is a washer man by profession.

She has been joined in her loan group by a few more members: Abida B. wants a loan to buy land and to buy an iron press and iron stands; Shamim B. wants a loan to expand her Pan Shop business; Safia B. wants a loan to buy a vegetable cart; Naseem B. wants a loan to improve the condition of workshop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Banbamima Group

texts.en: Nallay is 35 years old and married with 5 children. The family does subsistence farming for their survival.  They grow vegetables, peanuts, and rice. Like the other group members, Sallay K. and Mariama M., Nallay cannot grow enough food to sell due to a lack of farm inputs. The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le.1,500,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizer and hire laborers.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia B., wife of Mr. M., lives in a small city of Pakistan named Chichawatni. She has been living in this city for the last 40 years. She has a four room brick house. She has six sons. Her first two sons are married. All of her sons are in a mature age. The second son works in a paint shop. The son next to him has a motor bike business. Her husband runs a Pan shop. She needs a loan for her husband’s business.

Safia has been joined in her loan group by a few more members: Shazia B. wants a loan to expand her meat business; Suraiya B. wants a loan to buy a donkey cart; Nasreen B. wants a loan to expand her fruit business; Irshad B., wants a loan to make sacks of flour and fine flour to sell in the market and earn a profit.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To entertain peoples' demands

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with one daughter. She is the main breadwinner in the family. Victoria sells terrycloth robes and other clothing items at the central market in Novaya Kahovka, Ukraine. Financial problems brought out her tenacity and innovation six years ago when she decided to start her own small business. Today she has a small kiosk selling casual outerwear for women. She makes about $300-$500 of monthly net profit.  

Victoria is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to sustain her business. One of the greatest joys of her work is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. She has had a great history with "HOPE Intl-Nadiya Ukraine” having repaid every loan she has received. Victoria is requesting a loan 1000 Grivnas to re-supply her inventory. She is planning to purchase a variety of clothing items and expand her trade. Victoria believes that having an assortment of clothing that is practical and durable will increase her sales and offer a nice variety to her customer base.

loans.use: To increase her clothing inventory

loans.name: Alice Kalule's Group

texts.en:
Alice leads a group with four members. She is 48 years old and married with seven children. Their ages are 28, 26, 20, 18,15, 12, and 8 and three of them are in school. The community she resides and works in is semi-urban within a slum area.

She purchases bales of secondhand clothes, which she grades and prices. The clothes are then put on display in her home or sold in the daily markets in different areas. She sells at both retail and wholesale.

She must deal with high transport costs, price fluctuations, and an environment in which floods keep clients from getting to her stall in the rains.

She is successful in being able to pay school dues, acquire medication, and contribute to the family welfare. She aspires to buy a plot of land where she can construct rooms to rent out.

Alice has successfully paid back more than five loans.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Jeannine

texts.fr:
Born around 1944 in Djakotome, in the Mono department in southwest Benin, Mrs. Jeannine E. currently lives in Cotonou with her two children, Mica and Gérard, who are a junior and sophomore, respectively, at Vedoko Collège d’Enseignement Général high school. Mrs. Jeannine E. buys bags of cashew nuts, grills them, peels them, fries them in butter and then sells them wholesale and retail. Recently, the price of a bag of cashew nuts has gone from 25,000 to 38,000 CFA francs, so she is having serious trouble buying enough cashew nuts to satisfy her customers. She is thus requesting this loan to face this increase in the price of cashew nuts and better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers les années 1944 à DJAKOTOME dans le département de MONO au Sud-ouest du BENIN, dame E. Jeannine vit actuellement à COTONOU avec 2 enfants Mica et Gérard respectivement en classe de Seconde et de Troisième au Collège d’Enseignement Général VEDOKO. Dame E. Jeannine achète des sacs de noix d’anacarde, les grille, les épluche, les frit au beurre et les revend en gros et en détail. Actuellement le sac de noix d’anacarde est passé de 25000 à 38 francs. Ainsi, elle éprouve de sérieuses difficultés pour acheter les noix d’anacarde pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Elle sollicite donc ce crédit pour faire face à cette hausse de prix du sac d’acajou afin de satisfaire au mieux ses clients.

loans.use: Purchase of three bags of cashew nuts

loans.name: Rajab

texts.ru:
Rajab H. is a resident of the Rudaki region. He is 35 years old, is married and has 3 children. He has a high school education. Rajab purchases and sells small horned livestock. This business is the sole source of income for his family. Since Rajab’s parents are pensioners he needs to support their family as well. Today, he would like to purchase a small herd of goats an to send them to graze. This will allow him to earn a small profit. He has decided to take out a 7 month loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хасанов Раджаб житель района Рудаки. Возраст 35 лет , женат , имеет 3 детей. Образование средние. Раджаб занимается куплей продажей мелкого рогатого скота. Эта деятельность является единственным источником дохода его семьи.Так как родители Раджаба пенсионеры ему приходится содержать и их семью.Сейчас он хочет закупить небольшую отару коз и отправить на пастбище . После чего он сможет получить неплохой доход . Поэтому клиент решил взять кредит сроком на 7 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase goats

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana B., wife of A. S., was born and brought up in an area of an industrial city named Faisalabad. She has been living in Chichawatni, a small city of Pakistan, for the last 35 years. She has four daughters and three sons. The eldest son works in a garment factory. The next son to him works in a property dealing business. And the next to them is getting education in a local school.

She needs a loan for her husband to diversify the products and, in future, make her grocery shop into a store. Her husband has been in this profession for the last 35 years. She makes embroided clothes at home.

She has been joined in her loan group by a few more members: Naziran B. wants a loan to purchase the material for wooden baskets; Khadija B. wants a loan to repair her rickshaw; Jamila B. wants a loan to buy electric items; Kosar B. wants a loan to repair her rickshaw.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To diversify their businesses

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.en: M. Sobirjon is 50 years old. He’s married. Sobirjon and his wife have 3 children. Sobirjon is a farmer. His wife and elder son help him with the business. He is growing such crops as wheat, onions, potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers and others. Having worked the land for ten years, Sobirjon has gained rich experience. Each year he is growing a yield sufficient for the family consumption and for selling. The business is the main source of income and is generating a stable income. At the same time, it requires considerable funding. Now Sobirjon needs to purchase mineral fertilizer and the seeds for planting. He’s asking for a loan on the size of $600. The loan will be repaid in 9 months. Sobirjon and his family are counting on your help. Sobirjon thanks all supporting him and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr:
Born February 10, 1972 in Allada, in the Atlantique department, Mrs. Félicienne A. G. is a married mother of five children. She sells onions and fresh eggs. Due to the great increase in the number of cafeterias in Cotonou, demand has greatly increased, and she quickly runs out of her stock of fresh eggs. To meet her customers’ needs, Félicienne A. G. is requesting her third loan in order to purchase onions and fresh eggs.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 10 février 1972 à ALLADA dans le département de l’ATLANTIQUE, dame A. G. Félicienne est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle vend de l’oignon et des œufs frais. En raison de la multiplication des cafétérias dans la ville de COTONOU, elle écoule très vite son stock d’œufs frais. Ainsi, la demande est elle devenue plus importante. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, dame A. G. Félicienne sollicite son troisième crédit afin de s’approvisionner en oignon et en œufs frais.

loans.use: Purchase of five bags of onions and 500 fresh eggs

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana B., wife of M. A., lives in a 3 room brick house. Her husband is a fruit seller. He has been in this profession for the last 12 years. Farzana's husband’s monthly income is $5 to $6. She has applied for a loan to expand her husband’s fruit business.

She has been joined in her loan group by a few more members: Naseem B. wants a loan to expand her workshop; Shahnaz B. wants a loan to repair her rickshaw; Naziran B. wants a loan to buy fruits; Shazia B. wants a loan to start a wood business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To facilitate their customers and improve their financial condition

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr:
Born November 26, 1979 in Avrankou, in the Oueme department, Mrs. Yvette D. is single, has no children and lives with her mother. At Dantokpa, the largest market in Benin, she sells onions, black pepper and green anise, which is used to flavor certain alcoholic beverages. However, Mrs. Yvette D. is facing financial difficulties in purchasing these products. She is thus requesting this loan to overcome these difficulties.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 26 novembre 1979 à AVRANKOU dans le département de l’OUEME, dame D. Yvette est célibataire sans enfants et vit avec sa maman. Elle vend à DANTOKPA - le plus grand marché du BENIN - de l’oignon, du poivre noir et de l’anis vert servant à parfumer certaines boissons alcoolisées. Pour s’approvisionner, dame D. Yvette éprouve des difficultés financières. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour faire face à cette difficulté.

loans.use: Purchase of three bags of onions, one bag of green anise and three bags of pepper

loans.name: Ishrat's Group

texts.en:
Ishrat T., wife of Mr. T., lives in a small city of Pakistan named Chichawatni. She is a housewife. Her husband runs a grocery shop. Ishrat helps him in his business. She has applied for a loan for her grocery shop. She and her husband plan that if she gets the benefit of this loan, they will diversify the products and make the grocery shop into a full grocery store.

She has been joined in her group by a few more members: Azra B. wants a loan to buy a motor cycle; Sharifan B. wants a loan to buy fruits; Amiran B. wants a loan to buy a vegetable cart; Yasmeen B. wants a loan to buy cloth.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To diversify their businesses on a large scale

loans.name: Cossy Muhairwe's Group

texts.en:
Cossy is leads a group with five members. She is a 35-year-old widow with five children, ages 17, 16, 15, 14, and 13. All of them are in school. The community she resides and works in is semi-urban within a slum area.

She has had a hair salon in her home for the last 14 years. She stocks hair oils, synthetic hair, and other salon accessories for her clients to buy. Although there is a market for her business, she must deal with the challenges of price fluctuations of her stock and noisy surroundings because she resides in a slum.

Her children dropped out of school after the death of their father, but Cossy is able to care for them and has been able to send them back to school. She managed to move to a bigger house and started rearing goats in the village. She plans to invest more in her children’s education and to buy a plot of land where she can construct a house.

Cossy has successfully paid back more than four loans.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Sinisy Ll Group

texts.en:
Fatmata T. is the group leader of Sinisy solidarity group. Fatmata is 40 years old and married with 5 children. The family lives on subsistence farming but cannot grow enough for the family and for commercial purposes.

When Fatmata heard about Kiva, she organized the other group members, Fanta K., Saran K., Feremusu M., and Kutha S., to access loans to increase their production. The group grows rice, peanuts, carrots, and other vegetables for consumption and for sale. Therefore the group is requesting a loan of Le.2,500,00 to purchase fertilizer and vegetable, rice, and peanut seeds, as well as for hiring labor.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and increase production

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.en:
C. Mehriniso is 55-year-old mother of five children. Her husband is a driver, and they both are loving parents. Mehriniso and her husband are working hard to ensure the future for their children. Mehriniso has her own business for eight years already. She started as the seller of clothing. Gradually she is becoming more involved in this business and is dreaming of opening her own trading place. Now she is selling women's clothes and shoes in the store which is located in the central local market.

Mehriniso is a friendly and polite woman. She is trying to diversify the range of goods to satisfy the needs of the clients with the various levels of income. The business is stable, allowing Mehriniso to make a considerable contribution to the family budget. Her children are growing up and their expenses are increasing too. Thus she wants to develop her business. With this purpose Mehriniso requests $1000 for purchasing new summer clothes and shoes for women to sell. The loan will be repaid within 12 months. Mehriniso thanks all supporting her and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner, as she used to do with her previous loans.

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for increasing the stock

loans.name: Mayna

texts.en:
N. Mayna is 57 years old. She is widow. She’s the loving mother of eight children.  
Mayna is a market vendor. She is selling clothes and shoes for men in the local market. Her two sons help her with the business. Mayna has been in this business for five years already. For these years, she managed to make her business stable and profitable, generating the main incomes for her family. When we wanted take her picture she was busy servicing her clients. That is why in the photo she is standing in the background and is not clearly seen and the men standing in the foreground are her clients. She is trying to satisfy the needs of any client with various tastes and income levels. She works very hard to give her dearest children good educations and to make them happy. In order to cover the higher education expenses of her daughter who is going to enter the university, Mayna is planning to increase her working capital in order to purchase new summer shoes for selling. With this purpose Mayna requests 400 $ US Dollars for the term of 4 months. She promises to repay the loan in accurate manner. Mayna and her hopeful son are counting on your help. Be important in the growth of Mayna’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing of the new shoes for men in order to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Betty Nattabi's Group

texts.en:
Betty leads a group with five members. She is 22 years old and single with one baby. The community she resides and works in is semi-urban.

She has just started selling women’s clothes, such as skirts, blouses, and trousers. Although her business has not yet picked up momentum because it is new, she has been able to increase her stock.

She plans to use this loan to continue increasing her stock and perhaps move her business to a more strategic place.

Betty is paying her first loan.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Ugul

texts.en:
Ugul R. is 49 years old. Her husband is a driver. Together they are raising four children. Ugul sells clothes and shoes for kids in the central local market. She has been in this business for more then 10 years.

Ugul's business is very stable which allows her to improve the level of living conditions of her family. With the income from her business, Ugul managed to repair her house as she is planning to arrange the marriage of her son. That’s why she needs to expand her business and increase her working capital to purchase new summer clothes and shoes for kids. Ugul requests US$600 for this purpose. She is promising to repay the loan within 12 months. She thanks everybody who is supporting her. She says that your support will really help her.

loans.use: Purchase new children's clothes to sell

loans.name: Matiyande Group

texts.en:
Mohamed K. is the Matiyande group leader and is also a Kiva client who has completed his payment. With the previous loan, Mohamed increased his stock and income and has invested part of the profit in farming. Like the other 3 members, Fatmata K., Kati K., and Seray M., Mohamed sells agricultural products such as peanuts, rice, beans, etc. They buy the products from the farmers and sell to retailers, thus taking the economy into the villages.

The group is requesting a loan of Le.3,600,000 to increase their stock and reduce transportation costs and time spent on frequent traveling. Mohamed is 36 years old and married with 3 children.

loans.use: To increase stock and income

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz S. sells cattle. He started his business in 1998 with growing the calves. Now Aziz has the large cow-shed in which he has many calves and the milk cow. He likes animals and his job very much which allows him to support his family. Aziz is 48 years old. He is married with three children. The youngest is in his last year of school. His elder son has become an adult and now helps him as well as his wife.

The business requires a great effort to keep it successful and to generate stable income for the family. Thus, Aziz gets up every morning at five o’clock in order to feed the animals and to look after them. Today Aziz requests $1200 US for the term of 12 months. The loan is required to purchase calves and fodder for cattle. Aziz would like everyone to trust him, and he promises to be precise in the loan payment.

loans.use: Purchase cattle and fodder for the animals

loans.name: Teddy Namazzi's Group

texts.en:
Teddy leads a group of four members. She is 45 years old and married with six children. Their ages are 18, 16, 14, 11, 5, and 3, and they all go to school. The community she resides and works in is semi-urban and surrounded by slums.

She has been selling local brew for 15 years in Nakulabye, one of the busy suburbs of Kampala. She collects the brew from the village and sells it to residents of the nearby slums. She must deal with stiff competition.

She has been able to increase her business and contribute to the day-to-day running of her home. She would like to buy a plot of land in order to construct a house.

Teddy has successfully paid back more than five loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Manikala Group

texts.en:
Yonbo is the group leader and a Kiva client who has completed her repayment. With her previous loan, Yonbo increased her income and was able to take care of her children. She also expanded her rice farm. Yonbo is a widow, but recently she also lost her daughter, leaving her with a day-old baby. At 47 years old, Yonbo now has the responsibility of taking care of her grandchild.

The group has 5 members, but the other 3 members went to purchase their business stock and were not available for the group photo. Like Yonbo, Saio KaM. sells palm oil, rice, soap, etc. Occasionally Yonbo and Saio purchase kenel nuts and produce palm oil. The 2 members would like to expand their businesses and are therefore requesting a loan of Le.2200000.

loans.use: To increase stock and generate more income

loans.name: Molako L Group

texts.en: Alhaji is the group leader of Molako l. With their previous loans, he was able to increase his stock of rice and palm oil and has stock for the rainy season. Alhaji is very happy that with the profit he expanded his family's farm of rice and peanuts. Mariama K. and Jeneba M. are also happy that with the profits they were able to hire laborers to work in their firm while they do the business. The group is requesting a loan of Le.2900000 to expand their businesses. Alhaji is 55 years old and married with 5 children.

loans.use: To expand the existing business

loans.name: Harriet Namboyera's Group

texts.en:
Harriet is leader of a group with four members. She is 27 years old and married with two children, ages five and two. One of them goes to school. The community she resides and works in is semi-urban and surrounded by slums.

She has been selling local brew for two years in Kasubi, one of the busy suburbs of Kampala. She collects the brew from the village and sells it to residents of the nearby slums. She must face the problem of thieves who waylay people and rob them of money and property.

She has been able to build her business and contribute to the day-to-day running of her home. She would like to buy a plot of land in order to construct a house.

Harriet has successfully paid back more than five loans.

loans.use: She would like to increase her stock in order to earn more income.

loans.name: Hosiyat

texts.en:
Hosiyat K. is 57 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband works as an agricultural accountant. For about ten years Hosiyat has sold wheat, buckwheat, and peas in the local market. Her son helps Hosiyat run the business. Hosiyat begins her workday at 6:00 a.m. As a rule she buys the goods from the local farmers. In the market she is known for her fair prices and friendliness, and she has built a steady clientele and a steady source of income for her family.

Now it is the season and her goods are in great demand. She plans to purchase wheat, buckwheat, and peas to resell in the market. She is asking for a loan of 3400 somoni (1000 $ US Dollars) to be repaid over a term of 6 months. Hosiyat and her son are counting on your help. Be an important investor in Hosiyat’s business.

loans.use: To buy wheat, buckwheat, and peas for resale

loans.name: Kulania Group

texts.en:
Mbalu C. is a widow with 6 children. She has been working hard to feed her children and send the 2 elder children to school. Mbalu does subsistence farming and has a small business selling agricultural products. With her previous loans from SMT, Mbalu was able to increase her stock and sell her products in Freetown wholesale, where she earned better income.

Her group members also do the same business of selling rice, palm oil, and peanuts, in addition to farming. The members, Fatmata K., Tye C., and Hellen M., use the income from the businesses to expand their families' rice and peanut farms. The members would like a loan of Le.3,900,000 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To expand their businesses for more profit

loans.name: Chuks

texts.en: Mr. Chuks E. is 43 years and married with three children. He lives in Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. He is a motorcycle rider. He learned his trade over four years and started riding in 2000. He needs a loan of $875.00 to buy a motorcycle. He is very grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima B., wife of Mr. A. A., is a mother of four sisters and four sons. She has been living in this small city of Pakistan for the last 30 years. She lives in a house which is a 4 room brick house. She requires a loan for her husband to invest in her wheat business. They all have been working in this profession for the last so many years. She hopes that if she gets the benefit of this loan, she will buy washing machine and ceiling fan.

Nusrat B. wants a loan to expand her embroidered clothes business. Rani B. wants a loan to expand her barber salon. Shamim B. and Razia B. want a loan to buy cloth.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Shumkor

texts.en:
Shumkor M. is 54 years old. He is married and has three children, one of whom is still under his care.

Shumkor has been a farmer for ten years, and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. He began cultivating his land through his own efforts and has gradually gotten ahead in life. He grows wheat, onions, potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, and other crops. Each year he grows enough for the family and sells the surplus. The business is the main source of income, but keeping it afloat requires considerable effort and outlay.

Shumkor needs fertilizer and seeds to plant. He’s asking for a loan of $600 US dollars. Shumkor hopes that with this loan he can increase the quantity and quality of his yield and earn greater pofits. The loan will be repaid in 9 months. Shumkor and his family are counting on your help. Shumkor thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Binta

texts.en: Binta M. is 30 years old and married with seven children. She lives in Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. She sells beans wholesale. She learned her trade on her own and started her business in 2001. She is very grateful in anticipation of her Kiva loan. She needs a loan of $875.00 to buy more bags of beans to sell.

loans.use: To buy more beans to sell wholesale.

loans.name: Haldifote L Group

texts.en:
Alpha Umaru J. buys and sells cows. He is 33 years old and the father of 2 children, and he is married. Alpha is a Kiva client who completed payment of his installments and would like to take more loans to expand his business. With his previous loan, Alpha could purchase 2 to 3 cows at a go and sell them in Freetown. He increased his income and was able to purchase a cow for the family to rear on the farm, while he continues the buying and selling.

Ibrahim also increased his stock of goats and would like to start buying and selling cows. The members are therefore requesting a loan of le.2.200,000.

loans.use: To expand their business of animal sales

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en: Mrs. Magdalene I. is 51 years old and married with seven children. She lives in Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. She sells kerosene, a trade she learned from a friend. She started her business in 2004. She is requesting a loan of $875.00 to enable her buy more kerosene to sell.

loans.use: To buy more kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi, wife of M.I., is a 30 year old lady. She has three sons and one daughter. The youngest two kids are in kindergarten. She needs a loan to buy a rubbing machine which she will use for the cleaning of wood. Her daily income is $6 to $7 a day. Her husband has been in this profession for the last 20 years. Her husband will expand the business if he gets more profit. Allah Rakhi is a housewife, and does household chores.

Sughran B. wants a loan to start fruit business. Anwari B. wants a loan to expand her sugarcane business. Zeenat B. wants a loan to expand her workshop. Sabiha B. wants a loan to start a grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses on a large scale and improve their financial condition

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia B., wife of M.S., has been living in Chichawatni for the last 30 years. She lives in a two story house. She has six sons. She needs a loan for her son who has just completed the Electrician course, and is willing to start his own shop. Razia B. wants to invest the loan amount in her son’s shop where he performs his skills.

She has been joined in her loan group by a few other women: Naseem B. wants a loan to start a workshop; Zakia B. wants a loan to buy a donkey cart; Mahfooz B. wants a loan to start a fruit business; Bashiran B. wants a loan to buy a van on installments.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To give expansion to their businesses

loans.name: Apate Jean

texts.fr:
Apate Jean B. is 41 years old, married, and has children. He lives and works in Kpalimé, one of the biggest cities in Togo. To provide for his family's needs, he operates a business painting cars. With this loan, he wishes to buy a lot of paint of various colors to have variety in his work. He hopes that, with this improvement, he can capture more customers, earn more money, and increase the quality of life.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Apate Jean B. est âgé de 41 ans et marié avec des enfants. Il habite et travaille à Kpalimé, une des plus grandes villes du Togo. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille il opère un commerce de peinture auto. Avec ce crédit, il souhaite acheter beaucoup de peint des couleurs variées pour varier son produit. Il espère qu’avec cette amélioration il peut attraper plus des clients, gagner plus d’argent et augmenter la qualité de la vie.

loans.use: To buy paint

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia B., wife of M.S., lives in a 2 room brick house. She has three daughters and one son. One daughter is in 8th standard, the second daughter is in 5th standard. Her son is in 2nd standard. Her husband has run a grocery shop for the last 6 years. His daily income is $6 to $7. She has applied for a loan for her husband’s grocery shop business.

She has been joined in her loan group by a few other members: Shamim B. wants a loan to start a wood business; Razia B. wants a loan to start a fruit business; Rani B. wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw; Rubina B. wants a loan to start a grocery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Give expansion to their businesses

loans.name: Bosede

texts.en: Mrs. Bosede I. is 50 years old and married with seven children. She lives in Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. She sells women's bags. She learned her trade from her sister and has been in business since 1996. She is requesting a loan of $700.00 to buy more bags to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more women's bags to sell.

loans.name: Ibraim

texts.fr:
Ibraim I. is 36 years old, married, and has children. He sells food in general at a shop in Kpalimé, one of the biggest cities in Togo. His offers various goods and hopes to use this loan to bolster his shop. Specifically, he wants to increase the capacity of his enterprise by buying oil, eggs, rice, soap, and other items for retail sale. He hopes to continue to improve his family's quality of life through the profits he is going to earn by selling his merchandise.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Ibraim I. est âgé de 36 ans et marié avec des enfants. Il opère une boutique d’alimentation générale à Kpalimé, une des plus grandes villes du Togo. Il vend les produits variés et espère utiliser ce crédit pour renforcer sa boutique. Spécifiquement, Ibraim veut augmenter la capacité de son entreprise en achetant de l’huile, les œufs, du riz, du savon et les autres produits pour revendre. Il espère continuer améliorer la qualité de vie de sa famille par les profits il va dégager dans la vente de ses marchandises.

loans.use: To bolster his shop

loans.name: Riaz's Group

texts.en:
Riaz, wife of M.S., has lived in the small city of Chichawatni for the last 30 years. She lives in a 3 room mud house. Her husband has run a grocery shop for the last 2 years. She has applied for a loan for her husband’s grocery shop.

She has been joined in her loan group by a few more members: Rubina B. wants a loan to start a decor shop; Irshad B. wants a loan to buy wood to sell; Naseem B. wants a loan to expand her furniture business; Sardaran B. wants a loan to buy a fruit car.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Sabina Dudu's Group

texts.en:
Sabina is leader of a group with four members. She is 30 years old and divorced with three children aged 15, 12, and 8 years. All of them go to school. The community she resides and works in is semi-urban and surrounded by slums.

She washes, dyes, and plaits hair. She has been providing these services for seven years in Lusaze, one of the suburbs of Kampala. Her clients are residents of the nearby slums.

She faces stiff competition, which forces her to charge low fees, and sometimes she inadvertently buys fake materials, which causes her to lose money. Another challenge is the seasonality of her market. The months of January, February, July, August, and September are slow for her business because her clients pay school dues in these months.

She acquired a plot of land in Lusaze with the loan she got from MCDT and is looking after her family. She would like to construct a house in the near future.

Sabina has successfully paid back five loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock of salon accessories

loans.name: Šefika

texts.en: Šefika is a 47 years old woman from Ribnica, a small village near the town of Zavidovići. Her huband is working as a woodsman.  Šefika is currently doing vegetable greenhouse production and she also has a few cows. She sells milk to the dairy and milk products at the village. They have 5 children. This is her first loan at MCO WWI.  Šefika intends to use this loan to expand the greenhouse and to expand the vegetable assortment that she sells. By doing this she will improve standard of life for her family.

loans.use: To expand her greenhouse.

loans.name: Mobil Group

texts.en:
Saidu is a Kiva client who has completed his loan repayment. With the loan, Saidu has become one of the major sellers of fuel (diesel, petrol, and kerosene) in Fadugu village and is providing a service to the community. He used part of the profit to expand the family farm and the business.

Abubakar and Peter sell agricultural products and would like to expand their businesses. The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le.2,900,000.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to expand the businesses

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris A. is 40 years old and married with seven children. She lives in Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. She sells timber wood at the intermediary stage, such as planks and plywood. She learned her trade over a year and then started her business in 1996. She has been an LAPO member since 2003. She needs a loan of $450.00 to buy more wood to sell.

loans.use: To buy more woods to sell.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is 32, married, and has two children, aged 7 and 5. She owns and operates a little grocery shop selling items like rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, frozen beef, chicken, and fish. She wants to use the loan to buy more rice, canned foods and drinks, milk, etc. to expand her business. She believes that with increased income, she would be better able to provide a decent accommodation for her family.

Agnes belongs to the community group called Determination Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy rice, canned foods, drinks, milk, etc. to expand her inventory

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty O. is 57 years old and married with three children. She operates a provision store in Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. She learned her trade by herself. She said, “I want to use this Kiva loan to buy more provisions for sales, most especially those things my customers demand more. I thank LAPO Microfinance and Kiva for their assistance.”

loans.use: To buy more provisions and food items to sell.

loans.name: Hasiba

texts.en: Hasiba was born in 1969.  She is married and  lives with her husband and two children in Ribnica, a small village near the town Zavidovići. Her husband works at the market and has his own stall.  They are also doing farming and earning additional income by doing it. This is Hasibas first loan at MCO in the amount of $825. Hasiba will use the funds to buy chickens. Her wish is to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A., 50, divorced mother of one daughter, is really dedicated to her work and supportive of her child. By her own effort and hard work, Comfort has supported her daughter to finish senior high school. She owns and operates a clothing and cosmetics shop in the local market. She also repairs torn and old clothes as a part-time job.

Comfort believes she can make her business grow bigger and brighter with loan support. She wants to use this loan to buy more clothing and assorted cosmetics to increase her stock of goods. She belongs to the community group called Twen Awurade (Wait upon the Lord) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and assorted cosmetics for re-sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Victoria A. is 30 years old and married with five children. She lives in Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. She sells timber wood that is at the intermediary stage, such as planks and flat boards. She learned her trade over 6 months and then started her business in 1996. She needs a loan of $450.00 to buy more wood to sell.

loans.use: To buy more wood to sell.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana A., 38, is married with 3 children who are currently schooling. She is a food vendor and sells fufu. Fufu is prepared from cassava and plantain, cooked and pounded together and eaten with different kinds of soup. It is a very popular traditional food among the Ashanti tribe of Ghanaian society. It is enjoyed as breakfast, lunch, and/or supper.

Christiana wants to use this loan to buy more raw materials such as plantains, cassava, meat, fish, vegetables, and also firewood. She hopes to increase her income to support her children’s education. She belongs to the community group called Twen Awurade (Wait upon the Lord) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for food preparation: plantains, cassava, meat, fish, vegetables, and also firewood

loans.name: Teopista Namayanja's Group

texts.en:
Teopista is leader of a group with four members. She is 58 years old and a single mother with six children. Their ages range from 40 to 25. She is looking after two school-age grandchildren. The community she resides and works in is semi-urban.

She has a small retail outlet for basic commodities, soft drinks, and groceries and must pay a high rental fee for the house in which she sleeps and does the business. Although she has been able to support her family, she would like to increase her stock and income.

Teopista has successfully paid back five loans.

loans.use: She would like to increase her stock

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama D., 42, widowed mother of 4 children, works very hard with the passion to provide brighter future opportunities for her children. Two of her children are in junior high school and the other two are in primary school. She owns and operates a small grocery in the neighborhood market with items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, gari, groundnuts, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. displayed on top of a table. She also sells piped water to her neighbors who do not have direct access to water.

Ama wants to use this loan to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc. to expand her stock. She belongs to the community group called Twen Awurade (Wait upon the Lord) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, evaporated milk, vegetable oil, etc. to expand her inventory

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria I. is 48 years old and married with four children. She lives and works in Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. She learned to sell used clothes, bags, and shoes over 15 months and then started her business in 2004. She needs a loan of $1200.00 to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes, bags and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Musidal L Group

texts.en:
Amadu J. is a cow trader who has been running his business for more than 4 years. He buys and sells cows. With his previous loan from Kiva, he increased the number of cows by 2 and has a small calf for the family to rear.

Unlike Amadu, Ibrahim is a butcher in Fadugu village but at a very micro scale. He normally buys 1 cow at a time. The group has 5 members, but the other 3 were away and the team managed only to meet Amadu and Ibrahim. They are requesting a loan of Le.2,000,000. to increase their flocks.

loans.use: To purchase more cows and expand the business

loans.name: Azuma

texts.en:
Azuma S., 65, widowed mother of 8 children, sells tomatoes, groundnuts, maize, millet, and yams. Azuma says her husband died several years ago but through this business, she has managed to help 5 of her children finish school; they are currently working. She is, however, convinced that her business can grow better with increased capital and therefore wants this loan to buy more baskets of tomatoes, groundnuts, bags of maize and yams to increase her stock and make a bigger income to finance the education of her last three children.

Azuma belongs to the community group called Twen Awurade Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, groundnuts, bags of maize, and yams for re-sale

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba S., 62, widowed mother of 9 children, lost her husband 3 years ago through protracted illness. She has since been the sole breadwinner of the family. By dint of hard work and perseverance, she has two of her children at university, and the rest are in senior and junior high school. She sells smoked fish, eggplant, peppers, and tomatoes in one of the neighborhood markets. Many homes enjoy her fish because it has got good taste and the price is moderate.

Habiba wants to use this loan to buy assorted fish, eggplant, peppers, and onions to make increased sales and income to support her children’s education and businesses. She belongs to the community group called Twen Awurade Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased stocks of assorted fishes, eggplant, peppers, and onions

loans.name: Maboiyanday Ll Group

texts.en:
Mohamed K. is 52 years old and married with 5 children. He has been running his business of buying and selling cows for a long time. As a good SMYT client, he was recommended for Kiva loans and obtained his first Kiva loan 8 months ago. With the loan, he increased the number of animals in his flocks and earned a good profit.

Isata sells agricultural products such as rice, palm oil, and beans, and she would like to expand her business. They are therefore requesting a loan of Le.2,200,000.

loans.use: To purchase 2 cows and agricultural products in order to increase income

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Mr. Joseph U. is 38 years old and married with five children. He sells cooked food in Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. He learned his business from his mother and then started his restaurant in 2004. He needs a loan of $1200.00 to buy more food to cook and sell.

loans.use: To buy more food items to cook and sell in his restaurant.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida B., wife of A. S., has been living in a the city of Chichawatni, Pakistan for the last 30 years. She is a mother of six children: four sons and two daughters. All her children are currently attending school. Her husband is a trader while Sajida is a teacher. She gives stitching and embroidery classes to her neighbors on a monthly basis. She would like apply for a loan to expand her husband’s wheat business again. Previously, she successfully completed her first loan that she borrowed from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. With her first loan, she bought wheat and earned sufficient profit to buy two sewing machines.

Her loan group includes: Razia B., who wants to start a grocery shop; Bushra B., who wants to expand her grocery shop business; Irshad B., who wants to repair her rickshaw; and Kosar B. who wants to buy seasonal wheat. This loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen J., wife of Mr. J., has been living in Chichawatni, Pakistan for the last 15 years. She lives in a three room brick house with her three daughters and two sons. For the last 15 years, her husband has been running a poultry farm. She would like to apply for a loan to invest in her husband’s poultry farm business.

Her loan group members include: Parveen B., who wants to expand her food business; Irshad B. wants to make carpets; Karam B., who wants to repair her rickshaw; Razia B. wants to purchase and sell medicine. This loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana Y., wife of Mr. Y., lives in a four room brick house with her six daughters and two sons. She would like to apply for a loan to help her son, Bawar, who is an auto-rickshaw driver. Bawar wants to buy his own rickshaw so that he can able to earn a greater income.

Her loan group members include: Khursheed B., who wants to buy a food shop to sell samosas, a very famous Punjabi food; Suraiya B., who wants to buy and sell medicine; Kalsoom B., who wants to repair her auto-rickshaw; and Zeenat B., who wants to start a grocery shop. This loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their business

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida M. N., wife of M. N., has four sons. Her three sons received education up to fifth grade and her eldest son has completed ninth grade. Her husband is a barber and she would like to apply for a loan to buy her own barber shop.

Her loan group members include: Rafia B., who wants to expand her pharmaceutical business; Shagufta B., who wants to expand her furniture business; and Rubina B., who wants to start a grocery shop. This loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen F. M., wife of F. M., has six children: one daughter and five sons. Previously, she successfully started her own sweetmeat business, from a loan that she received from Asasah, a microfinance institute of Pakistan. She would now like a loan to buy and expand the sweetmeat shop.

Her loan group members include: Razia B., who wants to repair a rickshaw; Razia B., who wants to start a tea business; Zubaida B., who wants to expand her electronics business; and Kubran B., who wants to expand her food business. This loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Rano's Group

texts.en:
Rano K. H., wife of K. H., lives in the city of Vehari, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. Her eldest son makes plastic shoes and she would like to apply for a loan to invest in the opening of her son's shoe business. She hopes that if she get a good profit from her investiment, she will be able to admit her last son into a good school.

Her group members include: Khalida B., who wants to start a grocery shop; Saba Bibi, who wants to repair her rickshaw; Kaneez B., who wants to buy cotton for her business; and Kalsoom B., who wants to expand her grocery business. This loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To invest in a shoe business

loans.name: Mahamadou Awali

texts.fr:
Mr. Mahamadou Awali I. was born on September 13, 1971 in Lomé. He is married and the father of four (04) children. In 1994, he established his store selling building materials (I. Bros) in the neighborhood of Agoè Zongo. He received a first loan that allowed him to build a shed in the front of his store and to stock up. In order to revitalize his business, Mr. Mahamadou Awali I. is requesting a loan of 300.000FCFA to buy 12 drums of strong glue, 30 sheets of plywood, five bags of lime and a box of steel points. Thus, his store will be more attractive and he will gain a lot of clients.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur I. Mahamadou Awali est né le 13 septembre 1971 à Lomé. Il est marié et père de quatre (4) enfants. Depuis 1994, il a crée sa boutique de vente des matériaux de construction (ETS I. & FRERES) dans le quartier D’Agoè Zongo. Il avait obtenu un premier crédit qui lui a permis de faire un hangar devant sa boutique et de faire un approvisionnement. Dans le souci de redynamiser son activité, Monsieur I. Mahamadou Awali sollicite un crédit de 300.000FCFA pour acheter 12 bidons de colle forte, 30 contre plaquer, Cinq sachets de chaud et un carton de pointe d’acier. Ainsi sa boutique sera plus attrayante et il gagnera beaucoup de clients.

loans.use:
Purchase of building materials

Achat de matériaux de construction

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Mrs. Roseline U. is 44 years old and married with two children. She lives in Benin City in Edo state in Nigeria. She sells all kinds of drinks. She learned her trade from her Aunty and started her business in 2003. She needs a loan of $600.00 to buy more drinks to sell. She says she is grateful to Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira is married, and she has two children, who are eight and ten. Her husband is a mechanic. She started her business three years ago because she needed to support her husband, who was faced with extra expenses. Due to the lack of money for their children and the commitment to help their family get ahead, she started selling cosmetics by catalog. This activity has allowed her to have income to help her husband give a better quality of life to their children.

Now she needs a loan of $500, which she will repay in 5 months, to purchase merchandise and to be able to sell more. With your support, she will be able to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Elvira es casada, tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 8 años, su esposo es tecnico en mecanica. Inició el negocio hace 3 años porque ocupaba apoyar a su esposo ya que se le presentaron gastos extras, ante la falta de dinero para sus hijos y compromiso de sobresalir con su familia, inicio con la venta de cosmeticos por catalogo, actividad que la he permitido tener ingresos para poder ayudar a su esposo a darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar mercancia ya asi poder vender mas, con tu apoyo ella podra continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen Z., wife of Mr. Z., lives in the city of Vehari, Pakistan. Her husband is a gardener by profession, who also sells plants. They have an adopted girl who is five years old. Parveen stitches clothes at home for her nearby customers. She would like a loan to expand her husband’s business by purchasing more plants. If she makes a profit from her investment, she will renovate her house and buy some cattle.

Her loan group members include: Azra B., who wants to purchase and sell medicine; Kaneez B., who wants to repaire a tractor; Sardaran B., who wants to start a grocery shop; and Fatima B., who wants to start her tailoring business. This loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Grace Nabakaabya's Group

texts.en:
Grace is leader of a group of four members. She is 45 years old and married with five children aged between 28 and 11 years. Three of them are in school. The community she resides and works in is an urban slum in a low-lying area that is vulnerable to floods.

She has been selling dried fish, bananas, cassava, potatoes, and other foods for the last 19 years. When she goes to the seaside to collect the fish, she must deal with the high transport costs to and from the shore and spending nights in the cold.

She has been able to help support her family and she would like to invest more in her children’s education.

Grace has successfully paid back more than 15 loans.

loans.use: She would like to buy more stock in order to raise her income.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing W. is 25 years old and single. She sells drinks wholesale and has been in business since 2004. She live in Benin City in Edo state in Nigeria. She needs a loan for $700.00 to buy more drinks to sell. She says, "Thank you!" to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
Martha is married and has 2 children, 12 and 7 years old. Her husband works as a messenger. She started her business because she wanted to help her husband financially, since his salary was not enough to cover all the family expenses. She decided to get ahead by starting a food business and later on, began to sell cosmetics by catalog. This business is the one which has been more profitable and has given her better income.

She is requesting a US$500 loan, which will be repaid in 5 months, to buy merchandise so as to be able to continue selling. With your help Martha will be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Martha es casada y tiene 2 hijos D. 12 y 7 años, su esposo trabaja como mensajero. Inició el negocio porque queria apoyar economicamente a su esposo, ya que con sus sueldo no solventaba todos los gastos familiares. Decidio superarse por medio del negocio D. las comidas y posteriormente ventas D. cosmeticos por catalogo, esta ultima es L. que mejor le ha redituado ya que le ha dado mejores ingresos.

ElL. solicita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 5 meses para comprra mercancia y asi poder seguir vendiendo. Con tu ayuda Martha lograra incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Mena Group

texts.en: David M. S. is the group leader and cattle rearer.  Umu J. and Unisa A. K. are subsistence farmers and traders.  They grow rice, peanuts and beans. At the same time, they purchase the crops from other farmers.  With their previous loans, they increased their stocks and made good income which they invested in expanding the family farms and meeting their children's educational expenses.  The members would like to continue expanding their businesses and are therefore requesting a loan of 3,500,000 SLL.  David, the group leader, is 48 years old and married with 5 children.

loans.use: Expand the livestock and farming activities

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
Señora María del Socorro U. M. is a native of the city of Bluefields. She is 42-years-old and is married to señor Francisco Blanco. Both have 3 childrern. Señora U. has sold used clothing for 4 years. Her customers are both women and men of scarce resources who prefer her because she offers a variety of clothing. This is the second credit that she is requesting, and right now she needs to buy one package of blouses for $325 and one package of sheets for $325. This investment will help her gain more profits, and she will be able to offer more variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. María del Socorro U. M. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 42 años de edad esta casada con el Sr. Francisco Blanco ambos tienen 3 hijos. La Sra. U. vende ropa usada hace 4 años, teniendo como clientes a mujeres y hombres de escasos recursos, que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de ropa. Este es el segundo crédito que esta solicitando la Sra. U. ya que en estos momentos necesita comprar 1 paca de blusas a $325.00 dólares la paca y 1 paca de sabanas a $325.00 dólares la paca, esta inversión le ayudara a obtener mas ganancias ya que podrá ofrecer mas variedad a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase one package of blouses and one package of sheets

payments.comment: La cuota real es de $ 54.17 dólares.
La cuota real de pago es de $ 54.17 dólares.
La cuota real de pago es de $ 54.17 dólares
Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maryam's Group

texts.en:
Maryam A. S., wife of A. S., is a mother of eight children: seven sons and one daughter. Three of her children are married. One of her sons is tailor, while another is a shoe maker. Her husband is a gardener by profession, but his income remains insufficient to provide a good education for their children. She would like to apply for a loan to buy some plants for her husband's business and to help her son expand his work in tailoring.

Her loan group members include: Pathani B., who wants to invest her husband's goldsmith business; Suraiya B., who wants to expand her electronics shop; Shahnaz B., who wants to buy a rickshaw; and Sardaran B., who wants to start a vegetables business. This loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Facilitate their customers and get recognition among themselves

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Miss Stella I. is single and 28 years old. She lives in Benin City in Edo state in Nigeria. She sells provisions, a trade she learned for a year before starting her business in 2005. She is requesting a loan of $450.00 to enable her to buy more provisions to sell. She says, “Thank you!” to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran W., wife of Mr. W., has a six-year-old daughter. Her daughter is in kindergarten. Her husband is a laborer and she makes decorative embroidered clothes. She would like a loan for her husband who would like to start his own business of shuttering. From the money she is able to save, she will start a grocery shop in her home.

Her loan group members include: Ramzana Bibi, who wants to buy a fruit cart; Shahnaz B. who wants to start a vegetable business; and Jamila Bibi who wants to start shuttering business. This loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Invest in a shuttering business

loans.name: Blanca Veronica

texts.es:
Veronica is the mother of 2 children, 7 and 3 years old. Her husband works in a warehouse. She started her business because she needed to help with the family expenses and help her children to get ahead. For this reason she decided to sell shoes by catalog, starting with a few orders. Later her sales began to increase because she offers payment plans in installments, which is why people look to buy from her.

She now needs a loan of US$ 600, which will be repaid in 6 months, to buy merchandise. She would like to invest her earnings in another activity such as jewelry sales, so that she can take advantage of her customer base and have more earnings. With your help this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Veronica es madre de familia de 2 niños de 7 y 3 años, su esposo trabaja como almacenista. Inició el negocio porque necesitaba apoyar con los gastos familiares y sobresalir con sus hijo, por eso es que se decidió por la venta de zapatos por catalogo, con pocos pedidos para después ir incrementando sus ventas, esto ha sido ha que da plazos para que le paguen por lo que la gente la busca para comprar con ella.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia, ella desea invertir las ganancias en otra actividad, la venta de joyeria ya que puede aprovechar la cartera de clientes que ya tiene vendiendoles ahora joyeria y asi tener mas ganancias. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rose Nalwadda's Group

texts.en:
Rose is leader of a group of four members. She is 40 years old and married with four children aged between 22 and 12 years. All of them are in school. The community she resides and works in is an urban slum in a low-lying area that is vulnerable to floods.

She has been selling bananas (matooke) for 10 years. Presently, she works from under a tree after buying the produce from vendors who distribute it from trucks. She faces challenges of unstable prices, stiff competition, and the hazards of the weather.

She has been able to contribute to the running of her home and she would like to buy a plot of land and construct a house.

Rose has successfully paid back four loans.

loans.use: To be able to stock more food at a time.

loans.name: Shafqat's Group

texts.en:
Shafqat Rafique A., wife of R. A., is a mother of four children. Her husband is a milkman while she makes decorative embroidered clothes. She needs a loan to buy a garment shop. She plans to expand her garment business if she earns profit from this loan.

Her loan group members include: Naseem B., who wants to expand her grocery shop and Fatima B. who wants to invest her her embroidery business. This loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To invest in a garment business

loans.name: Busola

texts.en: Busola A. is a 31 years old and married. She lives in Benin City in Edo State in Nigeria. She is a fashion designer who learned her skill over two years and started her business in 2007. She is requesting a loan of $450.00 to buy more tailoring materials.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials.

loans.name: Koffi Sénam

texts.fr:
Mr. Koffi Sénam A. was born June 25, 1976 in Mission Tové in the department of Zio. He is married and the father of one child. His main activity is the sale of cleaning products in the neighborhood of Agoè. He is a traveling salesman; he walks from house to house and from neighborhood to neighborhood. His cleaning products are among others: soaps, bleach, detergents etc… He fully repaid his first loan, and he is requesting a second loan to buy 10 boxes of soap, 10 boxes of bleach and 10 boxes of detergent.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur A. Koffi Sénam est né le 25 juin 1976 à Mission Tové dans la préfecture de Zio. Il est marié et père d’un enfant. Il a pour activité principale la vente des produits d’entretien dans le quartier d’Agoè. Il est un revendeur ambulant et se promène de maison à maison et de quartier en quartier. Dans ses produits d’entretien, on peut citer les savons, l’eau de javel, les détergents, etc. Le second crédit qu’il sollicite après remboursement total du premier lui permettra d’acheter 10 cartons de savon, 10 cartons de Javel et 10 cartons de détergent.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of cleaning products

loans.name: Carmen Faustina

texts.es:
Carmen started her business because she needed to support the family finances, and since in that moment (5 years ago), she was pregnant with her first son, she needed a job where she wouldn't need to leave the house. This is why she decided to sell shoes and linens by catalog, since it would be her best opportunity to obtain better income before the expenses that were nearing because of the birth of her son. She is still doing this activity, and until now it has given her good income. Now she is expecting her second son.

She needs a loan of $500, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy merchandise and to sell more, so she will be able to get ahead with her business. With your help, this will become a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Carmen, inició el negocio porque necesitaba apoyar en la economía de la casa y como en ese tiempo (hace 5 años) estaba embarazada de su primer hijo, necesitaba un trabajo donde no necesitara salir de esta, así que se decidió por la venta de zapatos y blancos por catalogo , ya que seria su mejor oportunidad de obtener mejores ingresos ante los gastos que se aproximaban por el nacimiento de su hijo, y asi lo fue esta actividad continua desarrollandola hasta la fecha lo que le ha dado buenos ingresos, ahora se encuentra esperando a su segundo hijo.

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses, para comprar mercancía y vender mas, para salir adelante con su negocio, con tu ayuda esto se hara realidad.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Uwi

texts.en: Mrs. Uwi O. is 44 years old and married with a child. She lives in Benin City in the Edo State of Nigeria. She sells a local gin known as Ogogoro, which she has been selling since 2005. She is requsting a loan of $450.00 to buy more Ogogoro to sell.

loans.use: To buy more Ogogoro to sell.

loans.name: Maria Del Roble

texts.es:
Maria started her business when she separated from her husband, since she did not receive any child support for their 2 children, who were 1 and 2 years old at the time. Because her children were so small and she had no one to leave them with, she opened a general store in her home 6 years ago. Little by little she has reinvested in the business, buying merchandise so that she has a good supply in the store.
