She is now requesting a loan for US$ 975, which will be repaid in 6 months, to invest in merchandise and buy a public telephone, which will give extra income to the business and is a service that people have been asking for. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Maria inició el negocio cuando se separo de su marido, como el no le pasaba pension para mantener a sus 2 hijos de 1 y 2 años, decidio poner un negocio ya que sus niños estaban muy chiquitos y no tenia con quien dejarlos y abrio una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, hace 6 años, poco a poco ha invirtiendo en el negocio y comprando mercancia para tener bien surtida su tienda.

Ahora solicita un prestamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para invertir en mercancia y comprar un telefono publico que le va a dar un ingreso extra a su negocio, y es un servicio que la gente le esta pidiendo. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: Buy merchandise and a public telephone.

loans.name: Fatima Del Socorro

texts.es:
Fátima del Socorro M. Gaitán is a native of the city of Bluefields. She is 27 years old, a single mother of 3 young children who she supports with the income from her business. Fátima has owned a general store for the past 3 years. Her customers are residents of her neighborhood, who prefer to buy from her because of the variety of products she offers. Currently, she needs to buy 6 cases of soft drinks at $10.00 dollars each, 3 100-pound bags of rice at $47.00 dollars per bag, a 100-pound bag of beans at $51.00 dollars per bag and 1 drum of oil at $48.00 dollars each. This investment will help her to buy in greater quantities, as she does not have enough capital to make this type of purchase.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Fátima del Socorro M. Gaitán es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 27 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos menores de edad que mantiene con el ingreso de su negocio. Fátima es propietaria de una pulpería hace 3 años, sus clientes son los habitantes de su barrio que la prefieren por ofrecer variedad de productos. En estas momentos necesita comprar 6 cajas de gaseosa a $ 10.00 dólares cada caja, 3 quintales de arroz a $ 47.00 dólares cada quintal, 1 quintal de frijoles a $51.00 dólares el quintal y 1 bidón de aceite a $ 48.00 dólares el bidón, esta inversión le ayudara a poder comprar en grandes cantidades ya que ella no cuenta con suficiente capital para realizar este tipo de compras.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, rice, beans and oil.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Mrs. Doris O. is 44 years old and married with two children. She lives in Benin City in the Edo State in Nigeria. She sells drinks, a trade she learned from her mother. She started her business in 1992 and her shop is very busy with customers. She is requesting a loan of $875.00 to buy more drink to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anabidédé

texts.fr:
Mme. Anabidédé K. MANZI-NIKA was born on May 30, 1964 in Kara. She is married and the mother of two children. In 1998, she created BELINDA and Co, a store retailing cosmetics and traditional wrap around fabric (pagnes). The friendly and charming setting of her store allows her to gain new clients daily. The first loan she is requesting will enable her to purchase 20 pieces of fabric (middle-range brand), 5 boxes of perfume and 10 boxes of deodorant. She planned those purchases following an increase in her clients’ demand. This way she will be able to improve her sales and increase her income.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Madame K. E. MANZI-NIKA Anabidédé est née le 30 mai 1964 à Kara. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. En 1998, elle a crée ETS BELINDA qui est un magasin de vente de produits cosmétiques et de pagnes. Le cadre convivial et charmant dans lequel elle vend lui permet d’avoir de nouveaux clients au jour le jour. Le premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra de faire l’achat de 20 pièces de pagnes de marque intermédiaire, 05 cartons de parfum et 10 cartons de déodorant. Elle a programmé faire ses achats suite à la demande de ses clients et en le faisant ainsi, elle pourra améliorer ses ventes et augmenter son revenu.

loans.use: Purchase of wrap around fabric (pagnes) and cosmetics

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina began a business to help her husband take care of the family´s expenses, as at the time he did not have a job. Facing a shortage of money to be able to give her 2 children - 5 and 9 years old - a better standard of living, she decided to start a business selling candy from home, and in this way generated extra income which allowed her to help her husband.

She needs a loan of US$ 250, which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy goods and in this way be able to make more sales. With your contribution, Marina will continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Marina inició el negocio para apoyar a su esposo y solventar los gastos de la familia, ya que en aquel entonces no tenia trabajo y ante la falta de dinero para darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 hijos de 5 y 9 años, decidio emprender su negocio de venta de dulces en su casa, generando asi ingresos extras que le permiten apoyar a su marido.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia y asi poder terne mas ventas. Con tu contribucion Marina seguira con su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rose Nakimera's Group

texts.en:
Rose is leader of a group with four members. She is single, 25 years old, and without children. The community she resides and works in is an urban area that includes a large slum.

She purchases bales of old clothes, which she sells at retail and wholesale very early in the morning. There is a market for her goods, but her main challenges are the unstable prices and high rental fees.

She is able to look after herself without having to depend on someone. She would like to increase her stock and build herself a house with the anticipated increased income.

Rose has successfully paid back more than three loans.

loans.use: She would like to increase her stock and build herself a house

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra A. got her loan in her husband's name, Kodjo, because he wanted to help her bolster her restaurant. She is 55 years old, married, and a mother. She sells "foufou", a traditional dish made from yams. Since most people like this dish, the demand for it is always increasing. Abra hopes to use this loan to buy a lot of yams in neighboring villages and also to buy goat meat and fish to make sauce. With the profits she will make from her sales, she will be capable of supporting her childrens' needs at school. She is very happy about the opportunity to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Abra A. a pris son crédit dans le nom de son mari, Kodjo, parce qu’il a voulu l’aider renforcer son restaurant. Elle est âgée de 55 ans, mariée et mère des enfants. Elle vend le foufou, un plat traditionnel fait par les ignames. Comme la plupart de la population aime ce plat, la demande augmente toujours. Abra espère avec ce crédit d’acheter beaucoup d’ignames dans les villages environnants et aussi d’acheter la viande de la chèvre et des poissons pour faire le sauce. Avec les profits qu’elle va dégager de ses ventes elle sera capable de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants à l’école. Elle est très contente de l’opportunité d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make food

loans.name: Policarpa

texts.es:
Señora Policarpa M. Z. is a native of the city of Bluefields.  She is 60-years-old and is a single mother of 6 children.  Señora M. has sold butane gas for 15 years.  Her customers are people who live in her neighborhood and prefer her for offering good service.  Señora M. doesn't have enough capital to be able to purchase more cylinders of butane gas, and it is for this reason that she needs to buy 20 cylinders of butane gas at $16.25 each.  With this investment, she will be able to satisfy her clients' demand, which increases every day.Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer
La Sra. Policarpa M. Z. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 60 años de edad, es madre soltera de 6 hijos. La Sra. M. vende gas butano hace 15 años, sus clientes son los habitantes de su barrio que la prefieren por brindar un buen servicio. La Sra. M. no cuenta con el suficiente capital para poder comprar más cilindros de gas butano y por esta razón necesita comprar 20 cilindros de gas butano a $ 16.25 dólares cada cilindro, con esta inversión podrá satisfacer a sus clientes que cada día aumenta.

loans.use: To purchase cylinders of butane gas

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $ 53.31 dólares

loans.name: Komlakuma Dzigi

texts.fr:
"Institut de Providence" is a primary school established by Professor Komlakuma Dzigi N.. Professor N. is 48 years old, married, and the father of three. Since 2003, "Institut de Providence" has served the people of Kpalimé, one of the biggest cities in Togo. In 2007, the enrollment was 500 students. Professor N. wishes to use his loan to buy supplies for the Institute such as notebooks, pencils, and chalk. Also, he hopes to continue his program of sponsoring poor students, who cannot pay for school fees. Professor N. has made a big difference in his community. And with this loan, he wishes to continue providing a good education to the children of Kpalimé.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

« Institut de Providence » est une école primaire établie par Professeur Komlakuma Dzigi N.. Professeur N. est âgé de 48 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Depuis 2003, « Institut de Providence » a servi la population de Kpalimé, une des plus grandes villes du Togo. En 2007, l’enrôlement était 500 étudiants. Professeur N. souhaite d’utiliser son crédit pour acheter des matériaux pour l’Institut, comme les cahiers, les crayons et la craie. Aussi, il espère continuer son programme à patronner les élèves pauvres qui ne peuvent pas payer les frais scolaires. Professeur N. a créée une grande différence dans son communauté et avec ce crédit il souhaite à continuer fournir avec une bonne éducation aux enfants de Kpalimé.

loans.use: To buy supplies for the school and to pay school fees

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Komla D. is a 37-year-old man, married, and a father. He runs a shop, "Etablissement Ventout" in Kpalimé, one of the biggest cities in Togo. He sells various items, and he has an apprentice who works with him (see photo). Komla wishes to use these Kiva funds to increase the capacity of his enterprise by buying Togocell prepaid cell phone cards, soap, wristwatches, and other goods for retail sale. He has already had success with FECECAV loans, so he hopes to repay this loan in only one month! He hopes to continue to improve the quality of life for his family by the profits he is going to make selling his merchandise.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Komla D. est un homme âgé de 37 ans, marié et père. Il opère une boutique, « Etablissement Ventouts » à Kpalimé, une des plus grandes villes du Togo. Il vend les produits variés et il a un apprenti qui travaille avec lui (dans le photo.) Komla souhaite avec les fonds de Kiva augmenter la capacité de son entreprise en achetant les cartes de recharge Togocell, du savon, les montres et les autres produits pour revendre. Il a déjà réussi avec les crédits de FECECAV donc il espère rembourser ce crédit dans un mois seulement ! Il espère continuer améliorer la qualité de vie de sa famille par les profits qu’il va dégager dans la vente de ses marchandises.

loans.use: To increase the capacity of his enterprise

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Adjo M. is 28 years old, married, and the mother of five children, who all attend school. She is responsible for household expenses of her children. To earn money, she sells bananas on the side of the road. Since bananas are found everywhere in this region of Togo, a large part of the population consumes them. Adjo wishes to use this loan to buy more fresh bananas in neighboring villages in order to resell them in Kpalimé. With the profits she will make from her sales, she will be able to provide for her childrens' needs at school.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Adjo M. est âgée de 28 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants, tous à l’école. Elle est responsable des charges du foyer pour ses enfants et pour gagner de l’argent, elle vend les bananes au bord de la route. Comme les bananes sont partout ce région du Togo, une grande partie de la population les consomme. Adjo souhaite avec ce crédit acheter plus des bananes fraîches dans les villages environnants pour revendre à Kpalimé. Avec les profits qu’elle va dégager de ses ventes elle sera capable de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants à l’école.

loans.use: Acheter les bananes

loans.name: Loi Lubega's Group

texts.en:
Loi is leader of a group of four members. She is 63 years old and married with six children aged between 40 and 20 years. Two are still in school. She has been able to educate her children to university level. The community she resides and works in is semi-urban.

She has been making and selling samosas, cassava, pancakes, and chapattis for the last 24 years in school canteens and the surrounding areas. There is always a market for her products. Because of the high prices of the ingredients she uses, she would like to use this loan to buy materials for her business.

Loi has successfully paid back more than 15 loans.

loans.use: To buy materials for her food business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Micro Credit Development Trust SACCO (MCDT) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Gioconda Alina

texts.es:
Señora Gioconda Alina Chávez M. is from the city of Bluefields.  She is 35-years-old and is married to señor Alejandro Angulo.  Both have two young children.  Señora Chávez has owned a grocery store for 9 years, having as customers the people who live in her neighborhood, who prefer her for offering a variety of basic grains, vegetables, dairy products, and meat.  Right now, señora Chávez needs to buy 5 sacks of rice at $47 each, 5 sacks of beans at $51 each, and 2 sacks of sugar at $30 each.  With this investment, she will be able to buy these things in large quantities, and in this way satisfy the demand of her customers.Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer
La Sra. Gioconda Alina Chávez M. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 35 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Alejandro Angulo ambos tienen 2 hijos menores de edad. La  Sra. Chávez desde hace 9 años es propietaria de una  pulpería, teniendo como clientes a los habitantes de su barrio que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de granos básicos, verduras, productos lácteos  y carnes,  en estos momentos la Sra. Chávez necesita comprar 5 quintales de arroz a $ 47.00 dólares el quintal, 5 quintales de frijoles a $ 51.00 dólares el quintal y 2 quintales de azúcar a $ 30.00 dólares el quintal,  con esta inversión podrá comprar en grandes cantidades y de esta manera satisfacer la demanda de sus  clientes.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, and sugar.

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $ 90.22 dólares

loans.name: Salomey

texts.fr:
Salomey K. is 51 years old, married, and the mother of six children; two of them are in school, one is married and expecting a child, and two are apprentices. School and apprenticeship fees increase each year, and Salomey is responsible for the household expenses of her children. To earn money, she runs a business in her house preparing and selling dried red chili peppers. She wishes to use this loan to buy more fresh peppers to dry and also to help pay the two men who help her prepare them. With the profits she will earn from her sales, she will be able to cover her family's needs.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Salomey K. est âgée de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. 2 des enfants sont à l’école, 1 est épousée et enceinte et 2 sont les apprentis. Les frais scolaires et les frais d’apprentissage augmentent chaque année et Salomey est responsable des charges du foyer pour ses enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent, elle opère un commerce à sa maison de préparer et vendre les piments rouges séchés. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit d’acheter plus des piments fraîches pour secher et aussi de lui aider à payer les 2 hommes qui l’aident en leur preparation. Avec les profits qu’elle va dégager de ses ventes elle sera capable de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy fresh chili peppers to dry

loans.name: Kiyatodé

texts.fr:
Mme. Kiyatodé Z. was born on December 31, 1951 in Avété in the department of Ogou in the plateaux region. She is a widow and has the responsibility of three children all attending school. She trades cereals on the Agoè market to provide for her needs and those of her children. This year, given the scarcity of beans on the market, she wishes to stock up and buy six (6) bags of beans. To this end she is requesting a loan of 400.000 FCFA.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Z. Kiyatodé est née le 31 décembre 1951 à Avété dans la préfecture de l’Ogou dans la région des plateaux. Elle est veuve avec trois enfants à charges qui vont tous à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à celle de ses enfants, elle fait le commerce de céréales dans le marché d’Agoè. Cette année, compte tenu de la rareté du haricot sur le marché, elle désire en faire son stock par l’achat de six (6) sacs du haricot. A cet effet elle sollicite un crédit de 400.000 FCFA.

loans.use: Purchase of six bags of beans

loans.name: Juana Eva

texts.es:
Juana Eva began a business so she could get ahead and cover household expenses, because her husband´s salary was not enough. She has 2 children, 3 and 6 years old. She decided to start a business selling sheets, towels and other home goods by catalog. This has given her a good income and she has been able to establish a good client base.

She needs a loan for US $250, which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy merchandise and in this way be able to increase her sales. With your help this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Juana Eva inició el negocio para superarse y salir adelante con los gastos que se generan en su casa ya que con el sueldo de su pareja no completaban. Ella tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 6 años. Decidió emprender su negocio de venta de blancos por catalogo, lo que le ha dado buenas ganancias ya que ha logrado hacerse de una buena cartera de clientes.

Ella necesita un crédito por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y así poder incrementar sus ventas. Con tu ayuda esto será posible.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa started a business to help herself get ahead, as she was left without the suport of her husband after her divorce. Her financial need was what motivated her to start a business selling cleaning products. This has given her an income to help her 2 children - 11 and 8 years old - and for her to give them a better standard of living.

She needs a loan of US$ 250, which will be repaid in 3 months, to buy merchadise and continue generating sales. With your help, Rosa will continue forward.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa inició el negocio para superarse y salir adelante, por el hecho de quedarse sin el apoyo de su esposo, al divorciarse y tener necesidades economicas fue lo que la motivaron a iniciar su negocio de venta de productos para la limpieza, esto le ha permitido generar ingresos para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos de 11 y 8 años, y asi darles una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia y seguir generando ventas. Con tu ayuda Rosa seguira adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Calixto Francisco

texts.es:
Señor Calixto Francisco Sánchez is a native of the city of Bluefields. He is thiry-years-old, is married to señora Maritza Roa, and both have three young children. Señor Sánchez has been a traveling salesman for five years. He has both men and women of all ages as customers, who prefer him for offering a variety of products and because he goes to their homes. Right now he needs to buy twelve units of mosquito nets at $4 each, five dozen sheets at $53 per dozen, and three dozen towels at $29 per dozen. With this investment, he will be able to obtain more profits and to satisfy his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Calixto Francisco Sánchez es originario de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 30 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Maritza Roa ambos tienen 3 hijos menores de edad. El Sr. Sánchez es vendedor ambulante hace 5 años, tiene como clientes a hombres y mujeres de todas las edades que lo prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de productos y a domicilio en estos momentos necesita comprar 12 unidades de mosquiteros a $ 4.00 dólares la unidad, 5 docenas de sabanas a $53.00 dólares la docena y 3 docenas de toallas a $ 29.00 dólares la docena, con esta inversión podrá obtener mas ganancias y satisfacer a sus clientes.

loans.use: To purchase mosquito nets, sheets, and towels.

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $ 33.33 dólares.
La cuota real de pago es de $ 33.33 dólares

loans.name: Saramatu

texts.en:
Saramatu D., 65, wife and mother of 6 children, is a food vendor selling gari (milled and roasted cassava), beans, and fried plantains, popularly known as ‘red red’. This is a popular local meal enjoyed by many Ghanaians, especially students, because of its affordability. It is tasty and satisfying and very nutritious, too, because of the protein content from the beans. Saramatu also sells groundnuts, beans, and yams at the community market. She wants to use the loan to buy ingredients such as bags of gari, beans, bunches of plantains, and palm oil to increase her production and make good income.

Out of this business, Saramatu has been able to support five children to finish school, with only one currently in school. She belongs to the community group called Twen Awurade (Wait upon the Lord) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as gari, beans, plantains and palm oil

loans.name: Juan Eduardo

texts.es:
Juan Eduardo started his business because his mother is divorced, and he had to help her with the family finances. He had to stop studying to start working, and he started a taco stand, which has gone well for him. He is worried about not having enough money to invest further in his business to make it grow.

He needs a loan of $700, which he will repay in 6 months, to buy supplies. Now he is selling sandwiches in addition to tacos. With your help, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Juan Eduardo, inició el negocio porque su mama es divorciada y el tenia que ayudarla en la economia familiar por lo que tuvo que dejar de estudiar para empezar a trabajar, asi que puso un puesto de tacos con el que le ha ido bien pero su preocupacion es que no tiene dinero suficiente para invertir mas en su negocio y hacerlo crecer.

El necesita un prestamo por US $700 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar materia prima, ya que ahora esta vendiendo tortas ademas de los tacos. Con tu ayuda esto sera posible.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Martha Genara

texts.es:
Martha Genara F. is a native of the city of Bluefields. She is 45 years old and married to Pedro Miguel Sevilla. They have 9 children. For the past 9 years Martha has been the owner of a stand where she sells clothing for women, men and children. This is the family´s only source of income. Her customers are men and women of all ages who prefer to buy from her because of the variety of goods she has. Currently, she needs to buy 10 dozen pants at $8.00 dollars per dozen, 12 shirts at $3.00 dollars per shirt, 24 children´s dresses at $14.00 dollars per unit, and other clothing. With this investment she can increase her earnings and meet her customers´ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Martha Genara F. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 45 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Pedro Miguel Sevilla ambos tienen 9 hijos. Martha hace 9 años es propietaria de un tramo donde vende ropa para mujeres, hombres y niños, siendo este el único ingreso de esta familia, sus clientes son hombres y mujeres de todas las edades que la prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de productos, en estos momentos necesita comprar 10 docenas de pantalones a $ 8.00 dólares la docena, 12 unidades de camisas a $ 3.00 dólares la unidad, 24 unidades de vestidos para niñas a $ 14.00 dólares la unidad y otra ropa. Con esta inversión podrá aumentar su ganancia y satisfacer a sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy pants, shirts, t-shirts, dresses for children and lingerie for women.

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $53.87 dólares.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos Martínez AG. is a native of the city of Bluefields. He is 61 years old. For the past 9 years, Mr. Martínez has been the owner of a stand where he sells radios, knives, agendas, padlocks and irons, among other products. His customers are men and women of all ages who prefer to buy from him because of the variety of products he offers. Currently he needs to buy 5 radios at $16.00 dollars per unit, 3 watches at $1.00 dollar per unit, 2 irons at $12.00 dollars per unit, 3 boxes of padlocks at $26.00 per box, 5 agendas at $3.00 per unit, 6 dozen knives at $25.00 per dozen and 3 dozen wallets at $25.00 dollars per dozen. With this investment he can increase his earnings, as these are the products which are most in demand.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Carlos Martínez AG. es originario de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 61 años de edad. El Sr. Martínez hace 9 años es propietario de un tramo donde vende radios, cuchillos, agendas, candados, planchas, entre otros productos, sus clientes son hombres y mujeres de todas las edades que lo prefieren por ofrecer una variedad de productos, en estos momentos necesita comprar 5 unidades de radios a $ 16.00 dólares la unidad, 3 unidades de reloj a $1.00 dólar la unidad, 2 unidades de planchas a $ 12.00 dólares la unidad, 3 cajas de candados a $ 26.00 dólares la caja, 5 unidades de agenda a $ 3.00 dólares la unidad, 6 docenas de cuchillos a $ 25.00 dólares la docena y 3 docenas de carteras a $ 25.00 dólares la docena, con esta inversión podrá aumentar sus ganancia ya que estos productos tienen mayor demanda.

loans.use: Buy radios, watches, irons, padlocks, agendas, knives and wallets.

payments.comment: La cuota real es de $ 35.22 dólares.
La cuota real de pago es de $35.22 dólares.
La cuota real de pago es de $ 35.22 dólares

loans.name: Adilia

texts.es:
Mrs. Adilia H. G. is a resident of the city of Bluefields and is 32 years old. She is married to Mr. Francisco Antonio Lambi and together they have 4 minor children. Mrs. H. has been an owner of a butcher shop for the last two year. In addition to pork meat, she sells food supplies (yuca and plantains). Her customers are people that sell Nicaraguan tamales (nacatamales) and grocery stores in the neighborhood that prefer to get deliveries at their locations. She currently needs to buy one pig for USD $208, two bags of yucca for USD $10 a bag, and 2 bags of plantains for USD $11 a bag. With this investment she will be able to increase her income and satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Adilia Hernández García es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 32 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Francisco Antonio Lambí ambos tienen 4 hijos menores de edad. La Sra. Hernández es propietaria de una carnicería hace 2 años , además de carne de cerdo vende bastimentos (yuca y banano ) sus clientes son las personas que venden nacatamales y pulperías del barrio que la prefieren por brindar un servicio a domicilio, en estos momentos necesita comprar 1 cerdo a $ 208.00 dólares, 2 sacos de yuca a $ 10.00 dólares el saco y 2 sacos de banano a $ 11.00 dólares el saco, con esta inversión podrá aumentar su ganancia y satisfacer a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase one pig, yuca and plantains.

loans.name: Martha Patricia

texts.es:
Between my husband and myself, we are making it possible to expand our house. It is very small, and we are very crowded since the family is growing more. This is why I am requesting a loan of $1,200 to construct a room and to have more space in the house and for the children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Entre mi esposo y yo estamos haciendo lo posible para ampliar mas la casa. Ya que esta muy reducida y estamos muy apretados ya que la familia esta creciendo mas. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. Para la construcción de un cuarto. Y tener mas espacio en la casa y para los niños.

loans.use: Expansion of a room

loans.name: Felipe De Jesús

texts.es:
More than eight years ago, I started to construct some rooms out of wood on the bottom floor of the house. With time and the rains, the wood is giving out, and even more so with the humidity. This is why I am requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase materials and to start constructing two rooms on the bottom floor of the house.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Tengo ya más de 8 años que empecé a construir unos cuartos de madero en la planta alta de la casa. Con el tiempo y las lluvias ya la madera se esta acabando y mas con la humedad. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls. Para la comprar de material y empezar la construcción de dos cuartos en la planta de baja de la casa.

loans.use: Expansion of the bottom floor of the house

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel started her business in order to support her children, who - in her own words - are her reason for living. When she divorced, Isabel had many financial problems, as she needed to pay off debts which her husband left her. In addition, he gave her no child support, which is the reason that she began her business 9 years ago. In the beginning she only had a grill outside her parents´ home where she started selling food. Now she has established a business selling roasted chickens and thanks to this business, has been able to maintain and educate her 4 children.

She currently needs a loan for US$1,175, which will be repaid in 6 months, to invest in some publicity and promotional articles for the business, as she is about to open a new point of sale. With your help, Isabel will reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Isabel inició el negocio para mantener a sus hijos que son la razón de su vida, según sus palabras. Al divorciarse Isabel tuvo muchos problemas económicos, ya que necesitaba pagar deudas que le dejó su esposo, y además el no le daba pensión para la manutención de sus hijos; por lo que comenzó hace nueve años con su negocio, al principio solo con una parrilla afuera de la casa de sus padres, donde empezó a vender comida a la gente, hasta que logro establecerse como un negocio de venta de pollo asado, gracias a este negocio ha podido mantener y darle educación a sus 4 hijos.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $1,175 que pagara en 6 meses para invertirlos en algo de publicidad y artículos promocionales de su negocio ya que ya que abrirá un nuevo punto de venta. Con tu ayuda Isabel alcanzara sus metas.

loans.use: Invest in publicity and promotional articles.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
I've been doing some remodeling at my house but I haven't been able to finish because I don't have the money to do so. That's why I'm applying for a $1,100 loan. Installing the flooring and finishing the interior work is all that I have to do to finish the remodel.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

He estado haciendo unas remodelaciones a la casa. Pero no e podido terminarla por falta de dinero. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $1,100.00 Dlls. La colocación del vitropiso y acabados de interior de la casa ya que nada mas eso me esta haciendo falta para ya tenerla total mente terminada la remodelación.

loans.use: Install flooring and finish interior work.

loans.name: Librado

texts.es:
There are no bars on the doors or windows of the house and no gate. I work all day and my wife and son are here in the house so anyone could easily break in while they're here alone. That's why I'm applying for a $1,200 loan, to install security bars on the windows and doors and a gate for my family's security.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

En la casa le esta haciendo falta las protecciones en las puertas, ventanas y un portón. Yo trabajo todo el día así que mi esposa e hijo están aquí en la casa y no están bien asegurados de algún robo. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $ 1,200.00 dlls. Para la colocación de protecciones en puertas, ventanas y un portón para la seguridad de la familia.

loans.use: Bars for doors and windows.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
A short time ago, I moved into my subsidized house and, bit by bit, I've been making improvements. I still don't have a security gate at the front, though. I'm a single mother and I need it for my and my daughter's safety.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Hace poco me entregaron mi casa son de las económicas y poco a poco le hecho mejoras. Pero me esta haciendo falta el portón de enfrente de la casa ya que soy madres soltera y para la seguridad de mi hija y mía.

loans.use: Add security gate to front of house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
Norma belongs to the Communal Bank “Virgen de la Asunción,” and she has a grocery store. Her business is located in the district and province of Carhuaz in Ancash state.

With the S/.1,300 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy 5 cases of oil, 4 bags of sugar, and 5 bags of rice.

She is 37 years old, married and has 3 children, her husband is a truck driver and they both work so they can educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Norma, pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de la Asunción, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Su negocio esta ubicando en el distrito y provincia de Carhuaz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,300.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelada en 6 cuotas, comprará 5 cajas de aceite, 4 bolsas de azúcar y 5 bolsas de arroz.

Ella tiene 37 años, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo es conductor de camiones ambos trabajan para educar a su hijos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Martha Enriqueta

texts.es:
Martha started her business to have an activity that would allow her to earn extra income to help her husband pay for their household expenses and their children’s schooling.

She started 3 years ago in shoe and cosmetics sales. This past Mother’s Day, she sold a good amount of perfumes, which is why she wants to invest and expand the variety of the products she offers.

She needs a loan for US $775, which she will repay in 6 months to stock on perfumes (originals) being that she made several sales this season and has pending orders that need to be fulfilled in addition to purchasing them at a better price. With your help, Martha will continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha inició el negocio para tener una actividad que le permitiera tener otro ingreso, para apoyar a su esposo para pagar los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos. Comenzó hace 3 años en las ventas de zapatos y cosmeticos, en este 10 de mayo dia de las madres vendio una buena cantidad de perfumes, por lo cual quiere invertir ampliar un poco la variedad de sus productos y desea ofrecer tambien estos articulos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir perfumes originales , ya que esta temporada realizo varias ventas y tiene pedidos pendientes por surtir, ademas de conseguirlos a mejor precio. Con tu apoyo Martha seguira con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Rebeca Cirila

texts.es:
Rebeca belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres al Progreso,” and she prepares food in the market of Yungay, located in Yungay district and province.

With the S/.2,500 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 8 payments, she will buy kerosene, 2 sacks of rice, 2 bags of noodles, 2 bags of sugar and meat for the week.

She is 38 years old, married and has 2 children, and they both work so that their business may continuously grow.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rebeca, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, se dedica a la venta D. alimentos en el mercado del distrito y provincia D. Yungay.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 8 cuotas, comprará una cocina a kerosene, 2 sacos D. arroz, 2 bolsas D. fideos, 2 bolsos D. azúcar y carne para una semana

Ella tienen 38 años D. edad, es casada con 2 hijos, ambos trabajan para que su negocio sea cada vez más granD..

loans.use: Purchase supplies to prepare food.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es:
Mauricia belongs to the Communal Bank “Señor D. los Afligidos,” and she prepares food in the Carhuaz hospital, loated in Carhuaz province in Ancash state.

With the S/.200 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy oil and rice

She is 49 years old, has 4 children, her husband is an alcoholic in rehabilitation through Alcoholics Anonymous, only she works in order to educate her children, 2 of whom study in the “Instituto Pedagógico D. Yungay” which is one hour away from Cahuaz.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Mauricia , pertenece al Banco Comunal Señor D. los Afligidos, se dedica a la venta D. alimentos en el Hospital Carhuaz, Provincia D. Carhuaz, departamento D. Ancash.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 200.00 , el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará aceite, arroz .

Ella tienen 49 años D. edad, tiene 4 hijos, su esposo es alcohólico, esta en proceso D. rehabilitación en la Asociación D. Alcohólicos Anónimos, sola trabaja para educar a sus hijos 2 D. ellos estudian en el Instituto Pedagógico D. Yungay a una hora D. Cahuaz.

loans.use: Buy ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
Maria belongs to "Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rosas de Yungay". She sells sweets, sodas in the Yungay province.

With the loan of S/. 500.00, which will be paid back in 4 equal payments, she will purchase 5 cases of soda, disposable diapers, and 5 dozen paper plates.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, KIVA Volunteer.

Las señora Maria pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto Las Rosas de Yungay, se dedica a la venta de golosinas, gaseosas y descartables en el mercado del distrito y provincia de Yungay, departamento de Ancash. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 , el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 5 paquetes de gaseosas , paquetes, 2 paquetes de pañal desechables y 5 docenas de platos descartables. Ella tienen 57 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos que le ayudan en su negocio.

loans.use: More supplies for sales

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina belongs to the Communal Bank “Señor de los Milagros” in Chinquian, where she has a small store. Her business is located in Chiquian district, Bolognesi province, Ancash state.

With the S/.1,000 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will buy 2 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 2 cases of oil, 2 bags of oats, 4 packages of pop, fruit, and vegetables.

She is 62 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer and they both work to meet their household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Saturnina, pertenece al Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros de Chiquian, tiene una pequeña bodega, su negocio esta ubicado en el distrito de Chiquian, provincia de Bolognesi, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará 2 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de azúcar, 2 cajas de aceite, 2 bolsas de avena, 4 paquetes de gaseosas, frutas y verduras.

Ella tienen 62 años de edad, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura ambos trabajan para solventar los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to see in her store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila belongs to the Communal Bank “Luis Pardo II,” where she sells food. Her business is located on the corner of the market in Chiquian district, Bolognesi province, Ancash state.

With the S/.500 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy 5 sacks of tarwi (a bean native to the Andes).

She is 30 years old, married, and has 5 children. Her husband repairs shoes, and together they both work to support and provide an education to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Zoila pertenece al Banco Comunal Luis Pardo II, se dedica a la venta de Alimentos. Su negocio esta ubicado en la esquina del mercado del distrito de Chiquian, provincia de Bolognesi, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/.500.00, nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 5 sacos de tarwi.

Ella tienen 30 años de edad, es casada tiene 5 hijos, su esposo es zapatero juntos mantienen y educan a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare food.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Jeny

texts.es:
Jeny belongs to the Communal Bank “Luis Pardo II,” and she has Internet and phone cabins in her home. Her business is in Chiquian district, Bolognesi province, Ancash state.

With the S/.900 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will buy rechargeable phone cards.

She is 23 years old, married, and is expecting her first child. Her husband helps her with this business and they meet their household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Jeny, pertenece al Banco Comunal Luis Pardo II, tiene sus cabinas de Internet y locutorio en su casa, en el distrito Chiquian, provincia de Bolognesi, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/. 900.00 nuevos soles , el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará recarga virtual.

Ella tienen 23 años de edad, casada, esta esperando su primer bebé, su esposo le ayuda en este negocio y solventan los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: Purchase phone cards for her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Olga Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo belongs to the Communal Bank “Grupo Mientras Tanto San Agustín,” and she sells Avon products and makes deliveries to homes located in the Independencia district, Huaraz province of Ancash state.

With the S/.500.00 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy various products on sale such as women’s and men’s cologne, perfume, cosmetics and deodorants.

She is 52 years old, married, and has 4 children. The three oldest children are in the university, and 1 daughter is finishing 5th year of secondary school. Her husband is a bricklayer and he has temporary work; together they cover their household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Consuelo, pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto San Agustín, ella se dedica a la venta de Productos Avon y hace entrega a domicilio ubicado en el distrito de Independencia, provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de S/.500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará varios productos en oferta como Colonias para damas y caballeros, perfumes, comesticos y desodorantes.

Ella tienen 52 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos, 3 hijos mayores que estudian superior y 1 hija que esta cursando el 5to grado de secundaria, su esposo es albañil y tiene trabajos eventuales y los dos cubren los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of merchandise to resell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Mercedes,” and she sells veterinary supplies in her store located in the Carhuaz district and province of Ancash state.

With the S/.1,000.00 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy 3 cases of vaccines, antibiotics, vitamins and dewormers.

She is 54 years old, married, and her husband supports her in this business. Her income enables her to educate their three children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Flor, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Mercedes, tiene su veterinaria, que esta ubicado en el distrito y provincia D. Carhuaz, departamento D. Ancash. Con este prestamos D. S/. 1, 000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 3 cajas D. vacunas, antibióticos, vitaminas, productos para parásitos. Ella tiene 54 años D. edad es casada, su esposo la apoya en este negocio, sus ingresos le permite educar a sus 3 hijos.

loans.use: Purchase veterinary supplies to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase materials to make fireworks.

loans.name: Luzmila Elida

texts.es:
Luzmila belongs to the Communal Bank “Señor de los Milagros de Chavin,” and she has a small store where she sells candy, soda pop, cookies, and has communications call center, where she sells phone cards, phone chips, videos and CDs. Her business is located in the Chavin district of Huantar in Huaraz Province of Ancash state.

With the S/.600.00 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy phone cards in denominations of 10, 20 and 30 nuevos soles, 10 phone chips for Claro and Movistar. She will also buy 10 packages of cookies to stock her store.

She is 38 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her husband is an electrician and has temporary jobs. Her income enables her to support her husband and provide an education for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Luzmila, pertenece al Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros de Chavin , ella tiene su pequeña tienda de venta de golosinas, gaseosa, galletas, tiene locutorio, en el cual vende tarjetas, chip, videos, CDs. Su negocio esta ubicado en el distrito de Chavin de Huantar, Provincia de Huaraz, Departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo de 600.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará tarjetas, de 10, 20, 30 nuevos soles, 10 chips de claro, movistar. También comprará 10 paquetes de galletas surtidos para su tienda.

Ella tiene 38 años de edad, es casada con 4 hijos, su esposo es electricistas y tiene trabajos eventuales, sus ingresos le permite apoyar a su esposo en la educación de sus hijos

loans.use: Purchase a variety of products to sell in her call center

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Mercedes,” her business is selling food at the weekly market that is developing in the district and province of Carhuaz in Ancash state

With the S/.2,000.00 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy 2 buckets of oil, 2 sacks of rice, 3 sacks of potatos, and 4 packages of various noodles.

She is 44 years old, married, and has 1 son. Her husband works from time to time, and the income she generates enables them to meet their household expenses and proviD. an education for their only child.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Mercedes, su negocio es la venta D. comidas en la feria semanal que se desarrolla en el distrito y provincia D. Carhuaz, departamento D. Ancash.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 2 baldes D. aceite, 2 saco D. arroz, 3 saco D. papa, 4 paquetes D. fideos surtido.

Ella tiene 44 años D. edad es conviviente, su esposo trabaja eventualmente, y tienen un hijo, los ingresos que genera les permite solventar los gasto D. su hogar y la educación D. su único hijo.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare food.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emma belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres de Grandes Retos,” her business is buying and selling small animals (guinea pigs, rabbits, and chickens). Her business is located on Raymondi avenue in Huaraz city, Ancash state

With the S/.3,000.00 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy 50 guinea pigs, 20 chickens, 20 rabbits, and other items according to her customer’s needs.

She is 45 years old, married, and has 4 children. The oldest is 23 years old, studying at the high school; the other three are in primary school. Her husband is a temporary worker for the council, and both contribute to the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Emma pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Grandes Retos, se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores (cuy, conejo, gallinas), su negocio esta ubicado en la avenida Raymondi de la ciudad de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con este préstamo S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses comprará 50 cuyes, 20 gallinas, 20 conejos y según las necesidades de sus clientes va adquiriendo.

. La señora Emma tiene 45 años y es madre de 4 hijos, el mayor tiene 23 años, esta estudiando en superior y tres de sus hijos están en educación primaria, su esposo trabaja en el consejo en forma eventual y ambos contribuyen a los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: Purchase animals to resell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres del Futuro,” her business is selling vegetables and flours (flours from beans, peas, and wheat) as a street vendor in Huaraz city, Ancash state

With the S/.800.00 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy 3 cases of tomatos, 3 sacks of onions, 3 squash, a sack of potatoes, 12 kilos of bean flour, 12 kilos of pea flour.

She is 57 years old, married, and has 4 children. The oldest is 40 years old and the youngest is 25. All her children are independent adults. Her husband is a farmer and they both contributed to being able to educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Alejandrina, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del Futuro, se dedica a la venta D. verduras y harina preparada (harina D. haba, arvejas, trigo), en la parada, en la ciudad D. Huaraz, departamento D. Ancash.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 800.00 , el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará, 3 cajas D. tomates, 3 sacos D. cebolla, 3 zapallos , un saco D. papas, 12 kilos D. harina D. haba, 12 kilos D. harina D. arvejas.

Ella tienen 57 años D. edad es casada y madre D. 4 hijos, el mayor D. 40 años y la última D. 25 años, todos sus hijos son independientes, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura ambos educaron a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables and flour to sell

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ida

texts.es:
Ida belongs to the Communal Bank “El Progreso,” her business is a pharmacy where she offers her customers medicines and toiletries for the entire family. Her business is located in the Central Market of Huaraz, in Huaraz province, Ancash state

With the S/.3,000.00 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will buy different medicines and toiletry products.

She is 54 years old, is separated, and has 1 child who is now a grown professional. She separated from her husband when her son was 5 years old and alone she has been able to educate and enable her son’s success. The two still live together and she continues working so that she can grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La Señora Ida pertenece al Banco Comunal "El Progreso", tiene como negocio una Botica en donde ofrece a sus clientes Medicinas y Productos de Tocador para toda la familia, su negocio esta ubicado en el Mercado Central de Huaraz; provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 que será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará diferentes medicinas y productos de tocador.

Ella tiene 54 años es separada y madre de un hijo que ya es profesional, se separo de su esposo cuando su niño tenia la edad de 5 años y sola a podido educar y sacar adelante a su hijo, viven los dos y sigue trabajando para que siga creciendo su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell in the pharmacy

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Octavia

texts.es:
Octavia belongs to the Communal Bank “El Progreso,” her business is selling prepared and a la carte dishes. Her business is located at Jr. 13 de diciembre, district and province of Huaraz, Ancash state

With the S/.1,700.00 nuevos soles loan, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will buy products to replenish her stock and be able to offer good service to her customers such as: 2 sacks of rice, 1 bag of sugar, 4 bags of noodles, 2 cases of oil, 3 packages of pop in 6 packs, 3 cases of personal size pop and other products needed daily such as chicken, meat, etc.

She is 40 years old, has been separated for 20 years, she has one daughter who is an adult professional whom she has raised and educated by herself. Every day Octavia continues to work so that her business generates greater income for her.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Octavia pertenece al Banco Comunal "El Progreso", se dedica a la venta de menú y platos a la carta, su negocio esta ubicada en el Jr. 13 de diciembre, distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash, es una zona con bastante afluencia de publico.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará productos para poder abastecer su Stock y poder brindar un buen servicio a su clientela como: 2 sacos de arroz, 1 bolsa de azúcar, 4 bolsas de fideos, 2 cajas de aceite, 3 paquetes de gaseosas de 6 unidades, 3 cajas de gaseosas personales y otros productos de necesidad diaria como pollo, carne, etc.

Ella tiene 40 años es separada hace 20 años, tiene una hija profesional que ella a educado sola y día a día sigue trabajando para que su negocio le genere mayores ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell in her store.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Mrs. Marina belongs to the Community Bank Women of the Future, and makes living selling flour made from grains (from wheat, from corn, from fava beans, kiwicha, peas). She sells at both the retail and wholesale level in the northern section of Lima. Her business is located in the district and province of Huaraz..

With this loan of USD $550, which will be repaid in 8 months, she will buy three sacks of wheat, 3 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of peas, 2 sacks of fava beans, to convert them into flour.

Mrs. Marina is 65 years old, is married and has 7 children. Her husband used to have a bakery, which he no longer does because of his age. He helps his wife in her business. Her income allows her to cover the expenses of the home and one of her daughters, who is a single mother of two children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Marina pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres del futuro, se dedica a la venta de harina de granos (harina de trigo, de maíz, de haba, kiwicha, arvejas), vende por mayor y menor en el cono norte de Lima. Su negocio esta ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Huaraz.

Con este préstamo de 1500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 8 meses, comprará 3 sacos de trigo, 3 sacos de maíz, 2 sacos de arvejas, 2 sacos de haba, para ser transformados en harina.

La señora Marina tiene 65 años, es casada con 7 hijos, su esposo antes tenia su panadería, ahora ya no por la edad a dejado este negocio, en la actualidad el apoya a su esposa en este negocio. Sus ingresos le permite solventar su gastos de su hogar y tiene una de sus hijas a cargo que es madre soltera con dos hijos.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Julia Lionila

texts.es:
Julia, a native of Huarochiri, belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres de Grandes Retos.” Her business is selling fabric, and it is located in the district and province of Huaraz, Ancash state

With the previous loan S/.3,000.00 nuevos soles, which was repaid in 4 payments, she bought a good quantity of a variety of fabrics to stock her business. With the current loan also for 3000.00 she will buy a variety of stuffed animals and gifts to sell for Mother’s Day.

She is 49 years old, and is a single mother to 4 children. She has been able successfully raise her children and her income enables her to help her grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

Ella es la señora Julia, natural de Huarochiri, Lima, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Grandes Retos, se dedica ala venta de telas, su negocio esta ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash.

Con el préstamo anterior de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, ha comprado a mas cantidad de telas de distintas calidades par surtir su negocio, y con el préstamo actual también de 3000.00 ha comprado una variedad de peluches y regalos para venderlos por el día de madre.

Ella tiene 49 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos, ha logrado que todos su hijos tengan su propio, su ingreso le permite ayudar a su nietos.

loans.use: Buy items to sell in her fabric business

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
Bernardina belongs to Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros de Chavin, she dedicates herself to selling food (breakfast, lunch). She has been doing this for 15 years. She sells egg choclo, stewed potatoes, and potato soup. She already improved her business by selling breakfast (stew, chicken soup, and other lunch menus).

With the recent loan of 800.00soles which will be paid back in 6 equal payments, she will buy two bags of rice, 1 bag of sugar, 2 tubs of oil, 5 bags of assorted noodles and 1 bag of potatoes.

She is 70 years old and a widower, has 5 children who are very independent. They take care of their own home and she takes care of her business all by herself.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Bernardina, pertenece al Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros de Chavin, se dedica a la venta de alimentos (desayuno, almuerzo), esta actividad la inicio a los 15 años de edad, vendiendo choclo huevo, papa sancochado y sopa de papa. Posteriormente amplio su negocio con la venta de desayuno (caldo de cabeza, caldeo de gallina, y almuerzo (menú). Su negocio esta ubicado en el Distrito de Chavin de Huanta, provincia de Huari, departamento de Ancash. Con el reciente préstamo de 800.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas comprará 2 sacos de arroz, 1 saco de azular, 2 baldes de aceite, 5 paquetes de fideos surtido, 1 saco de papa. Ella tiene 70 años, es viuda, tiene 5 hijos, todos ellos independientes que cada uno se dedica a solventar sus hogares y ella con su negocio se mantiene sola.

loans.use: Con el prestamo comprara mas insumos para la preparacion de sus alimentos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 40 palm fruit plants,12 units of watermelon plants, 5 cans of jocote fruit, 100 units of mango, 20 banana plants, 12 units of papaya, 5 dozen avocado plants and 1 basket of mamon fruit.

loans.name: Candida's Group

texts.es:
Leonora, Candida and Juana belong to the Yachay Wasi community bank which means "House of Knowledge" in Quechua.

Leonora, 43, is partnered and has 5 children. She and her husband buy wood from suppliers in the jungle around Ayachucho and sell to carpentry shops. Candida, 40, is partnered and has 2 children. She has a car that she uses for "transporte urbano" (a cab, perhaps, but not clear) and she also travels to markets where she sells fruits and clothing and returns with grains and cheeses. Juana, 58, is married and has 6 children. She earns a living making and selling pastries and sweets that she makes in a small oven at home; she sells wholesale supplies of her products to stores.

Leonora, Candida and Juana need loans of 1000 soles, 750 soles and 750 soles, money that will be used to buy products that they will resell.

Leonora, Candida and Juana dream of improving their businesses, having another car, a shop and helping their children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Leonora, Candida y Juana pertenecen al Banco Comunal Yachay Wasi que significa Casa del Saber en quechua.

Leonora es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 5 hijos, Leonora junto a su esposo venden madera que adquiere en la selva ayacuchana, sus productos los distribuye a carpinterías. Por otro lado Candida es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Candida tiene un carro que realiza transporte urbano, además Candida viaja a las ferias donD. venD. frutas, ropa y D. las ferias compra queso y cereales. Mientras que Juana es casada, tiene 58 años y 6 hijos, Juana se dedica a la elaboración D. pasteles y dulces que ella prepara en un pequeño horno D. su casa, sus productos los venD. al por mayor a tiendas.

Leonora, Candida y Juana necesitan prestamos D. 1000 soles, 750 soles, 750 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. madera tornillo, buzos, polos, harina, manteca y azúcar.

Los sueños D. Leonora, Candida y Juana son mejorar sus negocios, tener otro carro, una tienda en su casa y salir adelante con sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina is a member of the Community Bank Yachay Wasi which means “house of knowledge” in Quechua.

Albina is married, is 46 years old and has 7 children. Albina sells wood, which she obtains in the forest of Ayacucho. She moves the wood with cars that she rents. She distributes her products to carpenter shops.

Albina needs a loan of USD $ 550, money which will be invested in the purchase of moena and tornillo wood.

Albina dreams of one day owning her own car for the transport of her products, her own home and the ability to provide a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Albina es socia del Banco Comunal Yachay Wasi que significa Casa del Saber en quechua.

Albina es casada, tiene 46 años y 7 hijos, Albina vende madera, que adquiere en la selva ayacuchana, el transporte de la madera lo realiza con carros que alquila, sus productos los distribuye a carpinterías.

Albina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de madera moena y tornillo.

Los sueños de Albina son tener un carro propio para el transporte de sus productos, casa propia y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Albina needs a loan of USD $ 550, money which will be invested in the purchase of moena and tornillo wood.

loans.name: Betilú

texts.es:
First Loan

Betilu is a member of the Banco Comunal Azucenas.

Betilu lives with her common-law spouse, is 31 years old and has 2 children. Betilu, together with her husband, sells pottery and crystal. Betilu has a stand in a shopping centre located in a major street in the city of Ayacucho. Her husband sells door-to-door in the streets of the city, his products varying depending on the demands.

Betilu requires a loan in the amount of 3200 soles. The funds will be invested in the purchase of thermos containers, plates, and cooking pots, all to be purchase in the city of Lima.

Betilu's dream is to expand her busniess and relocate it to a shopping centre with more traffic, and to have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=30375&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Betilu pertenece al Banco Comunal Azucenas.

Betilu es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Betilu junto a su esposo venden locería y cristalería, Betilu tiene un puesto en un centro comercial ubicado en una calle céntrica de la ciudad de Ayacucho, mientras que su esposo vende caminando por las calles de la ciudad, sus productos son variados dependiendo de la demanda.

Betilu necesita un préstamo de 3200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de termos, cubiertos, platos, ollas que serán adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima.

Los sueños de Betilu son incrementar su negocio, ubicar su negocio en otro centro comercial más concurrido y tener casa propia.

loans.use: Betilu requests a loan in the amount of 3200 soles. The funds will be invested in the purchase of thermos containers, cutlery, plates, and cooking pots, all to be purchase in the city of Lima.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly is a member of the Lirio ("Iris") community bank. She's 52 years old and married with 3 children. She sells spare car parts at her house in a neighborhood where there are many auto repair shops. She started with just a few products but her business has grown and she's planning to expand her shop. Nelly also sells "salchipollos" (a chicken-based food) on one of the main streets of Ayacucho in the afternoon.

Nelly needs a loan of 2600 soles which she will use to buy car radios, starters, alternators and wiring.

Her savings are for her children's school expenses. Nelly's dreams are to expand her business, to have a well-stocked storeroom and to build a second floor for her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=27427&_tpos=2&_tpg=1">Primer prestamo de Nelly

Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.

Nelly es casada, tiene 52 años y 3 hijos, Nelly vende repuestos en su casa ubicada en la asociación Los Mecánicos, cerca de diferentes talleres de mantenimiento de carros, al inicio tenia muy pocos productos, actualmente su negocio ha crecido y tiene proyectado ampliar su tienda. Además Nelly vende Salchipollos por las tarde en una avenida principal de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Nelly necesita un préstamo de 2600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de auto radios, arrancadores, alternadores y cables.

Sus ahorros son para los gastos de educación de sus hijos. Los sueños de Nelly son ampliar su negocio, tener un taller bien equipado y construir el segundo piso de su casa.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Mabel Nelly

texts.es:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=27767&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Mabel is a member of the Solucion ("Solution") community bank. She's 40 years old and married with 3 children. She sells tuna at the food markets in Lima that she buys from different towns in the surrounding area. Her sales increase in the months between November and March when tuna production is highest. She also sells lubricants and spare parts for cars, a business that she started to fill the demand that she spotted because her husband is an auto mechanic.

Mabel needs a loan of 3000 soles, money that she will use to buy various spare parts.

Mabel's dreams are to buy a car to carry her products, to have a shop in her house and to buy a lot to build another house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Primer prestamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=27767&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Mabel es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.

Mabel es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Mabel vende tuna en los mercados de abastos de la ciudad de Lima, sus productos son adquiridos en los diferentes pueblos de la región, sus ventas se incrementan los meses de noviembre a marzo donde hay producción de tuna. Además vende lubricantes y repuestos, actividad que inicio por la demanda que había porque su esposo es mecánico.

Mabel necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos diversos para carro.

Los sueños de Mabel son comprar un carro para transportar sus productos, tener una tienda de abarrotes en su casa y comprar un terreno para construir otra casa.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Aplonia

texts.es:
First loan:

http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=27118&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Apolonia joined the Primavera ("Spring") community bank 8 years ago. She is 54 years old and married with 6 children, 2 of whom live with her. She makes her living as a street vendor, selling snacks on a main street of Ayacucho near a high school. She has a cart from which she sells her snacks.

Apolonia needs a loan of 2000 soles, money that she will use to buy cookies, candy, gum, and chocolates, for her business. She will also use part of the loan to pay her daughter's school fees.

Apolonia's savings will be set asiD. for future emergencies and she dreams that her sales will get better and better, that her children continue their studies and find professional careers.
